title: Big city yuck
text: Family vacation to NYC and decided to try this place. it looked promising.  The location is great but the place was dirty, old, elevators never came had to walk up and down everyday.  The room was dirty on check in and the last person who stayed there had left laundry handing to dry on the lights... YUCK so disgusting.  it took the hotel a full day to come take the dirty disgusting underwear and socks off the lamps and shades ... so horrible

title: Historical gem
text: I’ve now stayed here three times over the past six years. I absolutely love this hotel. It has such charm and the staff is amazingly friendly and helpful. I wish the bar still served food, though. It was sooooo good!! It’s totally worth the extra money to stay at this historical gem!!

title: Décevant
text:
Tres deçue.
J’avais fait cette reservation pour mon anniversaire. Rien n’a été respectés. La chambre avec vue sur la ville… je vous laisse apprécier la photo (avec les vitres si propres au passage)
Nous sommes 4, il n’y a que 3 serviettes, 2 verres d’eau (une petite bouteille d’eau).
On demande 2 autres verres et un couteau : du plastique… 
On demande des glaçons, ont doit les chercher nous même. 
Pas de room service.
On paie pour garder nos valises la journée si on a deja fait le check out. 2$ par valise. Le tout sans un sourire.
Et quand on discute avec la manager, elle daigne a peine dire bonjour, me dit que je n’ai qu’a partir, d’autres seront contents. 

Sans compter les lits minuscules pour 4, alors que ca convient clairement à 2 personnes.
Seul + : il y a une machine à café. 

Je recommande sincèrement le Voco, ou encore un Marriott qui avaient une nette difference de prix, et dans lesquels nous avons été super bien accueillis.

title: Viaggio in famiglia
text: Posizione dell’albergo ottima lo consiglierei solo per questo motivo poiché il resto è deludente.Io ho alloggiato in una suit di 60 ma con vista interna ,pessima,buia sempre e rumorosa a causa dei motori dei condizionatori;sporca ,vecchia ,la maniglia della porta interna rotta,il bagno otturato ,l’acqua dal rubinetto usciva marrone .Personale indisponente e maleducato specialmente con gli italiani.Dimenticavo per ultimo ,ci hanno fatto pagare per tenersi i bagagli in custodia .

title: Excellent  again!
text:
This was my fourth stay at this wonderful, traditional style, New York City hotel.
  
Big thanks to Imani, who was  welcoming and  patient, despite having to juggle some issues with the way I made the reservation.

I love the lobby here. It’s not large, but is always comfortable. There’s also a sitting area on the second floor, next to the business center room, which is quiet. (I passed the entrance of a nearby  hotel I’d  considered—its lobby was huge and chaotic).  

All rooms are  now  equipped with a mini fridge, whereas  in the past you had to pay extra to have one in the room.  Go two block up Sixth Avenue to  stock up with things that need to be refrigerated.

Sone sections of the room’s baseboard had scuff marks, but to me, that’s a minor point. 

Each room I’ve had  four visits is slightly different,  but all have a big walk-in closet with shelves. I love the English toiletries which are used!

Thanks to excellent staff, including Dorji  the housekeeper on 19th floor, Jamaal at the front desk, and Victoria at Randolph’s.

title: Great neighborhood, good stay
text:
The location is excellent and the rates are a great value for New York. The elevators can be an issue but we were on a high floor, so we never had to wait long and we always got on. 

The room was clean and reasonably sized. Housekeeping was great and all of the staff was friendly and helpful.

I would have rated it 5 stars, except for the plumbing. It was hooked up incorrectly so that hot water came out of the cold tap and vice versa. It was hard to get a good temperature in the shower.

We didn't eat at the hotel but I recommend Certe just around the block on 55th St for a very reasonable breakfast.

title: Loved our stay
text: We recently came back from staying at the Warwick. We loved it! The location was perfect  for us since we wanted to be close to Central Park and Rockefeller center and Times Square. I am glad we didn’t stay that close to Times Square. Starbucks and Joe and Juice were close by as well. The staff were very friendly especially the doorman. Room was a good size. But the bathroom was smaller than I expected. We were also very close to Adel’s Famous Halal Food. We were happy about that. They did have offer breakfast but we didn’t try it. I wasn’t able to try their bar. They also gave us bottled water every day of our stay. The housekeeping would leave it on our table. They also have coffeemaker but we didn’t use it. We will be back.

title: Poor service. Poor experience for families.
text: We booked a room at the Warwick for three people - my partner and I and our 12 year old son. On arrival the extra bed for my son was not made up. We phoned house keeping in the afternoon and were assured someone from housekeeping would arrive to make up the bed. We came back from dinner at 7.30pm with a very tired jetlagged child and still the bed wasn't made up, and housekeeping not answering the phone. Lady at check in desk said she would ask for an urgent call. One hour later and we are still waiting. The service was unacceptable.

title: Old, tidy hotel in prime location. Customer service could be improved.
text:
Old, tidy hotel with functional rooms. Probably a bit overpriced by the time you factor in the extra’s and high speed internet is extra again. Prime location.
We arrived early after a red eye flight in the pouring rain, it was $4 per bag if we wanted to leave bags or $100 to check in early even though the room was ready. We chose to check in early and went to our ‘city view’ room where we opened the window to see a brick wall. I checked with downstairs desk and showed them the booking confirmation from b**king.com, they told me at first it was ‘my problem’ and to sort it out with them. I insisted I wanted the room I had paid for and eventually the manager ?  Put me in the room I had booked and paid for.
Generally the staff in the lobby and front desk are quite solemn and rarely engaged with their customers. To be honest we didn’t feel welcome and probably wouldn’t stay again. I would give 3  1/2 stars if I could.

title: check and double check the occupancy for your room
text:
Staying at the Warwick Hotel now. A word of warning: When I booked the room, I said I needed a room for three people (2 adults + 1 kid) and was given several rooms to choose from. I selected one and upon arrival found that it only sleeps 2. The concierge says that they don't take into consideration the # of people when you book a room. So in order for us to all sleep comfortably, I have to pay an extra fee for a rollaway bed. 

I've booked many a hotel. When I say I need a room for 3 people, I get a room that sleeps 3 people. Not one for 2 that *surprise* you now have to pay an extra fee for the 3rd person.

Feels like a real bait and switch. Very disappointing!

title: Great for our family trip to NYC!
text: The Warwick Hotel is in a great location to walk to all of NYC's hot spots - Times Square, the 9/11 Memorial, the Financial District, Rockefeller Plaza, Brooklyn Bridge, etc.  The hotel is beautiful and holds so much history!!  The staff was amazing and the room was very clean and so pretty!!  We stayed in a Premier One Bedroom Suite with a City View and two double beds and we had a rollaway bed added.  The room was so spacious and we even saw a movie filmed right outside our window.  We will definitely stay here again if we are in the NYC area!

title: Old School Elegance (new age capitalism)
text:
Pleasant surprise staying in this old hotel that maintains a certain grace and charm of yesteryear.   Besides the wonderful location ( my wife was attending a conference across the street) and old style glitz, the best thing about this hotel was the staff.  From the doormen to the front desk to the bar staff to the housekeeper, everyone I encountered working at the Warwick was polished, professional and helpful.  The staff was really top notch, noticed the little things and made our stay pleasant and productive.  The room was spacious and well appointed, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was perfect.  Unlike some other reviewers, I had no issue with the speed of the elevators.  However, I did feel that the furniture in Randolph's lounge was worn and had seen better days. 
The only drawback, which kept this hotel from being rated a 5, were some of the billing practices.  The hotel charges a "resort" fee that essentially supports your use of basic wifi, a fitness area, and the bottled water and coffee in your room.  That's fine, but it's best to know that since on travel websites the only thing you see is the basic room rate - which appears much less than surrounding hotels.  What is somewhat irksome is that after paying the fee, and the Manhattan prices for food and beverages, you get subjected to a $2 per bag (cash only) charge if you want to check your bags.  This included a $2 charge that the kind of arrogant baggage handler demanded for the barely filled tote bag of conference papers my wife received, draped over the handle of her carry-on bag.  Two bucks is couch change but that last little charge felt chintzy given the "resort" fee we'd already paid for two nights.  It's too bad because it sort of soured the rest of the great stay.

title: Cheated out of $200
text: As a Christmas present, I bought my parents a gift certificate for $200 to be used at the Warwick Hotel NYC and it transpires they have all sorts of stipulations on the use of certificates towards the cost of rooms.  This was not explained when I purchased the gift voucher and I feel well and utterly cheated. My elderly parents had wanted to use it for a weekend away and it is impossible to use.  Stay well away.  Book someplace else and don't give them your money!

title: Classy hotel
text:
Nice hotel, nice location.  Someone did try to enter while I was in my room and they took it very seriously though I don't know that I ever felt good about it. 

The hotel is classy looking and the staff are kind. If you get there early or check out but aren't flying out yet, they hold your luggage for you and let you enjoy your time. 

The second floor has the washrooms and also a nice seating area with mirrors and quiet. 

The location was great, many places to walk to nearby.  I would stay again.

title: Our new favorite old-school hotel in the city. Love it!
text:
We stayed at the Warwick for the first time in August 2023. After multiple trips to NY over the decades, it's now hands down our favorite hotel in the area. A short walk to everything we enjoy...Times Square, Central Park etc. It's very reasonably priced.
The staff were wonderful. Our corner 1 br suite was spacious and incredibly comfortable. 
We love that it's an old, classic NY hotel. It maintains its early 20th century charm but had plenty of the comforts of a newer hotel. 
We didn't care that there wasn't a full service restaurant on site. We walked out the door and had every imaginable food at our fingertips.
My wife and I had such an amazing time that we are going back Fen 18th and flying our son and daughter in to join us. We can't wait to come home to our favorite hotel in the city.

title: Charming hotel
text:
The Warwick Hotel was a perfect place and location for a mother, daughter, granddaughter overnight getaway in NYC. We splurged and rented a lovely suite with a grand view of the city. It was well worth it. And fortunately we were able to check-in early so we could enjoy the suite before heading over to the MOMA.

I've stayed at The Warwick before and was certainly not disappointed this time. My daughter and granddaughter loved the hotel. They commented that it was so much more charming and spacious than the modern hotels where they've stayed in the city on their past visits. 

Thanks to all the staff for making an otherwise freezing weekend into a warm, memorable occasion. We'll be back

title: Decadente
text:
Abbiamo scelto questo albergo per la sua posizione centrale ed in effetti oltre a questo non ha altro da offrire.
Immotivatamente caro (come peraltro tutti i prezzi impazziti a NYC), scarsa igiene, personale non particolarmente gentile, colazione alla carta molto scarsa. La struttura potrebbe rendere molto più se non fosse stata abbandonata a se stessa e ferma agli anni ‘80.
Sinceramente una grande delusione!

P.S. Inaccettabili gli asgumani per il corpo (minuscoli) bucati e la tappezzeria macchiata di sangue e altro. Il Phon forse è dell’anteguerra…

title: Family festive trip to NYC - 2023
text:
We can only comment on our experience.  We had a great stay at Warwick Hotel. 
 Cannot fault anything.  The guys at the main entrance were very helpful on arrival and departure.  The front desk staff were spot on.  If we needed anything they always offered assistance.  The housemaids were friendly and did a very good job cleaning our room daily.  We stayed in room no 1911 on the 19th floor.  A family of four, everything we needed.  Reasonable view.  We were very comfortable.  We also loved the character of the building considering how old it is, and enjoyed this more so than a new modern hotel for this trip.  The Warwick just seems to fit in, it is after all part of NYC going back all those years.  Fantastic location too!  We did not eat at the hotel, only because we were too busy soaking up the city vibe & so much to see.  We did try the bar a couple of times, which we also enjoyed.  Either at the end of the day or a pre dinner drink.  Thank you Warwick Hotel, part of a memorable family holiday.  Happy New Year!  We will return.

title: Iconic hotel, haunt of Hollywood stars, and now me.
text: This beautiful old hotel was the haunt of Elvis, the Beatles, Audrey Hepburn, Cary Grant (born Archie Leach from Bristol), and now the Z list celebrity author of this review.  Very comfortable room, helpful efficient staff.  Catering not sampled as we ate elsewhere.  Relatively low rise building showing its age in places, windows a tad draughty, heating eccentric.  Minor issues sorted swiftly by staff, and the cystern fixed by myself.  Say what you want, but Americans know the value of excellent service, pulling out all the stops to earn their tips, unlike in our creaky, on life support, home country UK.  Highly recommended and will visit again next time in NYC.

title: Great find and everything nearby
text:
While the hotel is old, it is well maintained. The suite, looking at 6th Avenue, was excellent in size. Also, considering it is in a busy area, relatively quiet. Front desk personnel were terrific and the hotel location was perfect. 

The downsides were minimal, including some burnt out lightbulbs. The bathroom was tiny - there was no place to even lay out your clothes. Other than that, a great find.

title: NYC Holiday Trip- Perfect Location!
text: A friend and I travelled to NYC for the holidays and stayed at the Warwick.  I lived in NYC for a long time and am familiar with the area, and I did a lot of research before booking this hotel.  We had a wonderful stay at the Warwick!  The location is ideal for the holidays.  We saw the Rockets at Radio City Music Hall a few blocks away, and we were able to walk to both Broadway shows we saw.   Very close to Bloomingdale's, Serendipity, FAO Schwartz, Central Park and more.  The hotel is a few blocks north of the busiest areas, which was helpful for getting around if you want to avoid some of the walking traffic during busy seasons.  Room was clean, quiet and quite spacious for NYC.  We had a city view room, which was lovely.  I joined the Warwick Rewards Program beforehand, based on a review I read.  I think you may get a better room on a higher floor this way, and you get free Wifi.  It was free to join.  We will definitely stay at the Warwick again in the future and highly recommend it!

title: Watch your view
text: Suppose to have 2 rooms with views, both looked at brick walls, courtyards of concrete. Nov 2021.. Elevators; when hotel booked may wait for 2-4 elevators. Staff not as friendly as in other boutique hotels.

title: Hospedagem em New York
text: A localização é excelente, a acomodação confortável, lençóis macios, colchão muito bom, os quartos são de vários tamanhos de acordo com as suas necessidades, fomos em família e tivemos acomodações diferenciadas, os funcionários sempre atentos. Chegamos antes do horário do check in e para deixar as malas no reservado, pagamos uma pequena taxa por mala. Já estivemos outras vezes no hotel e gostamos muito.

title: Comfortable & Welcoming
text:
I love the proximity of this hotel to place to eat and things to see all a short walking distance away. MOMA is just around the corner. Central Park a few blocks away. The bar can get a little noisy, but the staff always recognize you when you return a year later.

Plus of course the Warwick has a great history. The Beatles stayed there and Dylan visited them. Cary Grant lived there for 12-years.

title: Lovely hotel in ideal location
text: Just spent 3 nights here with three others for a girls weekend, in two rooms. Both rooms were very nice and comfortable.  Both faced a brick wall, which others have complained about- but the upside is there’s no street noise at all.  All of the staff we interacted with were very helpful, friendly, upbeat.  The location can’t be beat.  I don’t think I’d ever stay anywhere else in the future.  Only downside is at busy times, it’s hard to get an elevator..but we learned to use the service elevator- problem solved

title: Would you build a hotel for your gal?
text: William Randolph Hearst built this hotel so that his girlfriend Marion Davies and their other famous friends would have a place to stay in New York while she was performing down the street at the Ziegfeld Theater. Now that’s a baller move!  Cary Grant lived at the Warwick and the Beatles stayed there in the 60s. Flash forward to today and you have a moderately priced, clean and comfortable hotel right in the heart of midtown. I am always reluctant to suggest diamonds in the rough like the Warwick as I want to keep the secret to myself but here you go. My only critiques are the lack of cocktail options in the hotel and the elevator situation. The bar is only open 5-11pm daily and I went to have a Bloody Mary for brunch only to learn that they don’t serve until noon. Elevators are small and had long wait, 20 minutes to get down from 17th floor. At busy times they might consider opening the service elevator to guests. All said though, the Warwick is a great spot. I will return and you should check it out.

title: Good Value and Location
text:
My husband and I spent a week at the Warwick at the end of October. Our room was large and comfortable and we had a pleasant stay. The hotel is well located and walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway and Rockefeller Center. The MOMA is around the corner.
The staff were friendly and helpful. The elevators are small and in high demand in the mornings but the staff showed us to another set of elevators as we were departing which made it much easier to manage with our suitcases. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as it was pricey, but there are several nearby options. 
This is not a new, modern, hotel but an older building with history, charm and a few quirks. We found its room rate to be relatively reasonable compared with similar properties and would be happy to return.

title: Old school classy New York City hotel
text: I have found a home for my future New York City trips!    The Warwick NY was the quintessential hotel ...... exceptional staff inside and out, classy hotel, fantastic location, interesting history, and gorgeous room with balcony.

title: Great authentic hotel
text:
We arrived quite late after a long flight and the hotel staff were really warm and welcoming. We’d read reviews about the hotel looking tired and dated but in all honesty we thought the original features all added to its charm. The rooms were clean and whilst we did hear some beeping from cars outside it didn’t keep us up at night. 

We were in the city for the marathon and it’s location is really well placed for getting to Central Park. There’s also a number of underground stops nearby so nothing had to be a long walk if you didn’t want it to be. 5th Avenue is just around the corner and Times Square about 10mins walk away. 

We chatted to the staff throughout our trip and they couldn’t do enough for you when needed. Id left my AirPods in the room and only noticed when I’d checked out, everyone was so helpful in trying to find them but a special mention goes to Alan who personally went and checked through the laundry from the floor. He rang me when I landed in the UK, checked the serial numbers to ensure they were mine and then helped with the return process. Absolutely amazing customer service. 

If I return to New York I would definitely stay here again

title: A must in New York, if you want to experience the exquisite historical hotel.
text: A historical hotel right in the core of New York city, very central and in an excellent neighborhood. The room was very comfortable, and extremely decorated. The staff was very nice, and helpful. Definitely a place to stay in New York! Although is an historical hotel, it has accompanied the evolution of times and preserves its main decor lines.

title: Christmas In New York
text:
There's no place quite like New York City. The world-class museums, amazing food, and unforgettable views—there's always something new and exciting to discover. 

We love the awesome architecture and parks, taking in the city’s grandeur from observation decks at icons like the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock, or on a stroll across the Brooklyn Bridge or Brooklyn Heights Promenade.

title: Past its sell by date
text:
Stayed on this hotel during a business trip. Convenient location but the facilities are very tired and in need of refurbishment.
No towels in the bathroom. Tiny gym.

Location is convenient if you want to be in that part of Manhattan but extremely noisy - avoid rooms facing 6th avenue

title: Comfortably elegant!
text: I travelled to New York from Australia for my Birthday. I mentioned this to the Cabin Crew on Qantas, who presented me with a bottle of Champagne to drink on my Birthday in 2 days time. Upon arriving at The Warwick I asked if there was a fridge in the room for my Champagne. The Receptionist explained, No, there wasn't a fridge, but I could hire a small Bar fridge from them. On relaying the Qantas Birthday present story to him, he waved the fee as a Birthday gesture from the hotel. The hotel is historic, elegant, comfortable & in the most fabulous location. Times Square, Central Park, 42nd Street, 5th Avenue are all minutes away. The Randolph Bar off the Lobby is elegant & full of Business Execs relaxing after work. My room was large & looked onto 6th Avenue, for people watching. After a day out on my Birthday I returned to find a plate of ( delicious ) cookies & a hand written Birthday card from the Management. All staff were lovely & the service throughout, excellent. Concierge even got me front row Balcony seats for a show, later in the week. For movie buffs, the incredibly elegant actor Carey Grant, used to live at the Warwick during his heyday. I can't wait for my next visit to N.Y & The Warwick!! Xx

title: Great location & amenities
text: Very helpful staff, rooms have a historic feel, nice decor and quite spacious. Internet worked well. The lobby is lively. The hotel charges $2 per bag for storage. Walkable to most things to see & do in NYC. Would suggest to upgrade the room TV to smart TVs.

title: Why is the bar not open before 5 PM?
text:
1) The bar does not open until 5 PM.  Strange.  Several times we wanted a martini in the afternoon and had to go to another hotel bar.
2) The closet door in our room had a large hole in it- it had been patched, but now that was deteriorating.
3) The restaurant charges $6 for EACH ice tea.  No free refills.
4) our room was OK, rather bland-  the bathroom could use some updating.
5) Great location, nice staff, clean.

title: Charming hotel in a great location.
text:
Found The Warwick to be a charming hotel in a fantastic location - walking distance to Central Park, Bryant park, 5th Avenue, Broadway, Times Square, Empire State Building and many other key tourist sites.

Our room was a great size compared to other, newer hotels, plenty of storage to accommodate a teenager's many wardrobe options and wi-fi that was also fast enough to feed the teenager's social media requirements.

Furnishings are a little dated but it kind of added to the charm, and finding the right temperature on the shower took a bit of trial and error. The room was perfectly clean and staff friendly and helpful.

Would definitely return

title: The vice, the je ne sais quoi
text:
No, not what you’re thinking. It wasn’t the obvious nominal attraction, or seeing Warwick written all over the place in that decorous Art Deco font.
Rather it is what Dennis Denuto would call “the vibe”, or – if you will pardon my French – the je ne sais quoi.

There are newer hotels in Mid-Town Manhattan, like the anodyne Hilton across the road, and more famous ones, like the Plaza, around which Neil Simon sweetly, or suitely, fashioned his series of one act plays.
But there’s just that something about The Warwick that took us there the first time, and back twice since, the latest in September for a fortnight: The chance to stay where the young Elvis stayed, and where the Beatles did their press conference in 1965.

Cary Grant lived there permanently for more than a decade. And of course, there is Marion Davies. In a different time of American exceptionalism, when the Manhattan skyscrapers raced each other heavenward, Randolph Hearst, literally a paper millionaire, had built all 30 storeys of the Warwick Hotel so that his paramour had somewhere to live. Davies was an exotic dancer who performed at the Ziegfield Follies just up 54th Street. When this story was related to Phil, my life-time bestie who came to stay for a couple of days, he replied in his best Berambing: “She must have been a good root!”
Black and white photos of Davies in varying stages of dress and undress are all over the hotel. On the second floor, there are also photos, fully clothed, of the other rich and famous who have stayed there since 1926.  The photo of Elvis arriving at the building with his collar turned to the cold and damp is highly evocative; the young, handsome rock and roller from the days before Tom Parker ruined him. So, rock and roll, movie stars, brownstone architecture, The Warwick bespeaks much of New York, and America’s history, the two more often than not inter-twined even before Donald Trump so egregiously did so.

Being of a certain age, something another Warwick has come to understand, The Warwick Hotel has its idiosyncrasies, not the least the plumbing. The hot water seemed to come from lower Manhattan, and via snail mail, and you had to just wait for the right moment to switch the Heath Robinson piping from the bath to the shower head so as not to be drenched before you got into the shower. And then there are the lifts, which at times can feel like they’re coming from the Lower East Side and which also hark back to the days of snail mail, literally. Once upon a time, if you were Marion Davies, Cary Grant or Audrey Hepburn – another name with which to conjure given Tiffany’s is just along the way - and you wanted to post a letter, you dropped it down a shaft adjacent to the lift-well from where the concierge would take it to the post office. 

This stay, we got the king room with a balcony, the balcony we had seen from the floor above when we stayed in the Follie Suite and where, it being the middle of winter then, the guests simply left their wine and champers outside so that it was nicely chilled. The rooms are of a spaciousness that not even well-known New York crook Donald J Trump would feel a need to exaggerate.  
You could host a dinner party in the Follie Suite, and our room this time had a walk-in wardrobe, coffee table, two lounge chairs, and the little table and chairs out on the balcony, from where you could sip something chilled and watch the sun set down along 54th Street. And the balcony was also big enough to string up a line for our washing after we visited the laundromat in Hell’s Kitchen.

You see a different sort of Manhattan and Manhattanite in the laundromats. I was going to say in the raw, but no one took off all their clothes to be washed, just those in the jumble of bags which they had humped down to Ninth Avenue, right next to the restaurant that had been closed down BY ORDER OF THE NEW YORK HEALTH DEPARTMENT. Probably the original Hell’s Kitchen.  You needed 32 quarters to make each washing machine work, and when the quarters got stuck, you got a drama queen performance from the attendant as he tried to free them with an array of kitchen utensils, mumbling away to himself about stupid old people.

And speaking of Ninth Avenue, and the removal of clothes, a bit further down, in Chelsea, we went to Bathtub Gin, a faux speakeasy behind the nondescript coffee shop. You kind of officially needed a password to get into Bathtub Gin, but the security chap more than generously provided one. It was Burlesque Night, featuring the modern Marion Davies – Miss Poison Ivory and Miss Peekaboo Point, with whom one of us formed a very close attachment. Well, the fine print did say, don’t touch the dancers, but they may touch you, and we had asked for a table close to the Bathtub in the centre of the stage.

Perhaps Randolph and Marion had formed their attachment the same way.  And speaking again of Randolph, the bar bearing, as distinct from baring, his name downstairs at The Warwick, where Ermeel holds sway – is a must. Even before you take a seat in the plush leather, Ermeel has the two glasses of Californian chardonnay and Pretzels on the table. And once comfortable, you might bump into a Tony winning impresario called Murray Rosenthal who will tell you that Neil Simon’s last play was sh*t, and so too, was Plaza Suite, and that he would happily read one of your plays but be prepared for it too to be called sh*t. Then follows a dissertation on how to write a good play – Exposition, Conflict, Resolution. Hitherto, I had been relying heavily on Neil Simon’s three R’s of playwrighting, Revision, Revision, and Revision.  Mr Rosenthal has now a play re-written using both his and Neil Simon’s methodologies, and if the verdict is “sh*t” well I am in some pretty good company.

The Warwick also has a restaurant, Murals, where the food was over-priced and way under the standard of the other restaurants along 54th and 55th Street.  Bice Cucina remains a favourite, but Il Gattopardo, which had been closed because of Covid 19 on our other visits, was easily the best of the little gaggle of dining options. We did both lunch and dinner there, and it’s a mere minute walk away, past Sir Paul Macartney’s house, Sarah Jessica Parker’s old shoe shop and where the Mr Lehman had built a mansion before his bank went bust.

That’s the thing with The Warwick, it’s central to everything - Central Park, Strawberry Fields, MoMA, The Museum of Natural History, Radio City, the Broadway theatres, the horse on Seventh Avenue (Simon and Garfunkel joke which got a fair airing when Phil was in town), the New York Public Library, Bryant Park – idiosyncratically adding its own vibe to theirs.

title: Great location
text:
They upgraded me to a suite with a dinning area and living room and separate bedroom. Great views up and down 6th avenue from my room and a total comfort environment. 
If any downside the bathroom is quite small and the toilet is very small and short making it difficult for a big guy. (not a problem for my return)
It is easy to get to the Broadway shows (we did 3 this week) and loads of dinning spots near the home. 
One of the hotels I will return to in the city.

title: Acolhedor
text: Eu gosto desse hotel, tem a cara de NY. É acolhedor, confortável e com excelente localização. Ao lado do MoMA. Mesmo os quartos menores e sem vista valem a pena. Foram reformados e tudo funciona bem. Mantiveram o estilo clássico na decoração dos quartos. Banheiro com ótimo chuveiro. No lobby tem um bom restaurante e um bar muito simpático. Nessa categoria tem um ótimo custo benefício.

title: MALTRATO AL HUÉSPED!!!! MUY MAL MANTENIDO
text:
Volví recién de NY me alojé en una suite la 907 fue la semana de la lluvia y frío el cuarto además de mal mantenido luces quemadas mal servicio de mucamas NO ANDABA LA CALEFACCIÓN ME MORÍ DE FRÍO MANDARON   “LOS INGENIEROS “ en 3 oportunidades NO PASO NADA ni me ofrecieron cambiar de habitación!!! LA PASÉ MALLLLLLLLL!!!
TAMPOCO BUEN TRATO C EL HUÉSPED!!

title: Absolute Perfection!
text:
We stayed for 8 nights in a Premier Suite with a separate living room.  I had thought the sofa was a sofa bed, but this was not the case.  No worries though - called the front desk and a good-quality cot was brought up.
Might be worth it to pay a bit extra for a view.  I didn't realize that "no view" didn't just mean a poor view - you are literally looking at a brick wall. Can't see the sky or the ground.  
There was a fridge (and a minibar) and coffee machine in our room.  Microwaves are not available.
LOVED the doormen. They were all super cool!
Front desk was great, housekeeping was great.  Zero complaints during our 8 nights.

title: Beware of rooms facing brick walls.
text:
First time at this hotel. Picked it because of the one bedroom option which is perfect for families. Upon walking in we were very impressed with our room. Old school New York elegant. Comfortable and well appointed.

The only major problem was with the lack of transparency and lame explanation for putting us in a corner room facing brick walls. It was unacceptable for them to relate this time and again. “We are sold out” is not an excuse for charging full rate for a room that was located in the worst possible corner of the hotel.

They have no business charging full rate for a room that feels like you are in solitary confinement. 

Otherwise great location, close enough to the sites and restaurants but far away from the crowds.

title: Awesome,!!Satisfying,Educational,Delightful
text: The service was great!The rooms comfortable and beautifully decorated. If needed housekeeper available anytime. Great bar.Clean,Beautiful.Staff pleasant.The door man very nice.Experience wonderful .P.s.jus get a room with a view.

title: Cockroaches, beware!!!
text: The place is infested with Cockroaches, it's crazy! I found three in my room this morning in the matter of 3 minutes, two dead and one alive in the closet to greet me when I opened the door. I told the manager and he said let me see the pictures (as if he didn't know there was a Cockroach problem), and as I was showing him another dead cockroach showed-up right next to the desk in the lobby (can't make this up, and all the Manager and his clerk started doing was laughing when I showed them the cockroach next to their own desk)...Never will stay here again, especially since they failed to fully comp my room and only provided a $150 discount.

title: Very disappointing
text: I've stayed at the Warwick several times over the years, and always appreciated the fact that this venerable hotel, though no longer top tier, was comfortable and well-located. But based on my recent trip, I won't do another stay. This time around I found the rooms to be depressingly bare. The air conditioning didn't appear to be working in the hallways -- which we know about because we spent an inordinate amount of time in them, waiting for the elevator to come (a major problem unto itself that the hotel needs to deal with.) At check-out time there looked to be a line out the door to store luggage, and I heard someone say that there was a charge for doing so -- definitely a first. In short, aside from the friendly staff, the Warwick no longer has anything to recommend it, and has sadly lost whatever luster it ever had.

title: Excellent stay . Would definitely go back
text:
Excellent central location. Only short walk to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway. 
Nice staff.
Great quiet room
Has a great restaurant and close many other options for meals.
It was my first time in NYC and I would definitely use this hotel again.

title: Average experience
text: Nothing special. If you’re looking for an average,  clean room then this is an ideal choice. There was lots of noise when people walked outside the room. It was hard to sleep at time due to that. Room was clean, bathroom was clean but not much of a view.

title: Lovely hotel, great staff!
text: I booked this hotel as a package through Last-minute.com, as it was well-priced and the location was good. It was near Central Park, and there was a Prets around the corner and a couple of food stores very nearby. When I arrived I was told I'd been upgraded to a suite! It was absolutely lovely - bigger than my first apartment! There was a living room, large bedroom, bath and shower, a tiny kitchen, two TVs, walk in cupboard with hairdryer, iron and ironing board, safe, and luggage stand; two bottles of water, a coffee maker, slippers, recycling bins, desk with sockets, and loads of drawer units. There were three windows... the only downside was that the views from each were brick walls! But I wasn't there for the view! Staff were lovely, very helpful, especially the doorman who looked after me, and got me cabs. Unfortunately I didn't eat at the restaurant or bar... that was just because my itinerary meant I didn't get the chance. I loved my brief time at the Warwick New York! Thank you.

title: The War of the Wick - Ruining a Ziegfeld Wedding
text:
We used the Warwick for our wedding room block. After a few weeks, we noticed that our block wasn't filled up. It turned out that the room rate they booked our room at was a 30% _PREMIUM_ over the published website rate.

We tracked down all of the relevant confirmation numbers of those that booked outside the block, but they still made it a massive hassle to meet our minimum. We tried to add suites for our family to increase our block utilization and they simply did not respond... for weeks. Eventually we booked the suites on their website, which they refused to include in the block utilization. At one point they swore off our block entirely and forwarded us to their legal department.

The hotel itself is better than a motel if you like small rooms designed in the early 1990s. Our wedding suite, Suite of the Stars, smelled like someone's grandmother and clearly hadn't had a refresh in at least two decades.

There is some stipulation in their union that doesn't allow them to provide room service, liquor, or anything related even if you are there for your wedding.

We Drizlied some refreshments and received a fiery email from our representative demanding that we vow that we were not putting on an event, reminding us that there would be additional fees if we were.

The Warwick staff were provided with welcome bags to distribute to our guests. At the end of the wedding, we realized that they had withheld 20 bags for some inexplicable reason, including from my own mother. They then showed their true colors by blaming it on my wedding planner, who had written records proving it was the Warwick's mistake.

This hotel created the low light of our wedding. I hear the Beatles and some other stars stayed at this hotel in the 60s and it's clear that they've ridden that fame ever since, not putting an ounce of thought into hospitality.

title: Big City Hotel
text: This is an older hotel in a perfect location, around the corner from MOMA, a block from Fifth Avenue, a short walk to St. Patrick’s, Rockefeller Center, Sak’s! My room was large and light, though the view was just a generic city view. But it’s gigantic! ( My room was on the 31st floor.) That means hordes of guests and a flurry of activity in the lobby. The desk staff processed us in and out like cattle. I missed a personal, friendly touch. When I asked for change for a big bill so I could leave a tip for housekeeping,  I got : “We don’t give change.” After that I stayed out of their way. The staff in the breakfast room were friendlier.

title: Love this hotel!!
text: We just had an amazing experience at the Warwick! I absolutely love that hotel. With all the hustle and bustle of New York it is a quiet luxury. We had room 2309 which had a huge terrace, lovely king bed and nice sitting area. Loved it!!

title: Beautiful hotel at a five star location
text: A very beautiful building at a perfect location in Midtown. We walked easily to Times Square, Central Park, the Museum of Natural History, Summit one, Grand Central Terminal, Bryant Park, Rockefelller etc. We had a premier suite with city view and city view we definitely had! Loved it. The Suite was very big and had one bedroom so it was perfect because we travelled with our infant.

title: Amazing historic hotel with a lot of charm.
text: Great location and kind, helpful staff. We booked city view room with a balcony (2517) and were greeted by the most incredible huge terrace overlooking 6th Ave. If you can overlook few wall cracks and furniture scratches, this hotel is definitely unique and worth considering. It’s different from no character copy/paste newer establishments. Hopefully we will come back.

title: A staid hotel with ample space for you and your things.
text:
This staid old-line hotel has been a staple place to bed down for years along with the Algonquin, Essex House and others to many to mention.  Located on 6th Avenue and 54th Street, it was convenient to 5th Avenue shopping, the Theater District, Lincoln Center, museums, and a slew of excellent restaurants.  While we were only on the twelfth floor, we had a spacious room with suitable accoutrements including a large sitting area with sofa, lounge chair and writing desk.  The marble bath was well appointed with a suitable number of towels and high-end bath gels, shampoos, conditioners, and hand creams.  

The closet was large with a suitcase rest, safe, ironing board and iron, plenty of hangers and a full-length mirror.  The credenza housed a bar refrigerator, as well as many drawers for clothing and other things.  There was access to high-speed internet, charging stations and a large screen TV with access to many cable and commercial channels.  There was also a bar sink with counterspace for coffee maker and Starbuck’s coffee and teas.  The king size bed was very comfortable with a firm mattress and soft fluffy pillows that one could nestle into for a good night’s sleep.  

The hotel charges were reasonable by New York standards and won’t bankrupt you.  We have been to many NYC hotels and are very impressed with The Warwick.  It caters to your needs and there is never a want.  It is far superior to other hotels in terms of room size and space for things.  One does not feel as if they are staying in a shoebox.  We will return to The Warwick on our next New York visit.

title: Mixed experience in the heart of NYC
text:
Staying with my husband and two young kids. Charming hotel in the heart of NYC midtown, close to Central Park, Moma, Times Square, metro station. Plenty of restaurants and bakeries. 
We booked a room with two doubles for the four of us. On arrival we were told we’d been upgraded to a room with a view. The room did have a decent fourth floor view over 6th Av however the double beds were only just wider than singles. We asked reception if this was normal and the answer was yes, no offer to change. They couldn’t bring an extra mattress either. 
Each adult had to share a bed with a kid as there’s no way two adults would fit comfortably in these doubles. 
On our last night a massive cockroach came charging out of the ensuit! 
If it weren’t for the mini beds and the cockroach I would definitely recommend this hotel for its location and old-world charm.

title: Great location but resting on it’s laurels
text: This hotel, surrounded by scaffold as so many structures are in NY these days is perfectly placed for a weekend in NY, bring a short hop from both Times Square and the Park. Rooms are large and spacious however they are very tired looking and could do with updating and reinvigorating to bring the hotel back to the grandeur of former years. Same can be said for the bathrooms, which are functional but set back in 80s styling and need a revamp

title: Fab hotel for family holiday
text:
Stayed at the Warwick for 6 nights with my partner & 2 children aged 13 & 10. We had read the reviews before booking so joined the Warwick journeys program & booked directly with the hotel as the rate was quite a bit cheaper than on other booking sites. Being members also meant that we didn’t pay any resort fees and got free WiFi (essential with 2 kids!!). The hotel was in an ideal location for us, 12 minute walk to Times Square, only a few blocks from Central Park & only a few minutes from the subway. We booked a premier city view room which looked out onto 6th Ave, 2 queen sized beds & the room was spacious & clean. Had a hairdryer, safe, coffee machine, iron & ironing board, walk in wardrobe, fridge. The air con kept the room lovely & cool. It was cleaned every day. The lifts could be slow but it didn’t bother us. The staff on reception were friendly, and we were able to leave our bags after check out for only $2 per bag. 
All in all a great stay. We’ll definitely recommend the hotel & will stay again when we come back to New York!

title: Experiencia fantástica
text: Hemos disfrutado de una estancia realmente buena ya que, algunas de las críticas negativas que habíamos leído, no las hemos sufrido ninguno de los 7 días que hemos estado alojados. Las habitaciones son amplias, espaciosas y muy limpias. Las camas son comodísimas y hemos estado como en casa. Nunca hemos tenido que esperar por un ascensor, y eso que el hotel estaba lleno. La decoración es clásica pero muy cuidada y bonita. El personal también muy amable y la ubicación excelente. Sin duda, lo recomiendo a todo el mundo y volveremos a hospedarnos en este hotel cuando volvamos, Nueva York siempre es un buen plan.

title: Good Central Location for sightseeing ....
text:
Arrived from Scotland for my 60th birthday.  I got an email (automated I think) with what extras you could have in your room for arrival.  My husband emailed Guest Services to ask for something in my room for my birthday, but no one got back to him.  So arrived in our room to nothing sadly.  Was a bit upset, as hubby got balloons, cake, macaroons etc but that was a 5 star Scottish hotel.  On check in I was told there was no room service due to covid, but the cleaners were in every day.  I joined the Journey Loyalty Program but didn't get an upgrade which was listed as a bonus and despite it being my 60th birthday.  But we didn't have to pay the gym costs - didn't use it anyway as did enough walking about in NYC.  Chose this hotel for the history .... it was good enough for James Dean, Elvis and Beatles then good enough for me!

We were due to arrive on Tuesday at 2:30pm, but British Airways and JFK Airport had other ideas.  Due to thunderstorms the airport was closed and we got diverted to Logan Airport in Boston instead.  I emailed the hotel as we had a car booked which was eventually cancelled as British Airways didn't get a bus for us to JFK until 2:30am.  We arrived at the hotel around 7am and checked in - our room was ready and had been held over from the night before.  There was a dispute with the manager by email regarding how much we paid as a no show (when it wasn't our fault) but we came to a compromise and its sorted now.

The hotel is in a central location and easy to walk to 5th Avenue, Central Park and other mid town areas.  The room was clean, cool in the heat and quite comfortable.  I am a light sleeper and able to sleep ok despite the noise outside.  Shower was good too and we got enough towels.  Didn't use the restaurant but used Randolph Bar which was pretty cool with comfy sofas etc.  Drinks were ok too.  Glad we went for a room with a separate seating area -  Rooms in NYC hotels are normally quite small so good to have the extra space.  Join the loyalty program and book early enough, the prices are cheaper.

title: Warwick is a Winner
text: My husband and I stayed at the Warwick for four nights, beginning July 19, 2023 in a one bedroom suite with city view (54th St.) This is our third time at the hotel that never disappoints. Previously we had interior views and the city view is of course much superior but the room prices reflect this. As others have said, the location is excellent with a short walk to the F train, 6th Ave. buses, Central Park, restaurants, cafes, museums (right behind MOMA), and Starbucks (but what hotel isn't near a Starbucks!). I'm surprised by some of the negative reviews as our room was beautifully appointed, spacious, clean, and quiet. The housekeeping was excellent and all the staff very friendly. Even though the hotel was busy, I did not find the elevators slow  to arrive as some have said and although they are a bit small as you might expect in a historic hotel, they move very quickly. If you want a classic hotel, this is the place.

title: Atmosfera di inizio Novecento nel cuore di Manhattan, favoloso!
text:
Bellissimo albergo di inizio Novecento, il cui stile è stato perfettamente conservato nel tempo pur avendo ristrutturato stanze e ambienti comuni.
Ci troviamo in un'ottima posizione che consente di raggiungere a piedi moltissime delle principali attrazioni di Manhattan: museo MOMA, Central Park, Times Square, Radio City Hall, Rockfeller Center, Broadway nonché la 5th Avenue.
Nelle vicinanze ci sono anche diverse fermate della metro.
Abbiamo soggiornato per otto notti al 15° piano in una stanza con 2 queen bed molto ampia e con una comoda cabina armadio. Pulizia giornaliera molto accurata, prodotti da bagno di buona qualità.
Al terzo piano è presente una piccola palestra discretamente attrezzata; molto belli sia il bar sia il ristorante (dove viene servita anche la colazione), i prezzi medio/alti come tipico di NY.
Il personale alla reception è un po' distaccato e "indifferente" al cliente (non salutano e non sorridono mai, che peccato!); tuttavia devo riconoscere una notevole efficienza e celerità nel fare fronte alle richieste.
Inoltre, a causa della cancellazione del nostro volo, abbiamo dovuto trattenerci una notte in più e hanno fatto tutto il possibile per farci tenere la stessa stanza nonostante il brevissimo preavviso (e comunque pagando un sovrapprezzo per questa "cortesia", ma siamo a NY tutto ha un prezzo!).
Unico disappunto è stato il fatto che avevo prenotato una stanza Queen bed con vista sullo skyline di NY (pagandola ovviamente di più della Queen Bed senza vista) e invece la finestra - peraltro molto grande - si affacciava su una strada laterale interna veramente brutta. 
Se torneremo a New York, sicuramente soggiorneremo nuovamente in questo hotel che mi sento assolutamente di consigliare anche per il rapporto qualità prezzo (però acquistate direttamente dal sito dell'albergo!)

title: Warwick hotel New York
text: A real old-fashioned new york hotel.Not the swankiest,not the most famous but just a lovely quiet hotel that delivers exactly what you want on a stay in the city. The bar is a great spot to lose a couple of hours and overall it is a nice place to retreat when you need a break from having fun around town.

title: Old, tired and dated
text:
Checked in for 2 nights but only stayed for one because I felt so uncomfortable in the smelly, humid room. The a/c wasn’t really working and after reporting it to the front desk, they said they would send a maintenance person. When I returned back 7 hours later the room was warmer and more humid then before I left. The room had a faint smell of urine as well and I do t know if was from the a/c unit not being maintained. I did not have wash clothes or a bath mat in the bathroom. The bathroom itself was so small with no place to store toiletries. The bed was very stiff and uncomfortable with think standard pillows. 

There are many other great places to stay in NYC and while this hotel once had its place among them, sadly it has lost its luster. Avoid.

title: New York
text:
Al momento del check in ho avuto problemi perché la mia carta era stata bloccata e mi dispiace doverlo dire ma nessuno della reception è sembrato mettere a proprio agio il cliente straniero, stanco dal viaggio e in difficoltà.... Camera molto spaziosa con due letti adatti per una famiglia,.Peccato solo aver soggiornato al terzo piano quando avevo espressamente chiesto, mesi prima, durante la prenotazione un piano alto, i miei figli ci tenevano molto.
La posizione è comoda e vicina a Central Park.

title: One of the Best Hotels in the Midtown area!
text: I’m a very picky traveler and picked the Warwick Hotel back in 2019 and have been coming back here!  The rooms are very nice.  Clean and spacious.  I was on the 19th floor during this trip and it nice and quiet.  The Wi-Fi is very reliable and the food in the restaurant is very good, too.  The staff is also great.  For the last 3 times I visited, I’m always greeted by Marc C.  He’s friendly and always professional, providing excellent customer service.  The location of this hotel is in a prime location!  Easy to walk to Central Park to Hells Kitchen to Fifth Avenue!  I’ve been to the other Warwick Hotels in Seattle, Chicago, Dallas and NYC.  All are very nice, but there is nothing like NYC!  THANK YOU, WARWICK HOTEL, for another great stay!

title: Historic hotel at an convenient location
text: Old historic hotel with interesting stories where most of well-known celebs had stayed before. The room is small but still better compared to other hotels in NY. Restroom is old, need a rennovation soon. The restroom located at the waiting lounge on the second floor had bad odors. If the price is reasonable, I can manage to stay again. Very short walk to Central Park, Times Square and Carnegie Hall.

title: June week in NYC
text: Haven’t been here in many years. Good value for the money and it still has some of the old charm. Location is great walking to the theater and many restaurants. Go to the TKTS booth up at Lincoln Center much shorter lines

title: Perfect stay at the Warwick
text: Fantastic hotel and the best location. As we said when we checked out our stay was perfect. Firstly, the hotel is in a prime location, subway stop right on the doorstep and the E train (brings you to the air train is a 4 min walk away). The staff were a credit to the hotel, so friendly and a lovely welcome (especially the happy doorman). Our room was big with a huge king size bed and extremely clean. Housekeeping were also extremely friendly, big smiley face each morning. Randolph’s bar was a lovely pit stop to finish our evenings off, drinks were pricey but what you would expect for a hotel. We had all the amenities like free wifi. They also very kindly gave us a complimentary late check out until 1pm which we were so grateful for as it meant we didn’t need to rush. We read about long wait times for the elevators but didn’t find this an issue at all, it’s a big hotel with a lot of floors so found it normal wait times. The only tiny downside is just that it is an old hotel but if you know to expect that then the hotel will not disappoint in the slightest. We would 100% recommend the Warwick and really look forward to staying again for the location, the staff and overall ambiance. Thank you for a wonderful stay for my Fiancés 40th birthday and making our stay one that we will never forget.

title: Our experience at the Warwick was just per in every way! We had a beautiful room with a terrace that was amazing!
text: Amazing stay at the Warwick! We came in on a Groupon for three days and then were stranded for another two. Jamal at the front desk was so nice and helpful!  We had drinks at the bar downstairs and the drinks were great at a good price! Our suite with a terrace was amazing! We will definitely return!

title: Great location
text:
Location is absolutely perfect can easily walk to many areas and many train stops nearby!! The room was very nice with plenty of room and quiet. 

This is our 2nd time staying here and we were shocked when we went to leave our bags with the bellman when our room was not ready and that there would be a charge $2 per bag. We asked why they said a new policy. Also they would not allow the charge onto our room. It seemed odd that we had to pay cash and could not be added onto room. No one could give reason for the charge or who the cash went directly too. When you are paying in our case almost $1000 for a stay it did not sit well being charged for bags storage. However if that is the policy there should be more transparency and should be noted upon making a reservation and signage near front desk or luggage room.

title: ok but would stay somewhere else
text:
good and bad. I would stay somewhere else next time. there are too many other options

Good 
- great location
- nice room
- bar and restaurant onsite

Bad 
- felt nickel and dimed 
- charged to hold bags while waiting for room to be ready
- charged to hold bags after checkout
- parking - charged by 24 hours - so you can stay 1 night and get charged for more than 24 hours for parking depending on arrival and departure time
- restaurant charged a hotel tax in addition to sales tax - I think that is an error. it wasnt room service

title: Good location but tired hotel
text:
Third visit to the Warwick - this will be my last visit. Hotel has a good location, ground floor bar and restaurant spaces are comfortable and give the impression of a classic and stylish hotel.

The hotel rooms are spacious and comfortable, however there has been very little investment in the hotel rooms and common areas, everywhere is showing it’s age. We stayed in a corner suite with a separate lounge area, not the most inspiring  suite we have stayed in. Coffee machine - just plain nasty.

Given the prices you pay to stay in the hotel, the quality is just not there any more.

A tired hotel in need of refurbishment. Third visit and third time the hotel had scaffolding around the hotel lower floors.

title: Horribly understaffed
text: The hotel has seen better days, but the room was fine. The problem is that the hotel was horribly understaffed. They were long waits for check-in, check out, and a 30 minute wait to leave your bag with the Bellman. Nobody on the staff, give any thought to doing anything extra or out of the ordinary. Service was minimal at best. Very disappointing for the price.

title: What a shame. Nickels and Dimes
text: Following a great 4 nights with the staff always happy to assist, amazed to be told , on checkout that a bag charge of $2 per piece applied if left in the left luggage room. We had already been refused late checkout , although we are Warwick members and this is supposedly one of the perks. When challenged, the manager said it was hotel policy to charge for left luggage and refused to discuss. We were a party of 4 with 7 pieces. Would it have hurt him to wave the $14? Just saying!!

title: Great stay!
text: We stayed at the Warwick over Memorial Day weekend. One adult and 3 teens.  The best part about this hotel was the room size and the location.  The suite is very large and comfortable, with a large living area and bedroom.  The location was convenient to everything in the city. The room was slightly dated,it had character and was clean and nice. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Ubicación ideal en un 4 * accesible a pocos metros del Central Park
text: El hotel cumplió todas nuestras expectativas, la habitación cómoda, amplia y bien equipada para 3 personas, con heladera pequeña y cafetera, camas confortables y todo lo necesario para una excelente estadía en NY. Lo repetiría sin dudarlo

title: Loved our stay!
text: This was recommended by a family friend and I'm so glad we stayed here! It's apart from our normal hotels and we were not disappointed at all! Super friendly staff, very clean room and hotel. I would stay here again next time we visit NYC!

title: Excellent Hotel (singing praises of the package room/lost and found/security/housekeeping)
text:
We loved our stay at the Warwick. We had a corner junior suite that is spacious and clean. The hotel has its old world charm and modern comfort. The location of the hotel is superb!

I would especially like to sing the praises of the package room, the lost and found, the security and the housekeeper(s) who cleaned our room after we checked out. 

My husband lost his phone and we thought it was pickpocketed. Turned out the phone was left in our room. The house keeper found it. Mr. Daly from the security/package room/lost and found office(s) called me to let us know that they had the phone. He was most professional and helpful. He informed the entire security team that our friend would pick up the phone so that there would be no confusion. 

We were so impressed with the level of service we received.

title: Mandligt frontpersonale!
text:
Nygift par tjekker ind, hvoraf der er divergens i efternavn - hvilket resulterer i en dramatisk reaktion ift. snyd og svindel. 
Trods godkendt transaktion på Visa, er hotellet sikret betaling, alligevel skal Booking.com kontaktes og vi blev nægtet indtjekning! 

Til sidst får vi adgang til værelse, og ved udtjekning mødes vi af en venlig dame, hun får de 2 stjerner. 

Måske det mandlige personale trænger til uddannelse i kundeservice!

title: excelente
text:
Hotel com uma localização excelente, poucas quadras do central parque e da times square (o que é ótimo a noite). Mercadinho no quarteirão do hotel, o que ajuda bastante para quem querer tomar cafe da manha no quarto. Peguei uma semana de chuvas em NY e o hotel disponibilizou guarda chuva para a familia toda. 
Achei que o hotel seria antigo, mas quando cheguei me surpreendi, muito limpo, características antigas são preservadas o que da charme para o hotel. Cama excelente king, com quarto amplo, único ponto negativo foi o banheiro ser muito pequeno! 
Parte da minha familia ficou em um quarto com 2 camas de casal, a cama era pequena, mas muito confortável e nessa suite o banheiro era enorme, muito bom! 
Indico o hotel e voltaria parq ele com certeza!

title: Watch out for hidden costs and bricked up views
text:
Room with a view?? Brick wall with no light, couldn’t tell if it was night or day, dirty towels taken away but no fresh towels left had to go ask at desk for them, as reception didn’t answer phones this happened two days out of four. 
Breakfast was awful, turkey bacon, one hash brown and a couple of eggs for $26 and rude waiters. 
When we checked out we were charged $81 for breakfast with the added tax and a ridiculous add tip of 15% for bad service. We were also charged another $87 for taxes and amenities ( the supposed free WiFi and the unused gym ) this was not at any time mentioned when booking. 
Rude staff and bad service would not recommend

title: Our new favorite Manhattan hotel
text:
We had a choice of several hotels for the weekend stay, but the Warwick offered the biggest room for the lowest rate so decided to stay there bypassing our usual favorites. We definitely made the right choice and the Warwick is now our new favorite Manhattan hotel. The service was friendly from check-in to check-out, the rooms large and very clean. The adjacent restaurant was a delightful escape in the pouring rain with good food and nice background live music. And hotel is close to several different subway lines--as well as within walking distance of many of our favorite spots.
    The only flaw--and it's very slight--are the elevators which are exceptionally small and slow. If you need one during a busy time, you've got to plan ahead and add a few minutes to avoid being late.

title: Thank you, Warwick!
text: Absolutely great hotel, wonderfully placed. Had awesome view of the Avenue, room clean and good size, very well kept. Bar and restaurant very serviceminded, with great atmosphere. My second visit (this time with my dad). Absolutely A plus.

title: DA PROVARE
text: Siamo stati molto bene in questo hotel. Per chi ama soggiornare nel caos di Manhattan è perfetto... si trova a 150 m a piedi da Central Park e a 200 m a piedi da Radio City e dal Moma, Rockfeller Center, St. Patrick e tutti i grandi negozi. Inoltre è  perfettamente collegato con la metro.  E' un albergo newyorkese vecchia maniera, come una volta, ma perfettamente conservato e molto elegante, quindi dormire al Warwick  ti dà l'atmosfera della vera New York, inoltre ha un bel bar e un ottimo ristorante (anche se a prezzi molto elevati, ma nella media del quartiere). Camera enorme, letto enorme e molto comodo, bagno molto grande e tutto pulitissimo e ben tenuto. Macchina del ghiaccio al piano. Non c'è che dire. Consigliatissimo.

title: Great experience March 2023
text: Thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Warwick on my 16 year old son's first trip to NYC. We stayed in room 321 for four nights and were very pleased with everything. Yes, the hotel rooms could use a little bit of updating, but I cannot say enough about how friendly and awesome the staff was. Rooms and bathrooms very clean, full size luxury toiletries in the shower, very comfortable beds. The location is the best part, you truly cannot find a better location for a NYC trip. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, in fact the next time I am able to travel to NYC, the Warwick will be the first hotel I look into!

title: Comfortable,  clean and great location
text: PERFECT LOCATION near theaters,  restaurants and museums.  Price was typical for NY, so it is what it is.  Room was comfortable, cleaned and serviced daily.  Pleasantly old fashioned,  but no American breakfast in hotel. Astro Diner was one block away for a hearty breakfast and simple lunch or dinner.  Lots of convenience stores around for snacks, bottled water,  incidentals and a little fridge in the room to keep things cold and fresh.

title: Bien situado
text: Hotel súper bien situado, personal amable, tuvimos una noche una incidencia con un ruido que venía del aire acondicionado del piso superior y lo gestionaron y arreglaron al momento. El hotel está antiguo, especialmente el cuarto de baño pero está todo limpio en general. La habitación era luminosa y  amplia con espacio suficiente para guardar la ropa de 4 personas 1 semana. Es caro para lo que ofrecen y el estado en el que está, pero como la mayoría de hoteles de Manhattan. Recomendamos alojarse en un piso alto ya que hay bastante ruido de la calle. Las camas son estrechas, nosotros dormíamos 2 personas en cada una (un adulto + niño) y son justas. Lo mejor la localización y lo peor los ascensores, lentos y muchísima cola.

title: Will definitely come back
text:
Amazing hotel. Clean, tidy and spacious rooms. Staff were very helpful
Location was perfect with many eateries close by for convenience and far enough away from the hussle and bustle of Time Square that we frequently walked to
Highly recommended

title: Fantastic stay
text: My sister and I stayed here while we were in New York for an opening at MOMA. The location is fantastic. Our room was immaculate as is the entire hotel. Wonderful staff. Loved the bar for cocktails in the evening. Wish they served food. We will absolutely stay here again.

title: Exceptional stays at the Warwick Hotel NYC
text: The service is incredible! John, the doorman, is very attentive and helpful. Michael, the front desk manager, is exceptional! He goes above and beyond to accommodate all of our needs each time we return. Jose always provides the best recommendations for restaurants and activities in the city. The service of all the employees is the reason why we continue to return to the Warwick hotel as repeated guests. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. We highly recommend the Warwick hotel, which is in a great location in the city!

title: Warwick awful hotel
text: Absolutely horrible.. it’s such a old hotel … the restaurant is absolutely awful… run by kids .. the rest room was awful dirty … dirty dishes outside the toilet… the food would have been better in McDonald’s .. we have just done a month travelling around American and this was the worst hotel … there’s no way this is a 4 star hotel 2 and a half tops … really disappointed

title: OUTSTANDING!!
text:
By far the best hotel experience I've had in quite some time. The hotel staff (Matt) is very accommodating and friendly, they very much so obviously care about the guests and strive to make it a pleasurable experience for everyone. We can for the Saint Patrick’s day parade weekend and stayed In one of the suites and overall a luxuries atmosphere that exceeds expectations.  We also stayed in a regular room this time around. And it was just as nice. 
My Go To!!

title: The Real Deal
text: My husband and I make overnight visits to NYC to see a show or visit museums.  I always book near where we are going and for the best reasonable price.  I’m seeing a pattern emerge.  We like the Warwick the best. Location is great - near Moma, Central park and theater district.  It’s an old hotel in great shape.  You might say it has good bones.  Nice lobby with doorman, great staff at desk, on site bar and restaurant, not too big.  More important- rooms are comfortable and thoughtful- has enough plugs for gadgets,  easy coffee maker, really comfortable beds, soundproof.  It’s an old building with real wood doors.   You can see that it’s a solid building that’s been maintained well and the staff knows it’s stuff.

title: Perfect stay for family getaway
text:
We stayed here for four nights mid week and got a great rate for a city view double. When we arrived we decided to upgrade to a king suite for a small extra fee. This gave us a king bed in a larger room, larger bathroom and sizeable pull out sofa for our teenage son. The bed and bedding were incredibly comfortable. The room was quiet and a perfect amount of space for us. The temperature was always suitable and we didn’t feel the need to run the AC. The room wasn’t well stocked when we arrived, no coffee or extra bedding for the pullout but housekeeping quickly responded. The only other issue we had was no towels one day (they were taken but not replaced) but again, quickly remedied with a phone call. All the staff were very friendly and responsive.

MoMA is directly across the street, Rockefeller Centre and Central Park are both just a few blocks away.

You can’t beat the location, comfort and style of this hotel. It was my third stay and will always be my first choice when I visit Manhattan in the future.

title: Classic but a little dated
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights for business. Classic NY hotel, and a landmark in its own right. The hotel has a great midtown location, easily accessible by subway or cab. 

Hotel furnishings are all classic with an early 20th century vibe. Unfortunately, a lot of that history carries over to make the hotel feel its age. Holes from fixtures previously hung on the wall remain. Elevators can be slow, especially during busy times of the day. I don't recommend ingesting the brown hot water from the tap (see photo). The gym lacked cleaning wipes during my entire stay. One of the three treadmills was missing its safety key, making it inoperable. 

The room itself was relatively quiet, with street noise (on the 6th Ave side) audible but not obtrusive. Mine was spacious (especially by NYC standards). Bed and pillows were comfortable. Aside from the brown hot water, the bathroom is typical NYC-tight. 

Staff do not seem particularly eager to make your stay awesome. 

I'll will stay here when work compels it, but it will not likely be my first choice for a midtown stay.

title: Our go to hotel in New York City
text:
This is our usual hotel in NYC.  We used to live in the area, so we have friends and relative that live in NYC and Long Island.  The hotel is very comfortable,  well located at a reasonable price.  It is nice to have the bar off the lobby for a drink or to meet people.  

Note some room have interior views that are not so great.

title: Wawick after 50 years still one of the best hotels to book t when in NYC!
text:
I had stayed at the Warwick over 50 years ago - and had quite forgotten what a wonderful hotel it was. Friend with whom I was traveling had stayed there recently and recommended that we stay there.
What a pleasant suprise. The hotel may be one of the older hotels in the city - but the hotel rate and the great staff are "top notch"!
The restaurant is also extremely good, well priced and the waiters are very attentive,
I would certainly recommend the Warwick for its staff, its location and their very fair rates.
From now on the Warwick will be my hotel of choice for any trip to NYC!

title: Really, what's not to love here???
text: Really, to read some of these reviews, one wonders what people expect.  The Salisbury having been demolished, we stayed here for the first time for our first trip back to NYC since the pandemic.  We loved it.  The staff could not have been more accommodating (early check in, late check out).  The room (by NYC standards) was large (~350 ft2), with high ceilings, lovely marble bath, real furniture made of actual wood, a king-sized bed that was actually a king, not a queen, lovely heavy drapes.  So okay, the view out the window was an air shaft.  So what?  Who stays in their hotel room in New York?  We never had a problem waiting for an elevator.  Super convenient location.  Superbly quiet.  And for this silent film buff, a happy surprise -- photos of Marion Davies in our room (and throughout the hotel).  Turns out the hotel was built by her paramour, William Randolph Hearst, and she had a suite in one of the towers.  Pros: many; cons: none.  Ignore the naysayers and reserve without qualm -- unless you're a fan of the current sterile style of hotels, you will be very happy here.

title: Parfait
text: Troisième séjour dans cet hôtel et toujours aussi satisfait. Cet établissement a une histoire et ça ressent. Il garde tout son charme malgré les années. Les suites avec salon sont formidables pour des séjours en famille (il faut juste faire attention à bien prendre une vue sur la rue ou l’avenue, sinon elles seront sombres). Nous y reviendrons dès que possible.

title: Stealth charges beware
text:
Would really give this hotel a wide birth if you want to keep your money, when booking the hotel we were made aware of city taxes which I knew we would have to pay!

When we checked in, they took a deposit of $200 for city taxes and incidentals which isn’t unusual 

When we came to check out we were landed with a bill of $175 for hotel fees, I queried this as it wasn’t mentioned when checking in (why would they) and it covers the gym and Wi-Fi which when we checked in we were told these were FREE

Queried with the lady checking us out and she wasn’t bothered, her attitude and customer service was disgusting 

When giving our bags to the concierge and querying him on these fees he said it’s a stealthy way to get more money out of its customers and it’s a common theme with many guests not knowing this is due 

Location was fantastic but feel cheated and mislead by the hotel, would really advise anyone looking at staying here to avoid at all costs

title: 3 gg business trip
text: Non male. Posizione strategica a due passi da Time Square e praticamente a 150 m dalla 5 strada. Letto super comodo. Pulizia un po’ all’americana, migliorabile. Tutto sommato per essere in centro anche il prezzo non è eccessivo.

title: Great Hotel with a Tiny Bathroom
text: I enjoyed my stay at the Warwick for the most part.  The staff were top notch, friendly and professional.  It sits in a great location for mid-town and theater activities.  The food in the restaurant (Murals) was terrific and the lobby bar was fun.  The room was clean and comfortable and the price was right, but the bathroom in the room was absolutely tiny.  I have never seen such a small bathroom in a hotel before in my life, including old European hotels that converted to en suite.  I am not a big person and I barely had enough room to shave.  I probably will stay there again on business because I enjoyed the staff so much, but I don’t think I would stay there if there two of us in the room.

title: Warm, welcoming, well-kept hotel
text: The doorman was welcoming, as were Mark and Francine at the front desk who were also cordial and helpful. The room was clean and spacious. Emani was a gracious host at breakfast at Murals. Ronda was a timely and plesant waiter, as was the workers around her - the food was very fine. Grace at dinner was a gracious host and waiter and knew her wines. The Asian fusion food was very good. Randolfs is a lovely bar nice customers and the bartender was pleasent and timely though she was busy. The staff at The Warwick are all professional, cordial and well trained. The cleaning person was very accomdating, which was helpful. The location is great, near MOMA and Central park.

title: Enjoy the terrace!  Don’t use the rollaways!
text: Enjoyed nicely remodeled room with a terrace.  It was nice to have outdoor space!  I wasn’t expecting a friend to come along when I booked so I slept on a very old rollaway with springs sticking in my back.

title: Perfect location & 1930s glam!
text:
First trip to NYC and we wanted to be in the middle of it all. We got a terrace room with the most amazing views! The location was perfect. The front desk was incredible. Walking distance to Theater District, Times Square, the Met, literally across the street from the MOMA and a block from Radio City and Rockefeller Plaza, and, of course, the NYC subways (which prived incredibly easy to navigate!)
The fact that this hotel has history drew us to it and I'm so glad we chose it over modern chains. Reviews complaining about the elevators should not dissuade anyone from staying here. It felt 1930s glamour. This was completely worth the splurge for the terrace room.

title: A Gem in Midtown
text: We returned to our favorite hotel in mid-town for another special family occasion - had another outstanding stay at the Warwick - rooms were comfortable and clean - front desk staff were friendly and helpful - We especially enjoyed our time in Randolph's, their in-house bar/restaurant - food and drinks were excellent - what really stood out to us and separates them from all the rest was the quality of service by their staff - our server was by far the best we've ever had - professional, friendly and helpful in every way - We will return to the Warwick for special couple and family occasions, again and again....highly recommended

title: Great Location.
text: Great location bt Central Park and Times Square. Very polite and helpful staff. Nice rooms, small but appropriate size for New York. Is an old building but well taken care of. The lobby bar did not open until 5pm. The restaurant was open in the evenings. It was open in the morning the day I left but did not seem to be for breakfast or lunch I. The holiday weekend. Join the free membership group to receive a better room rate.

title: Nice Location, Good Stay
