text: The reception staff was pleasant and efficient.  Our room was spacious, 815, but it had the smallest bathroom.  There are nice views of 6th Avenue.  The elevators are the slowest in Manhattan.  Randolph' s Bar has a warm welcoming atmosphere and nice decor.  Sammy and Jessica are both friendly and professional bartenders.

title: bad changes
text:
We stayed many times at the Warwick, but after covid management has made some terrible decisions; 
- there is no buffet-style breakfast anymore. Now you need to choose for a la carte and most of the choices are egg dishes. Normally we have breakfast every day in the restaurant, but last December we only went once. I think the restaurant is not owned by the hotel but they could talk to the restaurant and change it back to buffet style. I talked to a lot of people that were dissapointed.
- bar is now open only from 5 pm untill 11 pm.
- bar is not serving food anymore. Normally we would end our day every day in the bar and have a drink and a bite over there. Now it is not possible anymore. On the day we arrived from the Netherlands it was already 9pm and we would like to eat something. Nothing was possible. Then we had to go outside (it was freezing) and take a hotdog. They warned us to take the food inside the bar. Also a lot of people that entered the bar and left  after they discovered that there was no foodservice anymore.
- there is no roomservice for food anymore. you can only order at the restaurant but than have to go to the restaurant topic it up by yourself.
-roll away beds are terrible (thin mattress and way to short). asked for another matress or bed but no respons after 3 times.
-wifi is not working properly. no one could solve it.

I did sent the general manager an email but he is not even responding.

This was our favorite hotel in New York.

title: Perfectly Positioned
text:
We stayed here for Christmas 2022 as a family of 6 adults.
Hotel is in the perfect spot, easy walking or subway to all of New Yorks attractions.
Hotel itself is a little dated but clean and comfortable.
Staff weren’t the friendliest, maybe understaffed??
Overall I’d recommend the Warwick😉

title: A éviter si vous recherchez une qualité de service!
text:
Hôtel qui a connu son époque de gloire mais ne répond plus du tout aux normes de confort actuelles pour un quatre étoiles.
Accueil déplorable. Personne pour vous aider à transporter les bagages quand vous descendez du taxi (on est soit-disant dans un quatre étoiles). Réceptionniste qui ne connaît pas le sens de l'hospitalité. Pas un sourire et très directif. Le seule réceptionniste agréable est Jahmel.Chambre donnant vue sur un mur!!!! Pas une bouteille d'eau dans la chambre. Minibar vide. Impossibilité d'ouvrir une fenêtre. Une minuscule brique de savon remplacée tous les trois jours (quand on le demande). Petit-déjeuner hors prix. Restaurant fermé certains jours de la semaine. 
Hôtel nécessitant une profonde rénovation. Mobilier vétuste. Décor minimal. Aucun journal à disposition. Lobby minuscule compte tenu du nombre chambres.
Je voyage énormément et j'ai parcouru 96 pays sur la planète. J'ai toujours séjourné dans des hôtels de grande qualité. Franchement, celui-ci je le déconseille. Il ne mérite pas d'être classifié quatre étoiles. Les Européens sont habitués à recevoir une meilleure qualité de service. Les avis publiés sur Tripadvisor sont rédigés en grande majorité par des Américains.... qui ne sont pas habitués à cette qualité de service que l'on connaît en Europe et surtout en Asie. Unilinguisme du personnel notamment de réception.
Le seul point positif est sa situation centrale.
D'autres hôtels à New York de la même catégorie offrent de bien meilleurs services. On sent que cet hôtel souffre et fait des économies de bout de chandelle.

title: Expensive disappointment
text:
The advertising suggests a bright, modern hotel with spacious rooms and up to date facilities. 

While the hotel is well located, the reality is that whatever might have been, the Warwick is past its prime.  The lobby is small and perennially crowded, there is nowhere to sit & relax during the day (the bar and lounge does not open until 5 pm and the quality of the restaurant is average.  The number of elevators is insufficient for a hotel of its size, and they are far too small.  I am not claustrophobic, but I came very close to a panic attack on several occasions as people piled into the tiny lifts (no doubt having waited for what felt like an age).  

The room itself was large enough, although it would appear I received an upgrade over my friends who arrived afterwards and stayed immediately above (they complained about a distinct lack of space around the bed).  Two unusual features were an empty minibar fridge, and the ability to experience an aircraft taking off in your room several times a night as the air-conditioning turned on and off.  The bathroom was tiny- insufficient room to even get dressed and the saddest excuse for a ‘bath’ I’ve ever seen (it *might*, at a pinch, have accommodated a baby hobbit).  

To cap it all off, they have the hide to charge a ‘facility fee’.  Just include it in the cost of the room, guys. 

The Warwick may well have been a glamorous midtown haven once, and it is cheaper than other leading hotels in the area, but find better ways to spend your money,

title: My forever NYC home!
text: I've waited too long to let Tripadvisor readers know how much I love this hotel and its staff, who have become part of my extended family. Through the years, I've been staying at least once a year at the Warwick NY. No words could ever describe the welcoming, professional and courteous staff. Rooms are traditionally in their decor but highly comfortable. The suites are enormous...so worth the extra money. The location is the BEST. On top of everything, Randolph's is one of the best bars in NYC. I could go on forever talking about Warwick NY. Thank you for being my NYC home away from home!

title: Not what it used to be. Misleading Website. Rude Front Desk.
text: I booked a hotel reservation for me and my girlfriend for a week in New York City at the Warwick hotel, a place that I have been coming to with my family for over a decade. When we showed up, we were told that we could not register because we were not 21 years old, we are 19. When I made the reservation online, there was nothing that prevented me based on my age from completing the reservation and I was never asked my age in order to complete the reservation. The front desk was incredibly rude and unhelpful, and essentially left us stranded in New York City. When I called back and spoke to someone in reservations, they were not even aware of this age policy, and it took them almost 10 minutes to find it in fine print after clicking several screens on the website. We have noticed that since the pandemic, the customer service in this hotel has been deteriorating, and we will certainly never stay here again nor will anyone in my family.

title: The Best of New York City
text:
Hotel Warwick epitomizes the best of New York City. It's a traditional historic hotel with fantastic staff, perfect location, and comfortable, beautifully
decorated rooms.

Staff are friendly, courteous, sincere, helpful but not obsequious. Garrett Corcoran, manager, was in the lobby every morning, chatting with guests. Doorman Adam must be NYC's greatest in that role. Calm, welcoming, gracious, funny, he turned our group of stressful frazzled travelers (having just braved NYC traffic) into smiling, happy guests. All the doormen usher guests through the  heavy revolving doors--one joked that he had great biceps! Jesus took our bags to the room and had us laughing and smiling even more. Daniel registered us, and filled us in on a bit of hotel history . Mark upon discharge, patiently explained all charges . Angela, in-house reservationist, helped before and during our stay. Housekeeper Situ, the engineer, the concierge, all added to this wonderful experience. Thank you!

I love this hotel’s location!! Perfdd red   in every way!
Practical info: Ernest Klein's gourmet grocery store/deli is around the corner (2 minute walk ) at 6th Ave & 55th St. Hotel guests (show your key) receive a 10% discount. My favorite place for morning pastries and good takeout sandwiches /salads is nearby Pret a Manger.

The room looks exactly like the website photos, but larger than expected. Bathroom has Gilchrist & Soames toiletries in  refillable bottles, as well as travel -sized. Unlike some hotels post-covid, there's  daily housekeeping. Lovely touches include the light switch at the door, reading "Welcome" and "Goodbye" and the brass door knocker.

Standard rooms don't have mini-fridges, but you can request one, for a one-time price of $20 for your stay

The lobby bar has an old fashioned NYC warm/cozy vibe. Take the staircase from first to second floor lobby, with photos of celebrity residents lining the walls. Throughout the hotel are framed pictures/posters in hallways, describing the Warwick's history.

Two things that would make the hotel even better, imho. In-room coffee is excellent Starbucks Verona blend. But instead of small containers of real half & half cream, generic powdered creamer is provided. Please consider a change. Also, there are no microwave ovens in rooms. Perhaps have the option of borrowing one, as with the mini-refrigerators. 

I visit New York City twice/yr, and no longer will wonder which accommodation to choose. See you next time, Hotel Warwick!

title: Unfortunately disappointed with the room
text:
Spent 7 nights in the Warwick Hotel
Booked through a travel agent 11 months previous. Large room, staff very nice hotel spotless and warm.
There was no view worth talking about but that wasn't a big deal really however it was dark 24 hrs a day. The hotel said the travel agent should have told us we had no view I explained the view wasn't my concern it was the darkness as you wouldn't have known whether it was night or day until you went outside. Also there was no tea only coffee in the room and only 2 cups per day in a paper cup tho understandable after covid. Just a small piece of info if your thinking of booking the Warwick. Enjoy New York.

title: An exceptional experience at the Warwick!
text: When we arrived the doorman and the front desk could not have been more pleasant. Upon check in, they offered to upgrade us to a suite (I think they were running low on double rooms) for no extra charge. When we got to the Hollywood Suite, we were absolutely blown away! It was gorgeous, had two bathrooms, a living room with a fireplace, a wraparound deck outside with outstanding views of the NYC skyline. The bedroom was huge and the bed and linens so comfortable. The whole suite was immaculate as well.  It was just such an amazing experience and we truly didn't want to leave. This is going to be our "go-to" NYC hotel from here on in.

title: Family of 4, First Time NYC
text:
Really a 4.5.  It is "NOSTALGIC".  You may find a nice chain or a fancier hotel but not for the value of the Warwick and perfect location, especially if want to go to Rockefeller Center and also be close to but not in Times Square.

The only real drawback is you have to request a fridge for your room if want cold drinks (and the fridges are a little old) and the elevators are a little slow.  But the place is classy!

As a family we like to experience different places, but we will definitely stay here again when we go back to NYC.

title: Love Warwick NYC!
text: Second time we've stayed at this beautiful old gem of a hotel and may be the only place we'll ever stay when visiting NYC.  The location is ideal for us, safe and close to everything including Central Park, the subway station, even a cute little (expensive!) grocery.  A nice easy stroll to Times Square. The rooms are spacious and sparkling clean.   Bathroom is small with no place to put anything except back of toilet. We had a problem with an outlet and the makeup mirror light not working and our sweet and efficient housekeeper had it repaired by the time we returned later that day.  The staff is friendly but professional and attentive.  The bed, pillows and linens are very comfy. View was nice enough. Only one complaint is I left my ID at the front desk upon check in and nobody called to let me know even though the room was in my name and I am a loyalty member.  When I realized it a couple days later, I called down and sure enough, they had it.  They could've saved me a lot of anxiety by calling me first!  Never used the restaurant or bar but peeked in and both are very nice.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Lovely hotel, staff really polite and professional. Really clean and comfy, definitely recommend this hotel. In walking distance for Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller centre etc. Room was air conditioned and worked really well as it was pretty warm while we were there.

title: Return guests
text: This is a beautiful property with spacious rooms on a quiet street with close access to everything.  Central Park is an easy 10 minute walk.  We’ve stayed here twice and will definitely be staying here in the future.

title: Very nice stay
text: I approached this with trepidation because of some (unwarranted) negative reviews. The Warwick is a solid place to stay. Here's what I saw: Yes, the place is a little worn, but what do you expect from a building approaching 100 years old? The impatient drive themselves crazy because the very (and I mean very) small elevators make it hard to accommodate more than 4-5 people comfortably without luggage and more than 2-3 with. I saw people huff and puff at the indignity of having to (gasp) wait for the next elevator. The rooms are spacious by NYC standards. The pillows are soft and the beds very firm, so know that if you prefer a softer surface. The staff was a pleasure. They quickly accommodated a room change since my 31st-floor room was over a humming heating and air vent that I could easily hear. I had a pleasant stay in a clean room blocks from Radio City Music Hall and Rockefeller Center and a short walk to Times Square. I'd stay here again in a minute.

title: Great situation, good sized accommodation
text: Lucky enough to have a suite on the 33rd floor.  So much quieter than anticipated for an hotel in Central New York.  Very comfortable.  Great situation - easy walking distance to Central Park, close to buses and Metro.  Just around the corner from MOMA and an easy bus ride to the Metropolitan Museum, the Guggenheim and the Metropolitan Opera.  If I return to New York would definitely stay there again.

title: Dirty
text: On arrival the hotel looks pleasant if a little old fashioned. The lift, corridors and our room are tired and could do with being redecorated. When we got to our room late in the evening after a long journey, we could see that the room wasn't very clean. There were specs of dirt on the carpet and hairs on the towels, stuck to the shampoo bottle and the soap. We slept in the room because we were so exhausted from travelling but informed the night manager of our concerns the next morning and she assured us that the issues would be rectified. Later in the day after housekeeping had attended the room, the towels were replaced but the hairy soap remained and the carpet was still dirty. The issue was raised again with the very pleasant reception staff and still nothing was done so the hairy soap remains...

title: Absolutely Exceeded Every Expectation
text:
My husband and I spent my birthday plus a couple of extra days in NYC this year and stayed at the Warwick for the first time.  WOW!  This gracious hotel, situated in the center of Midtown is indeed a gem.  The room was good sized, situated on the 22nd floor with a lovely ambiance.  The downstairs bar is delightful and the pours are generous.  Although we only had time for breakfast in the Mural Room, it is lovely and the dinner menu made me wish we had time to sample it.

All this being said, the most extraordinary experience of note is the service.  Every single interaction was pleasant, welcoming and delightful.  From the moment we checked in (and the reception desk was well staffed) to the moment we checked out, we were treated like old friends.  Always greeted in the hallways by service staff, who inquired if we were comfortable and enjoying our stay.  Always receiving a smile and greeting from each and every member of the hotel team.

Old friends we will become.  The Warwick Hotel is our new home when visiting NYC, and we cannot envision a more comfortable or charming one.

title: Nice hotel in a good location
text: The hotel is well maintained.  My room was quiet. But the HVAC fan was noisy and I could not adjust the pre set temperatures.  The room was large by NYC standards.  The staff was competent and friendly.  They charge your room $100 per room per night for incidentals, although the charge is reversed at checkout.  I thought the price was high for what the hotel was, but that's true all over NYC now.  It is close to Central Park, Rockefeller Center and a short walk to Times Square and the Theater district.  Next time, I'll find a cheaper hotel

title: An ok hotel that maybe used to be nicer but now kind of run down. Bath was not clean and the shower only had cold water
text: Hotel probably used to be nicer but now is kind of run down. I liked the restaurant. Bath was dirty and also the shower only had cold water. So, not so great. Also it was pretty expensive for what I got. I wouldn’t totally write it off for future trips but am looking for a better and nicer deal.

title: DECEPTION
text:
Désuet, un peu "château-branlant", le Warwick essaye de survivre au "Post-Covid" avec de grandes difficulités. Sa situation est idéale, Midtown Manhattan, à deux pas du Moma, beau bâtiment d'une architecture historique remarquable (que l'on peut apprécier au mieux des chambres "avec vue" comme celles du 23e étage qui sont pourvues pour certaines d'une terrasse, ce qui est enchanteur... mais...

Aucun service en chambre (pas même un petit déjeuner que l'on rêverait de prendre sur la terrasse), une architecture intérieure surannée (salle de bains de 4m² dans une Junior Suite, mobilier hors d'âge et un ensemble très très poussiéreux (à tous les sens du terme). L'accueil est agréable mais le lobby minuscule est bondé de clients en partance ou en arrrivée. Les ascenseurs sont surchargés et l'attente semble parfois longue...

Le restaurant est curieusement exotique mais absolument pas tentant, les petits déjeuners sont misérables, le bar n'ouvre qu'à 17h, et n'offre plus comme jadis, de petite restauration, qui était non seulement bien agréable (les Club Sandwiches) mais également bien pratique. Au total donc, déception, déception, déception...

title: Junior suite for a family
text: The midtown location of the Warwick is convenient for many NYC sites, although the hotel could use an update in its decor. The junior suite we stayed in had a bedroom with two comfortable queen beds and a living area that could accommodate a roll away. The bathroom was small, but we could spread out in the suite so it wasn't a problem. The bed linens were pressed, although the overall quality of the furnishings showed a lot of wear and tear. Friendly housekeeping staff.

title: The Warwick staff are GREAT
text:
We enjoyed our stay at the Warwick last Sunday evening.  We arrived around 9pm and Carlos the bellman greeted my wife and I and helped us with our luggage and parking our car.
We had a balcony and although the view isn't great the NYC experience was fun.  Have an in room Starbucks coffee in the morning, and enjoy the buzz. 
We checked out Monday morning but the hotel allowed us to leave our suitcases in a secure location so that we could tour parts of this great city.
Warwick is located 2 blocks from Central Park (go there it's beautiful), and very close to 5th avenue, Madison avenue, Broadway, and Times Square.

title: Still my favorite hotel in NY.
text: Stayed here in November 2019, and again, on my first return to NY since the pandemic began, in October 2022. In 2019 I dubbed this my favorite hotel in NY and the epithet still stands. It's a historic hotel, which is a fancy way of saying the elevators are slow, but the bathrooms are marble and have separate hot and cold levers. The location is phenomenal. I found the room very comfy (with the exception of the stupid lit light switches, which coincidentally I complained about in my 2019 review as well.) A room for three people was surprisingly affordable.

title: Beautiful stay
text: I don't understand the bad reviews. We were in a premiere city view suite on the 28th floor and it was spectacular. I love older hotels. This is elegance that is fading away in NYC. I have no complaints. Customer service was amazing. Our car was parked no problem. A beautiful stay.

title: A Slice of History in a  Great Location
text: In seeking a good place to stay I wanted a great location and a good sized room. We were lucky enough to find both, in fact the room was huge. Our 6th Floor Avenue View Suite was our home for 5 nights; you really felt as though you were part of the City with great views all down 6th Avenue. The King Bed was comfy and the Lounge was a good retreat. The elegance has faded a little and the furnishings could use a makeover but the style and  the history won me over. Randolph’s Bar is a great spot to relax in an old school lounge.Service is nice and so are the cocktails, but beware that they do close early Front of house was friendly and efficient and the Concierge will look after your ride to the airport and even charge it to your room. I can’t wait for the chance to do it all again!

title: Exceptional Housekeeping
text:
Extremely positive experience staying at the Warwick this past weekend. Every staff person with whom we interacted was pleasant and attentive. Especially pleased with housekeeping. Room was spotless and made up each day. 
The hotel itself? The rooms are enormous by NYC standards and the beds are comfortable. Furniture is a bit worn, but that’s understandable given the hotel’s popularity. 
I’d definitely stay at the Warwick on a return trip.

title: Roaches in my room
text: Booked a corner unit suite avenue facing the avenue thinking I was going to enjoy a clean 4 star hotel during our stay in NYC….wrong! This hotel had German roaches (aka the bad kind that can travel back to your own home with you). I informed the front desk and showed him photos and he assured me that this was a water bug and that the property did not have roaches. After doing my research I found out that was a lie. I called the manager after I left who told me that for my inconvenience during my stay they will upgrade me to a better room if I choose to return. I informed him that I already paid over 2k for 4 nights in a suite that was roach infested. Why would I return there? Now I’m paranoid that these nasty bugs could have gotten in my suitcase and returned home with me. I def would not recommend staying in this hotel if you are a germaphobe or afraid of bugs like myself.

title: Historic charm in great location.
text: Our doorman, Carlos, was amazing! He welcomed us, got us settled in our room, and gave us some tips for the neighborhood, as it was our first time staying at the Warwick, but not the last! The building itself is beautiful and full of character. It's quite clean, with daily housekeeping services and attentive staff when we asked for extra towels / toiletries.  We were celebrating a birthday and an anniversary, so we were treated to a large room with a sitting area, with coffee maker and minifridge (upon request), full bath with tub,  and a large closet for our luggage and hanging clothes. The hotel is a great location - a few more blocks from Times Square than some hotels, but just what we wanted; as it's close to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, and 5th Ave shopping. They do have valet parking and a self park across the street, but it's actually cheaper to us valet as the hotel has an agreement with the parking garage. Parking is expensive, with no in and out privileges, but it's Manhattan - parking is expensive everywhere.   Overall a pleasant stay.

title: Great value and location
text:
This does not attempt to be a luxury hotel, what it does is provide a large and comfortable room and a  slice of New York history in a great location.  We had a terrace room (2107) which was fine and at an average of $400/night, it was excellent value for money (a standard room at the Hilton across the road was more). The fridge was out of action but there are ice machines on every other (even) floor. Room service was excellent, as was front desk and concierge. Soundproofing was good, the occasional bike and siren came through even on the 21st floor, but you get that anywhere in NYC. They provide an excellent limo service to JFK if you book the day before. We would happily stay here again, no question.

A few local tips: there is a liquor store on the same block on 55th, Astra on the corner of 6th and 55th does great breakfasts, and there is a good deli on the corner of 54th and Madison.

title: Excelente localização!
text: Um hotel muito bom em excelente localização. Proximo a restaurantes, metro, central parque. Limpo, organizado, preço justo. Elevadores estavam funcionando muito bem no periodo em que estive no hotel e eram extremamente rápidos. Equipe cortês. No checkin, procuraram nos acomodar tão logo houve disponibilidade de quartos, mesmo antes do horário da reserva.

title: Peggiorato
text:
Sono stato più volte in passato in questo hotel e sono ritornato anche quest'anno.

La struttura è decisamente peggiorata.

Le camere non sono adeguatamente manutenute.

Il personale, che mi pare quasi interamente cambiato, ha la professionalità per gestire un ostello.

Il manager, con cui purtroppo ho dovuto confrontarmi, è assolutamente refrattario alle esigenze degli ospiti.

Insomma, mi pare una struttura, prima ottima, ma ora in caduta libera.

title: Great room… but room for improvement
text: We stayed in a one-bedroom avenue suite. The room is very spacious and comfortable, with great views down 6th avenue. The location is also a plus if you’re staying in Midtown. But the hotel is a bit dated and has some infrastructure issues typical of hotels this age: slow and small elevators, showers with drastic changes in water temperature. The service also left a little to be desired — we stayed there for six nights and never got another bar of soap, just the one that was in the room when we checked in and that was used up in two days. No water bottles are given by the hotel, unlike others in the area. We also requested and received a late checkout, which we appreciated… but then got an annoyed call from reception an hour before the agreed upon time telling us to vacate the room (the late checkout was granted but wasn’t registered… after calling us, the reception agent checked with the manager).

title: Great stay and great customer service !
text: Joel took the time to call me about an air conditioning problem we’re encountered on our last stay in august of this year . He upgraded us to the Hollywood suite for this stay and we were blown away ! What a room ! What a terrace !! Thank you Joel for taking care of us ! We will be back!

title: EXCELLENT STAY AT THE WARWICK
text:
Our stay at The Warwick was excellent from start to finish! 

Before we visited, I had contacted the hotel with a few queries.  Every time I got an answer straight back.  Excellent customer service which made my expectations very high, but The Warwick certainly lived up to these and more! 

I had a query regarding concerns over having paid extra for a city view.  Other reviewers had complained that they did not receive this.  We got an amazing suite, and the view was amazing!  Our room was 1507.

When we arrived the door man was so helpful with our bags and guided us to reception.  I totally forgot to have change for a tip and for this we apologise.  We gave him a larger tip when leaving.  Check in was quick and smooth.  Our room was spotless and one pleasant surprise after another.  While we booked a premier suite, we were not expecting it to be as amazing or as large as it was.  Yes, we could complain about no mini bar or the odd bit of chipped paint, but we didn’t need a mini bar and it’s a frequently used hotel room so wear and tear is to be expected!  We had a more than sufficient mini fridge.  A kettle is available upon request and each room as a coffee machine.  Some may describe the rooms as old fashioned and dated.  I would describe them, as the hotel itself, as historic and classic.  Please never modernise!

Other useful things to note about the room was it had a walk-in wardrobe, iron and ironing board, a hairdryer, and several sockets.  I have seen a few reviews regarding lack of sockets. In our room we had a pull-out drawer in the desk with a multi socket with 4 or 5 sockets. 

When we headed out to explore, we could not believe how convenient the location was.  Central Park was less than 5 minutes away for example.  A lot of tourist attractions are close by as is the subway.  Taxis are also easy to get from the front door.

Our room was cleaned every day.  We stayed there for seven nights.  We always left the room clean and tidy in case it couldn’t be cleaned.  However, each day when we retuned it was cleaned and fresh.  This was greatly appreciated.

We did not eat in the hotel only because of the nature of our trip being so busy.  Bar a few pre booked meals out we ate on the go or got takeaway on the way back.  There are some excellent street vendors nearby and we did get breakfast from them a few times.  Excellent value for money and convenient.  We used Randolphs only once, again just because of our busy days and we do wish we had been able to use it more.  Such a lovely atmosphere and excellent service.  Maybe next time! 

There is a small supermarket (Ernest Klein) a few doors away which was so convenient.  Prices were not too bad although a lot of items had no price.  Hotel guests get a 10% discount when they present a room key.

One of the historic aspects of the hotel was the number of high-profile celebrities who stayed there in the past including The Beatles and Elvis.  There are photos displayed throughout the hotel.

There is probably a lot more I could say but our trip was excellent form start to finish and The Warwick contributed greatly to this.  Even after we returned we had an issue with our credit card.  the hotel had reserved the payment but we used a different card to pay.  Although they removed the reservation it stayed on our account.  The hotel provided evidence to forward to our bank so they would rewove it.

I cannot wait to visit The Warwick again!

Thank You!

title: Just…ew.
text: I don’t know where the other reviewers were staying, but this was not the clean and responsive hotel they were talking about. It was gross. There were red marks on the headboard, some red bodily fluid on the sheets, and a film of yuck on everything. When we called for replacement sheets they took forever and when the new sheets arrived they were threadbare with a hole. Not impressed and pretty disappointed. The alarm went off in the night twice, and a bunch of floors didn’t have water one morning. At least the location was good?

title: Disappointing
text:
Today our room was not cleaned at all. At around 2 pm after we got back from lunch , I called for towels and told guest services that our room wasn’t cleaned. At around 4 pm before we left the hotel I stopped at the front desk and asked for our room to be cleaned. He said he will check why it wasn’t cleaned and will make sure it gets cleaned. 
By 10 pm we got back to our room and our room still wasn’t cleaned.  
I had stayed here before, several times this time the service is lacking.
I’m very disappointed with our stay this time. I will not recommend nor stay at this hotel again.

title: Excellent stay at the Warwick New York
text: I chose the Warwick New York partly because of its location and partly because of its nostalgic qualities. Usually, when a hotel is described as "classic" or something similar, what you really get is old and worn-down. That is not the experience we had at the Warwick. We had a large (yes, in New York City) and comfortable room which was perfect for two people. The hotel was solidly booked, so we got very lucky in having a room which faced a corner so we could see 54th Street and 6th Avenue from the 18th floor. Some of our windows did face the building and other rooms, but we hardly noticed when we had such a good view of the streets. The only minor complaint is that the room wasn't stocked with anything: there was no water available and the mini-fridge was completely empty. We didn't request anything, but I would have expected the option for free and/or paid items like sodas, alcohol, and snacks. The hotel location can't be beat: you can walk or take public transportation to anything in the city from this central location. Central Park was just blocks away. Overall, we had a great experience, and I would highly recommend the Warwick!

title: Great Quality for the Value
text:
We stayed in Manhattan for 2 days before leaving on a cruise.  We chose the hotel after comparing price and reviews of the hotels in the area we wanted to stay.  I am a compulsive planner and continue to read the reviews of the hotel prior to my stay to ensure there are no surprises when I arrive.  There was a review where someone complained about the daily service charge, which I expected because most hotels do that nowadays.  The manager responded to the review and said the hotel waives the charge if you join the loyalty program (for free).  I immediately signed up for the Journeys reward program and also saw that members receive the best rate available.  I did a mock booking and discovered a rate way better than we had originally received.  I cancelled the original reservation and did a new one through the rewards program.  All-in-all, we paid about $200 less for our 2-night reservation due to the rewards program.  

We arrived at the hotel after flying across the country on a red-eye.  Adam greeted us at the car and helped bring our luggage inside.  It was too early to check in so we left our luggage with bell services.  Adam them gave us the lay of the land and helped us know the easiest way to get to all the major landmarks.  Adam is an excellent ambassador for the hotel.  The next night he told us which pizza was the best in town (Angelo’s), and he was right!  

The elevators in the hotel were tiny, but fast.  If they appear too full, just wait for the next one which would show up fast.  Ladies, watch your step into the elevator if you are wearing heals.  There is a good-sized gap between the floor and the elevator.  

We did not eat on-site, but did enjoy drinks at the bar after a long-day of sightseeing in lower Manhattan.  Diana the bartender was sweet and we had fun conversations with her and other patrons.  The drinks were great.

We stayed in a king-bed city-view room on the 20th floor.  The room was decent sized, and my biggest complaint was lack of a mirror inside the room.  The only mirror was located above the sink in the tiny, but functional bathroom.  We didn’t mind the size of the bathroom as it helped prepare us for our cruise cabin.  The water pressure wasn’t the greatest, but as a woman with long, thick hair, I was happy that the water quality helped easily rinse the shampoo and conditioner from my hair.  The provided toiletries were wonderful and I never needed to pull out the toiletries that I packed.  

The walls of the room were pretty thin and we could easily hear people in the hall and the adjoining room.  The doors are very loud and can be annoying if you are a light sleeper.

All-in-all, I strongly recommend this hotel.  It is good quality for the price which is much less than the other hotels in the area.  We will stay here again if we are ever come back to the area.

title: Disappointing, would not recommend.
text:
We booked this hotel with high expectations, given the generally favourable reviews that we found online ahead of our visit. Sadly, we were left wanting. The hotel itself is fine and the location is good, easily within walking distance to most major NYC attractions. We had the basic ‘premier’ king room (the ‘premier’ could easily be left out of the description), which provides a good sized bed in a slightly dated room with a small bathroom in need of a refresh. The view from the window is simply of an opposing brick wall. 

The two-star rating comes as a result of a disappointing check-out experience. Upon departure, we were presented with a $92 ‘facilities fee’ bill which apparently included use of the wifi, gym, etc. The only ‘facility’ that we actually took advantage of was the wifi. We were advised that this fee is charged to all customers indiscriminately and, when I protested that this was never mentioned in the confirmation, pre-arrival call to the hotel to check that everything was paid, and at check-in when we were told that they only needed our card details for ‘incidentals’, I was told that there is ‘nothing they could do’. And that was that. The receptionist walked away from me and discreetly (not) fist-bumped his colleague as though to say that they had gotten the better of us.

If we hadn’t had the experience on check-out that we did, I would probably have awarded the hotel the three stars that it actually deserves.

title: Not a good experience
text:
We stayed three nights in the hotel and I can tell you that it doesn’t have much to offer but its location.
After booking online for over $300/night, we were given a room with a view on… a wall. Very few amenities in the room, not even a bottle of water. 
Without any previous notice, they charged us for an extra fee of $92 at the end for the “hotel facilities”. Apparently, it covers “standard wifi” (really? In 2022???) and some fitness room we didn’t get a chance to visit.
Last but not least, the staff were quite rude when we asked details about this unexpected charge, telling us we would have been aware of it if we had booked through them directly.
Conclusion: find a nicer hotel. Even if the location is less central, you will get more for your money than this hotel.

title: Una buona soluzione
text: Abbiamo pernottato quattro notti. Siamo stati bene, le camere erano ampie, la posizione è stupenda. L’hotel ha un suo fascino. Molte attrazioni sono facilmente raggiungibili a piedi, e comunque ci sono sempre i taxi dall’altra parte della strada.

title: Affirdable room in great location
text:
Warwick is an old hotel with classic charm. We got a good rate staying in their basic room, premier king. It is budget friendly in a good location, closest subway stations are F, N, Q, R and W. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but there are lots if breskfast option nearby. The drawback is room could be brighter and lack of electrical outlets. We were able to use the bathroom outlet and 2 more outlets not near the nightstand.
Room was clean and spacious for 2 people. With the rate i paid it was a good deal. It helps signing up for their journey membership.

title: Ottima posizione, prezzi competitivi ma  struttura un po’ datata e servizi limitati
text:
Siamo stati in questo hotel con i nostri bambini in una camera con due letti matrimoniali, affaccio su un muro, quindi niente vista (dovreste fare una richiesta specifica). La camera e la struttura in generale un po’ vecchia con uno stile classico americano. Non proprio uno standard da 4 stelle, frigobar  in camera non funzionante. Per avere un frigo in camera chiedono 20$ extra. Ascensori insufficienti nelle ore di punta, che richiedono lunghe attese.
Il ristorante dell’albergo non ci è sembrato interessante. C’è un negozio di alimentari vicino nella 6ave che può essere comodo e ha una convenzione con l’hotel con uno sconto del 10%.

La posizione dell’hotel è strategica, nella stessa strada del MOMA a due passi da Central Park e il prezzo che abbiamo pagato è competitivo rispetto all’offerta di NY, che è diventata carissima per tutto.

title: Tired hotel, not fit for a business stay
text:
I'll preface this by acknowledging that much of the hospitality industry is struggling post-Covid, and therefore understand that service is suffering / corners have to be cut.  That said, the Warwick has cut so many corners that it is not viable as a place to stay on a business trip.  No room service (which isn't mentioned anywhere until you try to order it), the minibar is switched off, not even water available in the rooms.  I went out to get a takeaway (wasting a lot of time when I needed to be working) and wasn't even allowed a proper plate and cutlery from the restaurant to take up to my room.

In addition the room is tired, with really noisy air con and shabby outdated furniture.  But this would be fine if the service was good.

Overall, wildly overpriced for what it is.  Will not be coming to stay here again.

title: Wonderful historic hotel
text: We stayed 3 nights in a spacious suite with large bathroom including full bathtub. Living area was very roomy with a couch, tv and dining table. Beds were very comfortable and the room was nice and quiet which made sleeping in the city do-able. Very friendly staff and good cleaning crew. Would definitely stay here again.

title: old school NY without breaking the bank
text: Location and the Room with terrace was exactly what we wanted.  The staff very freindly and accomodating.   Dont overlook Murels if you want a nice dinner without spending a fortune or sitting packed in like sardines.  Was very enjoyable.   Is it the St. Regis or Plaza?  No but for what you pay, the hotel is well run and evokes an elegant and classic NYC experience.   We are already planning  our next escape to Warwick Hotel.  Terrace room for Breakfast worth every penny.

title: Great, character hotel
text:
Charming 'older style' character hotel with a nice feeling about it. 
Great location for all the sights of NYC. 
Bed very comfortable and aircon kept us cool at night. A/C units a little noisy but didn't compromise sleep. 
We were surprised to receive a $29 per night tax bill upon our departure, but this is a complaint about the City rather than the hotel as this is apparently across the board. 
Overall, great hotel and would return in a heartbeat.

title: Old hotel with a soul
text: A better location can hardly be found in NYC! Staf is friendly and professional, we felt very welcome. The rooms may be a little worn out, but the hotel’s atmosphere is great, you can feel the history!

title: Comfortable and Clean
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights in the Hollywood Suite. Our suite was on the corner with a balcony. The views were brilliant. Table and chairs also on the balcony. Only wish we had more time to use the balcony.
Plenty of room in each of the rooms. A fridge was also in the suite. Bed was comfortable and clean, as were the  bathrooms. Would certainly stay here again.

title: Very Good Hotel
text:
We spent four very comfortable nights in The Warwick in the first week of May this year.  Thankfully the hotel was comfortable because the weather in NYC for those four days was miserable - rain, wind, wet and cold.  Our suite was on the 10th floor with bedroom, en-suite bathroom, sitting room/living room and a little kitchen area in the corner. We had lots of space, considering the fact that many NYC hotel rooms can be very small. Storage was ok too. The bed was enormous and extremely comfortable.  Our suite was in the centre of the hotel with the backs of other buildings outside the windows.  The constant hum of air con/heating machinery outside isn’t something that we’re familiar with but you get used to it after a day.  We had a problem with ours one night and hotel maintenance fixed it immediately.  
We could walk everywhere - Times Square, the Port Authority Terminus, Central Park, a Broadway theatre on 44th St and a Janis Ian concert up on West 64th Street etc. etc.  When it rained (which was often), we took Ubers.
Around the corner, 50 metres away, we used the ASTRO Diner for breakfast every day.
All in all a great hotel, in a great location and we’re decided that we’re going to stay there again in the future.
I’m only giving four stars out of five (four and a half if I could) because to get five, something has to be over and above, really, truly exceptional.  The Warwick comes close.

title: Would stay again!
text: If you are looking for a centrally located, Midtown Hotel be sure to check this one out! Considering we did not spend much time in our room, we were not looking for something over the top. This was exactly what we needed… Friendly staff, well appointed room and great location.

title: Old school hotel
text: Nice old school hotel. The standard room was decent sized for New York.  Staff was friendly and no issues. It is a 5 minute walk from the MoMA. Times square and Broadway is only a 20 minute walk . Not the most modern hotel, but the old school vibe worked for me. I would return.

title: Empatia e gentilezza…queste sconosciute!
text:
Partiamo dalle cose positive.. camera ampia per gli standard di New York e posizionato in zona comoda.
Ho alloggiato per 8 notti alla suite 1720 e ogni giorno ne è successa una.. all’arrivo non funzionavano le luci, la camera non veniva riassettata nei tempi stabiliti, dimenticato più volte di rimettere il caffè, il bagnoschiuma o lo shampoo… ma la cosa in assoluto più sgradevole è il livello minimo di empatia alla reception… mai un sorriso, o il suggerire una soluzione o cercare di farti capire che erano a tua disposizione… niente.. sembrava gli stessi dando fastidio! Lo stesso manager ti risponde come ti facesse un favore!
Che poi un 4 stelle a Manhattan non abbia un servizio di trasferimento per l’aeroporto si fa fatica a capire ma che dicendotelo non ti propongono una soluzione alternativa è pazzesco!
Sono stato a New York almeno 15 volte e non era mai capitato!
Diciamo che vista l’offerta andrei da un’altra parte!

title: Free upgrade at a great location
text: We spent two nights here to begin a family spring break trip. We were surprised at checkin to find that our two bed, one bath room had been upgraded to the elegant Cary Grant Suite. The views of the city and amenities made the great location of the hotel even more of an experience for us all. The convenience of being between Broadway and Central Park was what drew us to the Warwick, but the fantastic treatment we received would ensure that we’d return.

title: The most wonderful time in Manhattan at the Warwick!
text: We had the most lovely stay at the Warwick.  The lobby greets you with elegance, and Francine provided exemplary service upon our arrival.  The location is wonderful - not too far to the theater district, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, and 5th Avenue shopping.  A beautiful place to call home during a trip to NYC!

title: 2nd time staying here
text:
booked the suite with a terrace and there was lots of room in it.
view from the terrace was great esp at night to see the buildings lit up.
close to most attractions ..great nights slepp in a very comfy bed. room was spotless and was promptly cleaned when we left to do tourist stuff.
i love this palce its a bit outdated but thats the charm i guess..cool hotel.

title: Disappointed
text:
Stained bedspread, bedside table missing a pull, no refrigerator or microwave.  Advertised minibar it's empty and turned off.  Desk chair has a coaster that fell out
 Floor lampshade is falling apart.  Advertised as a high quality hotel the only thing high is the price.

title: Blackout Room
text: As a Warwick Journeys member, I expected a room with at least some ambient light for the 2 nights we stayed in suite 603. Unfortunately, not to be, as evidenced by the attach photo taken at 11:30 AM. I repeat, 11:30 AM. It would’ve been nice to know in advance, especially for the nearly $1,000 we paid. Disappointing to say the least.

title: Perfect Location and Wonderful Hotel
text: The Warwick is a perfect location to stay in NYC.  It is easily walkable to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Broadway.  The rooms are very clean and updated.  The staff was amazing, as a first time visitor of NYC they assisted us with subway directions and even provided a subway map.  There are lots of good restaurants close by.    There is a wonderful small grocery store abut 1/2 block away called Kleins, I highly recommend them.  The next visit to NYC I will be staying at Warwick.

title: Deux séjours au top
text: Cet hôtel est parfait en tout, emplacement, sympathie des employés ,les lits sont très confortables et les chambres spacieuses, nous pensons y retourner lors de notre prochaine visite dans la grosse pomme, vraiment fabuleux.

title: Great Hotel at New York 🗽
text:
Excelente hotel ! 
Bien ubicando 
Cerca de la 5 Avenida, museo, Ópera, puedes ir caminando a todos lados. 
Súper recomendado !
No tienen servicio de room service, pero tienes muchos restaurantes cerca en la misma cuadra. Clásico y acogedor !!!

title: Will Return!
text: I have stayed at this hotel twice and have found the staff very friendly and helpful.  We had 2 rooms for our family and it was great to be on the same floor.   Rooms were clean and ready upon arrival.   Lounge has nice atmosphere and service was excellent.  Elevators are on the small side and sometimes you do have to wait.   We were on a low floor so it was just as easy to to walk down the stairs.  Hotel is close to central park, Times Square, and Rockefeller center without being directly in the middle of crowded areas.  We easily took the subway to a number of destinations. Parking is conveniently across the street.

title: Great Hotel and Location is perfect
text: Iconic Hotel situated in a great location close to Central Park, Broadway, Times Square etc. The staff and management were friendly, efficient and nothing was too much trouble. We stayed in a superior King with Terrace and the views over Central Park and 6th Avenue were amazing.the Bar was also very welcoming with a great selection of beers and wines. We are already planning out next trip back to NYC and are planning on stopping here again.

title: really tired
text: this hotel has lost any of its charm it may have once had. I stayed for three nights on business. the hotel is incredibly tired. there was a cockroach on the floor when i was checking in. I did not eat in the hotel but the rooms are incredibly basic. bathrooms are tiny and the bedding is not good. would not return or recommend.

title: Great stay fab location
text:
This hotel was in a great location , 5mins Rockefeller Center, 5 mins Central Park , and I would say 8/10min time square …
Lots of restaurants and hotdog stands outside…… 

Hospitality was very good standard and The Randolph bar was a great asset with good window views ….. 
The bar staff had great customer service , the only thing I would say is it should open earlier……

The rooms was huge and nicely decorated , the only downside was the bathroom it was tiny , like washing in the tiny bath shower was quite a job having to shave legs lol and I’m only short so don’t no what tall  people do 
Also the sink took the whole room up and the taps was under a shelf so you couldn’t work out what the cold or hot Tap was 

The only other thing I would say is the coffee machine was hard to work out had to ask and the coffee wasn’t good , so would be better to just have a kettle in room 
the mini bar I couldn’t open so couldn’t put cold water in  , and it would be nice to have a brighter light in room as dark when getting ready … 
But lovely big comfy bed 

Been New York 5 times now and I would say this hotel was a fab felt relaxed , comfy , a great location , and friendly staff , loved the bar 

Would recommend

title: Absolutely perfect
text: A fantastic hotel. Perfect location in upper manhattan, pristine clean, wide comfortable rooms and fabulous service. It has an excellent pub and restaurant as well. I have to say I forgot a scarf in the bar one night and the kept it for me! nothing to improve, really an amazing experience.

title: Misleading website, bad service!
text:
My daughter and I came to NYC yesterday to spend Memorial day weekend then business meeting from Tuesday onward. 
This is what we found about Warwick hotel: 
1. Their room is different than pictured on their website. 
2. We booked & paid for a room with the city view. They put us in a room view another brick wall. No city view! 
3. When complained to the guy at the front desk, he simply replied: “those are our rooms with City View. The non ‘City View’ rooms have a view of AC machines and cables.”
4. The fridge! OMG we couldn’t find the fridge door. The we realized they put the fridge door facing sideway to the desk separator (look at the photo attached) so how can anybody open the fridge door??? 
5. Our bath room is totally plain. No Hairdryer, No showercap. 

We travel all over the world and this is the worst hotel with a very bad service!

We witness ar least 2 people complaint to the front desk angry. The front people just do nothing!

title: NO PAGUEN POR ESTE HOTEL ES UN DESASTRE / LO PEOR DE NYC
text: Hotel disgusting / Servicio pésimo ! Es una vergüenza absoluta todo / cómo está mantenido, el nivel de hostilidad de los recepcionistas y los gerentes de recepción no tienen idea de lo que es un hotel ! NO VAYAN / Además carísimo no lo vale / Desayuno solo desde los días Miércoles / las habitaciones están súper viejas / y la limpieza malísima también / inseguro y sucio

title: Nice Hotel with Some Exceptions
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights in a suite, room 903. We were very happy that the room was ready as early as noon. It was spacious and nicely decorated with a large living room. The bath was small, but had the BEST showerhead we've ever experienced. The dining room & bar are closed Sunday, Monday & Tuesday, so we had to find a breakfast place. No big deal. The reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 was housekeeping & the front desk. I had to call down to housekeeping 3 times in 3 days because they kept giving us just 1 washcloth a day. Huh? There are 2 people! It never occurred to them to rectify the problem after the first time. Also, one of our remotes didn't work, we called about it, they came & got it and returned it unfixed, 
The front desk personnel just seemed disinterested & even dismissive. Not a friendly one in  the bunch. The positives were the room, the location and Adam who is one of the valets. He was very helpful & joyful doing his job.

title: Great Customer Service
text: I stay in this hotel every month for work. The staff is always very friendly and remembers me. They go out of their way to make the experience truly exceptional. Once checked in, I have always found my room to be extremely clean and appeasing.

title: Great location - Nice rooms
text:
Grand old building and great location --easy walk to Central Park and Theater -both of which we did. Room was spacious, beds comfortable. Safe area. Doorman friendly and helped us by going to street and flagging cabs 00 in the rain & for early flight. 
But...Requested early check in as arrived from West Coast on redeye. We arrived at hotel at approx 8:30 am. Ok -understand room wasn't ready --went for breakfast.
Came back at 1:00 pm -room still not ready! Went for a drink. At 3:15 pm ( check in is 3:00 pm) room still not ready. Totally unaccpetable at this point.
They did offer $50 off 1st night & free drink ( which we didn't get to use as bar was closed part of the time) SOme of this may be Covid related -but staff needs to work on this.
I would stay here again --as I loved the location & rooms big.

title: Wonderful!
text: Loved this place.  Location was excellent, our room and bathroom were beautiful, quiet, spotless and roomy, the linens were exquisite.  The staff was above and beyond friendly and helpful.  I would stay here again in a minute - in fact I already have reservations to return in the fall.  Grand old hotel in an excellent and safe part of the city.  For NYC, the price wasn't insane either. Doubt if I will stay anywhere else from here on out when I visit.

title: Nice room, no frills hotel
text:
Let's start with the good. An excellent location - right off 6th Ave, a few blocks from Central Park one way and Times Square the other. A grand old building. And a lovely big rooms (well, my Premier City View King was, anyway). The reception desk staff was polite, friendly and helpful  on check-in and check-out. And the roomrate (USD 185, room only) was pretty decent for NYC in late April.

But ... although the hotel advertises itself as a 4-star, it really presents more like a budget, no frills motel in terms of services (despite the undoubtedly grand rooms and buildings). The large room was somewhat dingy, tired and dated (though perfectly clean – just old and faded). There was absolutely *NOTHING* in terms of room amenities except for soap and shampoo – no water, no tea/coffee, an empty (and unplugged) mini-bar. Not even any glasses. Just a couple of dusty, disposable plastic cups. Both the doorman and the bellboy watched me as I manhandled my heavy case out of the taxi and into the building (and vice versa on the way out), without even a flicker of an offer of assistance. 

Yes, I’d go back. But with much lower expectations as to service and amenities. Rather, I would just look forward to a fairly decent room in a good location. Certainly not to the 4-star class of hotel style, comfort, service and facilities that I’d anticipated I'd get on this trip.

title: Horrific customer service
text:
Have been using this hotel for work since 2016 but never again. Front desk staff is extremely rude and somewhat scary in their aggressive behavior towards guests. They actually made me cry and refused to calm down. They got my bill wrong and when I asked to revise - which they did - they got aggressive and unfriendly to the point I was uncomfortable merely walking through the lobby or leaving my room open for cleaning. When I asked to speak to a manager they refused. I come to New York monthly for work as does my staff, we will not be back to this hotel.

Once somewhere loses its charm it’s easy to see flaws. Rooms are dated, coffee maker had those thin plastic cups water cups like you get at the dentist (ever put hot coffee in a plastic cup??) and only one coffee bag. No floor towel for shower, shower towels were threadbare. Bed had long hairs on it when I arrived, most of the appliances are not plugged in. Fridge was locked and unusable.

title: Great Hotel and Great Location
text: We (family of 3) stayed here for 10 nights on holiday. The room - a 2 room suite- was really good. Lots of space, lots of storage and comfy beds. We got a rollaway bed as a third bed which was much better than sofa beds we have experienced in other hotels. Staff were all very friendly.

title: We will be back!
text: Location is great. Close to subway, shopping, tourist sites all within walking distance. Room was good and suited a family of four. Our room had double beds and could have done with queen or king beds for us!  Shower was great as well!  Staff very accommodating.

title: Beautiful hotel, but poor communication
text:
We stayed at the Warwick for a short trip to NYC. The front desk staff was attentive, even though they were very busy. When we checked into our room, I noticed the fire alarm (not smoke alarm) had a low chime that I knew would keep me awake all night. I notified the front desk and they agreed to send someone to inspect. When we came back after dinner, the chime was still there. In speaking with the front desk again, the person(s) who inspected didn't notice it. This time they someone right away, and agreed they could hear the chime, but it was due to a system issue. We went to the front desk and they kindly changed my room. They were very respectful in this exchange, but I do wonder how long this room has had this issue. 
Our second room was great, but likely not used in a while due to missing coffee items and full set of towels. We notified the front desk and they sent someone (eventually) with towels. We were not in a rush since we realize the industry like many are struggling to keep full time employees, and the hotel is being updated.

My issue is what happened after our stay. I realized after we left the city (within 1 hour of check out), I forgot several items in a drawer in the room. I immediately called them but no one answered, so I emailed them from my phone with the details. A few days went by, I was still unable to get ahold of anyone and no one responded to my emails. Monica assisted and forwarded the email. A week later, still no response. Two weeks later I called again and the phone tree must have been updated and I finally was able to speak to someone who said I would be contacted in 48hrs. with a resolution. The phone number they gave me is the same one I've been calling.  While the person I spoke with was respectful and helpful I am disappointed the that in 2022 an email is unable to be answered in a timely manner. I am sure they would have found the items if I had been able to speak to someone the day I checked out or been contacted the next day. This was a beautiful hotel, perfect location, but I am very disappointed in the communication in regards to my items left behind. I am only posting her because others seem to get a response. It has now been 3 weeks since I checked out, and no resolution on my items left behind. 

Highly recommend this hotel for the experience, but not the communication.

title: False advertising re. view
text:
We booked a "Premier City View King" for two nights.  The website states that the room has a "city view overlooking 6th Avenue or 54th Street."  Shortly after we checked in I realized our room had a view of two walls of the hotel with a tiny bit of a building if we craned our necks to the right.  We went to the front desk thinking there was a mistake but they insisted they gave us a room with a street view.  I'm attaching a pic of the floor diagram and it is obvious that two rooms, the ones ending in 10 and 14, do not have a street view.  To charge the same as the other rooms that actually do have a street view is absurd.  So beware if you book this kind of room to see what they assign you when you check in. 
Otherwise, the room was quiet and bed was comfortable enough, no complaints there.

title: Dont be fooled by "street view" room rate.
text: There is a more expensive "street view" rate than "courtyard view." We chose the street view and paid for it. Among others, there are two rooms on every floor ending with "...14" or "...10" that they charge as "street view" yet clearly are not. See our "street view" photo. They would not give us the lower courtyard view rate regardless. Obvioulsy false advertising. Write this down: If you pay extra for "street view" at check-in do not accept a room ending in 14 or10.

title: Outdated but passable. Great Beds.
text: The room was a good size however outdated. The bathroom was very very small with no counter space, just a small ledge. Beware of the slippery floor in the shower, which does not have a safety bar to which you can hold onto. Staff could be more friendly, aside from the doormen who are great. The bar was closed on the Sunday and Monday, do not know why so we had to meet with friends elsewhere. Took a day to get a large clump of hair removed from the room! No access to the in room bar as it had to be positioned sideways, probably due to covid-19 restrictions.

title: Loved it
text: This hotel was amazing! The rooms were spacious (bigger than I was expecting), clean and very comfortable. The entire place had a warm and welcoming feeling complimented by friendly and helpful staff. The location is great. It is about a 10min walk to Times Square, very close to Central Park and one block away from the famous 5th Avenvue. I really enjoyed my stay and will hopefully be back in the future.

title: Exceptional Service and Wonderful Stay
text: We stayed at the Warwick twice in March. Both times we experienced exceptional service from the door to the desk to housekeeping.  It's a wonderful historic hotel with a great history. We stayed in a suite each time which is well worth having the extra room. We had one city view and one rear suite. The city lights are wonderful but the rear suites offer a lot of quiet so you can't go wrong either way. The rooms were very clean and the beds very comfortable.  Housekeeping even checked to make sure we had everything we needed. Looking forward to our next visit.

title: Total disappointment
text: Stayed at this property last week. Sent an email directly to the GM to explain my disappointment in the condition of the room. No reply. Not particularly surprised as this hotel seems to shuttle people in and out and not needing to care about the cleanliness of their rooms. Will NOT stay there again which is unfortunate as the location is great but that's just about it.

title: Location Is Good
text: I wanted a hotel that is within walking distance of Central Park and Times Square. This hotel is. The room was clean. I had an issue with one of my flights and called the hotel that I would be checking in later than expected. They put a note on my reservation. The staff is friendly. We stayed four nights here. I have two complaints about the hotel. 1. No washcloths were in the room when we arrived. I asked for wash cloths and we got them. I was in the lobby one day and heard other guests tell guest services that they needed more towels in their room. No idea why the towels aren't stocked fully. 2. No mini fridge. There was a mini-bar, but it was not set up so that you could use it. 3. No small store inside the hotel. This is the first hotel I have been to that did not have a small little store in it just in case you needed something.

title: Weekend at the Warwick
text: Had a SPLENDID stay at this elegant, historic hotel. The staff were all friendly, helpful and accommodating. We were made to feel incredibly welcome. Our room was spacious and surprisingly quiet. Would highly recommend drinks in Randolph's (the swanky bar located inside the hotel) and an evening meal in Mural 54 as well. The Warwick exudes an old-time glamour that makes a stay here all the more special. Last but certainly not least is the location: MoMA, Radio City, the theater district all within walking distance. Will definitely be back!

title: A++ HIGHLY RECOMMEND
text: We spent a long weekend at the Warwick Hotel and from the moment we walked into the place we were thoroughly impressed. The hotel is full of charming history and warm welcoming staff. Our room was spacious, comfortable and very clean. Randolph’s Bar is an iconic NYC gem. We saw a great jazz band on Sunday night at Murals 54 restaurant and the food was top notch. When we return to the city we will definitely chose to stay at the Warwick again!

title: Location. Not much else.
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights in March 2022. The main this this hotel has going for it is location. Other than that, there’s not a lot to praise. My room was a suite and was pretty dated but clean. When traveling I make a point of arising early and doing everything I can to make sure I’m tired when I retire. Even so, the nice-sized bed still reminded me that it has two foundations under it. I could feel that seam all night. The temperature controls did a good job maintaining temps in my room. The noise outside (6th floor) from construction, garbage pickup, and other city noise was significant. I would recommend that if noise bothers you at night to get a room away from 6th Ave. 

My only interaction with staff was at the front desk. Check in, once to replace a room key and once to ask about getting access to the gym. Each time I had to wait several minutes (even after ringing the bell) for someone to notice there was a guest requiring assistance at the front desk. 

The gym is a disappointment in just about all respects. Three treadmills, two ellipticals (the gazelle type) a stationary bike and a recumbent bike for cardio, and a limited number of dumbbells and a machine for strength. Two of the three treadmills did not work during my visit. Both cycles were also in bad need of service. I usually fill my water bottle in the gym. No luck here. No water fountain, cooler or other water source unless you fill up from the tap in the gym’s bathroom. No bottles of water available to guests, either. 

I visit NYC with some frequency and will probably find another classic NY hotel for my next stay.

title: spur of the Moment Booking ,Great  location , Excellent Hotel.
text:
We recently stay at The Warwick , didn't know anything about it , booked it because of it convenient location  to everything .
Great find ,  staff are very friendly , (when booking in popped in to the restaurant the hotel manage was kind enough to get us a table last minute, food was excellent they even had live Jazz. The   rooms are very comfortable and well  laid out . will definitely stay there again.

title: Wonderful hotel in mid-town. Excellent accommodating staff!
text:
Had the pleasure of staying at the Warwick Hotel recently. Great midtown location, on the corner of 7th Ave & 54th, but away from the noise &  bustle of Times Square and Broadway. Manager & Staff were very accommodating with our every need. 
Thoroughly enjoyed our meal at their restaurant "Mural’s on 54th'. Would definitely stay there again!

title: فندق في مكان حيوي
text:
فندق في مكان حيوي ، وجيد ، قديم بعض الشيء ، والخدمة ليست عاليه ، لكنه فندق جميل والاهتمام رائع بالاثاث القديم والشكل التاريخي 

الغرف واسعة ، ونظيفة ، المطاعم قليلة واختيارتها ليست واسعة ، كل شيء قريب منك

title: Too hot, bed not good, but great location
text: Pros: Great location, nice size room, great price. Cons: understaffed, worn furniture, hard beds, scratchy sheets, no control over heat. View is not really a view. I’m getting the room for a very, very good price so the old saying goes - you get what you pay for. The heat is blasting and there’s no way to turn it off. The window opens but won’t stay open. I propped a paper cup in it and was able to get it stay open half an inch. I called for assistance twice. No one ever came. There are no hand towels or wash clothes. Again, I called for them but no one ever brought any. I think they are understaffed.

title: Great hotel, great location!
text:
Just back from 5 night stay in the Warwick. Not my first time in the hotel, and it never dissappoints. 

Location - great location on W54 street & 6th avenue. Walking distance to 5th avenue shops/theatre district/time square. Really well serviced with both bus & subway stops. Perfect midtown location for exploring New York

Hotel - gorgeous building, love the old style elevators. The staff here are super friendly and helpful, in particular the doormen. Rooms are really comfortable and spacious (particularly by New York hotel standards!).  There is a restaurant and bar in the hotel, but we didn't use them. For breakfast we went to the Astro diner, a really nice Greek diner 2 mins walk from the hotel. 

Highliy recommend, great value

title: A+++ for decor and location, D- for general hospitality
text:
I wanted to love this hotel. It was so charmingly decorated and located within walking distance to so much It made you feel like you stepped in the time of elegance. That is where it stopped. 
As elegant as a hotel this was, I had high expectations. First, the bathroom… it was ok but the toiletries were a mix match of brands. One brand for the hair care products, another for the soap and another for the lotion. It was like someone went to a hotel surplus store and purchased whatever was available. Minor. 
The bathroom light were so dim. It was worthless trying to get ready in there. Oh wait! There was a lighted magnifying mirror which was also useless since it placed ABOVE my head. I am 5’6”, lol!
For me, the icing on the cake, was the lack of basic conveniences such as bottled water. On our first full long day, I showered and got ready for the night. I went to get water from the mini-bar (as advertised on their website). There were no drinks and it was shut off! I called downstairs and inquired about vending machines and was told there none. I had to go to the bar to get a drink. I was exhausted and in my pajamas that was a no go! 

The next day (Sunday) we had been out all day and it was snowing pretty heavy. I told my to go get a water before heading back to the hotel but he insisted he would grab some at the bar. We entered the hotel wet and cold only to see the bar is closed on Sunday, wtf! I asked the desk if they are able to find some bottled water and it was suggested I go to the Halaal Guys ( in the f*%#<g snowstorm) 
How difficult would it be to provide water bottles for your guests! 
On our last night, Monday, we headed back early and my husband suggested we get drinks at the bar. He said the drink menu looked good. So with our bottled water in hand, 🙄, we ended our trip early to only find out the restaurant and bar are closed on Mondays as well. What a joke! 
******The other major issue was something bothersome. On Sunday, when it was snowing bad, I purchased a plastic Macys bag to carry my designer purse to keep from getting wet. We had bought $$$ jewelry and small souvenirs which I had placed in the bag. I had decided to wear most the jewelry but left a ring in the box. I had also put some cookies wrapped in a napkin and an empty bag. 
The next morning, I realized the bag was gone. I did flip out about the ring and realized I had it in my purse but the jewelry boxes, receipts, small souvenirs and everything else where gone. I am 99% sure they were thrown away but it was gut wrenching to think my jewelry was so close to being thrown out.  
Yes, they did ask security to look into but it was not going to solve anything. 
And my white comforter had pink stains.

title: Wonderful weekend
text: We stay at the Warwick whenever we need a NYC weekend for last 15 years —We stayed last weekend during snow storm and had a great time— Jahmal at front desk made us feel welcome and credited us $60 for minor problem during our stay —Hammel in Randolphs Bar is consistently friendly and makes us feel special constantly —obviously restaurants -activities and sights are walkable or short taxi ride away —covid cuts back on services like every hotel but was minor issue —we are looking for our next stay in the middle of NYC.

title: Repetiría.....según la zona de Nueva York que desee estar.
text: Hotel céntrico,para pasear,Central Park a 300 metros y los demás lugares para caminar y disfrutar,hotel cómodo,buen personal,muy profesionales,cama grande y cómodas imagen,quizás el único pero,es que las habitaciones de la zona par,la ventana da a una pared de ladrillo rojizo sin vistas y quizás sin luz solar,solución...descansar y salir temprano y regresar de noche....y las cortinas ni tocarlas..

title: Great location, poor service.
text: Fabulous location and an iconic building - sadly let down by indifferent service (other than housekeeping).  Stayed for seven nights and the only engagement from the front desk was on arrival and check out.  Absolutely nothing at all other times.  Front door and concierge staff were equally distant and basically unfriendly.  Ever been watched dragging your bags across reception by those paid to assist?  We had a suite which was a great size but in need of updating.  Hats off to the housekeepers though - always had a welcome and a smile.  The only smiles from Team Warwick.

title: A much-enjoyed stay in a piece of New York history.
text:
We stayed in the Follie Suite, a good choice it turned out on the 25th floor, for 11 days.  There is an ancient elegance about the room, and the hotel itself.  Position in Manhattan second to none, down the road from Paul McCartney, across the street from MoMa, short walk to Central Park.

Klein's deli, ATMs and the restaurants in 55th Street are all within a quick walk.

We got around the lack of wine glasses, cutlery and crockery in a suite with a dining table by our own devices. Not sure if their absence was due to Covid-19, or hotel policy but a little strange perhaps to have a dining room, but not the utensils with which to dine.

Generally, staff were excellent.  The manager personally attended to an issue with Murals Restaurant with a more than satisfactory outcome. Staff in Randolph's Bar know their stuff, and their clients. Cambria chardonnay produced on appearance. 

Overall, The Warwick lived up to expectations, and beyond, because of some of the negative reviews I had read, which made me a bit uncertain about our booking before we arrived.  While, yes, there were issues, loose door handles, a restaurant closed when it was supposed to be opened, coffee pods not always being replace, they were all dealt with excellently.  Overall a great stay.

title: Wonderful!!!!
text: Υπέροχο ξενοδοχείο ! Ιστορικό κτίριο με πολύ ωραία ανακαίνιση!!! Πολύ καλές υπηρεσίες! Καταπληκτικοοοοο εστιατόριο με υπέροχες γεύσεις και εξαιρετικά εξυπηρετικό και ευγενικό προσωπικό! Ευχαριστούμε για την υπέροχη διαμονή !!!!

title: Historic New York City hotel
text: This hotel has a lot of character, and preserves many of the charming, original features of the property. The room was spacious for a NYC hotel room, and the furnishings were lovely.  The lobby is small, but there are beautiful restaurant and bar areas.  Every staff member was extremely friendly, helpful, and courteous.  In the room itself, it was nearly impossible to regulate the temperature (we had the air conditioning on in late-December on the 26th floor and it never cooled off).  The location was incredible…just blocks from Times Square/Broadway shows, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, and literally across the street from the MoMA.

title: Great stay… don’t understand the negative reviews!
text:
We have just returned from our stay at the Warwick and we had a lovely 5 nights. The location of this hotel is superb. Close to Central Park/ Times Square and only 3-4 mins from the nearest subway station. 
We booked a Premier City room which was a corner room with two windows looking partly on to 6th Avenue. The room was very spacious for New York and very clean. The bed was big and comfy. There was plenty of storage space for clothes, a safe, great shower, coffee machine and big TV screen. The room was cleaned daily including replacing towels and toiletries where needed. After doing my research, I knew before I arrived, that this hotel is more traditional and was not going to be very modern -however, this was part of the attraction for us. 
We had an issue with electrics one evening but the engineer came up within 5 minutes to try and fix. Unfortunately it was not possible to fix and required a part so we were moved and upgraded to a suite facing 6th avenue!  This room was even bigger with a separate sofa and table area, walk in wardrobe and small kitchen area with a fridge. Fantastic- thank you :-) 
Check in/ out was very speedy and staff on the reception were always very friendly and polite. 
Other reviews complained about the lifts- we stayed at peak holiday season (5 days before Xmas) and we didn’t have to wait longer than 3-4 minutes for a lift the entire stay! Yes, they are quite small and dated, but no complaints from us! 
I can’t comment on the restaurant/ bar as we didn’t eat there.
