One recommendation for management- improve lighting in the rooms as it was quite low light and can be difficult to shave/ do make up. 
Thank you for a great stay! We will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

title: Simply Perfect
text: The Warwick Hotel was amazing. I stayed for my husband and I 3rd year anniversary and the experience was great. Loved how they have kept the original vintage look. The room was perfect and always clean when we came back. The location is super good. We walked to Time Square, Central Park, The Rockefeller. A lot of shops and restaurants close by as well, it is the perfect location. The subway is also near by if you wish to go some place further.

title: Nice visit but...
text: We stayed at the Warwick for 2 nights mid-week. What a great mid-town location! Check in was smooth. We asked to check in early (1:00) and room 510 was ready. The room was pretty spacious, very clean, and in good repair. The daily maid service was very good. Calling it a city view was a huge stretch, though. When we first got there I called and asked for towels and asked for a very dim bulb in the bathroom to be replaced. Both were done promptly. I liked the very firm bed, wifey not so much. The little coffee maker was fine. There were enough drawers and closet space to store all our stuff. It’s an older property, so there weren’t a lot of electrical outlets, but the desk had 3 extra plugs for our phones, etc. The light level from the lamps was low and there was no bright reading lamp. The light level in the bathroom was also low, so it was hard to put on makeup, shave, etc. The bathroom looked good, the shower worked well, and there was a nice magnifying mirror, but there weren’t any shelves or storage space. Well, okay, the floor. And no night light. We found out they don’t do wake up calls. I’ve never stayed in any other hotel that doesn’t offer that service. There was construction nearby and we could hear hammering and banging starting about 9:00 pm until about 1:00 am. Not the fault of the hotel, but if you’re a light sleeper it could be bothersome. Check out was smooth and quick. I don’t know that we’ll stay here again, there are a lot of other hotels in the area.

title: An excellent NYC midtown hotel
text:
Pros: Very friendly staff, quick elevators, good WiFi, very comfortable bed and pillows, strong shower, nicely-sized room, very quiet from outside street noise (23rd floor).

Cons: Dated room furnishings.

As you can see, the pros far outweigh the cons, and I plan on staying here again.

title: Rude staff
text: I booked a reservation here for my parents as a gift. Paying for it was a huge hassle, compounded by the curt/rude way in which staff handled my repeated phone calls to get the necessary information to merely pay for services. Hung up on multiple times, lectured for not knowing their policies in advance, and generally treated as if they could care less.

title: A hidden gem & worth the stay
text:
If you are looking for a hotel with all mod cons then this is not for you but if you are looking for a great place to stay within walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Empire State & Rockefeller Centre then consider this.

This is a historic hotel which has kept it character eg old lifts, shower curtain, classic bathroom tiles, etc.   The room we had was a Premier City View and whilst the view wasn’t quite the city view I was expecting, it turned out to be right for us, sheltered from the busy 6th Avenue.  

Hotel staff were very helpful, sadly due to COVID we didn’t get to experience the bar but did get to try out the restaurant.  The food and service excellent.  

I’m glad we we chose this venue and would consider it again.

title: Unresponsive to booking problem
text: I got charged a $1400 "no show" fee for a reservation i had cancelled. Can't get the manager to respond to my email AND I never even was told my card was charged! I only learned about it when I saw it deducted from my bank account. So do not use your bank card for a reservation -- use a credit card.

title: Choose another hotel
text:
They ran out of coffee for in room coffee pots!  They have no breakfast or room service available and there was no coffee available in the room or lobby.  They ran out; their order was "late".  They made no "plan B' for their guests.  There was no Large Coffee pot set up in the lobby from catering for ex.  No Coffee ordered in from a caterer.  Just "sorry" no coffee this week. 

Under staffed and poorly managed.

title: Not maintained
text:
Needs care- knobs falling off cabinets , bad plumbing, no coffee , poor service  , elevators that don’t work 
I’ve stayed here before and it hasn’t been maintained 
Historic and nice location 
Poor enforcement of covid regulations

title: Amazing and historical place to stay in NYC
text:
Absolutely beautiful, classy and amazing!!

Stayed here for the Thanksgiving holiday and our room was above the Macy’s parade route. 

This historical hotel is located on the corner of W 54th St and 6th Ave and is in the heart of midtown Manhattan. 

Now, you got to remember, this hotel was built in 1927 so while there are a lot of amazing architectural things to see, that also means three small elevators that take a while to get you where you’re going. Also some cold air by the windows and doors (if you have a balcony) that can be shielded by curtains. 

The staff is wonderful and there is Randolph’s Lounge and Murals on 54 Restaurant, who share entrances inside the Warwick lobby. 

The experience is worth all of it.

title: Older hotel, but still nice
text: Nice hotel, but obviously a bit older. Rooms had some obvious dings. We didn't have washcloths for some reason... Elevator was very slow and couldn't hold many guests at a time. So, that was probably the most annoying part of the stay. But overall I thought the rooms were pretty nice (just a little banged up), and the staff was very friendly.

title: The worst hotel ever
text: This was the most difficult hotel experience of my life! There are too many difficulties to list. But for the price of this hotel it is not worth it. Do not stay here if you do not want to deal with an exploded mini fridge, a broken heater, the wrong room key and gross smelling pillows.

title: Read the small print details on your room. Suites with no natural light and other issues.
text:
We booked a one-bedroom suite via our UK travel agent for 6 nights at the Warwick for my 60th birthday. We had informed the hotel of the special occasion and asked for the suite to be far away from elevators and a high floor.
We love classic hotels…we’re Brits and have plenty here so I had high expectations of this 4* hotel. We have travelled extensively around the world and have stayed in many great hotels and never had any issues before.

We have tried to be fair with this review as we’ve never written a negative one before but we hope this benefits both the management and prospective guests. 

Firstly, the good points:

An excellent location, an old classic hotel, general areas are clean, well decorated, and cared for. Desk staff and one person, in particular, were polite and courteous throughout our stay. 
Doormen, lovely and helpful. Restaurant staff, friendly and professional, thank you all.

So here is our complaint. 

Firstly the location: 3 doors away from the lift and on the 9th floor (request had been ignored). From stepping into our suite at 4pm we noticed how dark the room was, but we put it down to the time of day. I went to the window in the lounge and bedroom and saw to my horror that both faced a brick wall........ the reason for no light! I would have expected this on basic price room but certainly not a suite.

Sadly, the room also looked tired, we noticed a badly stained arm chair and marks on the sofa, the voile drapes at the window were badly hung. The bathroom soap dish was at an angle, the magnifying mirror was loose and swivelled around, the toilet actually looked dirty but we realised it was actually worn at the bottom. Cracked bathroom sink.
We can’t remember having stayed in any hotel the past few years that still had a shower curtain but this was also stained. I must be fair and say the room was spotlessly clean, but it was totally unloved. So many little issues that built up that could have easily been fixed before arrival.

We went downstairs within 15 minutes and told the reception desk that we were very disappointed with the room and asked if we could move. Unfortunately, there were none available, so he suggested speaking to the manager the following morning. This we did but we were unable to see him as he was busy with another guest. We couldn’t wait as we had a walking trip booked so asked if he could contact us.

The following morning (my actual birthday) we went to the front desk and asked to see the manager as we hadn’t had any contact. A man came to the desk to see us (no introductions but we assumed the manager) and straight away he was strangely very defensive in his manner, not what we were expecting. He asked us why we had chosen to complain 2 days after arriving! We explained (politely) in detail that we had tried twice to see him. We asked if he had seen the suite and would he come and view the room. He said he had no need to as he trusted his housekeepers. We found his attitude to us quite unbelievable. He kept repeating “but this was the room you booked and this is what you have been given”, we couldn’t understand his reluctance to see visit our room.
To be honest, he was quite right as we hadn’t read the small print on the room (which we later saw on the hotel website in fine print) but we certainly hadn’t expected a suite with no light and all the other issues inside.
It was so dark that the only way of checking the weather was via the live webcams in Times Square!  Again, we were told there was nothing suitable to move us to. He said he’d remove the tourist tax of $30 dollars per night from our room though our UK agent said it was within our rights to refuse to pay this as we hadn’t used the facilities. 

To end, we later found out on checkout that the man we spoke to hadn’t been the main manager, but we have chosen not to name him here. The main reason for our 3 stars is purely down to his attitude and how he approached our issues. 
An apology for our the room issues and maybe even a slice of cake and a card would have been a nice gesture under the circumstances. 

To all prospective guests please read the small print about your room/ suite and understand that “interior view” means you are facing a brick wall with no natural light. At least then you know what to expect and will have a realistic expectation of your suite.

To the hotel management (not housekeeping), please go and check the finer details of each room regularly or random checks to see if you would be happy staying in it yourself. 

We paid a lot extra for a suite for a special occasion and sadly we were left very disappointed.

title: Disappointing.  Do not recommend.
text: Did the standards for hotels drop to a new low since I traveled last? I just checked in after waiting an extended period of time to even get an elevator up to my room and this is what it looks like (see photos).  There’s no room service and not even a tea bag in the room to make a hot tea.  There’s not even an outlet by the bed to plug in your phone, etc.  I can hear every single word and movement of the people staying next door.  Please avoid making the same mistake.  Look elsewhere.

title: Good stay but small things let it down
text: Spent 6 nights. Great location. Hotel a little bit tatty but room was clean and comfortable. A shortage of power points in the room.  I was generally very happy with my stay but a couple of very small things disappointed me. Firstly, I requested a face/wash cloth four times during my visit but never did get it. Secondly, I asked twice for a knife on the Saturday so I could prepare some early bagel breakfast on morning of Marathon. They couldn’t give me a knife. When I was checking out I tried to tell the receptionist but she just wasn’t interested. Couldn’t wait to get me out of there!!

title: Amazing Location, Boutique & Beautiful
text: Mu wife and I recently stayed at The Warwick in NYC on business. I booked it because we've stayed at The Plaza and it was close to 5th and Central Park for @ 1/3 the price!! I was amazed how beautifully appointed and close The Warwick is to everything! The front desk offered us an upgrade to a "Signature Suite: The Hollywood" on the 27th Floor and I was BLOWN away by the terrace overlooking the skyline, for the price of a regular room at The Plaza!! The staff was amazing, incredibly accommodating, polite and FRIENDLY & HELPFUL not stuffy!! I'd HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend The Warwick, my wife and I can't wait to go back!! I hear it's AMAZING for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade!

title: What happened?  Used to be my favorite NYC hotel!  :-(
text: I tell everyone to stay here and visit 3 times/year for 6 nights each stay.  I was so excited to return after Covid.  I was given a room which smelled of smoke.  The smoke smell didn't really bother me, but I didn't want to be charged the $500 posted if there is smoke in your room.  I was changed and then asked for my mini fridge which I called to request a week prior.  They said I was on the "waitlist" for a fridge.  I then went to restaurant which closed at 10PM.  Arrived 9:20PM and was told it was closed.  When I questioned that, they said they could call the chef to see I could still eat but would need to be fast.  I said ok, but when I placed order they were out of it so decided to leave.  They said I could order a cocktail to go- what fun!  I then spent two days trying to get one knife, fork, spoon and one plate for a six night stay.  it was impossible- I finally gave up.  The closest I got was 3 plastic utensils but no plate.  The hot water wasn't operational Mon-Thurs from 10AM-3PM which was a big inconvenience (COLD shower).  As always, the staff was very nice (except restaurant people who couldn't help me), and the maids are always exceptionally nice.  I could not get a wash/face cloth for 6 days either.  I think the hotel was hit really hard financially during the pandemic so don't expect the same experience.  Really too bad.

title: Good location for families
text: The staff was helpful, the hotel room was clean, although dated. Great location for a family - easy to get to the Broadway shows, walkable to Central Park and the kid stores (American Girl, FAO Schwarz, etc). The lobby and bar area feels very old NY. Good rates. I didn’t love that key access isn’t required to access floors, but overall the security felt fine. I’d come back.

title: Not as expected
text:
This is the only hotel I normally stay at when I’m NY. I’m usually such a huge fan of the hotel but this time it was completely different. My suite wasn’t clean and I had to ask for towels. Then there was no coffee and the tray and coffee machine were filthy. The little sink area was covered in crumbs. I asked for coffee only to realize the machine didn’t work. The mini fridge in my room was dirty as well and covered in dust. 
The bathroom tub and sink doesn’t drain very well and there was hardly any hot water due to maintenance or something. Overall it was pretty disappointing considering it was my first time back since Covid. 
The staff were fantastic and couldn’t have been nicer! They are always extremely nice and helpful. 
I just would have expected more from my room considering it was a suite.

title: Can’t recommend due to  poor customer service and issues with cleanliness
text:
I’ve stayed here many times and it’s always been consistently fine with appropriate customer service and cleanliness. This time there were problems all along. My room had Italian leftovers in a drawer I found the first day. They stank and made my whole room smell when I opened the drawer. The only solution was to come in and spray the room. The housekeeper then proceeded to clean the bathroom and sort of suggested she hadn’t really cleaned it when the room was released. The next night I couldn’t get eating utensils without going to the restaurant (not sure what they do when it isn’t open) and they wouldn’t give me real utensils to use in the room. Then as I was rushing to leave for the airport after a meeting ran long, the bellhop directed me to a restroom on a different floor and didn’t offer to hold my luggage as I used it. So after navigating everything with all my luggage, the restroom was locked. And no one could come unlock it. I guess I could have gone down to the lobby and back to the restroom after waiting 10 minutes for a key, but (1) that’s a pain and (2) I needed to get to the airport. 

I understand some things aren’t normal and I understand if the restaurant isn’t open daily. I even would understand if I can’t get a room early. But dirty rooms and wild goose chases to find locked restrooms are easily avoidable and I doubt I’ll stay here again. It’s never been an impressive hotel but it’s been fine. But now it’s just a disorganized mess

title: Better than Expected
text: I stayed in the Randolph Suite and it was GORGEOUS, I am obsessed with how gorgeous that room was and it was thankfully clean as well. The staff also beyond exceeded my expectations, their service was amazing! Super friendly, remembered me by name, assisted me with everything I needed help with, even when I didn't. Only stayed for a night but honestly I don't have any complaints. I wasn't planning on staying here again because I try to stay with either Hilton or Hyatt, but I will most definitely be staying here again, for sure!!

title: Excellent value
text: Would have given it 5 stars but no bar no breakfast and very slow elevators Excellent staff specially concierge Robert.Very good value compared to other New York hotels Suite was very comfortable great seize and efficient housekeeping Will definitely stay here again

title: I wold return
text: Antique atmosphere, beautiful hall. Very neat, great staff. No breakfast because of pandemic. Great big clean rooms. Expensive food at the restaurant, amazing staff. Elvis Presley was there . Love the colours.

title: Old Hollywood meets NYC!
text: I have stayed at this hotel for the last 2 times we have stayed in NYC and we love it each time. The staff is super friendly, the rooms are clean, you're not right off of times square so its not super crazy busy, it feels safe and you're close walking distance to just about everything there is to do in nyc! I would recommend people ask for a room with a bathtub instead of a shower because you'll need to soak your feet after all that walking! We'll defiantly keep staying here.

title: Loved our stay!
text:
We loved the old world feel of the Warwick. Very charming and traditional. Our room was large, comfortable and quiet. The staff, very friendly. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant, Murals, which was quite nice with excellent service. We even observed the manager, Garret Corcoran, bussing tables to ensure everything went smooth! There was a very nice live jazz trio playing that night, playing at a respectful volume, which was appreciated!
All told, earmarks of a well run hotel!

title: Excellent Stay
text: We really enjoyed the Warwick Hotel in October 2021. We were lucky enough to book a room with a private terrace and two double beds on the 21st floor. While the terrace was small, it overlooked 6th Avenue and 54th Street and was perfect for my friend and I to enjoy a night with the city as the backdrop. The beds were very comfortable and the room had all modern amenities. Would stay here again.

title: Glad we stayed here
text: Reluctant to book this hotel given some people were saying it is old. Not really true. It is a different style. Reminds me of New York Palace but at a good price. Fantastic service. Felt like home. Very comfortable beds. Doesnt have great views but very close to Central Park and 5th Avenue Would stay here again.

title: Traditional hotel with amazing, friendly staff
text: This lovely older hotel provided us with a very warm welcome. The friendly, extremely helpful staff exceeded our expectations for a hotel in the time of Covid-19. We had a very large, very clean room with a nice street view of bustling cyclists, folks walking their dogs, and sparkling fountains on the plaza across the street. We were not bothered by not having the room looked after every single day, and when we asked for additional towels or washcloths, we promptly received them.  Yes, the elevators are small —  as they are in Europe.  This is a traditional style hotel after all; we just “packed our patience”.  The location was excellent for us. It’s a short walk to Central Park and to many small diners and restaurants.

title: After booking, don't click any of their room upgrade offers
text:
We got a good deal and after a few days received an email from Warwick asking us to upgrade our room starting at 150. 

I was curious and wanted to see what's covered in the new deal + the prices so I clicked the link on the form to view the offer.

After clicking the link I was automatically kicked out of my old offer and upgraded to the new offer without any warning or confirmation and the price was double. 

I tried to call back after a few minutes and they informed me the initial room was taken.

title: Not a 4*
text: Although we had a fine time, calling this hotel a 4* is a stretch. The staff was professional when we could interact with them (seems they are chronically understaffed). For example, I made a minimum of a dozen attempts during our one week stay to call front desk, with no answer . There was one room cleaning during our entire stay. Had to ask everyday for coffee, towels, garbage. Oddly enough, despite only one cleaning, housekeeping managed to enter our room every morning while we were there! No clue why. It certainly was not to attend to housekeeping.  The location was great. Zero amenities in room so bring your own toiletries, cotton balls, etc. There was s blow dryer and mini fridge. Really a 3* in need of fresh paint and carpets, linens.

title: Busca otro hotel
text:
Planeamos unas vacaciones familiares desde hacia algún tiempo, mi esposo, mis dos hijos y yo. En anteriores ocasiones nos habíamos quedado en el Warwick y siempre nos había ido bien. La ubicación es excelente, aunque unas de las habitaciones están  viejas. 
En esta última ocasión después de un largo viaje llegamos al hotel a la 1:30 am, con nuestros hijos agotados ( de 8 y 6 años).  
Hacemos el check in, y en ese momento nos enteramos que NO HAY SERVICIO DE LIMPIEZA A CUARTOS, lo hacen cada 3 días, la razón que me dieron es que por el COVID no tienen personal suficiente.  En ningún lado informan eso, te enteras hasta tu llegada. 
Eso fue una terrible bienvenida, nosotros llevábamos el hotel prepagado por lo que ya no podíamos cambiar de hotel. 
Cuando entramos a la  habitación, nos dimos cuenta que nos había tocado el peor cuarto de baño que probablemente tenga el hotel. En verdad era minúsculo, para entrar a la regadera tenias que dejar la puerta del baño abierta. Era toda una hazaña entrar y salir de la regadera. Cuando te lavabas los dientes tu espalda baja pegaba con el toallero. Era el equivalente a un baño de avión. ( Ese fue el baño que nos dieron para una familia de 4!!!) 
Estábamos tan cansados que no reclamamos en ese momento. Sentí que como llegamos tan tarde aprovecharon esa ventaja para ponernos en esa habitación.  
Pero al día siguiente, lo primero que hizo mi esposo fue reclamar. Inmediatamente nos cambiaron de habitación y la persona de recepción que recibió la queja, antes de que mi esposo dijera nada, se adelantó y le dijo que si era por el cuarto de baño. 
Mi pregunta aquí es : ¿Porque si saben que esa habitación es incómoda para las huéspedes la siguen usando? O esperan que tu seas el idiota que no se queja y te quedes conforme con lo que te dan. 
En conclusión: no me volvería a quedar en este hotel. 
Me perdieron como cliente y espero que mi experiencia les sirva a otros para no quedarse ahí. 
Hay muy buenas opciones por el mismo precio, donde tu no tienes que limpiar y tender tu cama, y no te queda el sentimiento de que se aprovechan de sus huéspedes.

title: A Haven In The Storm
text:
I’m writing to recap my recent experiences at the Warwick New York during the weekend of Hurricane Henri.  I had traveled from Boston to attend an outdoor concert in Central Park on a Saturday evening, and needed to find accommodations when Amtrak canceled all travel along my route home in anticipation of the arrival of the storm.  As a Warwick Journeys member I checked for availability directly with the hotel and found an interior room at a favorable rate was available to meet my need to extend my time in the city.  My Saturday stay was just around the corner at the sleek newish Shoreham and I had the option to cancel my Warwick reservation up until check in time as a Journeys member. I inquired with the Shoreham’s desk agent about extending my check out and was informed that an additional two hours would be available for a charge of fifty dollars. 

After being rained out of the Saturday night concert and thoroughly soaked  I was craving some creature comforts and so I strolled around the corner and stopped by The Warwick to inquire about the availability of early check in on my Sunday evening reservation. 

The experience could not have been more satisfying. The front desk manager offered an eleven a.m. check in perfect for taking shelter from the soaking rains and approaching hurricane. I was listened to attentively, and had such a positive feeling that my comfort mattered to this gentleman that I inquired about availability for upgrading to a standard terrace room. The desk manager explained that there was availability for this option if I was willing to check in later. I made the necessary arrangements and returned  to store my bag til check in. 

At check in the kind gentleman I had spoken with that morning remembered me, and told the agent assisting me to give me a particular room on the 23rd floor.  It turned out to be a beautiful junior suite with a gorgeous balcony for watching the storm. 

The ambiance at the Warwick is elegant and understated. I had loved the Art Deco decor during a stay back in April and this substantial upgrade in accommodation provided even more to love.   Mirrored coffee table and a comfy sofa , enormous closet space  and thoughtful touches like a small table in the suites foyer for keys, purse and phone while removing wet clothes.    The suite was a fabulous haven in the storm and represented a generous upgrade from the standard terrace room I’d purchased.   

I thoroughly enjoyed riding out the worst of the storm in complete comfort because The Warwick’s desk manager had listened to my experience and used his discretion to provide what I needed most under difficult circumstances.  I have to wonder about some recent reviews of the Warwick NYC on this site. In my experience there are two sides to every story and interaction with hotel desk agents is no exception.  In my experience,  staff at The Warwick NYC provide service on par with the legendary luxury hotels of the world. Their service is characterized by what I consider to be a mark distinction in the industry, they listen attentively and provide guests with the sense that their comfort is important.  Perhaps it’s a case of catching more flies with honey than vinegar, as my mother always said.  As a teacher and frequent traveler I know that people will always remember how you treated them. Those in the hospitality industry are no exception and I am pleased to report that simply communicating what I needed in accommodation resulted in the staff at the Warwick doing everything in their power to provide me with an exceptional stay.

title: The impressive Warwick
text: With my recent Warwick experiences, it has easily become a personal favorite NYC hotel option.  Those seeking chic, sleek, minimalist, cookie-cutter, contemporary design should look elsewhere.  The Warwick is steeped in fascinating history and has continued with the tradition of focused, warm hospitality.   It is important that anyone booking here join the Warwick Journeys Loyalty Program.  It's quick, easy and free to join online.  One of the best (of many) advantages of this program is that members receive the lowest rate option (better than AAA, AARP and pay in advance) and the daily, mandatory $33 facilities fee is waived.   This is a significant savings and unavailable if booking through 3rd party sites.  The doormen and chandelier and flower bedecked lobby  offer a warm welcome upon each entry.   The front  desk staff is cheerful and helpful.   My most recent experience offered an unexpected upgrade to a city view room.    Guest rooms are spacious with traditional, classy decor that could  rival some  rooms at the nearby grande dame  hotels, but at a fraction of the cost. The marble bathrooms are compact, but well thought out and stocked and with ample shelf space for toiletries.  Shower water pressure was excellent.  Robes and coffee makers can be delivered to rooms upon request.   Covid still creates many service challenges at hotels and guests should be aware of this.   At this time,  limited staffing means that guest rooms are serviced every 3rd day here.   The midtown location is excellent and within easy walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, theatres, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue shopping and multiple subway lines.  For a taste of past elegance at a reasonable price, The Warwick is the place to be.

title: We stayed Labor Day Weekend for the U  S Open
text: We stay at the Warwick each time we visit Manhattan. It has a great midtown location, with easy access to Central Park and Times Square. Getting a treat at Magnolia Bakery on 6th Ave on our way to Arthur Ashe Stadium is a plus. The staff at the Warwick always make us feel welcome, and go out of their way to assure a pleasant stay. We like that the hotel is quaint, the rooms are nicely decorated, and the staff is superb! We'll be back next year!

title: Muito bom!
text:
Faltou uma coisa para eu atribuir a nota máxima: o tráfego dos elevadores. Apesar de em número de 3, os elevadores não são grandes e estão com a capacidade ainda mais reduzida por conta do COVID.
Resultado: em 2 oportunidades (próximo do horário do checkout) tivemos que descer pelas escadas, por conta das sucessivas vezes em que todos os elevadores passaram lotados.
No mais, excelente escolha.
Localização primorosa, na 53 entre a 5a. e 6a. avenidas, muito próximo do Central Park.
Quarto muito limpo e confortável, com ótimo banheiro.
Recomendo.
Voltarei.

title: The hotel is fine but
text: The service is pretty awful..disinterested front desk staff…the doormen were much more helpful with information…no info about the hotel on the room re ice machines,restauants,etc. no room cleaning,and never were able to contact anyone re towels and etc  by phone and when we went down to the desk with our request there was a huddle of staff talking…

title: El estado del hotel es deplorable
text: La habitación tiene una ventana que da a la máquina del aire acondicionado y el sonido que emite es insoportable. El baño emite un olor a desagüe terrible. Yo solía venir a este hotel. Pero ya no vendré más. La limpieza del lobby tambien deja mucho que desear. Y la falta de cortesía del personal es abrumadora.

title: THANK YOU, BILLY!
text:
On Thursday night, September 2, during the storm, my daughter left work to find that there was no way for her to return to her apartment. She was, literally, stranded with the subways shut down, bus and cab service stalled and the Uber  she had called wasn't able to show up after an hour. 
Living in Massachusetts, I was obviously not able to get to her to help. I desperately began calling hotels to find her a safe place to spend the night. I contacted the Warwick and spoke to Billy. I was so upset and nervous thinking of my daughter being alone out there in a storm and Billy was such a help to me. He took all of the information over the phone and booked her a room. He told me to tell her to head on over to the Warwick and she would be fine for the night. 
She was soaking wet from head to toe, but managed to get there. She had a lovely room waiting and both of us were greatly relieved. I thank God that we were blessed that night to find the Warwick Hotel and a caring person at the desk who turned what could have been a tragic situation into a blessing. Thank you, again, Billy!

title: Horrible Stay at The Warwick
text: Our recent stay was horrible. The hotel was disgusting. We have stayed there many times in the past and were shocked to see the current state of disrepair. Had to move rooms twice. A/C went out in first room. Power went out in second room. Plus, the carpeting and bed were very stained and the paint was literally pealing off the walls. No coffee in the hotel. Kept telling us they were waiting for a shipment. No wipes in the gym during COVID to clean off the equipment. We checked out early and would NEVER stay there again!

title: Vacation
text: I stayed at the Warwick in New York for 4 nights and I must say it was very nice, the hotel was clean , everyone was very friendly and helpful . I’d definitely come back again . I just want to say a special shout out to Jamal the front desk clerk I loved him and izzie the bartender she KNOWS HOW TO MAKE Drinks  AND MY SERVER HE WAS SO FRIENDLY thanks to all of you who made my stay enjoyable.

title: فندق متوسط موقعه ممتاز
text:
الايجابيات : الموقع ، السعر ، حجم الغرف.   
السلبيات : لا يوجد افطار ، الرد على الاتصالات سيء.
حجزنا غرفة بسريرين للأطفال ملاصقة للجناح الكبير ذو الشبابيك الضخمة
ليست لديهم خدمة غسيل ملابس لكن أم الفندق مصبغة غسيل تقوم بإرجاع الملابس للفندق خلال يومين

title: Warwick is my new favorite hotel!
text: I, like many, was a little nervous about my stay after reading so many of these reviews but that was not my experience. I had a great stay and so I felt I must write a positive review.  I love the history of this gem of a hotel. First and foremost, this location can't be beat.  At the corner of 54th and 6th.  You can walk everywhere! At check-in, I was informed that due to Covid, they do not service the rooms until the third day, but if I needed anything prior to that, let them know.  I had no issues with that policy.  The room is very large(I had a double) plenty of space and the closet is HUGE.  There was a coffee maker and a mini bar(I didn't use either)  In the closet is an iron and ironing board and the blow dryer.  The bathroom was fine as well, I had 2 of each size towel which was fine for me.  I always had hot water.  Shower pressure was great and I even took a bath one night to rest my aching feet. There is a small shelf that runs above the sink to place all of your toiletries and make-up on.  I booked thru travelocity and paid in full prior but was informed there is a resort fee that would be collected at the hotel upon check-out.  There are 3 elevators, and yes we did squeeze more than 2 people in(we all wore masks). The room was soundproof.  I was right by the elevator and did not hear anything unless someone was standing right outside my door.  Slept wonderful!  I did not find the wait excessive and nothing to complain about.  I did not eat at the restaurant but it looked good and was full when I checked in on a Saturday night.  I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and hope to stay here in the future.

title: Pésima experiencia!
text: Me he quedado en múltiples ocasiones en el Warwick de NY. Nunca imagine lo que encontraría en esta visita. En general el hotel se ve sucio, pero el cuarto solo incrementa esta situación. La regadera con una fuga de agua que empapó el baño completo. A mi esposa le cayó del techo ( no sé si de la ranura del aire acondicionado) una cucaracha muy grande. Cabe mencionar que estábamos en el piso 21. Bajé a recepción con fotos y videos de lo que menciono y la recepcionista me informó que el Gerente General no estaba en ese momento, pero que si yo quería hablar con House keeping. Mandaron a una persona a retirar la cucaracha y a que se hiciera el cuarto, no obstante que su política , por COVID según ellos, es hacer el cuarto cada 4 dias. Esto último no lo publican en ningún lado. El personal de servicio parece estar de mal humor permanentemente. Mi percepción personal es que no hay suficiente personal para atender a los huéspedes. No recibí una disculpa por nada de lo que les estoy escribiendo, lo que me lleva a pensar que es mas común de lo que yo me imaginaba. Me duele escribir esto del hotel que fué mi favorito en NY por años pero creo que la gente que reserve ahí debe saber lo que va a encontrar,

title: Staycation disaster !
text:
I am utterly shocked that this hotel has kept its rating during covid. I am now seeing other negative reviews and wish I’d booked elsewhere. 
Do yourself a favor and stay away.

They charge an automated $90 fee upon check in and do not notify customers of this policy. It also isn’t on my final bill nor the initial bill i received when I booked. 
I checked my account upon check in (i always double check charges over $100) and called the front desk to clarify, they said it could cover potential charges to my room like room service. They reassured me I would be reimbursed when I checked out. I also sent an e mail with the print out of my receipt at exit so their offices would have no excuses. I have not been reimbursed and it has been over a week. When checking out I was reassured by the manager, a tall black man, that i would receive no extra charges. Today I called to clarify and Daniel at the front desk didn’t even know the names of his colleagues in accounting. Bizarre! 

The room was left in normal condition. We were granted a complimentary late check out which caused confusion at the front desk—we did not receive a courtesy call and were instead yelled at by a girl at the front desk when we gave her our room keys. At that point the manager interrupted and reassured us we would not be charged extra. 

I’ll add we also spent about $200 at their restaurant , Murals on 45, where our entrees were burnt and the service was slow. They gave us takeaway martinis and Jorge promised he would “help” if we charged the meal to our room. We charged it to the room and nothing was done about it, fine. But the last straw for me has been the fact I still haven’t been refunded the extra $90–when I was told i would be reimbursed in full. I feel exploited and will not be coming back.

I am shocked by the utter lack of professionalism and non existent hospitality at this hotel.

title: Fantastic location, customer service and room.
text:
I love this hotel and certainly will stay here again if I come back. Upon reading some reviews, I was a little worried about their possibly "slow customer service, AC not working or not having towels". NO NEED TO WORRY- we had everything and more.

 I would suggest it to all of my friends. The location was great. Clean, not scary and nice view. The front of this hotel was very pretty. The doorman was so kind. Our front desk hostess (Yara) was very welcoming. The music, flowers and waiting area was very welcoming. You feel a sense of peace and joy when you enter the hotel.

Upon entering the elevator, there was a sign that allows only 2ppl at a time due to the pandemic. That was much appreciated. There were 3 elevators total.

Our rooms (double city view room 522) was spacious and clean. Included everything we needed. (yes, lots of towels and our AC was perfection).

We were also welcomed to leave out luggage upon check out with the hotel. It was a huge and organized room. We felt very taken care of. For that reason, this review was very necessary. 

Thank you Warwick team.

title: Exceeded Expectations at this 5 Star Hotel
text: We just came back from a 4 night stay at the Warwick and felt lucky to have found this gem in New York. We usually stay at the Hilton across the street, but decided to give them a try since it was so close by and the fact that the Hilton is still closed. The décor of the hotel is old-fashioned (in a good way) and found the ambiance to be quite elegant. The reception staff were courteous and seemed to enjoy their jobs as we noticed everyone to be cheerful and attentive. The room they gave us was extremely big, especially in New York. The only gripe about my stay is that housekeeping did not clean my room until the last day. I know that Covid-19 is still very much of a reality, but I would have liked to get my room serviced. All in all, a very positive experience and will be sure to stay with them again later down the road. Keep it up!

title: Not really a four-star hotel.
text:
The Warwick has a great location and that is very close to time square. It is in a nice part of town. The hotel has been rated as a four-star but I would say it is maybe a solid 2 1/2 to 3. It is a much older hotel. I am sure that it was quite lovely and it’s time but there are definitely things that need to be fixed. Could not get hot water in the shower. Basically was lukewarm. Also could not get cold water out of the faucet. The elevators are small and they take forever. Elevator situation really needs to be improved. The rooms are OK but nothing extravagant. Had a view of absolutely nothing. Fitness center is small. It is not ventilated at all. There was no sanitizer available to clean the machinery with. There were no paper towels available. I don’t even know that there was water available in the fitness center.
They do have a restaurant but we did not eat there. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I can’t say that I would stay there again. There are so many other better options available.

title: Beautiful hotel located in the heart of NYC
text: Just came back from a much needed vacation to New York City and was very pleased with my experience at the Warwick. Staff were friendly and eager to help with my questions about restaurant recommendations and activities to do in the city. I did notice the hotel was understaffed and the wait to get towels were a bit long. Things to note: there is no room service or breakfast at the hotel and they only clean the rooms after 3 days. Seriously…? They can do much better than that. Otherwise a relaxing trip in a great location.

title: Buyer beware: $126.00 resort fee
text: If location in  NYC is your priority, look no further than The Warwick Hotel.  Two blocks left is Rockefeller Center, and two blocks right is Central Park.  However, you also need to know the following: they will charge you a $126.00 additional resort fee that will appear two days after you check out.  Even if you join the Warwick membership, and are told this will keep you from that fee, if you book through a third party like Expedia, they will charge you this fee, and will be a little adversarial about it.  Also know that the elevators are small and slow.  A 30 minute wait during check in and check out hours are not uncommon.  You might want to think about a lower floor so you can use the stairs.  But if you don't mind the extra resort fee, the location cannot be beat.  Next time we will explore other hotels in that area...that don't come with that ding on our overall experience.

title: Exceeded Expectations (Premium 2-Dbl Bed Rm)
text:
Just enjoyed a 2-night stay at the Warwick with my old NYC college buddy.  Had a reservation for a 2-double beds room, and upon check-in, the courteous gentleman at the front desk kindly upgraded us to a "premium" room (# 1921) which had a nice 6th Ave view (although the windows could use a washing).  Room was much cleaner than I expected given the recent negative reviews.  Also, the beds were surprisingly very comfortable, linens were all clean, we had plenty of towels in the cozy yet luxurious bathroom, and we had a coffee machine in the room with coffee pods, cups, and accessories.   Also, can't beat the hotel location in midtown close to Central Park, but away from any riffraff.

Only three minor negatives:  the carpet near the windows was a bit wet (guessing it was condensation from the A/C unit which was blasting nicely), a previous guest's food items were left in the otherwise-empty minibar, and the room had no drinking glasses.  (My roomie and I had nice booze with us, but all housekeeping could provide were additional coffee cups.  Proper glassware is a must in such a historic and classy hotel.)  Getting ice (on the 18th floor) was fast and easy, however.

Great experience overall.  Thanks, Warwick management and staff!

title: Expected more…
text: Our flights canceled so we had to stay an additional night. I was thrilled to get a room at the Warwick! I’ve always wanted to stay there. Excellent location, staff members were very helpful and pleasant, our room was nice and clean, a/c worked great, however only 2 bath towels, no hand towels, wash cloths, or  coffee! I called requesting these items. I waited 2+ hrs before going down to get them myself. I’m a bit disappointed particularly because we just stayed at another hotel in the area that provided all the typical amenities. I will say I would be willing to stay here again in the future. It’s an older hotel with an elegant touch.

title: Very disappointing stay
text: I understand it may take awhile to recover post COVID but this hotel has just given up. No room service, no coffee, no cleaning service. A/c barely cool is unacceptable in summer months . Limited front desk staff. The hotel needs major overhaul , updating, and deep cleaning. The location is perfect inspite of all the cons. Just shut down until you can give customers the level of service we pay for

title: Keep looking
text: For close to 300 a night I at least expect a decent place. You can see through the sheets. Dirty carpet. Rude staff. No cleaning service (COVID). Asked for an extra pillow and was told they don’t have any. Very disappointing experience overall. Really overpriced.  Only upside is the convenient location but there are many better hotels nearby.

title: Terrible service and hotel
text: Just checked in at 7:00 pm had the wrong bed in one of the two rooms we booked so had to go back down to the lobby to get a new room. The safe was locked before hand and we could not open it so had to wait for someone to come and fix it. Only had two bath towels so we had to call to get hand towels and wash clothes. When they finally brought them over a hour and a half later they only brought hand towels so had to call once again for wash clothes!! My husband had to go down to the front desk and they gave him 2 and would bring more later and they never did. We went to front desk the next day and got 4  at 2:15 pm and said they would bring more later. We had no stocked coffee station so had to call for that. Hotel, elevator and rooms are very hot and thermostat set at 64 but temperature in room is 75. Gosh, all this in the first 2 1/2 hrs since check in. Our second room is better we only had to call for wash clothes 😳 Air conditioning is broken and they are going to send up a “engineer” we will see how long it takes. The entire hotel is very hot! The entire time we had to beg for towels/washcloths. The only good thing about this hotel is that it is in a good location 😄

title: The Good & Bad - The Warwick New York
text:
I stayed at The Warwick for two night with parking parking. Overall it was a good experience and I would stay here again for the price I paid.

Pro:  Wonderful Location near Time Square, Central Park, and subway access. Parking is available across the street (book parking package).    Hotel was friendly and clean. 

Cons: Hot Water, 1st time we took a shower no issues with Hot water.  After that we had to wait about 15 minutes for hot water.   Also, for being a 5 star hotel they do not give you any wash clothes, no coffee for coffee pot.  It has a mini fridge in the room but it didn't work.  

Neutral:  I've seen a lot of review talking about the elevator being slow.  It's a very old hotel with 3 small elevators.   We did not have any issues with it being slow, just need a little patients.  (During check out was the longest we waited)

title: Pésimo hotel, Urge una remodelación!!
text:
tenia mucho tiempo de no escribir un review sobre un hotel, pero tuve tan mala experiencia que no dude ni un momento en escribir esto para evitar que alguien mas caiga en este hotel, le urge una remodelación, las habitaciones aunque están de muy buen tamaño tienen los peores colchones que me habían tocado jamas en algún  hotel, las alfombras están en pésimo estado, sucias, todo el mobiliario anticuado, pedí cambio de habitación porque el colchón se le sentían los resortes, me cambiaron y la diferencia era mínima, cuartos obscuros, muy poca iluminación, el aire acondicionado muy ruidoso, no te deja dormir...
en fin si estas buscando un hotel bien ubicado, mobiliario en mal estado y con pésimo servicio al cliente, este es tu lugar!

title: First Time
text: Beautiful hotel and a central location. Checkin  was quick facility was clean received a greed upon check-in. Could not ask for a better location a safe area plenty of security. I’m looking forward to returning to the area and seeing  more of New York City

title: Some good, some not so good
text:
Pending review
Pros: Excellent location, large rooms, comfortable beds.
Cons: Tired and not so clean. Stained and torn stuffed furniture, damaged wood (radiator covers), stained carpet, toilet needs deep cleaning.

Overall, I want to like this place. I want it to have a life in the modern day. It’s beautiful and the location is fabulous. Yet it feels worn out and tired and that dampened our experience.

title: Great location in NYC
text: A wonderful historic hotel, with a location that can’t be beat.  Close to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, 5th Ave shops and more.  It was so easy to walk to several places.  Loved the hotel character, though don’t expect new stuff everywhere.  Hotel had not fully called back all staff as of early June.  Rooms were comfortable.  Only issue was the elevators, which were extremely slow at times and we ended up actually taking the stairs down a couple times from the 11th floor.  Next time we may just request a lower floor so it’s not an issue to use stairs.  We would definitely stay again though, without a doubt.

title: Disaster , Terrible , the WORST hotel
text: This is the worst hotel. Dirty carpeted hallway. So sad to see a historical building in a good location that is kept as a 2 star hotel . The management should be fired . The hotel elevators took about 20 minutes wait , that is if you are lucky , otherwise you are asked to use the device elevators . This is NOT A FOUR STAR. At least if they down grade to a 2 or 3 star the guests would know what to expect , a four star hotel does not use the service elevators , does not have dirty stinky carpets in hallways , does not use rags that at one time used to be towels . I wrote this to at least save the next person reading this from the disappointment and inconvenience that I had to endure . Do yourself a favor look for another 4 star or book another 3 star that owns the fact that they are 3 star and not fooling guests .

title: Полное разочарование!
text: Вчера мы приехали в Нью Йорк!Это была моя давняя мечта и первое путешествие в США!Я долго выбирала отель,важно было месторасположение,комфорт ,красивые вида города.По описанию отеля и хвалебным отзывам это всё было!А по сути мы получили огромное разочарование !Нам дают номер на 18 этаже,он расположен как бы в нише дома,номер тёмный даже в солнечный день,и стены,стены со всех сторон!Но когда я увидела две,якобы двухспальные кровати-изумлению моему не было конца-мы с мужем на такой кровати можем спать только вытянувшись солдатиком,Эта кровать ну никак не может быть расчитана  на 2-х взрослых человек (так мы ещё оба худощавого телосложения)Короче,это явно двухместный номер,в который они решили заселить нас троих взрослых(дочке почти 17 уже).Когда мы обратились с претензией на ресепшн ,менеджер Джамал никак не пошёл нам на встречу,более того,проявил полное равнодушие,отворачивался,уходил….В номере элементарно не было воды!!!!!и это якобы 4 звёзды!!!Всё очень старое ,потрёпанное,а утром когда я попыталась посмотреть в окно-я увидела только очень грязные стёкла ,через которые ничего не видно,ну года 2 их не мыли!!!Короче,перечислять можно долго!Очень жаль,что я повелась на отзывы и выбрала этот отель , и он так испортил мне первое впечатление о стране!!!!

title: So happy we chose this hotel!
text:
Normally it’s a disaster when a hotel ends up overbooked but thanks to the quick thinking of Yara at the Warwick, our family had the best time!  My dad almost never travels and after a year of quarantine, my brother and I decided to treat him to a weekend in New York.  My brother, father and I had booked two hours room so she combined us into The Cary Grant Suite which was such a treat. It’s a beautiful room that overlooks the city and we even cancelled our dinner plans to order in and eat on the gorgeous patio. 
Yara was not only kind but very conscientious, working to make sure our combination of online reservations got sorted out so that there was no confusion and the staff in general was pleasant and responsive. The hotel is lovely in general with a great old fashioned feel but with updated and clean furnishings throughout. Easy access to restaurants and the MoMa. I want to come back soon and bring my mom!

title: Very good, considering.
text: I stayed at this hotel in May, just when NYC was opening up and it's possible they were understaffed.  There are many good things about this hotel - the location, the price was reasonable, and the size of the rooms are large for NYC standards.  I would stay here again.  Yes, there were some housekeeping issues such as they cleaned your room only every 3 days, and if you needed more than the basic 2 towels per room, you had to ask.  But they delivered them quickly when asked.  The elevators were slow, but no big deal.  The staff up front were friendly and courteous.  Yes, the hotel is older and is showing it's age somewhat, but overall the location and size of the rooms can't be beat.

title: Impossible to book by mail or phone
text:
We were looking for a hotel to stay for our next xmas holyday. We tried to book a 2 rooms suite in the Warvick for 8 nights.

We wrote an email to inform them that we wanted to book by them. No answer.... After one week, I tried again.... no answer again.

I tried to reach them on the phone. After several tries, someone of the front desk answered. I explained my project. The man I had gave me unpersonalised and general answers in a very unconfortable way. I must have disturbed him. After some moans, he transfered me to the Booking department which never answer.... (I waited 5 minutes and forgave up).

What a bad experience with them.... we got 0 reaction from them..... we got a 0 star service....

We went to another choice and book without any problem in another 4 stars hotel of the same category....

Dont loose your time to try to reach the Warvick. They dont care of their futur clients....

title: Good location, terrible service, average to below average rooms/amenities
text:
This hotel is situated near Central Park, the train, and within a nice walk to Times Square.  However, that’s where the good news ends.  The hotel itself is old and it shows.  The hot water heater broke while we were there and we had no hot water for showers for the day.  Old water damage and chipping paint were seen in both of our rooms.  Plan on spending at least 5-10 minutes waiting for one of the (tiny) elevators at busy times, like the morning, afternoon or evening.  If you call the front desk for anything, expect to wait in hold for several minutes.  Our room had two towels when we arrived (there were four of us and it took them two calls and an hour to bring more up (they forget them the first trip).  

This place is cheap, which is nice, but there are lots of other hotels in this price range.

title: Decepcionante.
text:
El staff es altamente déspota y muy condescendiente. Parece que te hacen un favor en todo momento, con excepción de la gente de "housekeeping", que fueron encantadoras. Desgraciadamente, fue a quien menos ví, ya que, por absurdo que parezca, el hotel solamente ebtra a limpiar las habitaciones una vez cada tercer día, alegando que son las recomendaciones de las autoridades. Al llamar a front desk, me dijeron que lo estaban haciendo todos los hoteles en NYC. Esto, es mentira. Hace menos de un mes, estuve en Park Lane a un par de calles y la habitación fue sanitizada diario. 
La mejor propuesta de quien me contestó, fue proponerme un reembolso por la estancia, abandonando el hotel. 

Los elevadores son un tema aparte: son insuficientes, tardan muchísimo en llegar al lobby, muchísimo en llegar al piso de la habitación y van siempre llenos, a pesar de que marca que debe haber solamente dos personas dentro, por la contingencia sanitaria. (allí no aplican las recomendaciones de las autoridades)
Cuando por fin llega el elevador, se detiene en cada piso conforme se baja. ¡Que Dios te libre de estar en un piso alto, porque puedes hacer 29 escalas antes de alcanzar el lobby. 

Concluyendo: terrible todo. No recomiendo para nada hospedarse en éste lugar.

title: NONEXISTENT  HOUSEKEEPING
text: Ever hear of a hotel that cleans the room, makes the bed ONCE in 5 days? Here it is! Checked in on Saturday, room not touched until Tuesday, not only not cleaned but not even making the bed. Was told it was due to Covid and some non-existent CDC regulations that funnily enough wasn't true in another hotel just weeks before. NONSENSE. No service, no smiles, four walls and a bed.

title: 1st holiday after lockdown!
text: given the covid protocols i wasnt quite sure what to expect. i guess it was as i imagined it. although i did not expect the staff on the front dest at check in to be so rude and obnoxious. i asked a few questions as to what to expect re covid etc and i was rudely told that i could go elsewhere !! despite having pre paid when booking. this completely put me off. the location is great although the property is quite run down and tired. the room was a decent size the bathroom was small housekeeping only came once in 8 days - due to covid - i do feel this was extreme.  will not go back there are plenty of hotels in the area which i would definitely chose over the warwick.

title: Gross
text: What a disgusting outdated hotel. Filthy carpet and furniture in the rooms.  Water damage ceiling in the bathroom. I was afraid to touch the floor with my feet. They gave my kids a room that someone was already in. Another friend had filthy sheets on his bed.  The elevators are tiny and hard to fit more than three people. Slow bell service. Also, the country, NY and NYC lifted the mask mandate but this hotel decides even if vaccinated you need to wear a mask in the lobby.  It seems that they don’t follow the science.  They care more about bs mask wearing when it’s safe than to clean the rooms from semen stains. Covid is the least of your worries at this hotel.

title: Not ready for prime time
text: The Warwick Hotel for all intensive purposes is still closed. I suspect this is a post Covid hangover but they are clearly not prepared for full service.  We checked in this weekend. Check in time was 3pm. We were unable to get into our room until 4 PM. The front desk was painfully understaffed and unapologetic. No towels in the room. The mini bar is empty  and the fridge was turned off. Tonight I asked about getting some bottled water and the front desk  suggested that we look for a vendor down the street. I had to go to the lobby to get towels. There are lots of hotels in New York. The Warwick Hotel is tired  and the service is non-existent. Recommend you look for a full service hotel.

title: Unsanitary conditions during COVID!
text: Double room  - no view (dark alley), no daylight in room. Had to go downstairs to see what the weather was like. Carpets throughout the hotel are FILTHY with huge stains, saw 2 dead cockroaches in corner on floor 10, visitors garbage line the hallways because the hotel does not have room cleaning AT ALL.  We had to search for towels, sheets, pillow cases (the ones on the bed were stained and the towels in the bathroom were obviously used!).  I found an apple core under the desk too. The 'coffeemachine' had one damaged coffee package, no cups and no powdered creamer.  DISASTER. The ceiling has cracks and water bubbles in the bathroom. TERRIBLE. We stayed for 5 days and our room was NEVER cleaned.  The hallways were also NEVER VACUUMED during this entire time because I saw the same trash in the corner all week.  The bathroom in the lobby area was disgusting with SH... in the bowl.  I mean, how does management expect for this hotel to survive?  I wasted hard earned money on my stay. NEVER AGAIN.

title: Great location, but a few issues hold it back
text:
We just got back from a weekend in NYC with the family. We booked two rooms; a city view room and a regular room with parking. This hotel has two major advantages working for it: The location and the price. We got a great deal for a Saturday night, with the regular room coming in right around $100. I thought the hotel was in an ideal location; it's very easy walking distance from Times Square and from Central Park, and there are some high end restaurants in the area as well. It's close to the 59th Street Bridge and there's a parking garage right across the street, so if you're driving in from Long Island it's perfect. 

However, the hotel itself has some issues that keep it from being truly great. The biggest issue honestly were the elevators. There are three elevators that service the entire hotel, and they are TINY. Like, 4 people with no luggage if you're small, tiny. On Sunday morning when everyone was going to check out it was impossible to get an elevator that we could fit even 1 person on. There was another man on our floor who was waiting to get on an elevator in front of us, and he said he was waiting for 15 minutes. We ended up noticing on the fire plan that there was another set of elevators in the stairway; they may have been service elevators as they were bigger and not as "nice" but it didn't say they were off limits so we ended up taking them because the wait was ridiculous. 

Another major design flaw was in my bathroom. As I mentioned we had 2 rooms, a regular room and a more expensive city view room. The bathroom in the regular room was fine, but the bathroom in the city view room was comically small compared to how large the room itself was. Somehow the smaller/cheaper room had a bigger and better bathroom. The regular room had a bathtub, the city view room just had the shower. I couldn't sit on the toilet without my legs hitting the sink. And worst of all, the sink was a pedestal without room to put anything on either side, which the hotel accommodated for with a ledge that runs the length of the bathroom. That's fine, except the ledge protrudes over the sink. So if you bend down to wash your face, there's a good chance you're going to hit your head on the ledge if you aren't careful. It's baffling considering how nice the room was, and how the bathroom felt like an after thought. 

Another disappointment was that the bar, Randolph's, was closed. We have stayed at the hotel before and Randolph's is quite good. I'm sure it's due to Covid, and we were told we could enjoy a drink at Murals 52 (their restaurant across the lobby) but neither the ambiance or selection were nearly as good. 

Another issue that we had was with the bell service. We had about 15 bags among our party, and I asked for a cart to assist. There was one (very hard working) bellman on staff and he said that I would have to bring the bags into the hotel to load it on the cart, as they had no way to get the cart curbside. However, as I said he appeared to be the ONLY one working, which on Sunday was clearly insufficient. He was trying to help guests with their bags on check in, help guests checking out store their bags, and get luggage up to the rooms all at the same time. Hire more staff.

In general the staff was very friendly and hardworking...our waiter in Murals apologized that the bar wasn't open and he offered to make us a drink that wasn't on the menu if they had the ingredients. The lobby staff was very attentive, and asked patrons to put on masks if they took them off, and gave one to a girl who said she didn't have one. The hotel itself felt clean, but it does feel small in the lobby and hallways.

Our room was a good size, and the TV had a lot of channels if you're into that. The rooms and bathrooms are very dark though, so if someone in your party needs light to get ready you may want to bring your own. The light in the hallway in our room was on a dimmer, but it flickered at it's highest setting and just wasn't bright enough otherwise so we had to leave it off. Our city view room had 2 sets of windows; one faced immediately into a building across the way, and the other also faced part of a building but also part of the street. So of the 4 windows, we were really only comfortable having one open at all times to let in light, otherwise we could see people in the other windows (and, could be seen by them). 

Overall, you can't beat the Warwick for it's value and location. If the bar were open it would have added another star. The elevators are a major deterrent that can lead to frustration, and the lobby and shared areas are tight. Thankfully the rooms, outside of some of the bathrooms, are spacious. We have stayed at the Warwick in the past and would again, just know what you are getting into with the wait if the hotel is crowded.

title: Wonderful Week at the Warrick and New York
text:
Great Return to The Warrick and New York

A wonderful week at the Warrick after a long absence from New York.  I enjoyed the benefits of an On The Avenue Suite, a corner suite with large sets of windows looking onto the Sixth Avenue.  A large bedroom with another set of windows above 54th street.  Truly exceptional.  

Safety precaution in place for COVID-19  and with that of course, some services were reduced.  Nonetheless, everything I required was available.  Much appreciated the mini-fridge which made storing items purchase from the nearby deli a breeze.  

The staff, as always, were helpful and welcoming.  So excited to see NYC coming back!

Thanks for a great return stay!  Looking forward to Christmas!

title: Exceeds 4 star hotel
text: We got the cheapest room and werent sorry. We were snug as bugs in room 3002. Room was less than 100 per nite. Wow. Room was clean and cozy. Service was excellent. There was tons of signage abt elevator limits due to covid. Some people ignored it but it wasnt the hotels job to yell at them. I thought in the time of covid, it was great. PS wish you could have coffee in room or somewhere in hotel

title: Not even close to 4 star hotel
text: For context my intent was for this to be a Babymoon with my wife. This isn’t anywhere close to a 4 star hotel. The hotel is quite outdated. The rooms aren’t very clean (stains on upholstery and sheets, pulled up carpet, loud air unit, cigarette butts left on terrace on arrival, gross sticky goo from when everything was taken out of the mini bar for COVID regulations I presume). The elevators are falling apart, literally falling apart (a mounted solid molding just fell out randomly and almost hit someone in the elevator). There’s a pandemic and NO ONE in the hotel is monitoring packed elevators with unassociated people from the lobby (floors can’t expect to monitor). Only one floor (18th floor) with ice machine in appx. 30 floor hotel. Just an EPIC waste of money and massive disappointment.

title: A Day in NYC
text: The hotel serves the purpose:  a reasonably priced place to stay in  NYC in a good location.  It is nothing special but it is not bad.  There were a few things little things that should be addresses:  no trashcan in the bathroom, NO TISSUES in the room, no outlets near the bed for charging phone.  Front desk was helpful & attentive.  Room was clean.  Great location.  (was visiting daughter at Fordham Lincoln Ctr Campus)  The parking was an issue but that is not the fault of the hotel.  Parking across street...could not find our car...took 30min to resolve.

title: Great stay
text: My son and I stayed 5 nights at the Warwick and it was incredible. The room was great and had a wonderful view of midtown. The staff was super nice and very helpful, especially Marc. He walked us through our entire stay before we arrived.

title: Worst Hotel Experience ever
text:
I hope someone actually reads these reviews and do something about this. This has by far been my worst experience in a hotel. Warwick to me felt like an overpriced motel in the middle of Manhattan. I checked into a room that was dirty and not ready for any guests. Linen on the bed was dirty, stained and full had dirty particles on them. Water was muddy and brown and felt like it had not been run for weeks. Took pictures of these and Jahmal(God bless him), who was working at the front desk that night switched my room. 
I got a new room which was much bigger and cleaner than the other one but that had its own problems. This room had a connecting door to another guest’s room and OMG the two nights we spent together with these guests were hell. I complained several times to the front desk and even to the manager about these people smoking weed in the room and nothing happened. My room felt smelled weed. Apart from that these other guests in the connecting room stayed up and partied and made so much noise till almost 5am. This I complained to front desk and manager as well. I had a 5 month old baby with me and my wife and and you can imagine what it felt like for him. Our baby only was able to sleep the last night we spent in the room by which time the other guests had already moved out. My wife called the front desk around 4am about the noise complaint on our second night and was told they would look at our bill and make adjustments which they never did after we checked out. 
I still don’t understand why after all the complaints I made they didn’t do anything about the smoking and noise they had to wait till they checked out to fine them 300 dollars fro smoking in the room...at least that’s what i was told. The hotel prioritized a 300 dollar fine instead of the comfort and safety of their guests. 
When I asked for was clothes the night before checkout i was told they had none and the lady at front desk said to call in the morning for was clothes. I called in the morning and was told house keeping would bring up some wash clothes...that never came!!!
Only positive from my stay there was Jahmal at front desk. He was always professional. Manager offered to switch my room again but I couldn’t go through packing our things again and moving another four floors down.

title: Disappointing Front Desk Service
text: We ordered a pizza from a nearby restaurant. I expected the front desk to call us and let us know it had arrived, they did not call. Our pizza was sitting down in the lobby for at least 15 minutes. By the time we received it, it was cold. As for the amenities, there is no microwave or fridge in our room, so we weren't even able to heat up our pizza. We are extremely disappointed in the quality of the TV reception as well.

title: Amazing reprieve from the real world
text:
We've stayed at the Warwick 3 times. This was our first time back in 2 years. Obviously staying during covid was a unique experience but the customer service here is second to none. While it's an older building, the staff make up for the lack of modern features. We checked in and we completely forgot that an older building would shut their AC off in the winter and switch to heat. My partner is asthmatic and needs the room cold. We didn't have a city view, but rather a regular room, which faced a brick wall so we couldn't get air. Vilma at the front desk was so kind and patient with us. She moved us to a street view so we could get a crisp breeze and keep the room chilly. Everyone from the bellman to the housekeeping crew was smiling and doing their best to make NYC feel magical in the midst of covid. I can't say enough about Vilma though. She was one of the most patient and empathetic people I've ever met in hospitality. We are already planning our spring trip in March and can't wait to come back.

They also did a great job with Christmas decorations. Everything was impeccable and it really helped us refresh and reset from the hellish year. 10/10

title: Covid safety concerns
text:
I stayed at the Warwick in NYC in October 2020 and unfortunately had a terrible experience.  Upon entering I noticed a large ugly stain on the floor in the hallway of my room.  I'm not sure what it was (blood? mud? vomit?) but it's right in front of the door and bathroom so a constant reminder of an unclean room.  In the bathroom I immediately noticed and reported that the toilet seat and toilet cover were sopping wet all over.  I had to wipe them down with a towel.  The toilet ran continuously -- and the dripping noise kept me up at night.  On the second day, the faucet handle fell off and I was no longer able to run cold water in the sink.

I sent several emails to Larry, a manager but he never replied.  I also tried calling guest services. It goes to voicemail.  I finally spoke to someone and requested help from a manager but received none. When I booked the room, I was told that nobody enters the rooms including housekeeping in order to maintain Covid health and safety protocols.  Despite this, upon returning one afternoon, I noticed someone had been in my bathroom.  I did not authorize entry and was not aware someone would be entering my bathroom.  Whoever it was may not have been wearing a mask or gloves, exposing my personal belongings to their germs.

So if you want to stay in a clean, safe, sanitized hotel in NYC, with access to running water in the sink and a functional toilet, I'd have to advise against staying at the Warwick.

title: Quaint
text: Warwick is not just for tourists..locals who live here, love it! Quaint village, lovely town with great scenery, things to do, wineries, creameries, restaurants, craft beers, playgrounds, apple orchards..lots of farms and markets.. A definite go to..

title: Got a very good because of location mostly.
text: The price was good, the location is FANTASTIC, the room was 'okay' but not awful - took quick note of fraying lampshades and other unsightly elements in the room but all in all it wasn't an offensive room by any means either.

title: Comfortable, family-friendly, classy hotel
text:
we spend a lot of time in NYC because my daughter has medical appointments there often. The Ronald McDonald house is out for me after spotting a dark gray "mouse" running under a stove in one of the kitchens! Yuck. I know there are critters  in NYC, I just don't want to see them where my food is prepared. 

Warwick New York was a great choice for this trip. The location is easy access to everything, across from MoMA, walking distance to Central Park. The hotel is clean and pays attention to social distancing rules. Restaurants are slowly opening up  again and we enjoyed delivery of coffee and pancakes from the restaurant kitty-corner across the street, Astro restaurant. 

Didn't have the chance to do any exploring, but hopefully we will soon, once things get back to "normal." 

The people that work at are  Warwick New York are super nice and accommodating. Housekeeping came early in the morning, and I asked them to come back after 2 pm, and they did! It's so nice to come back to a clean room Warwick New York the beds made. 

Definitely will put this in our top 3 hotels in the city.

title: Terrible Customer Service
text: We booked with the Warwick well before COVID started for the end if August. For the past couple months we have been requesting a refund as we the border is still closed and we could no longer make our trip. The hotel declined to refund us multiple times. To decline a refund during a global pandemic is incredibly shady and greedy. All the other hotels we booked for the year refunded us immediately with no issue. That's not even the worst part. I looked up reviews of the Warwick to see if others had had issues with refunds and found out THE HOTEL IS CLOSED by other reviewers! So not only were they declining our refund requests, but if we had somehow managed to get to New York we wouldn't have had a place to stay when we showed up. The hotel fully knew they were closed when we requested our refund for not being able to travel over the border, but I guess they were hoping we wouldn't notice they are actually closed so they could keep our money. We called the hotel out on the fact that they were actually going to be closed for our trip and told them we would be talking to our credit card company if they chose not to refund us. They finally refunded us. We were planning to re-book with the Warwick for all of our future trips to New York but due to their less than honest communication with us and their greed we will not be booking with them in the future. I am seriously disgusted.

title: Warwick is Closed!
text: Made reservations on the hotel website.  it made not mention of the fact it is closed.  I even received an email confirmation of the reservation along with a reservation number.  When I arrived it was closed.  No answer at the front desk and no message stating it is closed.  Very very poor performance.

title: A Great Place to Stay
text:
We have been staying at The Warwick for approx. five years, each time we visit NY. It is in an excellent location with walking to Central Park, 5th Ave, Times Square, shopping and numerous subway stations. 

The hotel is the perfect size of not too large and impersonal and not too small. It has character and is cosy when the NY temperature drops. 

Our last visit was in February which we enjoyed having had a not great experience in November 2019 (although this was at an extremely busy time with NY Marathon on). It was good to see that the level of service was again high in February, the lift was fixed and the overall experience was positive. 

The rooms have not changed in the time that we've been visiting and they could do with a freshen up but it is still our hotel of choice when in NY.

title: Married anniversary januruari 2020
text:
Wij hebben dit hotel gekozen voor 10 dagen. We  hadden een kamer gekregen echt precies naast de lift.. toen we hadden ingechecked kregen we een uur later happy married anniversary bord met champagne. Dat was wel leuk gedaan!!!

De eerste paar nachten waren vreselijk. Naast de lift en heel veel herrie s’ochtends van mensen naar de lift en van uit de lift. Echt vreselijk! Daar werden we steeds wakker van en ook van het dicht gaan van hotel kamer deurs...

Heb het na 4 nachten aangegeven, omdat we echt niet onze rust konden pakken. Toen zijn we paar verdiepingen lager gegaan, wat ook vreselijk was. Naast ons een kamer zat een gezin die elke keer super laat terug kwam en s’ochtend heel veel lawaai maakten en ook alle hotel kamer deuren gaan zo hard dicht. Vreselijk.

Als je echt je rust wilt pakken.. NIET dit hotel kiezen. Wij hebben 10 dagen onze rust niet kunnen pakken.. dat we echt de laatste dagen s’middags moesten slapen, zodat het heel rustig was.
