Hotel voor de prijs is het wel te duur ook de service en eten vond ik te duur voor wat je kreeg. Zelfs ontbijt was echter veel te duur voor wat je kreeg..... gwn bijna €65,- voor de 2de foto. 

Dit is meer een hotel voor zakelijke mensen die vroeg op moeten staan.

title: Amazing Experience At The Warwick
text: This was our second visit to the Warwick. The staff is amazing. Everyone goes out of there way to make you feel welcome. We were fortunate enough to be greeted by Vilma both times. She is amazing! She is so knowledgeable and professional. She actually remembered us from our previous stay. The hotel is full of history! Rooms are lively. The Randolph’s restaurant and lounge has great drinks and a nice menus. Service is great too!

title: Lovely room shame about the noise
text: We stayed here for 4nights, beds were comfortable but the noise from construction work outside through the night was very loud and couldn’t get much sleep, windows are very thin was also cold in the room. We didn’t have breakfast there as prices are very expensive for what you get. Unfortunately we will not be staying here again, but it is a lovely building to look at.

title: Beautiful Midtown Hotel
text: When you walk into the Warwick you feel like you just stepped back in time. The staff is phenomenal, the hotel is beautiful and it is perfectly located. If you love architecture, you will love just walking around the lobby of this hotel. When you stay here, you are 5 quick blocks to central park 5 blocks to Rockefeller Center (great during Christmas).  If you are coming to Manhattan, this is by far one of my favorite NYC hotels. Give it a shot. They won't disappoint.

title: Honey I’m home
text:
My home away from home. Friends booked me another hotel. I ran within 1 night to the Warwick Hotel and was warmly welcomed by all the staff. Immediately booked for 16 nights and was given a fantastic suite with balcony. The BEST for such a long stay. Heaps of room, all I needed including a small fridge, comfy living room and spacious bedroom. My best vacation. Attentive staff, great people in Randolph’s bar. I like the somewhat Art Deco old style of this hotel. This is no sleep factory but a personal approach hotel. I’m going again in 6 months and am bringing more friends to celebrate my birthday. Where else
Ps location super central. WiFi good. Room service great. Food yumm

title: Brilliant Hotel in Midtown Manhattan
text: The hotel is in a very central location close to all of the major attractions most within walking distance. We loved everything about our stay at the Warwick, the staff were friendly and helpful, our room was large, comfortable, quiet, and the hotel has retained that charm from a bygone era. We would highly recommend the Warwick for anyone considering where to stay in NYC, you won't be disappointed, my wife and I would definitely stay there again.

title: Perfect hotel for NYC visit.
text: Location is perfect for uptown and midtown exploration. Downtown easily accessible. Staff are very friendly and the rooms feel upscale and high quality. Lovely bar downstairs with food. Bed and pillows were comfortable and shower was powerful. Toilet was a little bit loud at night sometimes, refilling. They put out prosecco and strawberries for a special occasion which was a real nice touch and very much appreciated. Thank you for a lovely time.

title: Nicely surprised,
text:
Without hesitation, my fiancé and I would recommend The Warwick Hotel NYC to any of our close friends or relatives. Our corner suite was large, filled with light, extremely comfortable, perfectly clean and with more than adequate closet space. It was bigger than many NYC apartments! Though the furniture and room decor were hardly state of the art, it had the well known comfortable and welcoming quality of gemultlikeit. 
One added plus is the central and convenient location of the hotel. Superb!

title: A jewel in the middle of Manhattan
text: After staying at several other locations in Manhattan, the Warwick has become my home away from home. The location near Central Park, theatre district and amazing restaurants makes it the perfect place to stay especially in winter months. The hotel staff was professional, accommodating and ready to help with special arrangements along with suggestions to help us enjoy our stay. There is a charm about the Warwick that makes returning to it at the end of a long  day exploring New York City that makes you relax and smile as you enter into the front lobby.

title: Perfect!
text: We stayed here for 3 nights with our one year old last month. It was perfect. Old New York glamour, excellent location (half way between Central Park and the Rockefeller Centre) most of the things we wanted to do were within a very short walking distance, close to subway stations etc. The room was lovely, bright, clean, fresh. The bed was comfy and the shower was good! A cot was put in the room ready for our arrival too. We’d definitely stay here again, 10/10 from us!

title: Fantastic Place To Stay
text:
The Warwick Hotel is everything you want a Hotel to be.   It is beautiful,
    Clean, has everything you need.  Two excellent restaurants an amazing
    accommodating staff who is friendly, and eager to help you.   I feel
    like a Queen when I stay there.   My number one place to stay when visiting
    New York.

title: Slightly disappointing, in need of more politeness
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights in February. The hotel is extremely centrally located, it has some charm - being old - but also somewhat worn down. Most of the employees were friendly, the room was relatively clean - but again it had not been renovated for some years. I had booked the room through their own web-site. We were three, one adult and two children. According to the print-out of our booking; "breakfast on us" and booked for two adults and one child. We only received two vouchers for breakfast. Thus I asked politely for another voucher at the front-desk. The man at the front-desk (he said he was the manager..) declined to give us another voucher - according to him the offer was for two with breakfast. I tried to explain that when booking there was no indication that the third person would not have breakfastr and that according to the print-out we had booked for three persons  -with breakfast.  This was a minor issue - our daughter, (12 years - 30-35 kg) doesn`t eat much for breakfast - that would certainly not ruin the economy - the behaviour of this manager is a much greater threat - he was rude, unfriendly and when he at last gave us the third voucher - his non-verbal communication was extremely negative. The front desk director later apologized. Possibly the web-pages had given some information (with very small letters) that there was only breakfast for two - but there was no possibility to add breakfast for the third guest - and absolutely no need to treat a guest patronizingly and insolently.
Our room was located towards 6th Avenue. Due to some reapir of the street, every vehicle passing by made a noise like a minor thunder-storm. I tried to ask for another room at the front-desk, but their response was that they had no responsibility for the noise.... The air-condition/heating system sounded like an agricultural machine in desperate need of maintenance and lubrication. Four nights sleep disturbed.... 
THis could have been a four-star hotel, but today they do not deserve more than 2 or art most 3 stars.

title: I Love the Warwick!!!!!!
text: Another great anniversary weekend at our favorite hotel. I always feel like I am a guest in someone's home and they let us stay in the nicest bedroom in the mansion. Our room was quiet and clean. It is hard to beat the location for Broadway shows, MOMA, shopping on 5th Avenue and excellent restaurants. We ate at Utsav and Mont Blanc 52 this time both of which were excellent. The staff at the desk and on the floor are always cheerful and accommodating.Of course, we want to return.

title: Dirty and full of hidden charges
text:
I stayed here for six nights for work. The room was dirty (stains on the bedclothes, dried pee on the toilet seat, and an empty water bottle on the floor that still remained after I left).
The staff was generally polite, but some of the doormen were selective regarding who is helped pushing the really heavy swinging door. (I had to do it myself most of the time).
The final surprise was learning that I had to pay $163 for "facilities", even though the room was prepaid. I'm assuming this was for using the lift, as those were the only "facilities" I ever used.
On the positive side, the room was large - but so dark that all lights had to be turned on also during the day. Location is also good.

title: Charming
text: I loved the style of this hotel and the service is really kind. We had a corner room from where you get to see two streets, amazing! Very well located in midtown mangattan. The breakfast sometimes is too crowded since the space might be a little small, but still the whole experience is fantastic!

title: Personal
text: This was our second stay at the Warwick NY.  We returned because the location can’t be beat!  This stay was even better than the first time. If you’re looking for a hotel that feels like New York City, has quality personal service, is reasonably priced and very conveniently located for walking or subway access to popular attractions, the Warwick won’t disappoint.

title: Just OK
text: We ( me and my family ) spent 1 week at Warwick Hotel New York. The early checkin was possible ( Sunday morning ) and we appreciated that , but since the checkin until checkout the reception staff was professional but very cold. The room was also nice , but unfortunately I had the unpleased experience to have a cockroach inside the room for two days in a row. The staff, once again offered to change room or a daily tax free. The morning cleaning was nice. The hotel location is good, walking distance from the main NY attractions and good restaurants around. We did not have experience with the breakfast, restaurants or gym. Overall our experiencie was ook.

title: Granddaughter’s birthday weekend
text: Wonderful hotel in a perfect location for walking to restaurants, shows and shopping The room and bedding  was extremely comfortable and perfectly appointed. Hallways are very quiet and the room felt soundproofed Slept very well. The bathroom was good sized and modern.Randolphs on the first floor had a cozy bar with drinks and pub style food which was excellent and well priced. Staff all helpful and friendly I would definitely recommend and return again if in New York

title: Lovely place to stay
text: We were warmly welcomed when checking in. The service was friendly & efficient. The room was very spacious with a handy kitchenette area & a very comfortable bed. Good views onto 6th Avenue, the road was being worked on but the room was not affected by excessive noise. An all round nice place to stay.

title: Business Trip for two nights - wonderful location and hotel
text: I recently stayed two nights for a business trip and thoroughly enjoyed my stay here.  The staff was nice and let me check in a bit early.  They upgraded me to a King Suite which was huge and especially for a NYC hotel room.    I was so pleasantly surprised.   They had a nice breakfast buffet and I received the continental breakfast as part of my rate which was nice as well.   There was a fridge, microwave, keurig machine and safe in my room, along with a stocked minibar (of course costing a lot of $$).   Very happy with this hotel and would stay here again in a heart beat.

title: excellent choice
text: This was my first time staying at the Warwick and it will not be my last.  Everyone there was friendly and welcoming.  Not just at check in but every time we came back from our adventures in the city.  Rooms are a great size too.  Can't wait to return!

title: wonderful hotel right in the heart of things
text: We love to stay at the Warwick Hotel. It is right near the Plaza, Radio City and so many other fun things. It is clean and good size rooms. The cleaning lady was so sweet and did a great job. The Door man was super helpful and friendly. We have stayed at places like the Trump and Plaza, and now the Warwick is our place to stay. The price is great for the location.

title: NYC 2020
text: We have stayed at the Warwick once before.  It does not disappoint.  Located on the upper east side at 6th Ave and 54th, it is in a great location.  Premiere room was beautifully appointed (although small) and service was great.  I will say that our first stay was in a Suite, and it was absolutely perfect.  Large accommodations with Living/Dining room and a separate bedroom.  I think we will choose the Suite on our next trip.  Again, the room was very nice - just small.  The lobby restaurant serves breakfast/brunch each day with your choice of a buffet or menu selection.  Additionally, the lobby bar attracts alot of locals (not just hotel patrons) and they have a nice menu selection for lunch and dinner.  We will certainly be going back again.

title: Excellent customer service
text: I had a 2 night reservation at the Warwick that I had to cancel at the last minute.  In fact I was so sick my husband had to call for me.  He was amazed at how friendly and understanding the desk staff who took his call were.  I am sad I missed this trip to NYC (and lost out on my airfare - no compassion there!) but I will 100% stay at the Warwick on my next trip in appreciation for how they handled this.  Thank you!

title: great visit
text: Great experience was a little pricey but overall memorable experience. Would definitely recommend this trip to others and come back for another visit. Everything was in traveling distance but i did Wish there was a free shuttle to the hotel.

title: Great Central Location!!!
text: If you are looking for a hotel in the middle of Manhattan that provides outstanding value, the Warwick is a prime hotel to consider.  Accommodations and staff are top notch.  The location is simply fantastic - walking distance to so many Manhattan venues.

title: Great value in NYC
text: We are regular visitors to New York and out hotel of choice is the Warwick. We generally take an On The Avenue Suite and even on prolonged trips we are never short of living space, sleeping space and storage space (never a given however expensive the hotel). The position is central with a good choice of places to eat within walking distance and we are made to feel welcome every time we come through the door.

title: Classic Charm!
text:
The Warwick is our "go to" hotel whenever visiting Manhattan.  The staff, the accommodations and most of all the service have never disappointed.  The location is very convenient to Broadway shows, Radio City, and other sites of interest.  We almost always visit Randolph's once or twice during our stays.  Wonderful food and beverage and usually we meet some interesting patrons; many repeat guests like we are.

Every so often, the elevators are problematic--a bit slow or over crowded, but nothing we can't deal with.  It would also be helpful if the bathroom lighting could be brighter.  However in the grand scheme of things, you can't miss at the Warwick!

title: Wonderful hotel with convenient location and access to everything!
text: The Warwick is conveniently located at 54th and 6th Avenue in the heart of Manhattan.  Our corner room was spacious and appropriately appointed with all amenities needed. We enjoyed using the exercise room during the early morning hours and could relax in 'Randolphs' Bar in the evening.  The Warwick is our hotel of choice given so many other  hotels to choose from.

title: Wonderful Historical Hotel
text:
We had the pleasure of staying at the Warwick this weekend. I was looking forward to staying at this historical luxury hotel.

Positives -
Classy Warm Room
They were so courteous and gave us an upgrade
Amazing Location

Negatives -
No coffee maker in room
Mattress not preference

As a whole really wonderful place for my family and I. Courteous staff. Would recommend hotel has history pamphlets up front to read about the Hotels rich past.
Definitely would happily stay again.

title: Holidays
text:
I went on holiday to New York for 4 days because New York is the most famous city in the USA.I went there to do some visits and activities.
I flew at 8am from Paris airport so we had to take the train from Saint-Etienne to Paris and we arrived at 10.30am (England time)
Around 11am, we packed our bags at the Warwick New York Hotel which is located at 65 West 54th Street, New York, NY 10019-5404 near some great restaurants and near Times Square, and Central Park...
Then we went to lunch at Amy's Bread which is a nice vegetarian bakery, I chose to eat Chocolate Caramel Tarts that cost $6.50 and my friends took the Red Velvet Heart for 8 dollars.
Then we were going for a walk in Central Park, this park is really super big. After that we went to the restaurant which is Loeb Boathouse Central Park we both ate a breakfast. After that we got back to the hotel.

On the second day we went shopping at Fifth Avenue, we ate at the hotel.

On the third day we went to Times Square and I was impressed by its giant screens, background sirens of police cars or even fire trucks.
We ate at Carmine's Italian Restaurant that day.
After that we went to the Empire State Building, we took a lot of photo's overthere and the place was magical.

On the fourth we had to fly back to France
My trip to New York is the shortest I've done

For my next trip to New York I would like see Brooklyn Bridge because is the oldest  bridge  in New York and if I would have had a lot of time I'll eat to Balthazar.

title: Luxury the old-fashioned way
text:
January is a great month to visit NYC. Hotel prices are lower than usual and the crowds are smaller. We decided to try this lovely old hotel and were so pleasantly surprised. Management has found a way to upgrade the place while keeping the Old World charm.
The staff were all pleasant and helpful. We did not have a negative encounter with anyone.
We were given a lovely, large room on the 4th floor. The bed was comfortable and the shower was great. One caveat: Sixth Avenue is a busy thoroughfare 24/7. The hotel's quality windows and draperies keep the noise to a minimum but on a lower floor you still do hear some street noise. If you are a light sleeper, you might ask for a room on a higher floor.

title: Warwick New York
text: Loved this hotel.  Our room was perfect for the 3 of us. The bed was great, the room and bathroom was always clean when we came back in.  The employees were so nice to us and gave us great advise on some of the places we were able to go see.

title: Excellent 10 day stay
text:
The Warwick is a lovely "period style" hotel with a great location between Times Square and Central Park.  I was given a large suite overlooking 6th Avenue on the 30th Floor complete with fridge and coffee machine.  Housekeeping were terrific with a spotless room every day.  The bed was comfortable too.
We spent some time in Randolph's bar with varying service from excellent to ok - some more smiles might be nice but it does get busy. It does cater to the business/conventions market overflow from the Hilton across the street.
I would definitely stay there again!!
Plenty of local restaurants and a supermarket close by

title: Clean and great location
text: The hotel was clean and a GREAT location. Honestly, those are two of the most important things for me. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. The housekeeping staff was a little TOO much, they came to our room several times a day asking if we needed anything even though they had just cleaned. I appreciate the diligence but being disturbed 4 and 5 times in one day is a lot. Also, the doormen were RUDE and watched me struggle with my luggage twice without helping as well as getting in and out of a cab in dress clothes and heels in the rain. Not helpful at all and wouldn’t respond when I said good morning or good evening. Otherwise, great stay!!

title: Great location for long NYC weekend
text: Loved this location - great for walking to Central Park, Theater District, MOMA, 5th Ave, and Upper East Side.  Room and bathroom larger than expected.  Would stay again without a second thought.  We felt the rate was very reasonable for location, room size, and overall experience.

title: Terrific Hotel!!!
text: I stay at the Warwick whenever I come to New York, for business or pleasure. Everything, from the great location, to the ample size of the rooms, to the helpful and charming and consistent staff, makes this landmark hotel a true home-away-from-home, which I wholeheartedly appreciate. See you next time!

title: Albergo storico
text:
Il solito Hotel dove alloggio normalmente a New York era tutto pieno, quindi la scelta è caduta su questo storico Hotel di New York. La scelta ci ha soddisfatto pienamente per quanto riguarda la posizione (eccezionale), il servizio (reception, concierge, Randolph's restaurant e portiere), la stanza confortevolissima e ben tenuta, la pulizia.
Con una piccola quota aggiuntiva ci hanno dato una suite molto grande (65 mq) dotata di tutti i comfort. Il personale alla concerne è stato prodigo di consigli rivelatisi tutti perfetti.
Nota negativa: scortesia e maleducazione del personale e del direttore (direttrice) della sala colazione. Tremenda. Arrogante. Alla fine siamo sempre andati a fare colazione fuori dall'Hotel pur di non incontrarla.

title: Mrs
text: The hotel was so accommodating!  House keeping did a fantastic job and my overall experience was fabulous   We also had room service that was very prompt and upon arrival had a small lunch in the lounge  the only negative I have is the only Red wine was Columbia Crest and they need a better selection

title: Hôtel bien situé
text:
Hôtel bien situé au pied de Central Park, très beau et très bien entretenu. 
les chambres sont spacieuses et bien équipées. 
Points négatifs, le personnel ne fait  aucun effort avec les français, lorsqu’on demande un service on attend 3 heures à l’accueil que quelqu’un daigne s’occuper de nous... 
Du 11 eme étage, on entend comme si on était dans la rue,   on entend pas les voisins par contre les portes claquées sans arrêt. Dans la salle de bain 1 simple vasque pour 4, pas de balai à chiotte et le papier toilette est plus que moyen sinon a part ça très bon séjour pour le peu de temps que nous y avons passé sur 7 jours😜

title: A hotel living on its memories
text: We stayed here in December over the Christmas period in a suite and wasn't impressed with what we got on the price we paid. The suite was for 4 people (2 double beds) we had 1 bathrobe! 2 coffee cups, 2 glasses, no bottled water! this was a must as the water from the taps had a terrible taste. The coffee machine had nowhere to plug into so we had to make hot drinks on the floor next to the nearest plug socket. We had no breakfast tea, only green/peach flavoured tea, we asked at reception, and was rudely told they don't have any. Next day we saw maintenance man, and he said they had some and promptly left 4 sachets, but these were never replenished. The AC/heating units were noisy and had to be switched off at night. The units along with the windows let in cold air. The running joke was that they were made of swiss cheese. The so-called double glazing was non-existent and didn't do anything to stop the very early (6 am) construction work opposite and the pneumatic drill wars at 12:40 am, yes 40 minutes past midnight! When trying to request a late checkout, we were told to ask on the morning of check out, we could not do it the night before, the reception staff were not helpful, the maids and maintenance folks were very helpful and pleasant. The doorman was pleasant but beyond him, you are not felt welcome. I would not recommend staying at this hotel. It lives off its historical image and convenient location.

title: I wanted so much to really like this hotel, but they don't make it easy!
text: There is nothing to be said about the location, and the bellmen... who are helpful and very courteous,  But I found the reception staff unfriendly (except when we arrived at midnight on Monday the 30th)... it seems they are all too busy to smile or go the extra yard!  The bar at Randolf's makes a good martini and the food there is not bad for bar food.  Our room was big enough, however, the closet was tiny (and in the winter just not enough space to hang clothes for two, and the bathroom is just not up to par: there is no hand shower, so to turn on the shower, you get totally soaked (if you don't want to wet your hair, even though you wear a shower cap, it is still difficult to adjust the heat of the water!)   It also smelled of mold! The bed was comfortable.  The hotel is showing its age, and somehow, it is not being properly updated and taken care of.  It is a shame as it is in a great location.

title: Un hotel con encanto
text:
Precioso, con mucha historia y encanto, nos gustó ver las fotos que tienen de las celebridades que se han hospedado ahí, incluso Cary Grant vivió un tiempo en este hotel. Desde la entrada todo es muy lindo, nosotros fuimos en Navidad y estaba muy bien decorado, nos gustó que el lobby no es enorme, es muy acogedor, clásico y elegante. El restaurante del desayuno también es muy bonito y a pesar de no ser muy grande, lo más que tuvimos que esperar por una mesa fueron 10 minutos, el buffet era variado, tenían un tocino delicioso, el pan francés y los wafles no estaban tan buenos. El Randolph’s Bar siempre estaba muy animado, con mucha gente, nos pareció que es un lugar visitado no solo por los huéspedes del hotel, sino también por los locales.

La ubicación no podría ser mejor, a unas cuadras de Rockefeller Center, del Radio City Music Hall, del Central Park, de 5th Avenue, Times Square; se puede llegar a todos estos lugares caminando.

Las habitaciones son amplias y cómodas, la decoración bonita, aunque los muebles están un poco viejos, pero bien cuidados. Solo dos “peros” le pongo a este hotel. El primero es que la limpieza de las habitaciones no es su fuerte, no es que estuviera sucia, eso para mí es lo peor en un hotel, sino que la limpieza diaria no la hacen con cuidado, no pasan bien la aspiradora y había algo de polvo, si por ejemplo había alguna basura tirada en la alfombra, no la levantaban. Afortunadamente el baño sí estuvo muy limpio todos los días. 

El otro problema fue en la recepción la noche que llegamos, nuestro vuelo aterrizó muy tarde y estuvimos dos horas en la fila de migración, pues solo había un oficial atendiendo; acabamos llegando al hotel como a las 2:30 am.Teníamos pre pagadas dos habitaciones con vista a la calle, y solo nos dieron una de esa categoría, la otra era interior, muy obscura pues daba a una pared, le explicamos al señor de la recepción que no solo teníamos reservadas, sino ya pagadas las dos habitaciones con vista a la calle, cuya tarifa es mayor, nos dijo que estaban llenos y que era lo único que tenían. Considero que aunque llegamos muy tarde, si ya habíamos pagado por la habitación, nos la debían de haber respetado; como solución nos ofreció que al día siguiente nos darían otra habitación y que su personal haría el cambio de nuestras cosas después de medio día. Nosotros teníamos planes para estar fuera del hotel todo ese día, y no queríamos que movieran  nuestras cosas sin estar presentes y sin siquiera ver cuál habitación nos iban a dar, entonces decidimos quedarnos. El cuarto estaba bien y era cómodo, pero nos hizo falta ver el cielo, no se podía saber si estaba el día nublado o soleado. 

Todo el personal fue siempre muy amable, excepto el señor que nos recibió en la madrugada, seguramente no le gusta tener que trabajar a esas horas, pero nosotros veníamos muy cansados de un vuelo largo y de horas en migración, hubiera sido bueno recibir un poco de cortesía de su parte.

A pesar de estos inconvenientes, sin duda nos volveríamos a hospedar en el Warwick.

title: Quelle déception....
text:
Par où commencer ...

Après un accueil peu chaleureux, nous intégrons les chambres de ce célèbres 5 étoiles à la suite  de nombreuses heures passées dans les transports nous amenant jusqu’à notre rêve New Yorkais!! Et comment dire, personne pour nous amener jusqu’à nos chambres et aucune explication pour les trouver!! Ça commence mal, après un petit moment d’adaptation et une boussole, nous y voilà!! Mais tiens au prix ou l’on paye cette chambre, ne vous attendez pas à avoir une bouteille d’eau ou un thé, ils vous seront facturé directement!! Pas de petites attentions pour les clients !! Bon déjà le ton est donné!! On retire une étoile!! Le lit est correct mais la salle de bain minuscule, il faut se faufiler entre l’évier et les WC pour fermer la porte « de chantier » dont la poignée ne tiens plus ... on va pas tarder à retirer une seconde étoile!! Ne vous faite pas couler de bain, l’eau est marron .... le ménage est fait très rapidement et l’état des moquettes vous le révèle assez tôt!! Quand aux prises, elles sont inexistantes et celles sous le bureau sont dans un état!! Attention au coup de jus!!

Petit final, lors de votre départ, vérifiez la note, on vous facture des boissons du mini-Bar alors que nous ne l’avons pas ouvert du séjour.... 

Bref à éviter, l’image de cette hôtel est flou et son prestige n’est plus de ce monde.

title: A éviter....mais vraiment !!!
text:
URGENT.....À ÉVITER...
Hôtel en triste état, cher pour les prestations...ménage bas de gamme, peinture, mur et moquette sont humides.
Là ventilation fait un bruit incroyable.
Plus rien ne tient, même les robinets ne sont plus maintenu.
J ai fais des photos, vous vous rendrez compte pour vous même.
Ah oui aussi, rigide, le personnel est comparable à une porte de prison.
Bref.....à éviter à tout prix au risque de gâcher votre voyage.

title: Terrible. So many better options
text:
This hotel really is something else. 
One, the room and bathroom were not very clean. Bathroom was very small, rust on the floor, hair in the sink and shower. 
Two, every time you open the door you get shocked by the door handle. This happened to everyone in my family. We needed to use a towel to open the door. 
Three, elevators were extremely slow and we had to use the faculty elevators to get up to our room. 
Fourth, I left my AirPods on the counter of the room, I called up the hotel to ask them if they can find it for me since I had already checked out, they said they would call me back and never have. There goes my AirPods! 
Fifth, food at the hotel was very expensive and not very good at all. 

So for you sake I would really recommend staying somewhere else in Manhattan.

title: Pésima experiencia JAMÁS volveré a este hotel
text: Hado día años estuve en este hotel con la familia, nos gusto tanto que quisimos regresar este año. Lamentablemente nos fue pésimamente mal. MUY MAL TRATO de su gerente y gente de recepción. Una estafa, no respetaron mi reservación preparada y me hicieron volver a pagar para darme acceso aún habutacion como la que reserve. El hotel le falta mantenimiento, su instalaciones descuidadas y muy viejas. Lamento mucho pero JAMÁS volveré a este hotel. Cuidado con sus recepcionistas asiáticos que son muy groseros

title: Business Travel
text: Stay at the Warwick on a business trip. It was an average stay, however, the elevators weren't working and we had to take the service elevator after waiting at least 20 minutes. For the money that you pay you don't get amenities that one would expect from such an establishment. The checkout process was extremely painful. They waited until there were at least 7 people in line to assist. Those folks need some customer service training as they were short and rude.

title: Perfect location and excellent service
text:
My Daughter and I stayed for shopping / Ballet visit to NYC.  The Warwick was wonderful great location huge room and excellent service! 
Would chose this hotel again !  The food was good too !  They even provided umbrellas for us on a rainy day .

title: Exceeded Expectations in every way
text:
We stayed at The Warwick for a long weekend with our two school-age children to experience Christmas-time in New York. The reviews made me second-guess our choice because they made it seem like the hotel would be really out of date and run down. 
The hotel was absolutely perfect! I was shocked at the size of our room. Granted, it was not huge, but for New York, it was plentiful in terms of size and storage. We had a basic room with two double beds and it was absolutely fine for our family of four. The bathroom was even much larger than I expected. There was even a walk-in closet. The employees were extremely kind. My kids especially loved the door man with “his cool top hat”. The lobby was beautiful and comfortable with a gorgeous Christmas tree and nice music playing. 
You can’t beat the location. When you walk out of the building, Radio City Music Hall is right there. You are in walking distance to pretty much everything. Despite being right in the middle of everything, the street noise was not an issue at all and we all got a great night’s sleep each night. 
Overall, we were super impressed and will be excited to come back to The Warwick.

title: Go To Place
text: Several times a year my wife and I travel to NYC for a long weekend. We have stayed at several places but since finding the Warwick, we won't stay anywhere else in the City. Each time the staff is welcoming and professional. From the front desk to the housekeepers, they make you feel special and anticipate your every need. The hotel is always clean and its location in NYC is perfect. We and our friends would not sgay anywhere else when visiting the City.

title: NYC trip
text: This hotel exceeded our expectations.  Right before coming up I saw 1 poor review posted 2 days before our trip that said the elevators didn’t hardly work and the property was poorly maintained.  I found this hotel very clean and well maintained. All 3 elevators worked properly. Staff was very kind and thorough and room attendants were in and out and did a good job.  Only things I could point out were bathroom was a little small, but very nice. And if you have a room on the front side be careful opening up the drapes in the morning as a pervert right across the street  on the 18 th floor has binoculars and peeps in your window.  5-8 min walk to Times Square and plenty of restaurants.

title: Stay for Peter Stuyvesant Ball
text: Excellent rooms (slightly larger than usual for NY), clean, good service. Very decent breakfast included in hotel charge. Centrally located not far from Central Park, the MOMA et. etc. . I recommend this hotel for stays in NY NY.

title: Excelente ubicación y relación calidad - precio
text:
Es difícil encontrar hoteles de este nivel en NY en le rango de los 300 - 400 dólares. El Hotel Warwick es un excepción. Excelente ubicación para ir andando a todos sitios, habitaciones amplias, vestíbulo de esos antiguos que me encantan, y un restaurante abajo para tomar una copia pre o after diner, aunque los camareros son de todo menos amables, pero te lo tomas con sentido del humor, que fue lo que hice yo, y a disfrutar.

El aire de las habitaciones algo ruidoso, así que por la noche lo tenía apagado, Supongo que en verano a lo mejor es un problema. De todas formas, cuando vuelva por esta zona y sea invierno, posiblemente repetiré.

Servicio sencillamente correcto sin tirar cohetes. Y ascensores algo kiss, de esos que tardan mucho en llegar, pero preciosos por dentro.

title: Calm Oasis in the Midst of a Trumptastrophy
text: The president was across the street at the Hilton so all roads in the vicinity were shut down making check-in a challenge but thanks to the kindness of the NYPD and Secret Service we were permitted to off load passengers and luggage for our scheduled check-in.  The hotel staff were kind and accommodating so the stress of getting there was minimal under the extreme circumstances. Hats of to all who helped work things out. Good luck if it ever happens to you...parking reservations don't count if the street where you reserved is shut down. Ugh! That was a nightmare.

title: Overpriced for what you get!
text: We are currently staying here! Beautiful hotel and nice sized room, bathroom is small.  Amenities are lacking, only one washcloth for two people, and then down to no washcloths.  TV had no guide to show what was on.  The fixture on the bathtub was broken!

title: Never going back
text: Had booked "Premier Suite" to find out windows faced brick wall a few feet out.  Down graded and got reduced rate.  Dark room, no ambient light.  Property is very tired and worn.  Elevators are frequently out of service -- guests learn to use service elevators (we were here in March and October and elevators didn't  work then either).  Doorman are not helpful.  Good location but needs a lot of work.

title: Único ponto forte: localização.
text: É a terceira e última vez que ficaremos lá. O hotel está decadente. Velho. Mal cuidado. 3 mínimos elevadores que vivem lotados e te fazem esperar muito. Para piorar, estava sendo realizada uma feira de revendedores de sapatos no térreo e em apartamentos do hotel o que vez virar uma bagunça, cheio de gente não hóspede circulando pelos corredores, tirando a segurança dos hóspedes. Ficamos num quarto superior  péssimo no 11o andar: velho, cheio de infiltrações e mofo, cortinas imundas, não muito silencioso (mas estamos em NY), Roupas de cama velhas e de qualidade ruim. Pagamos por um quarto superior e era menor que um standard. Enfim, a única coisa que se salvou foi a localização excelente: menos burburinho que a Região da TS, ainda com um pouco do movimento da 5a, mas super acessível ao metrô - 3 estações super próximo que permitem acesso a qualquer parte da cidade- com muitos bons restaurantes, cafés, lojas bacanas.

title: Amazing Service
text:
I’m very pleased with the staff at the Warwick New York and specifically with Carlos Ventura who went above and beyond to help with a request I had during my stay.
Employees like him give a good name to anywhere they work and deserve recognition!. I left with a great impression of the Warwick because of him

title: Beautiful Hotel in Heart of Manhatten
text: This was a great hotel with luxurious lobby and amenities located near Broadway. convenient to Times Square and beautiful views from the rooms. It is not cheap but its a good value for New York. You will enjoy your stay here.

title: Great Location
text: The Warwick NY is well located for attending theater and strolling popular shopping areas including 5th Avenue and Madison Avenue.  The hotel is older but well-maintained.   Our room was spacious, but the bathroom was quite small.

title: Great stay, perfect location, not so friendly bar
text: I loved the stay overall. The room was spacious, esp for New York, quiet and well-maintained. The location was excellent. Easy walking to everywhere, nearby subway stop. I would definitely stay here again. My only quibble was getting ignored in the bar. Came in with a business colleague and the waitress ignored us. When he finally stopped her to ask a question, she acted annoyed and barked the answer. He insisted we leave, and we were on the corporate card! Foolish waitress. But otherwise, great stay.

title: GREAT
text: We enjoy everything about the Warwick:  friendly, professional staff; warm and  cosy rooms; delightful bar and restaurant.  The lobby is inviting, the rooms clean and comfortable, and the staff greets you with warmth and respect.  All good!  No!  I should say, all Excellent!

title: Will come back again
text:
Shopping and walking around the town was a great day ending with a wonderful meal at Frannies near the train station-farm fresh meal!
History in the buildings and churches. Not enough time to get to see winery but will come back!

title: Macy’s Parade 2019
text: We stayed at the Warwick for a couple nights over Thanksgiving. The hotel itself was very nice, the doorman was very friendly! Only complaints were the price $$$$$ however, we got front row out in front of our hotel for the parade which was an amazing experience! And the elevators are soooo slow and crowded!  We received bands to identify guests from the hotel to come inside the hotel during the parade Don’t drink from the mini bar 1 can of coke $6.53, there’s a Walgreens just up the road and plenty of Starbucks. The breakfast buffet was just ok I wouldn’t eat there again. The eggs were very runny! I would stay at this location again . A cap ride to LGA for 2 was just over $40, not terrible.

title: Thanksgiving visit
text: The Warwick is the Perfect place to spend time in New York City!  We watched the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade from our window. Walked to every event, including Rockette Spectacular Christmas Show, Broadway Shows, Time Square, 5the Avenue shopping and carriage ride in Central Park. The food is delicious at hotel restaurants and staff was superior. Room is drenched in history and regal surroundings. We loved our time here and give the experience a trip of a lifetime ten out of ten. Thank you Warwick for wonderful memories!

title: Very nice hotel in midtown Manhattan
text:
I stayed at this hotel for my holiday in NYC.

I enjoyed staying in this hotel, the room was nice, quiet,with 2 comfortable beds.
The size was enough, though the bathroom is a bit small , and the water system is a bit old.

Overall I recommend staying there.

The one thing I didn’t like, is the facility fee
of $25 per day , just to use WIFI, and business center.

title: Perfect For Macys Parade Dream
text: Booked the Warwick NYC over a year ago exclusively for the Parade.  Got a great in advance rate on their website for 2 nights in the Plus Suite 6th Ave view with two double beds.  Sign up for their Journeys loyalty program and had free WiFi that worked great inside and outside the morning of the parade.  We arrived early at 10:00am and front desk staff was friendly, welcoming, confirmed the waived fees and said the room was ready. Great surprise.  I Loved the Warwick.  Our room was on the 26th floor, very large with two queen beds, nice desk, closet, and the bathroom was great. The shower was awesome great for those that are tall. We were able to walk to most central places and easily took train nearby North then walked back. Parade morning at 4:30am I got a good spot out front and the teens enjoyed watching from window. By 11:00am we checked out and walked to nearby metro and was at the JFK airport by 12:00n.  I would and will highly recommend and will stay again.

title: Sightseeing
text: Stayed 4 nights at Warwick hotel on 6th Ave, 54th st. Beware booking direct with hotel as when we booked it was advertised as breakfast included by direct booking. When we arrived breakfast wasn't included after all, also VERY expensive to eat there, plenty of cheaper better value places for breakfast nearby. I cannot fault the cleanliness , it's also perfectly positioned to get out and about.

title: Huge bedroom with great view in Excellent Location but only one Bedside Light!
text: In a great location. The bedroom was huge and nicely furnished with double aspect windows with a great view onto 6th Avenue. Disappointed no bath but was afraid to ask to change in case we got an inferior room! Unfortunately there was only one bedside light but when we asked for another one we were told the room wasn’t supposed to have two!! Couldn’t understand why as there seemed to be a socket. Unfortunately no mirror over desk for doing make up which I like....no coffee maker or bottles of water provided. Plug didn’t fit washbasin and although someone tried to fix it still wouldn’t actually hold water. However bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet. Breakfast seemed expensive so we enjoyed eating it at Pret every day which is literally round the corner. We decided to eat in the bar/ restaurant one night but got fed up with queuing and it looked a bit chaotic anyway. It’s a shame they don’t open the restaurant in the evening and keep the bar for drinks only....I think that would be much nicer. Food seemed far too expensive to eat at bar table anyway. Doormen were a bit laidback and inattentive but half heartedly tried to look the part with a bit of a scruffy uniform! We had difficulty finding good places to dine locally ....apart from an expensive Italian a few doors away.....maybe we need to do more research. Would stay there again as long as I could have a bedside light,!!!

title: Fantastic location in Manhattan
text:
The Warwick featured a wonderful location not far from Central Park, Times Square, and Broadway shows, and the rooms are a bit bigger than average for Manhattan. It had a nice bar/restaurant where we enjoyed happy hour, a friendly doorman, and capable, friendly staff.

Only two challenges: 1) the hated resort fee, which should be banned by law.  Drives me nuts.  Just charge the price, without the silly extras.  2) the hot water would go on and off during showers - happened every day of our 3 night stay.  It wasn't horrible, just annoying for the cost.

That said, it was a solid stay given that it was 2-3 times less than many of the hotels in the area.

title: Went to NYC on a whim, took a chance on details (and glad I did)
text: Very convenient location; terrific, knowledgeable, and attentive staff (but not overbearing); very nice room -- surprisingly large for NYC and quiet. I plan to return for the same meeting next summer, if not before.

title: Disappointing Stay
text:
We have stayed at the Warwick Hotel in NY several times. This time our stay was very disappointing. It was a busy time with Halloween and NY Marathon but at the hotel had a distinct lack of staff and service was almost non existent. 

We are Warwick members yet were given a terribile room overlooking a dark brick wall. Check in was fine but it was all downhill from there. One lift was not working which led to very lengthy waits everytime we needed to come or go from our room. The doorman did not once greet or acknowlege us as he was too busy gaining tips from taxi departures. If fact, the side door was open to allow guests quick access which is fine but that's not service. We had pre arrival requested a quiet room yet were given a room right beside the lift and across from a baby. We had pre requested herbal tea bags in our room, yet had to phone several times requesting these to much confusion by the staff. 

Previously, the Warwick has been my favourite hotel in Manhattan but it seems that they are currently in cost saving mode. The location is great but I counted ten other hotel options in this area which we will explore. 

We won't be returning to the Warwick.

title: Great location, not much more
text:
Great location in Midtown Manhattan, close to Central Park.
Room is big, bed is big and decent, but bathroom is quite small. 

What annoyed me is the lack of a mini fridge, yet they have a mini bar-fridge(w a sensor that charges) stocked with small bottles/cans of wine/beer, and a sign on it that says something like..."Do not put your own items in it"...forgot the exact wordings but it is not cold enough for most things(just a slight chill for the drinks) and it's stocked to the brim with trays of drinks so there's no space left.

No kettle, but you can ask for one for free and they provide some tea/coffee along.
No free bottled water and no filters provided...yes I know NYC tap water is kinda safe...Its gym has a water dispenser though.

Wifi/gym is charged as part of facilities fee.

There's like only 3 lifts for the whole hotel and I had to wait like 10+mins for one with space when going down in morning peak hour, it's an old building tho so that's that.

For this price range, I expected better overall.

title: Great location, otherwise forgettable
text: Great location is th best thing we can say. It is right in the heart of upper mid town with easy access to the key sights and shopping.  Otherwise the service was avaergae, the rooms plain (but large enough), the bathrooms very plain and the bedding old and nothing special.

title: Cómodo
text:
Un hotel muy cómodo en todos los sentidos, muy bien ubicado a dos cuadras de diferentes estaciones de metro que te permiten moverte bien en NY.
Las habitaciones de buen tamaño considerando los estándares de los hoteles en NY, todo el personal muy atento y servicial.

title: New York City
text: Stayed here for four nights while visiting New York. Great location, close to Central Park and we walked everywhere.  When your tired of walking the subway is very close.  Hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was modern and was always clean. I would return.

title: ENDED UP HERE BY ACCIDENT
text:
i was a Walk out from the nearby Conrad, then London NYC as the renovations were going on. i settled for the warwick and was very happy. 
it has a very traditional feel to it and very new yorky (if that is even a thing)
cleanliness could be better but was not too bad...
Location was great as it was a few mins to times square and 7 mins to central park
could not fault it! lovely hotel with great staff

title: A week in NYC during Fall
text:
This is my frist time in this great hotel (several times before in NYC) and I must say that the different opinions and pictures published in the web about this hotel are true: excellent!!! It is a small one, kind of boutique, very comfortable and the staff very kind.  If you can find an offer of a room including breakfast I would reccomend to take it because you will find plenty of good food...If you buy it separately it is expensive....
The only "low rated service" of this hotel is its elevator....they have only two working and they are small.  You will have to be patient in order to take it.....

title: Hôtel au top!
text:
L’hôtel est idéalement situé; proche de  times square, et central park..
J’ai été surclassé, car retard de chambre pour le check-in, un grand merci!!!
La chambre est très propre, et le personnel est très sympa!!!
Je recommande et reviendrai, pour mon séjour prévu au mois de mars...

title: My new favorite hotel
text:
Spotless and huge (by NY standards!) room, good sleep quality. 

The service was particularly notable; friendly, professional, looking for ways to help. (Full disclosure: never ventured into the restaurant or bar.) 

Next to the bed is a light panel with buttons for each side of the bed, the desk, etc. Some people will love this, and love the comfort when waking in the middle of the night in a strange place. This "people" found the light disruptive, but leaned a pillow over it and that helped. 

Note to management: thanks for the lighted makeup mirror, but um...have you tried using it? Can't stand very close because of the relative situation of it and the toilet. Also, putting on makeup above a toilet can have wet results. #eyepencilfallsintoilet #nofun. Small considerations for what is otherwise, my new favorite New York hotel. 

Hope to see you again really soon!

title: Perfect Location
text: My wife booked a surprise trip to New York City. She picked the perfect hotel. The staff was helpful when we arrived. We found our room to be a perfect size including our bathroom. We had a bathtub which is dumbfounding to me because who takes baths... but that is me. I did read reviews that there were sound issues from the street but we could not hear a thing. There is no fridge in the room which is a bummer. I will note that there did not seem like enough wait staff at the bar especailly when you consider that the place was packed. Breakfast on sight was tasty but you pay New York prices. Please know that there a lot of choices nearby. But the real reason to stay at the Warwick is because of location. Everything is nearby and walkable. The subway system was also usable especailly if you are going to The Statue of Liberty and 9/11 Memorial.

title: Tired but good
text: We stayed as a family of four in a suite. It was perfectly pleasant but a bit tired and in need of a bit of a refurbishment. I was left some chocolate strawberries as it was my birthday. We were all very comfortable though and the staff were generally ok. No frills though and nowhere near 5 star. Great location.

title: Avoid this hotel
text: Far from a luxury hotel. They will nickel and dime you throughout stay and are unprofessional. For example, if you put your do not disturb sign up, they will disturb. They state on their website that a fridge is available upon request, yet when you ask, they charge you.

title: New York Hotel
text:
Lovely room but a wee bit dark, no outside looking windows.
Nice bathroom
Elevators very small and slow to call
Overall a great location close to Broadway, Times Square and Central Park
The only disappoint was the desk staff were unfriendly and not very helpful.
Conversely the doormen were all very friendly and helpful

title: HUGE ROOM IN MIDTOWN NYC
text: Stayed here for 3 nights to attend a conference at the Midtown Hilton right across the street. It was cheaper than the Hilton and very convenient. Our corner room with a king bed was huge! I couldn’t believe I was in Manhattan. The bed was soft and it was very conveniently located to the subway.

title: Great Location
text:
Came with family (9 & 11) and stayed in room with two queen beds. Difficult size beds for 2 kids that aren’t tiny anymore & no extra bed available but room was a decent size for NYC and beds comfy. Service good as we initially ended up in a room next to the extractors so very noisy but we complained and were moved without a fuss. Main issue was road noise outside but it was Manhattan!! 
Had breakfast there once and it was plentiful. The location is great as walking distance from Central Park, Times Sq & Rockefeller Plaza.

title: Average
text: A nice hotel. One of the lifts was broken for the entire duration of our stay meaning long waits to leave/enter you room. $25 per day ‘facilities fee’ is a rip off (I was told it was for the free Wi-fi!!) and very well hidden. Left a bad taste.

title: Loved it! Great location to the park, Rockefeller Center and the subway
text:
Stayed here a few nights with friends. Great location, large room....though small bathroom. We had a corner room which was very spacious. Booked on Booking.com. 

Convenient to the park, Radio City, Rockefeller Center, St Patrick’s Cathedral, not too far to walk to Grand Central and Public Library and Bryant Park. 

One inexpensive suggestion would be for the hotel to add another shelf in the shower as it’s very difficult to have soap, shampoo, conditioner and a razor on the little one provided.

title: Distinctly ‘only ok’
text:
My overriding view is that this is not a 4 star hotel and does not warrant its current TripAdvisor rating. The latter is what I would base all my bookings on, and we felt it was very much out of kilter. 

The pros - the location is excellent if you are visiting the main tourists spots of Manhattan or if you want easy access to the subway - no complaints there. The location is on the corner of 6th Ave and a stones throw from Central Park, Times Sq & Rockfeller. The room was well cleaned each day and the doorman was friendly. The room was spacious and bed comfortable. We didn’t have breakfast or dinner so can’t comment on that. 

The negatives / not 4 star standard - the place is run down. We chose this hotel as we thought it looked like an old school New York vibe, but it’s just old. The decor is v dated, the paintwork cracking and the upkeep was poor (wardrobe door handles missing and not replaced etc). The air con system is also ancient and v noisy. The elevators were painfully slow; only two out of the three where working and at times you were waiting a full 5 mins minutes for one to arrive. Generally speaking I would say the reception staff and concierge were not up to usual standards. We had aa definite feeling of disturbing them and when we had a query on our bill, reception washed their hands and sent us to the concierge. That gentleman promised help and confirmed he would be there when I returned; however he was not and did not pass over the issue to his colleague - again below the standard expected of this star and rating.

Overall, fine as a base but I think your money could be well spent elsewhere as this would not be up to a usual 4.5 TripAdvisor rating, particularly when it wouldn’t be considered particularly good value for money!

title: Pro e contro
text: Camere pulite, peccato la moquette che trovo terribilmente antigienica.!!!! Le camere danno sulla strada e le finestre non hanno i doppi vetri, per cui se avete il sonno leggero...buona fortuna. Sconsiglio di prendere il servizio di colazione, in quanto costoso e nel raggio di pochi metri avrete a disposizione diverso Starbucks e altri locali per fare colazione, come ad esempio la catena francese La Maison Kayser. Il vantaggio dell’hotel è che si trova sulla 6th, a pochi minuti da Times Square.

title: Hôtel idéalement situé, beaucoup de czchet
text:
Très très bien situé, à 400 m de Central Park. Cet hôtel a une histoire et une âme.
Les chambres sont belles et il y a tout ce qu’il faut. Lits confortables.
Le room service est bien mais très cher évidemment.
Il en va de même du petit déjeuner et il vaut mieux le prendre dehors à Angela’s Sandwich par exemple (7ème et 57 st). A noter quasi au même endroit un supermarché ouvert toute la nuit où on peut prendre tout ce qu’on veut (plats chauds) et manger ds la chambre. Pas mal après une journée de marche dehors!
Le bar est beau et le barman super! 
La note est salée et je n’ai rien compris à la facture, mais je recommande!

title: Great location
text: Warwick Hotel is in a great location for visiting NYC.  Walking distant to Central Park, Rockefeller Center and shopping on 5th Avenue.  Our room was very clean and nicely appointed .  When we checked in the desk attendant said we had an interior room with really no view and because we were staying for 3 nights asked if we would like to upgrade at no charge to a street view.  But he did warn us that the bathroom would be considerably smaller.  We opted to stay with the room with no view as we planned on being out and enjoying the city.  The bar is nice any cozy but could benefit from more staff.  One bartender and one wait person is not nearly enough to handle the space. We watched as one wait person served the entire bar on her own.  There were food runners but they do not take drink orders.  She was run off her feet.  The only other complaint is the elevators.  There are only 3 tiny cars and we only seen 2 of them work for the 4 days we were there.  You line up to get on often having to wait 2 or 3 time before it is your turn and you wait for ever on your floor to get a car to go down.  Very frustrating.  Other than those 2 issue I would recommend The Warwick Hotel .

title: Great 4-5 star Manhattan hotel
text:
If you’re looking for a good quality midtown hotel close to Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza and fifth avenue then the Warwick is perfect. 
Quite historic as it’s where The Beatles got mobbed when they did the Ed Sullivan show and Cary Grant lived there for 12 years apparently. 
Superior double room was good. Looked out onto 54th from the 8th floor so the car park opposite was our view. Ah well. 
Not too modernised apart from iPhone dock/alarm clock and flat screen tv so proper retro styling - I mean it was built by citizen Kane so it would need to feel all old New York. 
Randolph’s bar was nice. Only really stopped in for one drink. Not sure if it was mostly residents but got chatting to someone at the bar who worked down the road in time square so if the locals are drinking there it’s always a good sign.

title: Just OK, but: The smallest bathroom I have ever seen!
text: I travel twice a year to New York and, because of its location, I wanted to try this hotel. There are much better hotels in this area. I was really disappointed. The hotel is old, sort of outdated. The location is perfect (although rather noisy), the staff friendly, the size of the room is good. But what shocked me most was the size of the bathroom (see picture) - it was so tiny that you had to sit sideways on the loo to avoid hitting my head at the sink! It would be impossible for an overweight person to use this bathroom (and shower). Unbelievable! I was staying in room 809 - maybe the other rooms are better. For me it is very clear, that I will definitely NOT return.

title: Great location near to Central Park
text: Really friendly place, the hotel was of a good standard. The bedroom I had was very large. it was clean and comfortable if a little dated.  The bathroom was tiny but functional with a shower in the bath.  The hotel has a lovely comfortable bar on the ground floor area which wasideal for a nightcap, it also provided a good range of drinks. I would be happy to go back there.

title: Estancia inmejorable! Repetiremos
text: El hotel era precioso, de estilo años 20. Las habitaciones eran muy espaciosas y estaban muy limpias y además las camas eran comodísimas. Además la situación del hotel es buenísima: al lado de la sexta avenida y el rockefeller center, a pocos minutos andando de Central Park y de Times square, con muchas paradas de metro y de autobús cerca, con lo que es comodísimo para visitar toda la ciudad. El personal es muy amable y atento (en especial Carlos, el conserje). Sin duda repetiremos en este hotel si volvemos a NYC

title: Very Disappointed!!!
text:
We have stayed at the Warwick many times over the last ten or more years and have enjoyed the hotel and it’s location.  However, as a result of our recent three night stay last week we will be considering another property for our next visit.
The biggest issue was our bathroom and the fact that it was no bigger than a closet! One person could barely fit and you could literally flush the toilet and turn on the shower without taking a step.....All toiletries had to be kept in the bedroom....plus the sink was the size of a small mixing bowl!  When I went to the desk to ask for some remedy I was told that business travelers like these rooms...that seems very unlikely to me and then again we were a married couple on a holiday so this explanation meant nothing to us.  We were not offered another room and were told that a note would be put in our profile not to assign us rooms in the 15 series in the future.  Wow!
In the past we have enjoyed meeting friends and family in the Randolph bar/lounge not only for drinks but lunch and even light dinners.  On this trip we met our son for drinks and lunch and were surprised at the rude and off handed service, but we went back twice more and on our third effort after waiting what seemed that forever  for service on a Sunday midday with a thin crowd, we still had not been waited on we left and enjoyed a great meal and drinks at another hotel restaurant nearby.
Sorry to see the decline in service at a hotel that has held special memories for us....time to move on.

title: Lovely hotel!
text:
Had great time staying at the hotel for 3 nights.
Lovely old charm with big beautiful rooms.
The only down side was the 25$ a day facility fee. 
We didn't use the fitness/business rooms, so why charging us?

title: 위치가 좋은 고급호텔
text:
위치도 좋고 고급스러운 호텔입니다. 방도 넓고 깨끗한 편이었습니다. 침대도 적당히 푹신하고 침구류도 깨끗했습니다. 
객실에 냉장고가 없습니다. 미니바가 있는데 내용물을 꺼내면 자동으로 결제되는 시스템이라 사용이 어렵습니다. 
저층의 경우에는 아침에 엘리베이터 사용이 어렵습니다. 위층에서 내려오는 투숙객들 때문에 엘리베이터 한번에 타기 힘들었습니다. 아침에 체크아웃 할 경우에는 여유를 두고 미리 나가시는게 좋을 것 같습니다.

title: Classically old style
text: Great location, easy walk to Times Square, Central Park, central Manhattan and 5th Avenue.  Old style hotel with a touch of class.  Rooms were spacious and comfortable but could do with a bit of renovation (the air con sounded like a car engine was running in the room, it was left off - but I understand there is a refit of the air con currently going on, it had just not reached the floors we were on). Attentive and friendly staff. Small but relaxing bar if you fancy staying in for the night.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: We have recently returned from an amazing USA holiday and stayed at the Warwick Hotel for 6 nights.  We loved this hotel!!! the location was perfect for us, we have previously stayed close to Time Square but loved being close to Central park and the Rockefeller Centre this time.  Yes it's an old hotel but that is part of it's charm for us.  We would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

title: Old school but charming...
text:
We’re in NY for six days and staying at the Warwick for the full duration. It’s different - location and style of hotel - than we usually go for. We’ve stayed at the Grand Hyatt on our previous stays but this time got a fairly ok deal at the Warwick and though why not. Location wise it’s a couple of blocks from Central Park and close to radio city and magnolia bakery...there are plenty of subways so I’m hoping getting around won’t be too bad. In the past we’ve been closer to Times Square but we’re looking forward to a change in scenery. Couple of things about the hotel: it’s old New York, so if you’re looking for modern or contemporary this is not for you. I was a bit reluctant when I first got here but there’s something quite charming about it. On checkin we had to pay additional taxes which we weren’t aware of...it’s around $25/night so unless you book directly with the hotel expect to pay this...not entirely fair because we would’ve been happy to book directly with the hotel had we have known this.  We booked a premier king room. It’s nice, ok decor, biggish bed but the bathroom is tiny. It’s a single cubicle shower and you’d find two people in the bathroom together impossible. Breakfast isn’t included in our rate and it’s works out $40 or thereabouts per day per person. 
We asked for a roller bed and were told it’s $30 per night...by this point we’d already paid out more than we expected and hadn’t even seen the room yet! But the manager was great and sorted something out. 

I signed up to the Warwick membership and thought I’d get one complimentary breakfast but this isn’t the case. So far it’s ok, I’ll keep updating my feedback as my stay goes on!

title: Covienient location, spacious rooms, lackluster service
text: My partner and I stayed for 4 nights. Upon arriving, we were warmly welcomed by night doorman and the receptionist. When we complained about our faulty toilet we were given a better room. Sadly, the welcome wagon was never to be seen after that. The daytime doorman couldn’t be bothered to make eye contact, answer a question or properly hail a taxi - he casually pointed us in the direction of an occupied vehicle and seemed annoyed that he needed spend energy to flag down an empty taxi. There were several staff members around the front desk who were happy to engage in personal conversations with one another while blissfully ignoring the long line of guests forming in front of them. This hotel is for you if you’re happy paying a premium for a great location, spacious rooms and lackluster customer service.

title: Convenient to theatre district
text:
Don’t mistake historic for grand. Tiny lobby. Adequate rooms but a bit dim and worn around the edges. Clean. Staff helpful and engaging, real people not franchise rubber stamps. 

Theatre district and MOMA near by. Central Park a short stroll. Lots of good restaurants of various price points nearby.

title: Liking the Warwick
text: The Warwick is well located in excellent location very close to 5th Avenue shopping, Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park . Our room was a suite and the staff was very accommodating from the moment that we arrived.  The room was spacious and comfortable, with great bedding and pillows.  Lots of room for storing our full suitcases.. We very much liked our room except for the poor bathroom lighting. Not sure what that as about as the suite was very well lit. The only other negative experience was when we had 12 people join us on the elevator one morning. Sort of reminded me of cramming 12 people in a Volkswagen.  Other than these few minor glitches this is where we will stay when we return to New York next time. I'd give this place a solid 4 1/2. stars.

title: Tre nätter i NY
text:
Hör tillbringade vi hela vår vistelse i NY.
Centralt läge!

Stort och ståtligt hotell. 
Stora, rena och fräscha rum.
Bra service.

Fick betala extra för Wifi, ca 15 dollar/natt

Bra frukostbuffé men dyr.

Kan absolut tänka mig att återkomma.

title: Great hotel and service
text: We stayed at the Warwick for our anniversary!  Had a fabulous king suite and were treated like royalty.  Lovely furnishings, fine linens, and very caring staff!! We look forward to returning. Location is the best and it's an easy walk to the theater district.

title: Worth it if you get a decent rate
text:
Well located in Upper Midtown with decent decor and reasonable room sizes for NYC.
Beds were comfortable with just enough space for us with luggage, but we were hardly in the rooms spending all our time exploring the city.
Air conditioning units were very noisy and when turned down, they didn't manage to cope with the temperature.
Breakfast was good but expensive. There are better and more reasonably priced breakfast diners within a few yards of the hotel.

title: Loved the location
text: Lovely hotel though a bit dated and in an excellent location. Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller Centre. Large room and bathroom well kept. Check-in was quick and found the staff friendly and professional. Randolph's Bar and Lounge is nice for drink and Mural's onsite restaurant breakfast option was good.

title: Lackluster Hotel in Great Location
text: I cannot say that this hotel is any better than average.  The staff seemed inconvenienced to speak with us or any other guest at the front desk.  I observed other interactions, and none were very pleasant.  The room was clean enough, but the bedroom does not have an additional mirror for a second guest to get ready.  This was in the city view Premier King room.  The bed was comfortable and the room was updated to a bare minimum.  I just returned from the trip and saw additional charges I had not signed off on.  It was parking fees.  We did not have a vehicle.  It concerns me that this may be standard and that most guests would overlook the charge.  They assured me they have credited it back.  I would not be staying at this hotel again.  There are plenty of others.

title: Too many negatives this time
text: We have stayed  at this hotel for years. It has always been a solid 4 starters in a good location in NYC we have now created that we need to look elsewhere. First, the room had a broken phone and a broken air-conditioning grare that was falling into the system. Layout was a bad as well. That would have all been OK except for common areas. The elevator was out one morning and we waited almost 15 minutes to get downstairs before deciding to walk.  But the biggest Problem is the restaurant and bar areas. The bar is about the worst hotel bar I have ever been to in my life, and everyone in our party always agrees. The Drinks are poorly made ( ie super sweet cosmo in a juice glass!).  Murals restaurant is horrible.  I got an eggs Benedict with well done eggs. Then the waiter didn’t see the problem.    Seriously?   Plus they sneakily add 15% “murals gratuity “ on your bill without telling you tip is included.   They do the same at the bar.  I normally tip 20% but if you add 15% that’s all you get.  Not good for the staff.  All in all, we are going back to the Benjamin.

title: Nice hotel and good location
text: It had a good location and through Expedia had reasonable prices.  The room was clean and it had a great shower, unlike many hotels that you only get a sprinkle.  My only complaint is that it had a very poor internet connection.  They have one restaurant and bar which serves food as well and it was very good.

title: Abschluss einer USA Rundreise in New York
text: Ein wirklich sehr charmantes Hotel mit sehr zuvorkommendem Personal. Wir verbrachten 5 Nächte im Warwick und würden es jederzeit wieder buchen. Sehr saubere und große Zimmer für NYC! Wir sind begeistert und kommen wieder!

title: Family Visit
text: Lovely hotel. Staff very pleasant couldnt do enough for you. Room was lovely very clean and quite big. Room cleaned everyday. Can't comment on any food in restaurants as we didn't eat from there. Great location very close to central park and other main extractions. will defiantly be back again soon.

title: Great location
text:
This was a great hotel
Ideal location to Broadway and all the shows 
Easy walking to everywhere and trains as well
Shame breakfast wasn’t included in price as not cheap But plenty of ideal eating places close by 
Most Staff extremely helpful

title: Great location, shame it was so dark in the room!
text: we stayed for 6 nights for our 2nd trip to the Big Apple and are happy we chose this hotel. Location, bed, cleanliness, staff, all excellent. The only very minor gripes were as we were on the 9th floor and our suite was facing a wall, it was constantly dark in there, the air conditioning units are ridiculously loud, and on one occasion the iron we had in our room tripped the fuse box and removed all lighting! we had to escape via Iphone light! ha. This was sorted quickly though. I would stay again but be aware of the charge for the WIFI and use of the business centre even if you don't use them. They don't tell you on check in that you are being charged this.

title: Good locaton and great room if you don't mind a view of a brick wall
text:
We enjoyed our stay at the Warwick. Our room was beautiful and spotless. We requested a coffee maker and it arrived promptly.  Its a good location but would have appreciated a room with some sunlight.  We had to call down to reception to find out what the weather was.  We had dinner in their bar and it was excellent and reasonably priced.  Their breakfast was very expensive so we ate in a deli which was a block away.
Staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: Hôtel au top
text: Hôtel très agréable, personnel serviable et chambre impeccable. La literie est top, le lit est ferme. Il est parfaitement situé à proximité de Central Park et à 50m d’une ligne de métro qui va directement à Times square.

title: A beautiful welcoming hotel ideally located 2 blocks from Central Park.
text: Our request for a quiet room resulted in a large well-appointed VERY QUIET corner room on the 22nd floor.  Bathrobes and generous coffee and tea service were provided gratis as requested.  Housekeeping services were outstanding, as were guest services in general.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and cannot wait to return.

title: Bom conforme o preço
text:
A localização perto da 57, 5ª avenida e das linhas amarela e laranja é muito boa. 
Pela excelente condição de preço reservamos a suíte premier, com ampla sala e quarto, porém com um banheiro minúsculo, se não fechar a porta não usa o vaso por exemplo. A limpeza também não é lá estas coisas. Havia um pouco de poeira do próprio ar condicionado. 
O que pesa negativamente é o serviço de todos funcionários no geral. Falta uma certa polidez e elegância. O servidos de delivery das compras também pode ser melhorado, com a respectiva colocação das compras no quarto. 
Enfim, caso o preço esteja bom, normalmente há boas promoções e caso estas observações sejam irrelevantes, pode-se hospedar tranquilidade. Caso não, há outros hotéis na região entre 5ª e 6ª que atendem estas expectativas. The Quin é um exemplo!

title: Excellent as always, clean and very comfortable.
text: Excellent as always, clean and very comfortable. Excellent location near Times Square and Central Park. The rooms and bathrooms are always clean, this Hotel y very well maintained and the staff is always friendly.

title: Great Location, too expensive, very old, needing intervention, and charges ahead 100USD/night for safety
text: Family of three, we choose for the location. The beds were goood, but toilet outdated, bath drain didn´t work well, lights missing buble, glass broken, room noisy due to ventilation systema from hotel restaurant. Charged us on credit card 100usd/night for security reasons, as we stay for 6 nights it was 600USD blocked in Visa. When we booked there was no mention of that. The staff weren't particulary nice, and overhall it was to expensive for what it offer.

title: Classic Hotel, Great Location
text: Family trip, two adult couples.  Everyone on staff at the Warwick is helpful and gracious; you will not be made to feel unwelcome here.  If you are a traveler who wants the latest decor and amenities in your room, you will not be happy here; but if you appreciate a hotel that is clean, well-located, and full of history, this place is a delight.  We walked easily to six different theaters while on this trip, and when we craved cookies from Levain Bakery on the upper west side, the subway was a block away. Restaurants are also an easy walk, whether for a diner breakfast or a more formal dinner.  Both dinner and breakfast are available in the hotel if you want to rest for a day. We've stayed at various hotels near the theater district in the past; the rooms at the Warwick are larger and more comfortable than the others. Be sure to join their loyalty club.  We'll be back.

title: visit for friend wedding
text: the rooms were clean spacious, had everything we needed, staff were friendly professional accommodating to requests, food was good, service was excellent, we will definitely go back. location is great. very prompt to requests.

title: Very poor service.
text: Though my room was fine,nothing spectacular,  but fine.  I stayed mid week. The service was awful. No hot water all night and the entire next morning. I didn't check in until 3:30 in the afternoon and there was a small piece of paper taped to the front counter to advise me of this situation. Sort of too late to do anything at that point as my reservation was prepaid.  They even have the audacity to charge me an additional $20 Resort Fee at checkout.  Really ? An additional $20? Bull ! There are hundreds of good hotels in the same neighborhood. I would take my business elsewhere.

title: Hotel muy funcional y todo muy bien
text:
El mejor hotel cerca de los teatros y Central Park todo es impecable 
Siempre que puedo vuelvo con mi esposo solos o con la flia . Desayuno increíble 
Blanquearía de las habitaciones de lo mejor 
Servicio de mucamas siempre a la orden

title: Great Hotel
text: We had a lovely time staying in the Warwick. The location was perfect as is only a 5 minute walk from Central Park and about 10-15 minutes to Times Square so ideal as not in a too crowded area but in handy reach to all the fantastic sites. The reception area is very nice and the room was spacious with very comfy beds- the bathroom was smaller but this didn’t matter as much. Everything is very clean and the staff are friendly. We had a “courtyard view” which was actually only a black brick wall so we couldn’t see anything out of the window and the room was always dark but this was okay as meant it was nice and dark when we were asleep. The air conditioning was good and the restaurant food was tasty. Had a fab stay and would come back.

title: Ottima posizione!
text: Hotel storico frequentato da personaggi famosi. La posizione e' centralissima e a un passo da Cental park o dalla 5th Avenue.La camera vista citta' era ampia e elegante, sempre pulita e ordinata. Reception accogliente anche se alcuni un po' formali. Consiglio colazione al di fuori dell hotel in quanto costosa.
