title: Very nice hotel, but expensive restaurants!
text: Service was very good.  The room was spacious, but was surprised that a $300/night room would have a bath tub shower instead of a walk in shower. Very clean.  The restaurants were ridiculously expensive.  At the bar, each glass of tea and each seltzer water was $6 each..no refills included.  That's not a big deal; however, for breakfast, I would highly recommend eating elsewhere.  2 eggs and fruit was $44 including tax and gratuity.  That is too much to pay for food, especially when there are so many other restaurants in the area.  The other issue we had was a $24.95 per night resort fee.  There isn't really any resort or anything that's "extra."  So, in addition to the room, our five nights had another $125 in resort fees.  We would look for someplace else to stay on our next visit.

title: Perfect location
text:
Great hotel in middle off everything . You got your 5th Avenue on your doorstep 5min walk , 3min to Central Park ,  14min to time square  by walking . The staff at Warwick are very helpful. Like to thank you Jose  for all the suggestions.  
Only down side of the hotel is it bit dated with the decoration in bedrooms and lifts are small . But still keeping high standard.

title: Clean, helpful and undemanding hotel
text: We chose the Warwick for its good sized “twin double” rooms - ideal for our two teenage girls, and two teenage boys, who enjoyed their independence. We had the Warwick suite, which is a good size, and has windows looking out at two aspects. Breakfasts are good with a wide enough selection to please everyone. Subway is near enough to be able to get about easily. Highly recommend.

title: My Go-To Hotel When I Am in NYC
text: Great location, comfortable and well-appointed room (and a good size for NYC), professional and courteous staff.  The bar on the 1st floor is a great gathering spot.  Only thing I would change is the addition of a coffee pot in the room ~ you have to call room service to have one brought up, which is fine, but I would rather have it there without asking.  Wouldn't stay anywhere else unless I was forced to.

title: Una vera delusione
text: Convinti della scelta perche' albergo storico e per la posizione, davvero comoda per raggiungere zone di maggior interesse, purtroppo si è rivelata subito una delusione: nessun kit di cortesia ne' set di pantofole, né accappatoi, nemmeno una macchina da caffè o bollitore, per non parlare di bottiglie d'acqua ricevute giornalmente gratuitamente in tutti gli hotel in cui abbiamo soggiornato nel tour del nostro viaggio, camera priva di illuminazione sembrava di stare a lume di candela, bagno piccolissimo quasi da roulotte, sistema di area condizionata rumoroso ed inefficiente, stanza umida, ascensori con attesa spasmodica perche'  troppo piccoli per la capienza dell'hotel. Cappuccino a pagamento a colazione, personale della colazione scorbutico, alle nostre richieste riceviamo risposte con gesti della testa e mugugni, anche alle reception impiegati decisamente poco affabili, che dire purtroppo una scelta sbagliata, non ci tornerò e non lo consiglierò.

title: Superb!  Keep a Light on for me, Please!
text:
A bit of a snag with the hotel I originally booked that was just up the street (tried to add a night) and they could not accomodate me.  After a bit of research, I decided to give Warwick a shot and I am so glad I did!  Don't stay over in NYC very often but I've found my new home base.  

Classic, old school charm starts at the lobby (loved the glass mail chute by the elevators even though they are sealed up) and continues to the large, quiet rooms.  Superior towels in the bathroom, great bedding, WiFi, nice sized desk with super comfortable chair, and the bed was very comfortable.  

Had lunch and dinner (small menus but a nice, varied selection) at Randolph's (charming too with lots of leather and dark wood) right past the revolving door.  

All of the hands on deck were friendly, helpful, and professional.  I can't wait for the next time I find myself spending the night in NYC at the Warwick.

title: Location, location, location
text: Historic hotel located in the heart of midtown 2 blocks from Central Park and easy walking distance to restaurants, theatres and shopping. The rooms were updated, clean and comfortable. Special thanks to Eric and Nana who were very welcoming, helpful and definitely exceeded expectations. I can see why it has earned 5 star ratings and has been frequented by stars like Cary Grant and Elvis Presley. We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 day stay here. Thank you.

title: great location
text:
The hotel is well located in NYC close by Central Park and TImes Square walking distance. Rooms are spacious enough for a family of 4. 
There is a valet parking if needed. Breakfast is awesome.
Please just be aware that the breakfast on us is partially true as it does not include children.

title: Perfect in Every Way
text:
The Warwick hotel did not disappoint during my visit to NYC.  
   The staff was top notch;very friendly and eager to help in any way. Robert, the concierge, is a real gem and a great asset to the hotel. Our room was not ready so we had time to go over our itinerary with Robert. He made suggestions to enhance our experience and to our pleasant surprise  it was restaurant week. We took Robert’s suggestion as to where to dine and love, loved the restaurants suggested. 
   So many pluses to staying at the Warwick... great location, roomy accommodations and the restaurant has a menu to please everyone. 
   I look forward to my return to the Warwick Hotel.

title: It may have been great once
text:
To get things out of the way, This is an nice hotel, however they advertise themselves and price themselves as a luxury hotel, so I rated them based on that, They even require a luxury resort like "facility fee". Throughout the hotel have pictures throughout the hotel showing celebrities who have stayed there in the past - 50 or more years ago.

On the plus side, there was a powerstrip on the desk that would directly accept all foreign plugs.  However there were a number of niggling annoyances. The bathroom mirror did not have any anti-fog areas. The tub/shower lever did not automatically switch back to tub when the water pressure was removed (making for a cold surprise the next time it was used) and the elevators were small - no more than 6 average sized people could ride at once. (We could get all 6 of our family group in one elevator, however during the stops on the way down any attempt for a 7th individual to get on resulted in overload messages)

Again, to summarize, as a mid level hotel I would rate the Warwick as very good to excellent. However as a luxury hotel I am being generous to rate them as average.

title: Idéalement situé - chambre confortable
text: Le point fort de cet hôtel est son emplacement géographique pour deux raisons. Sa connexion avec les lignes de métro qui se rendent dans le sud de Manhattan (financial district notamment) et Brooklyn. Et la possibilité de faire à pied depuis Central Park jusque St Herald Square ce qui permet de couvrir les emplacements incontournables de NYC. Pour l’hôtel, nous avions une chambre au 10e étage confortable avec literie conforme aux attentes. Le personnel de l’hôtel est professionnel souriant et disponible. Le petit déjeuner est cher en comparaison européenne mais d’une excellente qualité. C’est une bonne idée avant de faire une longue journée découverte de la ville !

title: Buono
text:
Hotel in ottima posizione nella mid town 
Vicino central park ed ad un passo dalla 5th avenue 

Buon livello di pulizia 

Reception abbastanza cortese e disponibile 
Forse dovrebbero sorridere un po di più 

Prezzo abbastanza buono 

Consigliato

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed in the Warwick hotel whilst visiting New York.  A really lovely hotel.  We originally booked a standard room but upon arrival found that the sink taps were loose and the sink itself wasn’t draining.  The hotel staff were very apologetic and gave us a free upgrade to a suite for the further two nights of our stay.  The hotel is conveniently situated to many attractions such as Central Park, the theatre district and Times Square.  The breakfast is very expensive but this is quite normal as New York is an expensive city to stay in but also a great city.

title: Great location
text:
Stayed for 4 nights, location is great for Central Park (5 minute walk) Times Square (10 minutes) Rockefeller (again about 8-10 minutes) right on the underground line, so a really top spot location wise.

Room was a decent size, and I really enjoyed the old skool grand 1930’s style of the hotel instead of the multitude of modern soulless hotel littered across NYC! 

Didn’t try the restaurant as there are plenty of options locally but be very aware if you are a first time visitor from the UK, (fx rate doesn’t help!) food is very expensive in New York, it’s not a cheap place to go to with Kids at all!

title: Disappointed - Service Poor
text:
Booked a suite on the Avenue, the room itself was a great size even though the bathroom was very very small and as seems to be the trend only a shower over the bath tub.  Water pressure and temperature was disappointing also.
When we checked in we had to wait over 15 minutes whilst the check in person checked with the Manager about our Warwick Journey situation.  When he came back I would have to say he was unpleasant - but them I was frazzled as well after a bad experience from JFK.  He assured us that the telephone call included international calls and when we asked for clarification he said “ I said I would honour the international calls”. This was after querying the Resort Fee - believe me this is not a resort and the the USD27 odd per day it is not worth it.  We only used internet and this added around AUF$350 to our bill for the week - What a ripoff. After some hours we get a telephone message to go back on this promise and not only NYC calls were included.  We send an email to guest relations on the 11/8 or 12/8 with no response as yet.  Poor service. The Assistant Desk Manager had included the Director of front office and told me to contact him.  It is his responsibility to contact a disgruntled guest and should have made contact with me not the other was around.
The service in Randolphs was slow and when the food came it was not as ordered, the excuse - the kitchen forgot some of the ingredients and some are not available so were replaced - the dish was taken back and the missing ingredients added - Isn’t there any quality control in this establishment?
House keeping comes as early at 9am so don’t forget to put out the sign or you will be disturbed.
The bell hop took my case to the lobby down the stairs but there does not seem to be any service for case delivery or pickup.  These are usual hotel services.
The lifts are very small and as there only seem to be 3 of them the wait can be long - make sure that you leave plenty of time to get down to the Lobby.
Apart from the above 
Pros - great place at the bottom of Central Park and within around 15 - 20 minute walking distance to most things including Times Square
Rooms clean - even though they are not vacuumed, wiped or dusted properly 
Cons - staff are not friendly and are quite rude and slow at times - except the room staff
All in all a disappointing 7 days in New York

title: Great Stay!
text: This hotel’s the perfect location. The room’s very roomy if the bathroom a bit small. Excellent service overall except somewhat slow in Randolph’s restaurant. Convenient walk to 5th Avenue, Central Park, Times Square and Broadway. I would recommend it highly and will stay there again.

title: Perfect location
text: This place is close to Rockefeller center Central Park Times Square subways restaurants etc it’s a beautiful older motel the staff are extremely helpful and friendly we got the double queen room good size for nyc beds comfy pillows ok we bought the breakfast package so enjoyed the food in the morning we did eat one night in the bar and that was good as well will return again to this place and will look for other warwicks to stay in future travels

title: Location-Localizacion-Manhattan
text: Vayamos por partes: si es usted europeo, esperará sin duda que por un total (tasas incluidas) de casi 300$ le den una buena habitación, con un amplio baño lleno de productos cosméticos, albornoz, zapatillas, nevera con productos accesibles, wifi gratis y ciertos objetos de cortesía por parte del hotel. Pues bien, por este precio, en Nueva York a lo único que puede aspirar usted es a estar situado en un lugar excelente de Manhattan, con Central Park a cinco minutos a pie, todos los teatros de Broadway a diez minutos y el MOMA a la vuelta de la esquina. Por ese precio la habitación será interior (ninguna luz natural en todo el día) oirá usted el tremendo aparato de refrigeración sin poder dormir, el baño muy pequeño y algo viejo y ningún extra en la habitación. Y la wifi de pago, por supuesto. El hotel es precioso, un sitio con mucho encanto y con mucha historia. El personal muy atento. Las habitaciones, escandalosamente caras para lo poco que dan pero...Están en Manhattan.

title: Lovely size room but double beds were small!
text:
We booked a superior room with two double beds for two adults and two children.
The hotel is lovely and reminds you of decades past.
It is ideally located for Central Park and we walked everywhere from our hotel.
Our room was big compared to some in New York and another plus was that it was quiet. We really appreciated that after a day sight seeing. 
The only down side was that the beds were not really big enough for two adults and two older children. We did try and change our room but the lady at reception said that all their double beds were the same size.
We would return if it was just my husband and I but not as a family.

title: Great Loaction, Great stay
text: Lovely hotel very conveniently located. About 5 min walk to Central park and about 10 min to Times Square. Room was a good size and tastefully decorated. We asked for a coffee maker and this was supplied at no charge. Lift can be a bit slow at peak times. Staff were very friendly and check in/check out was efficient.This was out second stay and would certainly stay here again.

title: Quaint shopping town
text:
Pretty town, nicely kept up, tons of local stores for browsing and shopping. We had an extra day while traveling and enjoyed the morning spent there. Scenic area with photo ops. Shop keepers were all friendly and I liked the varied selection in each store, not your usual tourist items.
I did not eat while there but did notice a few restaurants that looked appealing.

title: Good choice for Midtown!
text:
I chose to stay at the Warwick Hotel when I was in NYC for a conference that was, ironically, being held across the street at the Hilton Midtown.  Yes, there were rooms available at the Hilton, but a few too many "BB" reports came back about the Hilton for my liking, and I continued to search for a nearby hotel that was more likely to be bug-free.  I found the Warwick to be very clean and indeed free of "BB's", but I would also recommend it for other reasons.  The rooms were very large for NYC standards.  I had just a normal kind bed room with an interior view, and it was much more spacious than expected.  I also appreciated the interior location because peace and quiet were more important to me than a view.

The Warwick also has quite possibly the best breakfast buffet I have ever seen.  It wasn't cheap ($42 per adult) but the selection was phenomenal and you could easily eat for the day at this buffet.  Incredible!

I highly recommend this hotel and will return if my travels bring me to Midtown again.

Oh - and I saw some reviews that complained about the elevators.  This is NYC and to be expected.  Just get a room on a high floor so the elevators aren't full by the time they drop down to you!

title: A Suite at the Warwick
text:
I've stayed here a number of times but I'll have to say, the Suite was Gorgeous I booked this time.  You enter a beautiful foyer and come upon a large living room with comfy furniture (sofa and 2 side chairs), dining room table, writing desk and of course a credenza with a large flat screen TV.
The separate bedroom had a wonderful king size bed that was extremely comfortable and the sheets crisp and impeccable.  We had both a 54th Street view as well as a 6th Ave view.
A truly magical stay.  The front desk lady was delightful.

title: Old Classic Hotel ideally located
text:
There are mixed reviews about this place which I don't understand. We were here for 5 nights and had a room on the 20th floor. The room was quiet and perfect for our needs. I read about dated decor, but to me this is part of the charm, its not like the place is in tatters?!?

The elevators can be frustrating as they are small, but how often do you spend going up and down? As for charging points which someone mentioned, there is a pull out drawer in the table which has a power bank.

Anyway we liked this place, we are a family of 4, got a room with 2 queens. It was lovely and quiet, exactly what we wanted. I would definitely stay here again, even though there is a $25 a day resort fee, it still was priced well compared to others.

title: Disappointed
text:
We booked for 2 nights and except for the location of the hotel, there is nothing that we can recommend. There are numerous hotels in the vicinity so next time we are NYC, we would look at staying at another hotel in the area. The room we booked a 'premium room with twin beds. Room was small, bathroom was super tiny! No plug points where one would expect them, to charge phones/devices. TV remote not working.. Surprisingly, there's no tea/coffee in the rooms  which even the smallest hotels now provide. On checking-in I called the reception to enquire if we could move to another room with a better view, (ours faced a construction site) a woman at the reception desk was glib and told me "this is Manhattan, there are no rooms with a good view,"!!!
Historic hotel yes, but in real need for refurbishment. Carpets, amenities could all do with an upgrade.
Concierge desk guys are polite and helpful.

title: Buena estadía.
text:
Hotel muy bien ubicado.
Es un edificio antiguo, muy bonito y elegante, el cual está refaccionado con todas las comodidades que se exigen hoy en día. 
La atención y limpieza de las habitaciones fue excelente.
El wifi es gratuito y funciona perfecto tanto en la pieza como en la recepción.

Para mejorar, el baño es muuuy chico, resulta difícil entrar y salir de la ducha incluso.

title: Old but classy
text: Stayed here in March 2019 for two nights while I was in Midtown.  Location is excellent, there was a BOA, Starbucks, Duane Reade, subway stations, restaurants, LOVE sign, etc all within walking distance.  I moved from my hotel in downtown after two nights and checked in early around noon.  I was feeling ill so I was SO thankful they had a room ready.  Unfortunately, the elevators were down so we had to use the service elevators around the back way, the elevators are tiny btw and HOT so it was quite uncomfortable as many times I had to wait a long time since it was already packed with people.  Door man was always friendly, check out went without problems, and the Loccitane toiletries smelled so nice.  The bathrooms are very old style though so the tubs dont allow soaking and are small.  I also hate that they charge a resort fee when...its not really a resort, but its becoming common in nyc.

title: Great location, worst management
text: Great location, nice building, most amateur service. No bathrobes, a hairdryer from 1982, room all dusty, staff communicates through a small notebook of notes they write to each other when they change shifts! You have to ask 3 people 3 times during the day to get anything, 25 dollars “facilities fee” per day, but no facilities except an old gym and wifi! And the most overpriced in room dining. Never again!

title: Just oK- wouldn’t rush back
text: I stayed here many years ago and had looked forward to a return visit. The hotel is ideally located within walking distance to many attractions. This time around I noticed the decor was less boutique  and  a lot more of the generic grey/mauve modern hotel decor that you see everywhere, which kind of takes away from its historic charm. The staff were indifferent - not to the point of rudeness but close- and could not be bothered to provide a restaurant recommendation (“oh, there are lots. Just walk around”) or help me try and change a fifty dollar bill. The rooms seemed clean and well updated and so I’m hoping the mystery red marks on my neck aren’t what I’m afraid they are. Overall, it was just OK. For a basic standard room with an average lounge and no special ambiance, I’d probably try a newer property next time just for better elevators and plumbing that doesn’t groan.

title: Great stay, fantastic service
text: Lovely stay at the Warwick with a family of 5. A special mention of the bellman team who were outstanding always on hand to help out and did a great job with our kids. Ty on the front door was exceptional, especially getting everything loaded into the car on our departure and also making sure we had enjoyed our stay. Was a lovey service with a genuine desire to help at all times. Housekeeping was also exceptional with rooms left spotless each day and plenty of toiletries etc replenished without going over the top. Recommended!

title: Love staying here. Close to everything and big rooms for NYC. Great people working here too.
text:
This is my 3rd stay at the Warwick and I really enjoy it. Very large rooms, bathrooms on the small side but the room compensates for space. Excellent concierge services, shout out to Robert and Jose. Very welcoming front desk and the bell boys are great specially Carlos. 
Walking distance to everything, restaurants shops and Central Park. Used to stay at The Plaza but The Warwick is my NYC go to hotel.

title: A grand hotel
text:
We stayed here two nights prior to catching a Trans-Atlantic voyage on Queen Mary 2. We have stayed here a number of times and it is always a delight. Hotel is steeped in history but is still modern and elegant. Service in the bar was bit slow the one evening we went(the the bar manager had greeted us when we came in- so should have noticed our wait). But ,once the server arrived, service and the drinks were top-notch.

Overall, a great experience, will stay here on out next trip to New York. 

WE look dorwrd

Good service at reception. Doorman eve noticed us in the lobby after checkout waiting for our transport and keep a look-out for us. 

Room, with a view out on the street, was well appointed and a pleaure to come back to in the evening.

Hotel is a short walk to Times Square ,  Radio City  and a host of dining options

title: good hotel but be careful of hidden payments
text:
It could be a good place to stay in manhattan: wonderful location, nice rooms good staff. But all the good things I can say about the hotel were not enough to recommend this place.because at check out I was asked to pay a bill of $2017.76 for  facilities""/
The hotel nantain that äll reservations are charged a facility fee of %25 per day +taxes for the use os wifi, gym and business center regardless if the facilities were used or not". a A hotel of this category should not use this strange method in order to increase its revenues

title: 5 day theatre break
text:
Very disappointed with the Warwick. This was our second stay, We arrived late on Friday night the 5th of July.  For us, it was 5.00am in the morning. After travelling from London we just wanted to shower and go to bed.  The receptionist was not friendly and was following a process rather than showing any personal welcome. 

We arrived at our room which seemed very hot. We established the air con was not working. We wanted to jump in the shower but there were not towels.

We just went to sleep feeling dirty and fed up.

In the morning we reported the situation to reception again. We took a shower and dried with a facecloth whilst we waited for towels.

We left the hotel hoping our problems would be resolved when we returned.

We had a very short turn around after going to a matinee before our next appointment. Returned to the hotel and again no towels. Called reception, but again not time showered and dried with facecloths and went out.

Returned late again no towels.

Eventually requested to speak to the manager. 

Explained the situation and eventually on Sunday we received towels.

The manager was very nice and asked what we wanted, a drink in the bar? to be honest all I wanted was a shower and to be able to dry myself with a towel. so refused the offer of a free drink. I am not a freeloader, I just want what is expected the basics that all hotels offer.

I was so disappointed with our stay. Service seems in less than a year to have turned into a process. 

I wont be back again.

I

title: excelente
text: He estado 12 noches en este hotel, y la verdad es que la estancia no ha podido ser mejor. Ibamos con mi hija de 9 años y hemos estado muy cómodos en la habitación King Deluxe, aunque era interna. A destacar la limpieza de la habitación, el espacio de la misma, y la calidad de muebles y sábanas y productos de tocador. Nosotros decidimos coger la habitación con desayuno y fue una idea acertada, pues el desayuno es de muy buena calidad. Cuando vuelva a New York, sin duda volveré a escoger este hotel que además está cerquita de Central Park.

title: Very good but a slight miss
text:
My husband and I spent 2 nights in room 315 recently. The hotel is very conveniently located - especially if you enjoy walking as we do. The staff are top notch and friendly. Randolph’s is great for a cocktail. Our room was very clean and nicely appointed however, the bathroom in this particular room is quite odd. The space is extremely narrow and not configured well. We are both tall (but thin) people and had quite a difficult time fitting in the space where the toilet is. I do understand that these old buildings can be challenging to configure and renovate but goodness. Definitely the strangest I’ve ever seen. 

We would surely stay again but would know to avoid certain rooms next time.

title: Super hotel, super clean, super service.
text:
Just been, on the Best Hotel in New York. 
THE WARWICK.
My husbond and I stayed one week here, from 29/6-19
We arrivede to the hotel, about tjek in time. And the Nice doormann( forgot his name) help US, with all our bags.
We Got the room fast and took the elevator to 16 floor room 1620.
And from the moment we Enter the room, we loved it. It Was a Nice room. Big bed, lots of place to put your bags, lots of place to put all your stuff.
The bathroom Was Nice too. Great  bathtub, lots off hot warter, and soo clean. This Was the cleanest hotel we had on our 3 weeks in USA.
I became a member , When I booket the room on there own web side. That Was a good deal.
We had there breakfast ones, and it Was Nice.
Notthing bad to say about this hotel. Its simple beautifull and charming.
Thanks for the Best stay at our trip.
See you again. Thats fore sure.
Love fra Denmark

title: Beautiful older hotel
text: The Warwick did not disappoint. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite on the 11th floor which was nicely appointed. The Suite had a sitting room with tv, a table with four chairs, and enough room for a rollaway bed. It was very large compared to other NYC hotel rooms from what I understand. The bedroom could be closed off from the rest of the suite. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom opened off of the bedroom and was very clean — but counter space within the bathroom was at a premium.  The maid service was great!  Our room was cleaned every day when we returned from sightseeing, and they performed a turndown service each night.  The hotel elevators were efficient but very small.  They fit about 6 people max so we had to wait for the next car a couple of times. The best thing about this hotel was the location in Midtown —close by to many eateries and the subway.  We would definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent
text: We stayed in one of the suites, separate living room area- Having been to NYC many times I was pleasantly surprised with the living  space and the view. Only downfall was a lack of shelf space in the bathroom, but it was really not a major inconvenience. We would stay here again and recommend the Warwick-the place where The Beatles stayed, as well as many other famous people.

title: Great hotel, great location, excellent value
text:
We stayed at the Warwick for a quick trip into the city and although at first I was not happy with them because they told me upon arrival that they did not have a roll away bed available which would mean that one of us would have to sleep on the floor. I tried to ask for a way to solve the problem but they basically told me I could go stay in another hotel. We were exhausted from traveling all day and couldn't imagine finding another hotel at that time so we stayed. We ended up getting a bed that night for which was very thankful.
I have to say that aside from that, I really loved the hotel. It was well decorated, clean and it was a wonderful location. We had an easy walk to the theater district, and to Rockefeller Center and Central Park. It was right near a subway for further destinations. I feel like it was good value and not as pricey as other hotels in nearby locations. I would stay here again!

title: Not impressed
text: The rooms were fine but we were very shocked with the reaction of the staff when Manhattan suffered a 5 hour blackout on July 13th. There were no  emergency lights in the hotel, which I found unbelievable and probably illegal. People were packed in the lobby sitting in the dark on the floor and on the second floor mezzanine. The bar and restaurant, which had seats and couches were not open as staff said they could not open them because of no lighting- however the bar had at least one emergency light. Staff had glow sticks! We were told we could walk up the stairwell and there was not emergency lighting of any sort all the way up to floor 21. That to me seemed extremely dangerous. Friends went across to the Hilton which had everything open and candles around. They sat in the bar and were given free cold soft drinks and well looked after. Quite a difference. I understand that a blackout is nothing anyone would expect but the lack of emergency lighting, the climb in the dark and the ineptitude of staff during this disruption were all very unprofessional. On the other hand people on the street (1000's) and NYC emergency workers were amazing.

title: Good choice for a base in NY
text:
Have visited NYC a few times but first visit to The Warwick.

Forgot to write a review straight after stay but wanted to leave a review to share our positive experience.

I was fairly ‘neutral’ on this place on arrival but the hotel grew on me, and my friend, as we got into our 4 night stay.

Well run hotel, classical building with some nice features. Bar area always lively and a good place to be. Some hotel bars lack character, this place is great.

Excellent central location, decent 4 star in my opinion and room prices are fair.

Did not have breakfast. Restaurant looked nice but breakfast prices looked a little expensive, so we ventured out in the mornings, plenty of choice. Brooklyn Diner worth a visit.

Will return to the Warwick on my next visit.

title: 内装が素敵
text:
立地がとてもよく、内装が素晴らしいです。
ロビーもゆったりしています。
スタッフも思いの外フレンドリーで、気さくに話してくれました。

title: Friendly Hotel, Great Location
text:
We stayed for three nights to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary. The hotel has a great location to visit all the main attractions.
The room was comfortable and adequate, but you do need to request coffee making facilities which were okay.
The staff were very friendly and helpful.
I would have given 5 stars but for just a small default. There is a $27 facility fee per night which Warwick Hotels say is deferred if you join the Loyalty programme, which I did.However as I had booked the package through a third party and not directly with Warwick Hotels I could not get the fee waived. To me it shouldn't matter where you book the Hotel you are still a member of their Loyalty club. 
All in all would recommend

title: Great location and great classic hotel at reasonable price
text: I was looking for a classic 4-5 start mid-town hotel that was not too pricey and could accommodate me, my wife and our 3 small children.  The hotel allowed us to squeeze into a room with two double beds and a baby crib between them.  It was crowded of course, but there was enough room for our luggage and the bathroom was just big enough for my wife to clean my 3 small kids together.  It was not cheap but compared to other 4-5 star well reviewed hotels, it was the cheapest.  Location was great - walking distance to Rockefeller Centre, 5th Avenue, Central Park and the Theater District.  Rooms were very clean, quiet and comfy.  Furnishings, fittings and fixtures were top notch.  Beautiful classy lobby with photos of old celebrities who frequented the hotel during its hey days.  While not cheap, I considered it great value for money for a two-day experience for my family of five.  Will definitely stay there again.

title: Fair by all means
text: The hotel is located in an excellent spot 3 blocks away from the Central Park. What I appreciated most is the size of the hotel which is not big if compared with other luxurious hotels and therefore, the circulation of people going in and out is imperceptible. The standard room that we stayed in fits 4 people comfortably and the queen size beds are wide enough to lie down 2 people. The room also looked like brand new. The only observation is that the toilet was proportionally small. The staff as a whole was pretty useful when needed. Hence, it is a fair option considering the daily rate x location x hotel’s standard.

title: Great location with old world charm
text:
We stayed for 4 nights and had a wonderful time.  Hotel is the perfect spot to easily walk to Times Square or Central Park.  The rooms are large and comfortable.  Ask for a coffee maker when you check in.

If you want a cookie cutter chain hotel, this isn't it.  The elevators aren't that slow, we never had a problem.

title: Always there when you need them!
text: I have stayed at both San Francisco and New York WARWICK hotels. They are wonderful! Service is terrific and rooms are great! As soon as you check in at the front desk you feel a sense of relief from the chaotic city you have left behind.Truly a calm place to rest your head.

title: very nice hotel
text:
The hotel is in an excellent location and is very elegant and well kept.
Our room was well furnished and surprisingly spacious, even if it did have a view of a brick wall opposite.
Shame there were no coffee making facilities or fridge provided.There was a mini bar with prices as you would expect for a hotel like this and warnings NOT to put your own items inside or you would be charged. 
Everything was an extra that you had to request and pay for but i would still  recommend staying here.

title: Okay
text: The hotel is in a great location - walkable to Central Park, Time Square and Broadway, but it's also old. The elevators are small and slow. The air conditioning was not adjustable, so the room was always at 74, and during a heat wave, that was uncomfortable. Our room faced a brick wall, so we also had no natural light, which I accept in the city, but the lighting in the room is also poor, so applying make-up was a guessing game.

title: Excellently trained staff in great location
text: We are frequent travelers to NY as we have family there, still and used to live there. One of our children had an event there this week, and for the first time ever, we stated on the West Side (midtown) at The Warwick. The hotel is elegant, the staff is SO nice. Every single one of them from housekeeping, front desk, doormen - were consistently wonderful, warm and welcoming. There is a great market nearby (we rented a small room fridge for snacks and drinks for the week), many dining options. We walked to two Broadway plays. The beds were very comfortable. The only complaint that I had was that the cold water tap was very slow. I am surprised to give this hotel such a great review - because I'm usually pretty picky. But we had a wonderful week and the hotel was everything that we needed for a great home base.

title: Explicacion erronea de la wifi y desayuno malo y caro
text: Estuvimos a finales de junio en este hotel tan antiguo pero bien situado. Considero que el precio para las instalaciones es muy caro. El timo de la wifi... te hacen pagar 25 dolares al dia... cuando seleccionas free wifi ... te hacen poner el numero de habitacion y te cobran... una wifi que iba bastante lenta y se colgaba muchas veces. Como llovia uno de los dias ... probamos el desayuno continental.., el pan muy malo .. el cafe... nada del otro mundo y el zumo no natural... y malo... ademas de carisimo para lo que ofrecian... 2 tostadas,mantequilla y cafe con leche... 25 dolares.. Resumiendo, la localizacion excelente... el personal agradable... pero las instalciones antiguas, el desayuno malo y la wifi... un timo.

title: Best location amid quiet elegance
text: We are a family of four and like to book two hotel rooms to have a little space and privacy. I looked high and low for hotels with family suites that wouldn't break the bank and was resigned to booking two standard adjoining rooms at a Hilton or the like. A good price at the Warwick caught my eye and when I called to book two rooms, a reservations agent let me know that the hotel offered a 2-bedroom suite for a pretty reasonable price. I jumped on it and I'm so glad I did. Our suite consisted of a standard double room connected by a private hallway to a 1-bedroom suite with a living area, desk, and dining table. The connecting bedroom had a comfortable king-size bed. The rooms were quiet and street noise was minimal, even overlooking busy 6th Avenue. The room was such an oasis and very comfortably appointed. Staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel's best feature is its location. We didn't take a taxi or Lyft once while staying there. We were close enough to walk to Times Square, Central Park, Bryant Park, Fifth Avenue shopping, etc. What a treat this hotel was! I highly recommend it.

title: Good Location for Manhattan Stay
text: Initially heard complaints about the elevator being slow and being very small. I was also warned about extremely small rooms with no windows. There weren't many elevators, I think between 1-3 (it's been a while since I stayed there, and can't remember exactly), but I never experienced long wait times or overcrowded elevators. Staff was nice, room was also quite nice, only thing that took away from the room was the brick wall view. Regardless, I would stay here again.

title: Hotel da evitare assolutamente!!!
text: Prima cosa nessuno parla italiano in tutto l’hotel , direi carissimo per quello che offre , alla reception non c’è mai nessuno o quasi , entri esci nessuno che ti degna di un saluto  , dopo una settimana nessuno ci hai mai chiesto se andava bene ecc , per non parlare della colazione fatta una volta per caso ( 2 cappucci 2 paste e 2 succhi frutta ) 104,00 euro questo un altro furto e in fine arriviamo ad oggi per venire via e ci troviamo un conto di altri 270,00 dollari che abbiamo dovuto pagare con corta di credito senza che nessuno ci spiegasse di cosa si trattava ... unica nota positiva le camere grandi con clima ma bagno imbarazzante piccolo piccolo... mai più in questo hotel , in zona si trova molto meglio a meno !! Triste

title: Very Good Staff, Very Slow and Small Elevators
text: This was my first time staying in the city. The staff are great and very accommodating. The Breakfast Buffet is an excellent choice for breakfast. Once you add the price of the coffee and one item, you might as well get it all for a little more money, but still not cheap. Hey, this is NYC. For lunch on one of the days, we walked across the street to a hot dog vendor and had a hot-dog with onions, $4 a piece. Can't beat it. It's a very nice hotel, and nicely updated. The elevators are small and slow getting to  the main lobby. Fortunately, there are 3 of them. In hotels of this age, you are bound to find issues like this. I would have liked it if they had more USB ports. I only found 1 and to plug in additional devices, we had to unplug the lamps or use bathroom space to plug it in there. Not sure if better rooms have more USB ports or more convenient outlets.   The location was great for us. I love the hustle  and bustle of the city and everything all lit up at night. We walked to most places like the Theater and surrounding stores and restaurants. Everything they advertise on their site I found to be true.

title: outstanding hotel in prime location
text:
The Warwick is excellent in location, safety, cleanliness, and staff assistance.
It is 5 short-end blocks to Central Park (5 min. walk), less than that to the closest subway stop with three other stops only a couple of blocks away. It's an easy walk of just a few blocks to St. Patrick's Cathedral, 5th Avenue, Radio City Music Hall, MoMA, and more.
Our room on an upper floor was spacious, clean, and quiet.
I was extremely pleased with our stay at Warwick Hotel.

title: Best Experience Ever
text: I’ve stayed at the Warwick three times in the last couple of years.  I’m an older woman, 76, and this hotel made me feel safe and welcome.  It has, perhaps, the best hotel bar in the city, with great staff who know you after one visit.  The rooms are comfortable and well equipped.  I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in NYC!

title: Great hotel, great location
text: The Warwick was perfect for our recent trip to NYC. It is convenient to Broadway, 5th Avenue, Central Park, and many of New York’s best restaurants. The staff was friendly, the rooms were large and very clean, and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast buffet was a solid option for a fast breakfast. We enjoyed our stay very much.

title: Fantastic hotel in great locstion
text:
We booked this hotel through Hotwire and so were pleasantly surprised to find ourselves upgraded to a premier plus room upon checking in. Not only was the room huge and overlooking 7th Avenue, but we had been left a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to celebrate our 10year wedding anniversary, along with a personalized card from the manager! I had mentioned, when emailing the hotel previously about the best way to get to the hotel from JFK, that the reason for the visit was to celebrate our anniversary and was really touched that they remembered it!

The hotel itself is proper old school glamour. Take a moment to venture to the second floor staircase and see the photos of all the famous guests, you are definitely in good company staying here!

The location is fab, out of the hustle and bustle of Times Square but easily walkable to their and the theatre district, along with being only a few blocks from the Rockefeller center and Central Park. 

The nearest metro is one block away and you can easily get to downtown from this station.

We never had breakfast at the hotel but did use the Randolph bar for a few drinks and whilst slightly expensive, drinks were of a good selection and quality. 

Overall I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for old school glamour, with large rooms in a nice area.

title: Perfectly located
text: Just a few blocks from Central Park this old fashioned hotel is perfectly located. Rooms differ in size and quality (I have tried several) but the service is good. Stable Internet. Nice, but pricy, breakfast buffet. Recommended.

title: Good location and very comfy
text: I have stayed here many times and always return because it is such a comfortable and charming boutique hotel.  The location is ideal.  Whilst the concierge and door staff are very helpful, sadly the reception staff are usually rude and dismissive.  Perhaps that’s just NYC, but it would be so much improved if they could be pleasant to their customers when they arrive and leave. I often checkout and wonder why I keep coming back, it’s certainly not due to the reception staff.  Then I remember the comfortable bed ...

title: Old NYC charm but with slow elevators
text: This was our first time in NYC (from Texas) and I wanted a hotel with charm and class, not a contemporary modern one. This fit the bill. The location is superb. I loved that it was in between Times Square and Central Park/5th Avenue. It wasn't super updated but was very charming. Our king room with a city view was BIG for NYC in my opinion and the bed slept very well. The room was clean and spacious. We got the pkg which included breakfast each day. We enjoyed the breakfast, good variety but not amazing food. We interacted little with the staff but each time they were very pleasant and professional. My one complaint (hence the 4 out of 5 stars and not 5) is the elevators were extremely slow. I read through some reviews from May and I was surprised to not see others complaining about this, so maybe it was the bad week we were there. We were there for 4 nights and one elevator (out of 3) never worked and it often seemed like only one was moving. We waited an excessive amount of time in the AM to get downstairs. We began to dread the morning elevator ride. We ended up walking in the back of the hall and discovering a second, much uglier elevator that was for the cleaning crew. We ended up having to this elevator (that wasn't even for guests) the majority of the time. This was disappointing given that 2 nights it was $500/night! All in all, I think I would stay here again. Choose the city view to avoid looking at another building/brick wall!

title: Thin walls, but great location
text:
We picked it for the location and while the walls ver thin and we could hear a lot of noise, we weren't inside the hotel much. 

It's a very beautiful hotel in my opinion. Customer service was great and the rooms were clean. The size of the room was really large for it being a NYC hotel.

title: Very comfortable
text: The Warwick is quite old-fashioned in style but it is comfortable and well located.  The rooms are reasonably large: I had an enormous suite to myself which was very nice but I think the normal rooms are good-sized too.  Breakfast is decent but the fitness centre is a bit limited in facilities.

title: lovely trip to New York
text: The hotel was beautiful and the room we had was great with a balconty that overlooked new York.  The service was great and did a lot of walking with great directions from the service staff at the Warwick.  We will be coming back there again.

title: Watch Your Wallet
text: This is a lovely old hotel, with an interesting show biz history, in a great location. The staff people were efficient--kudos to the valet parking guy and the hard-working waitress in the bar. The room was big and comfortable. My only gripe--and it is a serious one--is that it is lacking in amenities for a hotel that, with all the all the taxes and extra charges, cost over $300/night. There's no coffee in the room, no minibar, no bathrobes. The lobby has almost no chairs, so you will be forced to sit in the bar (and spend money). After we left, our bill had an extra "Service charge" of $25--for what? It's a nice hotel, but it was hard to escape feeling gouged.

title: Great 1st visit!
text: As soon as we arrived, the gentleman at the front desk greeted us warmly! In fact, he upgraded us to a nice suite on the top floor.  Pretty awesome!  Everything was clean and you honestly can't beat the location.  Stay here, SERIOUSLY!

title: A very comfortable stay in a large premier suite
text:
My wife, son of 27 & I are staying in one suite 1507-1508 for four nights. It consists of a large lounge with a big corridor, three piece sofa, TV, Coffee machine facing sixth Avenue. It has a large bedroom with two double beds and attached bath, shower & toilet. Area over 700 sq. ft.
It is well worth the price. Central Park, Rockefeller Centre,Times Square,Empire State Building etc are all within 5-10 minutes walk. We have loved coming back to our room. The two beds are medium firm & very comfortable.
We are delighted to be staying here.

title: Cousins Come To Town
text: Old-time luxury in a midtown location. Steps away from the MOMA. Updated marble bathroom, well decorated room, comfortable beds with a staff that exceeds all your expectations. This is now my go-to hotel in NYC. The total ambience of the Warwick was everything you would expect in a 5 star hotel. No chocolates on the pillow but a cheerful doorman who greets you with a smile .

title: Great location for a great trip
text:
You can tell this hotel is dated. However it's not dated in the "falling apart" way. It's dated in the "old style class" way. Instant walked in and thought I was in the hotel from home alone. The front desk was quick and attentive to my needs. The room was huge. It kept it's classy charm while still adding newer modern day conveniences. You can access all the lights from one panel while in bed. Their is an iPhone/iPod dock to use for your music.  The bathroom was fairly sized with a number of toiletries provided.  The water pressure in the shower was perfect which doesn't happen often in hotels.  The bed itself was extemely comfortable and clean. 

My only complaint was that there weren't many plugs for my phone etc. The ones on the desk didn't seem to work right.  

Other than. That this hotel is great.  It's less then a five minute walk to anywhere(times square, Broadway, Central Park, and the Sunway station). I'd definitely stay again

title: Pleasant return after 25 years
text:
Having the good memories of an earlier stay at the Warwick New York, we decided to go back after having tested other hotels in NY in the meantime.
The hotel was and remained an institution. Compared with the many NY hotels, it remained the mid-size, classic and pleasant hotel. They surely have undertaken some remodeling and renovation, but they kept it in a classy way.
We like the location, the staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms are ok in size and comfortable with respect to amenities and installations. The only thing missing was a mirror apart from the one in the bath room.

title: Karen and Ed's 34 the Wed anniversary,.
text:
Staff were very helpful and friendly, great visit and a reasonable price the room, used Hotwire for the deal. Hop on an off bus was easy to use we purchased through Robert the concierge. The breakfast was pricey but very handy and was an incredible selection of items. 
The Randolph's Pub provided several great Dinners as well for our stay of excellent quality.

title: Always very nice
text:
We’ve stayed at the Warwick a few times and are always satisfied. Good and friendly service, rooms that have some character, and a great location. Also easy access to the subway. 
Will be back for sure next time we are in New York!

title: lovely stay
text: The king room was spacious, quiet (even though it faced Sixth Avenue) and included a mini refrigerator. If you ask for a coffee maker at check in, they will bring one up to the room. Location was excellent. It was away from the bustle of Times Square but walkable to many attractions (MOMA was a block away) and restaurants. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  I would stay here again when visiting NYC.

title: Bem localizado
text:
Foi a segunda vez que fiquei no Warwick hotel e posso dizer que a localização é maravilhosa. O hotel também é muito bom, mas o fato de ser um hotel antigo com carpete e aqueles cobertores antigos,incomoda um pouco pra quem é alérgico. No mais o atendimento é simpático ,o quarto tem uma
Boa limpeza. Ficaria novamente.

title: Ok but not the best
text:
We booked here as we wanted a change of hotel. 
The booking was easy and we were offered an upgrade on the room for which we paid extra for.
The hotel took our money, then when we got to our room, there was a letter informing us that renovation works would be taking place for the 2 days we were staying! 
Very disappointed as the hotel should have informed us before we travelled. 
There was cherry picker outside and scaffolding around the building. 
On a positive the room was a good size and was clean. 
The bathroom was tired and the toilet ran all the time. 
With the world worrying about plastic, it was surprising to see all the small shampoos and shower gels in the bathroom. It would be better to fix a dispenser and refill rather than replace each bottle every day. 
Staff were friendly from what we saw of them. 
There is a mini bar in the room with very very expensive drinks in! No water provided
For the price, I would not stay at this hotel again. I felt ripped off receiving an upgrade then a letter telling us about the works.

title: Hotel normal, no es tan bueno como esta puntuado
text:
El hotel esta bien ubicado. Pero, no avisaron que estaban arreglando y nos levantabamos a las 7am con ruidos. El desayuno que uno paga como incluido nl te incluye un monton de cosas como un capuchino y no avisan. Al retirarnos nos quisieron cobrar todos esos insumos. La habitacion esta ok, pero no excelente.
Tienen poca luz y el baño es chico.
Los ascensores tardan mucho, no dan abasto.
Es un hotel Normal con buena ubicacion. No es excelente como esta puntuado

title: Old world charm
text: Ideally located and minutes away from Central Park, Times Square and Fifth Avenue, the hotel has nice, spacious rooms, they are really big for New York standards. I found everybody working there to be friendly especially Jesus the concierge. I must complain about the multiple times i found dead cockroaches in our room and the bathroom which terrified the kids. The shower drain also didn't seem to work properly water used to overflow. Both of which we complained and I hope they will take care of. All in all I would definitely stay here again. The breakfast at the restaurant near the lobby is excellent but you will have to pay for it.

title: Can’t complain
text:
stayed here for a night and booked it on hot wire. @ $200.00
Lobby was just ok . their outside had construction but the room was really very good
Bathroom was updated and very good, room was updated and very good ,Bed was very comfortable . no wear and tear in the room 
Only complaint was no coffee in the room or complementary coffee in the lobby
Grabbed Starbucks across the street.
And the elevators are very small!!
Good location , for the money I thought it was well worth it

title: Definitely not as expected.
text:
Since I booked my room via a third party website I was given the worst possible room - by the elevators and next to the janitorial closet. The noise of the elevator was constant - day and night, and I was woken up by the cleaning crew banging their equipment and shutting the closet door starting at 7 am daily. The walls are paper thin so you can hear everyone walking and chatting in the hallway. Oh, and I got a prison room view! Take a look at the wall I am facing with no sunlight. The rooms was dark regardless of the time of the day. Look at the proximity of that wall. They call this the courtyard view yet there is no courtyard. The room was dusty and one of the lights was out. the safe isn’t secured properly. Look at those acres (and the dust in the closet). Appalling.
When I corresponded with the front desk manager via email I was invited to stay again and would receive 20 percent off. They automatically offer 15 percent off on their website so 20 percent is just a joke.

title: Great location, friendly and welcoming
text: A classic hotel in the heart of the midtown. Walkable to Central Park and the Empire State Building so a great location if you’re only staying a couple of days. Best hotel breakfast I’ve had in a while (though commensurately expensive). Hotel staff have the perfect balance of professional informality, we were made to feel very welcome.

title: Excelente localização
text: O hotel e muito antigo e tradicional em NY e recentemente foi reformado! O quarto que ficamos com a nossa filha de 5 anos era bastante espaçoso e confortável! A localização é excelente, no coração de NY, ao lado do Central Park e perto de otimos restaurantes!

title: Has some old-fashioned style, but issues with service and maintenance
text:
The property is reminiscent of old New York, and has a certain kind of charm for guests looking to avoid the endless barrage of cookie-cutter contemporary hotels.

Unfortunately the hotel could use some renovations. Many of the furniture were slightly creaky or roughed up, showing their age. Several trims and moldings were starting to crack or had paint peeling off (in less conspicuous areas, but still). The A/C unit was a little musty and needed some maintenance, and the upholstery, the curtains, and the bed covers all looked somewhat dated (to varying degrees). Fixing these would go a long way towards looking like a classy historic hotel instead of an aging one. As is, this is hard to rate as a 4.5-star hotel.

The WiFi was not working for two out of three days of our stay. To their credit, the front desk staff was apologetic during check-in and took off two days' worth of facility fees when I asked them to upon check-out. However, the way they dealt with the matter was quite impersonal and matter-of-fact. It just felt like the hotel staff were having a rough day and were overwhelmed.

The biggest issue was with the cleaning service. The cleaning staff were exceptionally attentive. They checked in on the room several times throughout the day and always tried their utmost best to make sure it was cleaned properly. They were warm and cheerful. I don't have anything bad to say about them. However, the room I was assigned was close to the storage area where the cleaning supplies were kept, and from morning through turndown service, whenever we were in the room we were constantly bothered by noise. It was extremely disruptive when we were trying to sleep in after a long night. Again, they were not making a ruckus or anything; they were simply trying to do their job well, but they had to access the area so many times that it was impossible for us to get calm, uninterrupted rest.

Oh, and the mattress was a little too soft for my liking, because I have a bad back. However, they might be perfectly comfortable for most others who prefer soft beds.

I am disappointed because the prices are really reasonable for a 4.5-star hotel, the location is great, and as a regular visitor to NYC, I thought I had found a great option for my future trips. I had already made another reservation at the Warwick for my next trip coming up at the end of June. These little issues really undermined what could have been a very good experience. Since I cannot cancel the next booking, I will have to hope for the best on my second stay.

title: Warwick hotel in NYC is our favorite place to stay
text: We have been fortunate to stay at the Warwick many times and it is great the way everyone makes you feel special. From the familiar faces of the doorman to Velma at the front desk you get a big welcome back. In addition we have been upgraded on several occasions to their signature suites which are truly special.It is a perfect place to have quite romantic vacation in one of the worlds finest cities.

title: Love it here
text:
Have been coming here for roughly a decade for work. Old New York charm without the old crustyness. 

Service is exceptional. They know I have been coming here for years. Classic, old, rich, rooms. Elegant.

Will continue to come here as often as possible.

title: Lovely hotel
text: I have been wanting to stay at this hotel for a few years now and finally was able to a couple of weeks ago.  The hotel is lovely, a kind of old elegance.  The room was a decent size and the beds where comfy and the decor was nice.  The staff was very nice and always had a smile.  We arrived at noon and they even had a room ready for us which was excellent!  The doorman added a classy touch.  We very much enjoyed the stay except for one issue, the air conditioner never went below 72 degrees.  I get hot very easily and like the room relatively cold so i called the front desk and they sent someone up immediately.  He cleaned and changed the filter and it still didn't move so the air was blowing continuously (we had it on 68) but it was never cold enough for us and we stayed three nights.

title: Best hotel in midtown
text:
The Warwick did not disappoint! It’s quiet, clean and the elevators worked. We were on the 19th floor for 5 nights. Recommend Pick A Bagel for a quick breakfast nearby. 
When we arrived at the hotel a lovely plate of chocolate covered strawberries was waiting for us in the room to celebrate my daughter’s birthday.

title: Great location and character hotel
text: We really enjoyed the hotel. Great character and it was obvious there have been some updates, without compromising the style. We booked through Hotwire, so it was a pleasant surprise, although you don't get any member perqs if you book through an agent (it was my birthday month, and they didn't offer the member birthday treat). The room sizes are very generous, and there is free wifi throughout. We even had space to do some yoga in the morning before heading out for our 25,000 daily steps! Location can't be beat. MoMa across the street, Central Park 2 blocks up, and 57th St Subway station a few blocks away. Lots of coffee shops and restaurants around, and easy walking distance to the theatre district and Times Square. Concierge and staff were very helpful. Randolph's is a great place to enjoy a beverage before retiring (a bit pricey).  We didn't take in Muriels as we hit the ground running every morning. I would definitely return to this hotel, but book directly.

title: Brief, vacation stay
text: Warwick's location is wonderful, and the hotel's old charm is appealing. Would have been nicer without the scaffolding, but it seems every other building in midtown is under repair or construction. Front desk staff is efficient, but cold. Murals (for breakfast) has terrible customer service, and the food is way overpriced. Go elsewhere if you can. Same goes for the restaurant and bar; service there is downright weird. Rooms are nice, if a bit musty. Bathrooms are tiny. And things are a bit dirty and rundown. But this isn't a luxury hotel, and the rates reflect that.

title: Great Location & Price Marred by Small Details
text:
We chose the Warwick for its location & price. The location was perfect for us--near to museums and Central Park.  
     The room itself, housekeeping, and the free breakfast lowered my rating for the hotel. The power had issues.  Lights blinked & some outlets simply didn't work at all. Using a hairdryer close to a mirror wasn't a happening thing. 
     Housekeeping had problems. I requested service between 9:00 and 2:00 on two days. Never happened. The linens needed for the bathroom were always missing something. We never had a bathmat for the floor outside the tub/shower. There were never washcloths and I needed them. I made a sticky spill on the bathroom floor. The floor wasn't touched for the rest of our stay. 
     The workout area was small. Not all equipment worked. They could use a bigger facility. 
    Finally, the breakfast buffet looked good, but it wasn't really. The "warm" dishes were chilly. The pastries and bagels were stale. Hard to complain about something that was included, but we've had some outstanding breakfasts included in other places.
     None of the problems would change our choice. Costs are outrageous in NYC and the price was right and the location was perfect. We would go back. We would hope that housekeeping improves and the hotel makes sure all the outlets work in the room when next we return. We would probably skip the free breakfast and head for some reasonable places close by.

title: Good hotel
text: Location, location, location!! 4 minutes walking distance from Central Park. The hotel is old, not renovated, but in good condition. They have great internet, big rooms, but there is an issue with elevators, especially during morning time. Prices for rooms are very high, but cheaper than others hotels. We didn’t buy breakfast- too expensive, but many options around. In general there are lots of different restaurants in 2 minutes walking distance. In general that’s a good option for business or family visit. I recommend this hotel!!

title: Great experience
text: I had a great experience at the Warwick Hotel.  At check-in, I arrived at 10:30am and didn't expect a room to be ready for me but was pleasantly surprised that they were able to get me in a room!  The room was beautiful and big, not like a lot of NY hotels.  I had a fabulous experience with Ty the bellman.  He was so kind and smiley.  He hailed a taxi for me and lifted my super heavy bag with a smile on his face.  He left me smiling and was a pleasant way to end my trip.

title: Great hotel
text: My daughter and I took a vacation to New York. My daughter’s first time. The hotel was beautiful.  The room were classic and spacious. We loved the location close to everything. The staff was welcoming and nice. Next trip we are definitely staying here again.

title: Very good location
text: I had the best experience with Warwick! The hotel was in a great midtown location and the hotel managers were very kind and sweet. Also the room was clean and luxurious. The check in process went very smooth and the front desk manager was very helpful during my entire visit. I would definitely visit Warwick again when I come to NY.

title: Surprised by Cockroach in the Bathroom
text: We arrived  at the Warwick in New York City on 04/11/2019 and departed on 04/13/2019. The morning of our departure, we found a live cockroach in the bathroom. At the front desk, we reported this bug issue to the manager. He apologized and removed the facility fee of $50 from our hotel bill. We had expected to have one night's lodging taken off our bill due to this inconvenience. Next time we visit New York City, we will stay at the nearby Hilton.

title: This time it was the Bellman...
text:
The hotel is beautiful, however the front desk staff seemed very stuffy and uptight. The best part was the great bellman Steve and Burt. They are so friendly, helpful and saved me a lot of stress
With their suggestions.

title: Grand New York Hotel
text: The hotel has an old world New York charm, and is in a awesome Midtown location. It does represent great value for money as well. Carlos the concierge was top notch and provided us with a wealth of information and was very accommodating. We had a large, nice and clean room. All the staff provided great service. The hotel is in need a some renovations but is awesome value for money.

title: Clean with large rooms
text: Big, nice and clean room with coffee and the in room. Ice and coke mashine on floor. Lots of water in the hot shower and sooooo lovely bed. Friendly staff. Close to the park and rest of shopping area.

title: Not bad but disappointing
text:
We spent four nights at The Warwick in mid April 2019. It's a nice enough hotel centrally located which suited us fine. The lifts are small and slow but that cannot be helped.

Despite all the traffic noise outside, the room was very quiet.

Unfortunately, the room seemed to heat up rapidly if the aircon was not switched on. And unfortunately the aircon was crazy loud which didn't bother me as I use earplugs but my partner hated it being on due to the excessive noise. 

The room was also extremely stuffy - totally airless and stale which bothered me a lot. Being on the 17th floor we could not open the windows. Perhaps the aircon was faulty ?

The food in the front bar - Randolphs - was forgettable though plenty of it.

The worst aspect was the mens bathroom on the second floor which patrons of the bar use. It was just totally disgusting and looked like it had not been cleaned for 3 days. Pools of water on the floor, blocked toilets and worse - totally disgusting.

No in room tea or coffee making facilities - come on - how much does that cost ? You are forced to use room service.

Our bed was terrible. Worn out and sagging, we both had terrible hip and shoulder pain in the mornings.

Staff were great, especially the front desk. Bathroom was good.

Would I stay here again ? Maybe if the aircon and ventilation was fixed. And the loos were cleaned.

title: Classic NY hotel
text: The hotel itself has an old world charm, and is in a great Midtown location. It does represent great value for money as well. However, the property is showing its age; I stayed on the 25th floor, and the room had scuff marks on the walls as well as damage to furniture. The room itself also had loud yet ineffective air conditioning.

title: 4.5 Star Hotel and well deserved.
text: Elegant hotel in the center of it all. Brenda Pesce is my go to contact when I stay there and she is friendly, professional and a great representative for the Warwick. Across the street you will find the Hilton New York. The Hilton NY is outrageously over priced, they tag you with a daily facility fee of $25.00, $25.00 for what? Capitalist at its finest, I guess if people are willing to pay for it then good for the hotel. I urge anyone who is thinking about staying in midtown to stay at both hotels if you're there for an extended period of time. I'm not hating on Hilton, it just has no personality or culture. How they get people to pay their rate's must take magic.

title: Perefect place to say in NYC
text:
Rooms beautiful- not cookie cutter- elegantly decorated. Lots of interesting Hollywood history as stars stayed here in early Hollywood.

Location perfect for exploring all that NYC has to offer. 

staff excellent- helpful. 

Highly recommended

title: Excepcional ubicación
text:
A 4 cuadras de Central Park, una de la 5a Avenida, rodeado de estupendos restaurantes y atracciones como Rockefeller Center, Moma, San Patricio y las tiendas más prestigiadas lo hace ser un lugar para volver. 
Lo único malo es que 3 elevadores son insuficientes para el número de cuartos y esto hace el servicio muy lento.
El restaurante para desayunar es excelente.

title: Decadente
text: Fuimos con mi familia por 5 noches. Ya habiamos estado antes como 4 veces. El hotel esta viejo, sin mantenimiento, la tecnologia de las habitaciones es malisima. La atencion es muy mala. Como si fuera un hotel barato de paso. Tiene solo 3 ascensores para 33 pisos con lo cual o esperas 15 minutos un ascensor o usas la escalera de servicio ( que es lo que hace mucha gente cansada de esperar). La verdad que antes era un hotel fantastico que ahora solo le queda el location. Lo demas es decadente y caro.

title: Magique
text:
Nous avons séjournes dans cet hôtel rempli de charmes et d histoire .Notre séjour fut parfait ,la situation est parfaite ,les services également. Mention particulière pour la literie .Nous étions avec nos enfants et eux aussi ont été très contents de leur séjour .
Le bar vaut le détour également pour prendre un verre en tout tranquillité .
En bref une tres bonne semaine ,nous reviendrons avec plaisir.

title: Location and great staff
text: This hotel has a classic vibe with great amenities. The fact that is in the heart of midtown and near theatres, Times Square and Central Park and great breakfast cafes was a huge bonus. It had comfortable updated rooms and was quiet! The staff, especially the concierge, were great and knowledgeable about how to get around the area.

title: Nice THREE stars hotel
text:
So disappointed, you have no idea !! Waiting 20/25 mn the lift every morning, the bathroom is so little ( room 2003) that you cannot be two in the same time, water pressure of the shower is just a joke and this morning... no warm water!!
Without that, quiet hotel if you support the slamming door the morning. Good luck for your stay .

title: No happy Easter
text:
We are in NY because the kids did want to explore NYC. Our favourite hotel is under construction and this is the reason why stranded here. The checking experience was awful. We kindly asked for rooms next to each other as we travel with kids. The offer was then two different floors. Wow. 
Rooms have seen better days. Today no hot water at 7.30am. 
This hotel is good located in Midtown, but that is it. Most probably we did stay here two times - first and last.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: My mom and I always try to come stay at the Warwick in NYC at least once a year during Christmas timeframe. This hotel is in the BEST location! Right next to radio city music hall, so close to shopping, and really anything you would want to see and do in NYC! The staff is amazing from the guys outside, to the staff at check in! special shout out to Jose for always making our stay extra special!

title: Nice Hotel in Perfect Location
text:
We recently stayed here as a family of 4 for our City Break. The hotel is nice, but rooms a little dated. The hotel is perfect if you just need a base whilst visiting and enjoying all of New York.
No tea/coffee facilities but when we requested it was brought to our room.
The Hotel is perfectly situated for Central Park, Broadway, 5th Avenue and Times Square. There is also the Metro nearby to assist getting up or down town. 
I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting. I would go room only as there are plenty of places to eat when needed.

title: Perfect Location
text: Very nice hotel, our room was clean, everybody was very friendly. The Warwick is located  in between Central Park and Time Square. It's close to 5th Avenue for shopping and there are great places to eat and drink close by.

title: Wonderful nostalgic New York hotel in an excellent location
text: I recently stayed at the Warwick on a business trip and was pleasantly surprised by the 5-star service from the staff (from assistance out of the cab upon arrival by the bellman, to check-in, to another bellman anticipating my need to leave my bag for the day and taking it from me, and the efficient service at Murals for breakfast) at this 4-star hotel.  The room was comfortable and had everything I needed and the lobby and building were quintessential New York.  Close to Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, the MoMA, and everything Manhattan has to offer.  I will be returning.

title: Perfect small hotel!
text: We had a very short time in Manhattan...two days and one night with the goal of seeing two Broadway shows. We wanted to be walking distance to the theatre district and chose the Warwick for its location. I can not say enough about this perfect choice! The hotel is simply lovely...the hotel has old warm charm ( which I much prefer over the modern hotels that are all over the city! ) But, the hotel has been kept up beautifully...our room could not have been nicer..very warm and inviting..really well furnished with good linens and a small but pretty bathroom with a great shower! You can not go wrong staying at this hotel if you want to be in this part of Manhattan...it is a couple of blocks from Central Park and easy walks to the theatre and to Lincoln Center..Also, the staff were all so pleasant and accomodating...This hotel was suggested to us by a friend and I am so glad she did...a perfect stay!

title: Great location and service!
text:
The Warwick is centrally located and conveniently out of the fray of Times Square. The Tonight Show, Radio City, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue shopping, MOMA and the Metro are all located near by. 

The hotel rooms have ample space, the beds are comfortable, and everything is very modern for a Classic New York hotel. Most importantly the staff are friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend staying here.

title: Great location but not relaxing
text: Location is great. Central to everything, incl Central Park. Join their journeys club and then book your room. Member room discounts are significant so me me this was overall a great value. Rooms VERY DATED AND NOISY. No coffee pot. Makes mornings a hassle.

title: The staff makes this hotel worth staying at !
text: Recently spend 5 nights at The Warwick and was very pleased. Arrived at the  hotel at 9:30am after a redeye flight knowing check in wasn't until 3pm, however the front desk rushed a request for a room to be available and we were in by 11:00AM. Everyone we came in contact with at this hotel, from the front desk, to the bellman, housekeeping and maintenance, was extremely helpful and courteous. There are no coffee makers in the room but if you want one just ask and they will get it to you in no time! Same for extra hangers or any other request. The room was tastefully decorated, beds comfy and towels plentiful. The location is excellent with easy access to many attractions and train service. I really enjoyed my stay!

title: Location could not be better
text: This hotel was ideal for us. The location is fab. Easy walk to Central Park, theatreland, art galleries, radio city and even shopping in 5th Avenue. Restaurants are also within easy reach and the subway is outside. The staff on the whole were friendly and could not do more to help from the concierge to the room staff. The only people who were less friendly and helpful were the breakfast staff who appeared to not respond to enquiries e.g the yoghurt had run out and it too ages to replenish even though they were asked.

title: Very Nice, but Avoid Murals Resturant!
text: The Warwick is in a terrific location on Sixth Avenue and 54th Street West, not far a walk to Central Park, the theatre district, Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue shopping, or Times Square.  The room was spacious for an older hotel, quiet, and with comfortable beds.  The staff from the doormen, concierge, and front desk were all helpful.  And the lobby bar was a terrific spot for late night drinks and snacks -- although amazingly for NYC it stops serving snacks at 10:30 pm even though it stays open much later.  And the hotel price was decent for this excellent location and high quality in NYC (look for the AAA discount online).  One complaint: be forewarned that the Murals restaurant in the lobby for breakfast is the most fantastically expensive breakfast I have ever seen anywhere.  New York prices generally are not for the faint-hearted, and I'm fine with splurging once in a while.  But it cost $150 with tip for three people - two pancakes, a waffle, eggs benedict, 3 cups of coffee, 3 orange juice.  $150!  That's insane.  The coffee and juice were $48 alone.  The buffet at $34 per person is slightly less but still excessive.  I suspect they price it for foreign travelers who may not know better or care.  There are several Starbucks nearby, and a terrific diner called Cosmic on 8th Ave and 52nd St. West - just a 10 minute walk - which is excellent.  Cosmic has better food and coffee for half the cost.  Bottom line - I would stay at the Warwick again because it is clean, comfortable, and a fantastic location, but avoid Murals.

title: Nice hotel but don't charge anything to your room!
text: This is the second time we've stayed here.  The rooms are very nice and staff is friendly.  My only major gripe was that when I reviewed my final bill, I found out that they now charge a $25 service fee each time you charge something to your room.
