We stopped several times at the hotel bar and just entered our room number when we paid for the bill.  I never would have done this had we known the ridiculous and very excessive service fee.  Shame on your Warwick Hotel.  We will not be back.

title: Nice accommodations
text: First time staying here. 2 rooms, 4 people. Clean, comfortable accommodations. Convenient location for our trip and the staff was courteous and knowledgeable.  It’s an older building which is part of the charm but the elevators and small and slow so not helpful if you’re in a rush. Will stay here again!

title: Marie’s Birthday
text:
Classic New York Hotel with kerb appeal.

We were invited through the entrance by a friendly doorman, and greeted by a helpful reception who directed us to our beautiful room with views down 6th Avenue.

Our room was bigger and better than anticipated. There was also lots of historical pictures and memorabilia from the hotels glamorous past.

Our stay was comfortable and hassle free.

title: Totally ignored by front desk
text: We stayed at The Warwick for the location, it is incredible, althought the building is a bit old (very small elevatores) everything in it has been restored, making the rooms large (for NYC) and comfortable as well as modern, everything was great, excpet that the service door was right next to our room, and the employees at the hotel slammed the door everytime they went in and out of it, this started every day since 6 or 7am! EVERYDAYYY!!! The whole room trembled with each slam, we called the front desk several times, we approach the employees asking them to keep it quiet, we went down to the front desk to complain, and althought everyone told us really nicely that they would talk to the manager in charge, NOTHING changed, we could not sleep well for our entire stay, and they never offered to change our room or even tried to make an extra effort to help us in anyway. We are sadly not going back and NOT RECOMENDING THIS HOTEL!!

title: de las mejores opciones de NYC
text:
nos acabamos de quedar ahi, y la realidad es que la calidad precio es excelente, el hotel limpio y agradable los cuartos MUY grandes (para NYC) Todo funciono de maravilla.
realmente me pareció muy recomendable y ademas muy bien ubicado.

title: Elegant, historic style in high-rise Manhattan
text: I stayed here for 3 nights for a business conference and was pleasantly surprised.  The desk staff was very accommodating, the room was spacious and comfortable.  I requested a 'city view' room and had a nice corner room with views of 54th St and 6th Ave.  The elevators are small and it takes a while to get one of them, but it wasn't slow enough to be an irritant.  The continental breakfast was quite good.  Overall a pleasant stay.

title: Bien ubicado y cómodo.
text: Limpio, bien mantenido, con buena ubicación y buen servicio. La decoración rememora la época del cine hollywoodense de los años 20’s. Las habitaciones son un poco reducidas pero suficientes. Tienen calefacción y aire acondicionado. El desayuno a la carta o buffet en “Murals on 54” es simple y común, pero los murales sí son de destacarse. El personal es amable y el Concierge muy eficiente con las reservaciones en restaurantes y teatros.

title: Weekend Getaway
text:
Had previously stayed at the Warwick and really never considered any other option when planning this recent trip.  Not sure I still have that same opinion.  
The rooms are spacious and well appointed but regular conveniences are overlooked. For example, all useable electric plugs are across the room from the beds. Another example is that there is an iron in the room but no ironing board.  The elevator situation was a problem. Only two working elevators and the waits were long. 
On the plus side, the bar is great and the doormen were helpful.

title: Elevators were out of service
text:
I had a room on the 19th floor and they had one elevator running, they had instructions to use use the service elevators and it was still up to a 15 minute wait. 
They have a fridge in the room but it is filled with product and I do not recommend taking anything out, $9 for bottled water.  If you want a mini fridge in the room there is a charge, in fact there is a charge for pretty much anything. I cant stand when hotels nickle and dime like that. After a long flight water should be complementary. 
No coffee in the room and breakfast is not included. There is room service with standard fare. 
The rooms are nice and the staff does an excellent job in cleaning. (I did the lipstick test on the glass - and it was cleaned.)  You do get nice soaps and shampoo daily.
The building has a door man that will hail a cab for you - that is standard for NYC. 
Excellent location, near Central Park.

title: Retour au Warwick à New York
text:
Nous recommandons  totalement cet hotel.C est notre 2eme séjour dans cet hotel  à NY et toujours aussi satisfaits.
Le service en chambre est parfait. Le check in/out est très rapide.Nous  recommandons également le restaurant .
En conclusion un très bon service !

title: stay during week of 4th March
text: We've been coming here as a family for over 20 years. We arrived late in the evening from London and were delighted to be upgraded and given a lovely room.  This was a great haven from an exceptionally cold week in New York.

title: Romantic Getaway
text: My husband and I stayed at this amazing hotel for our Valentine's day weekend last month in order to attend Anita Baker's farewell concert at Radio City Music Hall. This hotel with its prime location allowed us to find parking with ease, walk to Radio City Music Hall, Time square and much more. The talented chef procured a preordered fruit platter to our room and the GM welcomed us with tickets to the MOMA. To top it all, our spacious room had a great view of 6th ave. I just can't say how much we enjoyed our stay at the Warwick.

title: Good and bad
text: It’s a great location and the room was recently redecorated and very clean.  Also I got a very reasonable rate online.  Staff on check in were efficient but not friendly and made no effort to tell me anything other than my room number. On the downside the walls are better than paper thin but do let through the sound of conversations and phone calls from next door. The lifts are hopeless - one is permanently out of order and the other two are tiny.  The wait for a lift is normally about five minutes. I waited 13 minutes one morning - no joke if you leave something in your room !   The room had a plumbing problem which recurred both times they fixed it.  There are many better places to stay unless you can get a good rate.

title: Amazing service in amazing hotel
text:
Wonderful hotel with roots in ancient and contemporary history (Beatles slept here!) (Elvis too!). Prime location, near Times Sq but no hassle.
And amazing service. TV was out in our room. Engeneer came up and saw the screen was broken. Then the, manager himself came up and apologised and relocated us to a suite. Security checked if marital agression was involved, a mom would be less worried than he was.
Spotless room, soundproof, bed hard to say goodbye to. Roomservice with creative menu, far more than the standard steak or burger. And considering nyv-prices affordable, also on own website. Highly recommended.

title: Wonderful
text:
Everything in this hotel was great. Perfect location for shopping or siteseeing. Near the metrostation. 5 minute walk to Central Park or Rockefeller Centre, 10 minute walk to Times Square.
The rooms of the hotel are quiet, clean and nice. Big as well. The beds are great.
Now the best thing: ambiance. Because of the architecture, but certainly the staf, the hotel breathes class and style, but in a comfortable way. The dinner at Alfonso restaurant is very nice and fairly prized. So is the Breakfast. 
We loved our stay at Warwick and hope to be back soon!!

title: Not as expected
text:
I’ve been staying at The Warwick for 40 years or more, for both businesses and pleasure. This trip was for pleasure- a girls weekend with family. We chose The Warwick because of the location ( close to the Park, theaters, shopping) and past experiences.  We’ve always enjoyed the charm, and I personally like Journeys Hotels.  
We were hoping for rooms that shared a common hall. I’ve had that room setup quit often and it works out great for a small group, but at checkin they weren’t available unless we paid an additional fee, we had 3 rooms on the same floor instead. 
The rooms are very clean, and the renovations done since my last visit were very tastefully done. We did find, however, that it may be time for another round of updating. Our iHome clock was very outdated- it had an attached charger for an iPhone 4, and the USB outlet on it was larger than it should be and did not accept our charging cords. There was one double outlet on the other side of the room, so having our phones next to our bed was not an option. Our hairdryer only blew cold air on high.  I requested a replacement twice but never got one. Also requested were face cloths. We had one face cloth each day and asked for an additional since there were two in the room, we were left a stack of hand and bath towels instead. 
The bathroom, though small, is nicely decorated. I did struggle with getting the shower at the right temp though, but the water pressure was great. 
Also, take note, there are no coffee makers in the rooms at The Warwick. Ordering coffee from room services is $9+. There are lots of nearby spots to get coffee to bring back, but I find it an inconvenience. Even offering it for n the lobby would be a help. 
Randolph’s Bar in the lobby is alway a good spot.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We visited a couple times during our stay. Additionally, since none of our rooms were large enough for 7 to gather to chat, we used the 2nd flour reception area to hangout with a bottle of wine and some snacks. 
The most annoying issue we found was that only 2 of the 3 elevators were operating. We often waited 5-15 minutes for one.  This has happened in past visits as well. 
There were a few too many inconveniences for me this time.  $300/night should provide seamless experiences. It may be time to claim a new favorite location.

title: Disappointing
text: The hotel is a 3 star at best, with tired looking rooms, especially bathrooms need an upgrade. Staff is sullen and not welcoming, never a smile. On many occasions we had to wait for an elevator for over 10 min. Overall, there is a lot of choice in the area, so don't recommend and will not return.

title: Disappointing
text:
Was really looking forward to staying at the Warwick for a weekend trip. So far it hasn’t been that great. After arrival wanted to iron a shirt to wear for dinner. Go to the closet and guess what... there’s an iron but no ironing board. Called the front desk and they said they will send one right up. Well that wait was over 30 minutes. Came back to the room around 11:45 after dinner and the smoke alarm in the living room is constantly chirping. Again the front desk says they be right up. Over 30 minutes now and no one has showed up!
And to top it all off the commode constantly runs if you don’t giggle the handle. I’m ready to scream. Really wanted to like this place but so far I’ve been really disappointed.

title: A charming hotel.
text:
An excellent location in New York City. Despite scaffolding around the Hotel it is a really good hotel. The staff are charming and very helpful.
The rooms are comfortable and clean. The bar is vibrant and always busy.
I would stay there again.

title: The best location in NY, elegant charm and there are great rooms!
text:
The hotel is fabulous with a beautiful lobby and a lovely bar and restaurant!  
The best value for money as we had a fabulous huge room with view to 6th Avenue which was great. Bathroom a bit old but still clasic in marble.
No coffee machine or cermic cups for a good cup of tea just a keetle provided if request and free tea on request. No bottle water either.

title: Très bien placé et très professionnel
text:
Nous sommes ravis de notre séjour 
Hôtel très bien placé 
Hôtel très professionnel 
Personnel attentif et très serviable 
De gentilles attentions pour notre anniversaire 
Nous avions demandé une chambre calme et cela a été respecté 
Ne parle pas français 
Nous reviendrons avec plaisir

title: Great New York hotel
text: I finally have found my hotel in NYC . Great location , fantastic sized room for New York and really service oriented staff . Buffet breakfast is excellent , really can’t fault anything . Highly recommend

title: Great location near Central Park
text:
This hotel is old world and full service. Rooms a tad small, especially the bathroom.

Quaint but elegant lobby. Make sure to check out the lobby bar. It's cozy with a fireplace and a wonderful stop for a pre theatre cocktail (or two).

Bellman and helpful and happy to hail a taxi.

Overall great hotel.

title: What a pleasure to be back! My home in New York!
text:
I stayed overnight at Warwick and I was so thankful to be back. The staff is friendly, wonderful, and oh so helpful and it's all effortless. My room was a joy with a full and spacious room that lets you breathe and relax. Ahhhh. The bed is just so comfortable and the pillows ample.
It is always a pleasure to return to this fantastic and understated jewel.  Steps away from Central Park and Fifth Avenue and the rest of this wonderful city. Come, check-in, and relax. You will be SO glad you did!

title: Magique 😍
text:
Quelle joie d avoir passé mes 40 ans dans ce chouette établissement.
Situation de rêve et accès easy depuis JFK.
Un personnel attentionné et une chambre digne de ce nom ; oui à 40 ans on commence à dire la literie 🙈et bien là c est la grande classe.
Pas besoin de regarder ailleurs pour moi c est Warwick NYC 😍😍😍

title: Excellent location - stylish!
text: We stayed 5 nights at the Warwick and appreciated our comfortable,clean and spacious room. The Hotel has an old style charm with a welcoming concierge, helpful baggage room and professional check - in staff. The location is excellent - close to the Broadway shows , a few minutes from the MoMa and some very good bistros for dinner. The hotel bar is also very good place for a light meal or drink at the end of a busy day. Would happily stay again!

title: Old style, reasonably spacious rooms, full service
text: It was a business trip so I settled for an airshaft view with a king bed. The room was about 5X the size of the bed, which is pretty good for NYC. Everything seemed new and clean. I needed to valet-park a minivan ($50/day) and also store some luggage. The breakfast looked delicious and is served in a beautiful room, but I didn't try it due to early meetings.

title: 3 Night Stay To Visit NYC.  Perfect room, meals and accomodations.  Hotel saff members were friendly, professional.
text: Perfect hotel in every way.  Room was clean, comfortable.  Everything worked. Restaurant was great; food well prepared and delicious.  Staff was friendly and professional.  We so much enjoyed our stay and will return again no doubt.

title: A Revived Gem
text: Excellent rooms, service, staff and location - impressive buffet and good bar. Very good value for money and a positive bargain compared to many - will return without question. Cannot recommend highly enough.

title: Perfect location and amenities
text: We return to The Warwick year after year for two reasons: amazing location and superb amenities. We walked to shows, restaurants, museums. This time we visited The Museum of the Dog near Grand Central. The hotel is busy, but the rooms are quiet, clean and cozy, full of old-fashioned charm and elegance. I would not recommend booking through Reservation.com as they told us we could add breakfast for a small fee, but that is not the hotel's problem. Next time, I will book directly with them. We look forward to seeing our beloved Warwick next year for our anniversary--or sooner.

title: Fantastic location
text: Fabulous hotel in a great location 15 minute walk to Times Square same to the Chrysler building and grand central station. Lovely big beds very clean rooms and nice bar staff were super polite and very helpful.

title: fantastic
text: we stayed here in december and we must say it was beautiful the hotel has so much character. Fantastic location and everyone was so friendly especially the doorman I would certainly stay here again great experience

title: Perfect midtown location
text: I’ve stayed in the Warwick NY several times over the past 4-5 years. It’s much nicer than most of the major hotel chains and has far more character. The midtown location is perfect for business and site seeing.

title: Perfect Location
text: The Hotel’s façade is quite vintage, very elegant which dates back to the 20’s. However the rooms are modern and comfy. The employees were welcoming and helpful, the service was nice exactly what you should expect from a 4 star hotel, the hotel was well decorated for christmas (we visited on december 2017). We really enjoyed our stay thanks to the location which is perfect. The hotel is really close to the MoMa, Central Park, Times Square, the rink at Rockfeller center.

title: Downgraded -- One elevator out of service for at least 60 hours
text:
We returned to the Warwick and had a much better experience than the first time.  While the bathroom technically failed the throne test (can the bathroom door be you opened and closed while you are on the throne?) it was actually quite roomy.  Plenty of shelves.  Good pressure in shower. Room was decent sized - king bed.  Fan in bathroom and HVAC on the noisy side.  Set room temp so HVAC didn't turn on too often.  Staff good; check in quick.  "Facilities charges" piss me off. If you want the extra bucks, increase your rates.

When we arrived one of three elevators were out of order; when we left 60 hours later, it was still out of order.  This is a hotel; in the middle of the week; where is the urgency? Wait time for the two remaining elevator was unacceptable.

If not for the elevator, it was a very nice visit and would consider going back.

title: Family time
text: Presidents weekend trip. Great time touring NYC. Have been there several times and still have more to see. The staff at the hotel were great. The dooorman was very nice and friendly along with the front desk staff. All the staff were great. Room was better than expected, large and roomy. The bathroom was smaller than expected and could use a shel for storage. Would stay again as it has a great location.

title: Step back in time......
text:
Wonderful "old" hotel with such history.  It is pretty crowded these days , probably due to its location.  The suites are large and comfy.  Room service is good and prompt.  "Randolph's " is always (too) busy--must be some non-guests at those tables, I fear.
We stay here several times a year--love the old New York feel.

title: Don't Overlook this Old Hotel
text:
Giving five stars because it was a "fun place" to stay.  Some of the criticism that it is an old hotel is correct, but still has charm.  Yes, the bar is too small, but really found places for six to sit, met a lot of nice people. Service was excellent and very friendly. Yes, the three hotel elevators are too small.  Was told by a supervisor from Thanksgiving to New Years, they are jammed with people in the small lobby as well as taking the elevator is a venture. The rest of the year is has a different group of travelers and time schedules.
We used the fire stair going down from six floors (once) and Sue's daughter’s family took the service elevator many times (they said it was fast).  In the morning it was an adventure getting in, and hearing from those on the 20th floor the elevator stopped at each floor and we were lucky to get in as someone got off the floor above us. Everyone seemed to complain about it, but they laughed and we all squeezed in complained, but also seem to find it humorous and everyone got alone.  Going up was never a problem. Going down, was an adventure and fun squeezing in and meeting people.  When the morning rush was over, we actually kind of missed the extra company. 

The front doorman was extremely helpful in directions, as the staff was always helpful, even working the elevator group when crowded.  The concierge gave us good advice (take the subway to the World Trade Center and how to do it).  Never saw so many Lyft and Uber SUV's and traffic was worse than San Francisco and Silicon Valley, where we are from (we thought we had it bad, but not like New York City!).

I liked the breakfast.  Most in our group took buffet. I ordered the omelet, which was so large, I could not finish it, although delicious. A couple of times I brought coffee to our room and watched the news, before taking the adventure going down for breakfast.

Our room was interesting, but comfortable. Bed was warm at night with comforter.  The one bathroom much too small and the shower was old school (but really very good and easy to operate, especially compared to some of the modern hotel showers).  We didn't have any problems as everything was clean and housecleaners efficient and friendly. Most modern hotels have two sinks and are large.  Having a private one where only one could use at a time had its benefits.
I don’t know if this was an average room.  It was quiet, unusual for traffic outside and we didn’t hear our neighbors.
And the hotel location is perfect to get around.  The history of the hotel and who has stayed there was told to us by a person who may have been an assistant manager.  One of the tricks I have about learning about hotels is to ask how long the employee has worked there. I ask bellmen, desk personnel, doormen; people I can start up a conversation. When I hear how long, as I did at the Warwicke, and the stories of famous guests throughout the years, was impressed.  They liked the place, meaning they also liked the people who stayed there.  You have a happy employee, you have a happy guest!

title: Great stay!
text: The Warwick was wonderful! Its a beautiful old world style hotel beautifully decorated and the rooms were clean and nicely decorated as well.  Great restaurant & bar right in the lobby. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Aging Dame
text: This is my second stay. I like the Warwick. I like the history, the location is good-ish (I usually use the #1 subway, and that's a bit of a hike), and the staff are friendly and attentive. The old gal is showing her age, especially in the more budget-friendly rooms like mine (where the drapes are getting shabby and the hand-me-down-from-suites furniture is well-worn), and on this trip one of the three very small elevators was out of commission (of an era when the "the elevator is here" sign still says "car"). At Sunday check-out time I literally waited 15 minutes before opting for 12 flights down the service/emergency stairs. I wouldn't *not* recommend it because I'm fond of it, and I'll likely stay here again, but they might consider some improvements.

title: The perfect city hotel
text: The Warwick in New York City is well located in midtown. For a recent conference located in a large hotel chain, I decided to stay at the nearby Warwick instead of the conference hotel. It was such a good decision. The room was well appointed, nice bathroom, closet, comfortable large bed. Service was excellent. The breakfast buffet too was very good with a large assortment of healthy and delicious food - and a plentiful assortment of bread. Very good coffee too with a pot on each table.

title: Aristocrático
text:
Clasico, elegante y limpio hotel con unas grandes habitaciones enmoquetadas provistas de amplias camas y baño.
Las vistas desde sus ventanales son inmejorables y situado justo enfrente del moderno Hotel Hilton. Las salas para desayuno acogedoras. Otro cantar ya es el precio. En definitiva: RECOMENDABLE.

title: Beautiful, upscale hotel
text: Our room was beautiful and nice sized. We had an airshaft view. The view was so bad that it was actually funny! Our view was of discarded construction stuff and paint cans. But, we didn't stay there for the view. We stayed there because it is perfectly located, upscale, clean and beautiful. The view aside, it's a 5-star place to stay when in NYC. This is our second stay at the Warwick and probably not our last.

title: Wonderful time at the Warwick - highly recommend it
text: We spend a long weekend for our anniversary. We were so glad we picked the Warwick for its elegant feel, great service, wonderful restaurants & bars and spacious room.  The location was ideal: walk to Times Square/Broadway, Lincoln Center, 5th Ave. Shopping and Central Park. The staff went over the top to make our stay special. We can't wait to return.

title: The Warwick: No Longer a Secret
text: I found the Warwick by accident about 5 years ago. Everything is of the highest quality. The rooms are well appointed. The restaurant is first-class, and the service ion a 5-point scale is a 5+. Also, the location is perfect. Close to subways, but of course you have taxis right there. By the way, if the bar scene is your thing, it is also exceptional. I stay there any time I am in NY, and that is quite often. I am a senior citizen, and it is definitely user friendly.

title: Excellant
text: We have been staying here from Australia since our kids were little. They are now 22 and 19. We just finished 10 days at The Warwick and it remains exceptional. The position is perfect. It is the best value accomodation in NYC. No hesitation in recommending it.

title: Comfortable hotel in the heart of NY
text:
Stayed here for a conference. Rooms are good, service is good only thing missing was tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms and hotel slippers etc which should be standard. 

Get a room on a lower floor if possible, the rooms at the top take forever to get to with the busy lifts and they don’t have much of a view either, so no pay off for going up.

title: Service beyond expectations
text: I had the pleasure of returning to the Warwick Hotel this past weekend after a very minor issue on my last stay, and being very pleasantly surprised with a major upgrade, and then having a lovely fruit plate and bottles of water delivered to my room. As usual as I approached the elevators in the lobby a staff member had already pressed the call button, the doormen were always waiting and inquired each time if I required a cab. The front desk staff as always were very pleasant, and helpful. I would absolutely recommend this property to any and all.

title: Not a bad stay, but nothing spectacular
text: I wanted to love this place. It's old and grand and impressive when you step into the lobby. You feel like this is a piece of history. The location is convenient to many iconic sights and is close to the subway. But there was nothing about it that made me say "I want to go back." The staff was a bit stiff and unfriendly. Lots of hidden fees for things every time you turned around. If I was able to find a really good deal I would probably stay again, but it is definitely not on the short list for a return visit.

title: Great central hotel
text:
I stayed here just before Christmas. The hotel is perfectly situated to all the main attractions of NYC...Times Square, Rockefeller, Grand Central Station. 
The hotel itself felt really inviting, staff helpful and friendly as well as having the atmosphere of ‘old school’ and classy. The room was very spacious, warm, comfortable and spotlessly clean. Considering how busy it is out on the streets, you couldn’t hear any noise! The lifts are tiny and do take a while to get to your floor but that’s no biggy really.
I’ll definitely come back to this hotel.

title: Wonderful, repeat stay at the Warwick.
text:
I visit New York several times a year for a variety of reasons. I always stay at the Warwick, because it is well located, elegant, and provides excellent service.
The rooms are very large by NY standards and provide a  quiet night's sleep.
I have a number of allergies, so I am happy that animals and down bedding are not
on the premises.
I have recommended the Warwick to a number of friends, who have consistently thanked me.

title: Longtime fan
text: In a city of constant change, The Warwick endures - and proves why that is the case with each visit. Cleanliness, attentive staff, and classic decor are all hallmarks of this midtown institution. On a recent visit I experienced an issue (rare occurrence) - and the manager dealt with me and promptly resolved. Such customer service is infrequent these days, but the Warwick values its loyal and new customers. Thank you!!

title: Great location, poor service
text: I stayed at this hotel Christmas 2018. It was the first hotel of many on our USA 5 week holiday. Although the hotel is a great location, a few short blocks from Rockefeller and Central Park, the staff were dismal. Not welcoming, not helpful, no Christmas cheer. The hotel also charges a "resort fee" (which is kind of standard) but then charges anything & everything on top of that. You have to pay for a fridge in your room as they dont have them and you also have to pay to ask for the use of a wine glass. Thought that was a joke. Shame the service was so bad as compared to the rest of the states, dont think its that hard.

title: Vale pela localização!
text: A uma quadra da Fitfh Avenue e, igualmente perto do MoMA, a localização deste hotel garante diversão na certa. Há várias estações e linhas de Subway nas proximidades também, o que facilita a mobilidade pela cidade, seja qual for seu interesse. Acomodações confortáveis e serviço gentil, quando solicitado. O café da manhã é bem servido mas caro e a equipe oscila entre simpática e indiferente, o que nos convida a procurar um outro local para o breakfast, se o clima permitir. No hotel, há um bom restaurante e um bar, este quase sempre aberto e onde fui muito bem atendida. Considerando a localização e os benefícios apresenta um bom custo benefício, o que acaba sendo um atrativo para escolher este hotel.

title: So surprised by everything
text: Not only is this property very nicely appointed and maintained with a real Hollywood Regency flare, but the staff  and their level of service couldn't be better!  I've stayed at many properties in NYC and outside of the uber expensive 5 star hotels, service and the property itself can be 'hit or miss'.  Not here.  Consistently friendly; helpful and just plain nice people work here.  It's good value for the money and the location can't be beat for theater district in particular.  Overall, a great find!

title: Good Service, nice room, great location
text: My husband and I took his 92 year old mom with us to visit an old friend in Manhattan.  The Warwick is so conveniently located.  I knew it was a place my grandfather used to go and my mother in law remembered going as a young woman to see some of the stars who used to frequent the hotel.  Cary Grant actually lived there for years.  The breakfast buffet is very good if a little expensive at $30 .  The lounge is quite comfortable and doesn't rush you out if you're sitting a while.  We liked it very much.

title: Another great stay
text: Stayed here for the third time. Its a fabulous hotel! Immaculate, spacious rooms, helpful staff and fantastic breakfasts! Location is also perfect to get anywhere you need to go. Couldn't ask for more

title: Excellent location, well appointed large room and fair price
text: The location is great for a tourist and quite convenient for my visit to relatives.  It is across the street from MOMA, a few blocks from Rockefeller Center, central park and generally in the center of things.  The staff are helpful and pleasant.  The cost is less than the more famous hotels nearby while the feel is more New Your and the building is far more interesting than the Hilton on the other side of 6th.

title: Loved my stay!
text:
Have been a guest at The Warwick both in December and in January and have had a great stay both times. My rooms (a one bedroom suite and a Premier King) were lovely. Each room was neat, clean and well done. 
The staff were always welcoming and helpful. From check-in to check-out I had a great experience. 
Randolph’s was very nice and both food and drink were good. Did not visit Mural’s but did try room service on one visit. 
During my Christmas visit my husband and I became ill and needed an extra day to be able to fly home. Many, many thanks to Michael for making this happen. 
My January visit was made special by Nana who was always there with a smile and helping hand. And a big thank you to Larry M, General Manager, for your kind expression of hospitality—the fruit was wonderful!
Give the Warwick a try. It really is a great place to be.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: We stayed here on a business trip with a few other groups and received excellent service. The only downside was (maybe because it was the time we went) it took forever sometimes to get an elevator, which would not have mattered but we were so high up and had several older people in our group. Just something to keep in mind.

title: Excellent!
text: My daughter and I stayed at The Warwick for a 4 night stay in this wonderful city. Our room was clean, fresh and we found the beds  very comfy! The view was not important as we literally just slept once we returned after a full on day in the city. Would recommend unreservedly.

title: Trip for my granddaughter
text: My husband and I have always been fans of the Warwick, but a recent experience just cemented that. My daughter-in-law took our granddaughter to NYC for a mother/daughter trip for her 18th birthday. I booked the Warwick Hotel as a bday gift for her. I like the Warwick for a variety of reasons: central, convenient location, NY architectural charm, friendly service, decent rates, etc. I called the concierge a couple days ahead to inquire if we might have some balloons, cookies, or some other 18th birthday surprise waiting in the room. I explained the mother/daughter/birthday trip. He said he would get back to me. Much to our delighted surprise, the hotel sent a bottle of prosecco (for my daughter-in-law) and chocolate covered strawberries (for my granddaughter) with a birthday message written in chocolate......compliments of the hotel!! Yep, we'll continue to stay at this hotel when we travel to NY. Thanks Warwick!!

title: Great location. Perfect for families.
text: The Warwick is well located for leisure, shopping and theater! We’ve stayed here many times and always know it will meet our expectations. Staff is friendly. Room ms are comfortable and clean with an upscale feel. Usually a good rate, too.

title: Terrific location, great service
text:
I stayed at the Warwick for 13 nights in October and November, 2018, travelling on business. The hotel was booked by my employer.

I read reviews on TripAdvisor before leaving which lamented the ageing decor and the unreliable elevators, so I didn't quite know what to expect. I am pleased to say I was pleasantly surprised. Yes, the decor is of a period, but the hotel is of a period. What counts is that it is clean and well-maintained. My room on the fourteenth floor was spacious, and the bed and furnishings comfortable.

The bathroom, though, was tiny, but I assume this is the original design, and I assume nothing can be done to alter this. There's just enough room to stand, with the required toilet, basin and shower recess. Conversations I overheard at breakfast indicated others had similarly tiny bathrooms. That aside, everything worked fine and did what it was supposed to do.

Breakfast was excellent, served in the hotel's dining room. The bar is also great, with decent snacks and light meals till late at night. The service in both was efficient and helpful. Maybe the folks on the front desk could smile a little more, but the concierges were really kind and friendly.

Be warned, New York is a noisy city. The Warwick is on the corner of W54th and 6th Avenue, and even with the solid windows closed, there's always some noise. This does quieten down after midnight, but I imagine this would be an issue in most hotels in Midtown. I got used to it after a couple of days.

The other thing to be aware of that even when they're all working (as they were during my stay) the three elevators are also very small. Be prepared to get up close and personal with strangers, or wait for the next one.

title: Very good hotel near Central Park
text: We got a large and quiet room, which is not always the case in NYC. The counterpart is that the room was very dark with no view. The room was nice and clean with all the equipment required for this standing. The location is perfect near the shopping streets and Central Park. We found the hotel a bit expensive overall, but this is quite normal for this part of Manhattan.

title: Nice hotel for a great price!
text: Needed a hotel for one night only after staying a few days at the New York Hilton mid-town with my friend for her business trip.  The Warwick is literally across the street so I figured that was the best option.  I was very happy with my room and the hotel especially considering the low cost.  It is a great mid-town location at 6th Ave and 54th.  Lots of things within a few blocks.  Arrived at 11 fully expecting them to say my room wasn't ready and they'd have to store my luggage, but the nice guy at the front desk said they did have a high floor room available for me.  Not sure if hotels realize how happy ppl are when they let you check in early and don't play the "no rooms ready til 3:00 game"; there have to be some rooms ready earlier even if a hotel was sold out the night before as everyone doesn't check out at 12.  Anyway, that wasn't an issue here.  My room was quite large by NYC standards.  Very clean.  Big closet with shelves would be perfect for a longer stay.  TV has lots of channels including 4 or more HBO channels.  Large bathroom (noted that the counter and toilet were lower than normal but I don't think this was a handicapped room - didn't really bother me but it might someone who is tall).  I didn't hear street noises from the 29th floor.   All employees I came into contact with were nice.  Went to the bar for a drink and it was pretty busy for a hotel bar.  I would definitely stay there in the future.  They have a $25 "resort fee" as with most hotels in NYC, but as a tip - if you join their "Journeys" program and book directly through the hotel, that fee is waived.    My only complaint was that the water in the shower either took a long time to get hot enough or never got quite hot enough - same with the sink.    Minor issue that the bathroom has a fan which comes on when light is on (no separate switches) and it is kind of loud; drowns out the TV coming from the other room if you would like to hear it.

title: A wonderful weekend in NYC
text: What an elegant hotel at a reasonable price! The service was impeccable and the King Suite, which was an upgrade, was immaculate. The only thing missing was a free bottle of water. We would definitely stay here again since the location was great and the room itself so lovely.

title: Was OK
text: Having stayed in New York a few times, I was very excited to stay in The Warwick. We arrived and everything was perfect apart from the bloody stain on the pillow we left this on the floor and told the maid yet every day she put this pillow back on our bed. When we arrived we was told we do not pay the hotel in full they hold this money from our card and when we leave we pay how ever we wish (cash or card) yet the full amount was already being held on my card. The rest of the stay was lovely (apart from the pillow and the awful view from our window of a brick wall). When we left the hotel we wanted to pay for the stay with cash, we paid with cash and was told the money being held would be put straight back on to the card. This was a lie, I waited 2 weeks for the money to released back into my bank. After 3 phone calls and a £30 phone bill (called from uk) I finally got my money.

title: New Year’s Eve in Nyc
text: It’s been 12 yrs since I was in NYC,we booked the Warwick hotel at the airport on the 29th of December deciding to go on a whim that morning.The location of the hotel was fantastic the hotel itself looked nice with its old world decor...on arriving my son felt pretty unwell with flu type symptoms..we checked into our room and not a kettle in sight...all my son wanted to do was take a lemsip.. and go to bed...considering this is ment to be a 5 star hotel it took me 3 phone calls to get a kettle eventually I went to get one myself in reception...not good enough...we were staying  on the 14th floor our window faced a brick wall no natural light came into the room at all plus some of the electrics didn’t work..plus all through the night all I could hear was a generator type machine coming on and off,I got no answer to what this was when I asked....I spoke to guest relations and he said basically he couldn’t do anything for me but comp my WiFi...at $25 a night.::what a joke..a 5 star hotel charging for WiFi 🤷🏻‍♀️...€1200 for 3 nights...what a joke...I won’t be rushing back!!!!!!

title: amazing professional and friendly staff, luxurious experience and perfect location
text: The staff makes the whole experience very special, very american! the breakfast is amazing and the hotel itself remind me of the movie home and away, it is very iconic full of character and definitely worth a visit.

title: My go-to hotel in NYC however was dissappointed with restaurant breakfast
text: I love the Warwick, this was my second time staying there and this time was with my daughter for a weekend in NYC.  The service at this hotel is amazing, which is why I was so surprised at the experience we had at the Murals 54 restaurant for breakfast.  It was apparent they were understaffed for servers, however given this one would expect the manager/hostess to be assisting in some way instead of chatting the entire time at the hostess stand.  The one server for the entire room was having a hard time keeping up with his tables, he did the best job he could given the situation.  I think there needs to be better front house management for this particular part of the hotel.

title: Vacances d hiver au top!!!!!!
text:
Hôtel fantastique.  Le personnel y sympathique et professionnel.
Idéalement situé pour faire des visites sur tout New York.
Notre suite etait suffisamment grande pour 4 adultes sans se marcher les uns sur les autres.

title: Séjours agréable dans la grande Pomme
text: Expérience assez sympathique concernant mon séjour aux Warwick dont je connais bien la chaîne. Nous avons séjourné à 4. Le lit est extrêmement confortable et malgré sa disposition géographique nous n'avons jamais été importuné par le bruit. Légèrement déçu par la salle de bain trop simple pour un hôtel de ce prestige et en comparaison des autres de la même chaîne. Situé de façon idéal pour toutes vos différentes promenades qui resteront accessibles en Uber-taxi-métro-vélo ou à pied. Je recommande vivement cet hôtel pour les budget assez élevé.

title: Ho Hum at best
text:
This hotel seems to be preferred by an older clientelle.  Hallways and lobby are very warm. It is conveniently located, so there's that, and if you have to choose between this place and The Hilton across the street, definitely choose The Warwick. If that sound like faint praise it is intended as such.

The bar is great in a classic way. Without the bar this would be one star.  Murals restaurant is pretty terrible, especially for breakfast. They do not care at Murals and make sure you are aware if their apathy.

As for the rooms, pretty standard. No coffeemaker which was a huge bummer.  Next time I am in town I am going back to The Chambers, which I love. It's two blocks away but worth the extra hoofing.

title: Sporco e pessimo servizio
text:
Siamo stati per 1 settimana con mio marito. Abbiamo scelto il Warwick sia per il prestigio del suo nome che per la posizione. E' la settima volta che andiamo a NY e la seconda che alloggiamo a midtown. Tra la 54th e la 5th c'è una puzza incredibile di baracchini e smog che entra fin dento l'hotel.
Il servizio non è assolutamente a 5 stelle e la pulizia lascia veramente a desiderare.
Gli ascensori che non arrivano mai perchè troppo pochi rispetto alle dimensioni dell'hotel.
Il portiere che non ti apre la porta nemmeno se entri con i bagagli (tranne uno educatissimo e molto gentile), gli asciugamani non cambiati tutti i giorni (nemmeno se richiesto perchè sporchi), kit bagno pressochè inesistente. I prezzi del bar sono molto alti ma nella media di NYC. 
La stanza mi è piaciuta. Abbiamo preso una king, molto spaziosa e funzionale. Meno il bagno. Non torneremo. 
Non torneremo sicuramente.

title: Top Shelf
text:
The staff and accommodation at the Warwick could not have been finer. Upon arrival we were upgraded from a Premier King to a Signature Suite which offered 675 sq/ft of comfort. Fridge had been placed in the room as requested, this room 2506/07 has an enormous terrace which was closed due to exterior renovation while we were there but it was December anyhow, any other time of year we would have been disappointed but it was a complimentary upgrade so no room to complain. The only downside is the size of the bathrooms, they are quite small compared to the rest of the space. Walls were covered in artwork, windows were almost ceiling to floor. I was amazed that this size of room was available in Manhattan within our budget.
As for the staff, I broke my ankle our first night there. The in house Dr. recommended a clinic who quickly got me into see an ortho specialist. Guest services arranged a mobility scooter for me with delivery and pick up from the hotel, overall world class service from everyone, my week on a scooter was made comfortable. For the people complaining that the hotel "has seen better days".... well yah it's almost 100 years old but has been well kept and upgraded, I suspect the small bathrooms & elevators are a product of the age, fixtures and appearance is modern and new but the footprint is likely original. 

The Warwick will be our hotel of choice for all future NYC trips, cost for value is unbeatable from what I've seen.

We were not impressed with the restaurant Randolph's - $6 coffeees + refills ($24 for 2 cups of coffee for 2 people) the chicken Alfredo sauce was runny and flavorless. And it was $$$ 2 small entres and coffee for 2 was $80 USD.

Connolly's Irish Pub 2 doors down 54st was AMAZING - we ate there 3 times in a week, home cooked, large portions, great staff....

As for the hotel it definately deserves it's 4.5 stars in my opinion.

title: ottima caffetteria
text:
Non abbiamo soggiornato nell' albergo, ma abbiamo utilizzato la caffetteria.
Il locale, molto centrale, è elegante con un ottimo servizio.
Abbiamo gustato una cioccolata veramente buona, accompagnandola con una pasticceria di alto livello.

title: Excellent hotel in a great localtion
text:
This is a wonderful hotel that is centrally located in Manhattan.  It has easy access to subways.  MOMA is right down the street.
I find the staff to be helpful and courteous. The Superior  extra rooms are spacious;the beds are comfortable and the bathrooms clean with amenities.  Housekeeping is excellent.
There is a great breakfast room in the lobby and if you can get it included, its a great value.
The elevators can be crowded at peak times. The only other shorting coming is that the room close loudly and you can hear them from you room.  It's a minor incovenience

title: Great Location But has Seen Better Days
text: Location is perfect for a short visit to the City. Lots of great restaurants, shopping, museums and Central Park within walking distance. Room was ok but not soundproof and lots of slamming doors woke us up numerous times. Small lobby can get very crowded and has limited seating.

title: Our home from home - Great location
text: Had a lovely Christmas and New Years 10 nights stay at the Warwick. We were very dubious to start off with after not receiving any replies to our emails. But the hotel is in a great location and it provided us with everything we needed. The lifts are still very few and far between but we just used the service lifts. Room 916 gave us a great view of the city! Thank you Warwick

title: Nurrie and staff New Year's Eve
text: The staff was incredible. Everyone went out of their way to make conversation, even for brief moments in the elevator. Our doorman, Nurrie, was the absolute best! He was so nice and helpful and sent us off with a great last impression of our stay.

title: 昔は定宿？
text: 5年ぐらい年間1カ月は宿泊してましたがあまりにも酷く今は定宿探し中です従業員が掃除の合間にタバコ吸って部屋がタバコ臭かったリ色々最近問題ありです

title: Fabulous Location, Nice Vibe
text: Planned a last minute trip to NYC for family of 4 (kids aged 6 and 8).  It's not easy to find rooms in Manhattan with 2 beds especially on short notice.  We were happy at the Warwick it is a wonderful location.  My only complaint is the air control in the room din't work properly and it was too hot.  Which is pretty miserable when you're travelling in the winter and it's cold and snowy outside but stuffy in the room.  I could barely stand to be fully dressed in my winter clothes inside the hotel room.

title: The location is very good, rooms are ok priced high in December
text: Warm and comfortable with helpful staff, this hotel is OK for a short stay in New York, however don’t pay for view upgrades whilst the building work is on, as you can’t open the balcony doors.  Would I stay again.  Yes.

title: Location, location, location....and quality
text: History abounds and location is convenient (short ride) to most attractions.  Almost across the street from MoMA.  The staff is very friendly and the service is superb.  We travel a lot and were pleased with our room, especially the bed.  One of the best sleeps on the road ever.  Higher up is best to avoid the constant Manhattan street noise.

title: Great location, friendly staff, and cool building
text: This is a great location for those trying to explore manhattan.  If you come in on the train into penn station it's just over a mile walk. If you decide to walk you can stroll down Broadway through times square or past Rockefeller plaza just a block or two over.  Very cool looking architecture and friendly staff.  Rooms are small but what you would expect in NYC.  Very close to central park and radio city music hall, maybe 3 blocks to each.

title: Medium
text:
Ottima posizione, vicino central park. 
L’hotel ha ottime potenzialità ma sarebbe da ristrutturare. Decisamente poco curato nei dettagli (stanza con pareti macchiate, lavandino scoperto, vasca molto piccola e doccia vecchia, riscaldamento molto rumoroso).
Il “Bar” sottostante e’ carino, ha una bella atmosfera, il personale non e’ particolarmente cortese, un po’ affaticato. 
Nel complesso e’ decisamente inferiore a molti 5 stelle ma il giudizio e’ medio/positivo grazie ad un buon rapporto qualità/ prezzo.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Really beautiful hotel the room was very clean the breakfast buffet was beyond my expectation the entire team was very helpful thanks to each of them and specifically to JOSE the concierge who saved my day on the December 25th by giving me his own carry on luggage thanks also to the breakfast team for preparing this delicious breakfast and also to the kitchen cooker thanks to the receptionists day and night shift and to the conciergerie team for making the hotel safe. I'll not hesitate to come back again for my next trip in new york!!!!

title: Very nice
text:
This was our second stay at The Warwick, and just as enjoyable as the first.
Check in was smooth and was lucky enough to get a decent upgrade.
The room was lovely, spacious and very clean.
Breakfast is very nice, with plenty of choice from either the buffet or menu option. I never eat that much at home but you just can’t help yourself with such amazing choice. The staff are great as well.
Randolph’s bar is a good place to have a pre or post evening drink or even something to eat. The menu is very good.
The only reason I gave this hotel 4 and not 5 stars is because of Randolph’s. Although I said it’s good, it’s also very chaotic you have to grab a table when it becomes available as being a guest in the hotel means nothing. You also have to settle your tab at the bar before you can get a table as they are dealt with separately and the grumpy barman will let you know this!!! 
This aside the hotel is in a fantastic location and still very good.

title: Great Hotel with old world charm
text: Great hotel, perfect location, friendly helpful staff, comfortable rooms decorated to a high standard. We could not ask for more. Really the only negative I have is that the room was a bit warm/stuffy for our taste. And we did not have any washcloths the first couple of nights but did receive some. These things were not a huge problem just a matter of preference. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Nice hotel, some renovations needed
text: Beautiful historic hotel located near 5th ave & Time Square.  The beds were comfortable and I loved the location. We were there for a business meeting so we knew several people staying in the hotel at this time. Quite a few of the people (including me) had difficulty with the temperature control in the room.  Our first room temperature was 78 degrees. They sent maintenance up to fix it but that did not help. We demanded a different room  and things got better in the new room.  I did notice in a couple of areas in the hallways that the wallpaper is starting to peel off - time to renovate!!!  I ordered food service a couple of times. Unimpressed by this food. Also, not impressed that each time they charged us $10 to deliver the food to the room! The restaurant has a great bar offering great food plus another restaurant for breakfast.  The historic feel of this hotel is quite charming! Wish they offered free bottles of water like they do at the Hilton hotels. It was my second stay at this hotel so I may visit again.

title: yıllar sonra yeniden
text: Ilk kez 26 yıl once kaldigim otelde yeniden kalma sansim oldu. lokasyon olarak merkezi, fiyat olarak bolgedeki diger otellere gore daha uygun. Kahvalti secenekleri zengin. giris katındaki cafe yorgunluk atmak icin birebir. bana verilen oda bosluga baktigi icin o konuda sanssizdim.

title: Amazing!
text: Beautiful hotel in a perfect location. Easy walk to Central Park, Radio City Music Hall and Rockefeller. Lobby bar is perfect spot for a drink.  All staff were friendly and helpful. Can’t wait to come back.

title: nice options, a few suggestions
text: I'll start off by saying this is a very nice hotel.  I enjoyed my stay and it was priced better than the hilton across the street. I do have some important advice and feedback though which is why I rated this as average.  First, ensure you get a room that does not look out on a brick wall. I checked in and my room window literally looked at a brick wall that was very close to the window. I received no natural daylight in my room at all.  They moved me the next day after I complained at no extra fee.  Personally, if they can't provide a window with daylight they shouldn't have a room there.  I'm not expecting a view everywhere I stay but for the amount of money paid, I feel I deserve some natural sunlight.  The other thing I thought was odd was that as a corporate guest I was provided breakfast vouchers with dates for each day of my stay.  On the first day no one said anything and I thought they were good for the entire breakfast buffet. The next day, as I was seated, I was informed that the voucher was only good for 4 pastries, excluding bagels.  When I checked out I mentioned this and that it was not ideal that I wasn't told this on my first day and that I was now being charged for that breakfast.  They told me this was made clear on the voucher by the worrd "continental breakfast".  I'm sorry, but no, I didn't know that continental breakfast only means 4 pastries and nothing else in the buffet.  To assume that guests know this is not ideal and quite honestly the whole policy comes across as petty.  Otherwise, the hotel was lovely.

title: Great location, deceiving web site
text:
The location is fantastic, within walking distance of Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, theater district, diamond center, and many fine restaurants.  The hotel is quaint, rooms are nice sized, and, if you book on the 6th Avenue side, with good views. There are only three elevators, and they are very small. Will only hold six people without luggage. Business center only has two computers.  Front desk staff can be either pleasant or not. Housekeepers are very nice and do a great job, very unobtrusive. Their web site is deceiving. It offers free breakfast if you book online, which I did. When I asked about it at check in, they told me no, I booked the rack rate. A manager called to confirm. We were meeting friends who were also staying at the Warwick, and the same thing happened to them. 

If it wasn't for the deceiving web site, I would have rated them four stars.

title: Christmas Light Bucket List
text: Since this was a Bucket List trip, I decided to spend a little more on a hotel and stay in one that I had heard a lot about and was one of the more historic in NYC.  Arriving at the hotel it didn't disappoint the Doorman in his Top Hat & Coat was just as you would imagine, he was extremely nice and had our bags out of the car almost before we got out.  My exhilaration ended there.  The Desk Clerk at check in was border line rude.  Very curt when asked a question and almost made you want to apologize for checking in.  The Clerk checking out wasn't much better.  The elevators are extremely small and can leave you waiting for as much as 20 minutes to catch from your room.  A couple of times I considered taking the stairs even though I was on the 16th floor.  I booked a Suite which was okay but I have had better in NYC, for less.  The bathroom by New York standards is smaller than most, and if you've been to New York at all you know the bathrooms are small.   If you want any kind of view make sure you book an Ave of the Americas suite, we looked at brick walls all around.   Besides the Doorman upon arrival the only other bright point of the hotel was the Housekeeping staff, they were  very friendly and accommodating.    I will say the location of the hotel was good in proximity to what we wanted to do.   Needless to say I was extremely disappointed.

title: Great location, great hotel, slightly pricey
text: I've been a repeat guest at this hotel on business trips due to the great location, top condition of rooms and furnishings and excellent service. Unfortunately price has also been increasing. Havn't had breakfast so I can´t comment on this part of the service. The gym is also comfortable, well equipped and in good condition.

title: PERFECT
text:
Splendido hotel di lusso 5 stelle allocato sulla 6th Ave, comodissimo, confortevole, dotato di tutti i confort, a 2 passi da Central Park e quindi dalla 5th Ave.La colazione non è compresa nel prezzo, (un neo di questa splendida struttura) ma il vero punto di forza è la posizione centrale nel cuore di Manhattan.
CONSIGLIATO

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: This was our first stay in the Warwick and definitely not our last.  The suite was beautiful, well-maintained and clean.  Every person from the hotel with whom we had contact was first-class.  Highly recommend!

title: A 3.75 rating: More attention to detail could make this a truly first class hotel
text: There are scores of hotels like the Warwick in midtown Manhattan, properties which cater to tourists, business travelers, and conventions, which aspire to luxury status but never quite make it. When family from Ohio visited, I selected the Warwick because it was in midtown, had a good reputation, and had reasonable prices, at least for a New York hotel. The one-bedroom suite (2007/8) was largely as advertised and illustrated in both official and traveler photos--spacious enough, comfortable, and clean. However, when I scoped out the room before my family arrived, I saw that one of the toilet paper rolls had barely half a roll and the other less than a quarter roll, with no back-up rolls anywhere. To be fair, housekeeping promptly brought up spare rolls, Later, my sister noted that the vanity mirror's light was out and that the bathtub drained very slowly. Yes, they could have alerted the front desk, but they had more important things to do in the big city. The beds were comfortable, the suite was made up properly each day, and room service was fine. The breakfast room off the lobby is generic but pleasant. The hotel really doesn't have a restaurant--it's attached to the bar, which was thronged with people every evening, making it impossible to get a table. The public area was quite small, able to seat only 8 people. The staff was friendly. If I could, I would rate this hotel as 3.75, and were it to pay greater attention to detail, it could be a 4.5. Bottom line: despite the deficiencies, I would definitely put my family up there again..

title: Old World Charm at its best
text: Having stayed at many NYC hotels my wife and I decided on the Warwick Hotel for an overnight stay during the Christmas Holidays.  You are greeted at the door by the hotel doorman who is replete in top hat and overcoat.  The reception desk is staffed by personable and professional hotel staff which made for a quick check-in process.  The thirty-six story hotel built by Randolph Heasrst and frequented by many of the notable movie stars of the 1920's and 30's has a rich history both its famous guests and its old world charm.  The room provides the comforts of home and a great location to view the many sites such as Radio City Music Hall, Central Park, Rockafeller Center and shopping.  For tourist and New Yorkers alike the hotel for the price is well worth the stay.

title: Great Hotel with great service and location
text: The Warwick Hotel in NYC is the place to stay for business or pleasure. The staff, from reservations, front desk and room service, are extremely professional and helpful. I have been at this hotel numerous times and it always hits the mark. I have sent clients and friends and they agree. So for value, location and service its a no brainer to stay at the Warwick when in New York.

title: Great location
text: Stayed here with a friend for 5 nights. Room was nice. Downside no tea coffee making facilities or fridge. Didn’t eat here but had a drink at the bar which was expensive compared to London . WiFi was poor! Although first visit in 5 years, I think NY is definitely more expensive now. Hadn’t realised on booking that facilities we paid for,  that we never used also weren’t reminded at check in. But that’s our fault for not checking booking.  One lift out of order but used service elevator. Fantastic location for Times Square and Top of the Rock.  Would stay here again .

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo, posizione centralissima.
text: Servizio accogliente e ben organizzato, camera spaziosa e servizio attento, posizione centralissima di fronte al Moma e a 100 metri da Radio City e Rockefeller Center. Sempre 100 m. da Five Avenue e tutto lo shopping di NY.

title: Mother daughter trip
text: I just finished a lovey stay at the Warwick. The hotel is beautiful and rustic.  I especially love that they recently changed their color to purple which is royal. We did not eat at the hotel but the options looked nice. The rooms were spacious which is not a norm for New York. The hotel staff was just cordial, no one was really friendly and no one was rude.  I would stay here again if I came back to New York. Location was great.

title: Beautiful traditional New York hotel which is rich in history
text:
I recently stayed at The Warwick for 4 nights and was very pleased with my visit. Overall, I found the staff very helpful and pleasant. We stayed in a suite which over looked the avenue which in my opinion was definitely worth the extra money as it was a great experience. The hotel is very traditional and very clean, the hotel is rich in history with many celebrities staying here over the years, with photos around the hotel to showcase this. I used to be a regular visitor to the Waldorf Astoria, but since the closure I have been looking for a new place to stay in New York and can happily say I will now be returning to The Warwick. The location is perfect, literally minutes walking distance to Central Park, Times Sq, Rockerfeller, Empire State Building etc. 

I had zero issues with the lifts as per some of the other reviews, and considering I visited at a busy time during the holiday season, I can't really understand how this could be an issue - maybe people are just inpatient when it comes to waiting 1/2 minutes for a lift during peak season in a very busy City or I was just very fortunate. 

Thankfully I read the negative reviews regarding the $25 per night fee and was advised to sign up for the Journeys Membership (free of charge) and this automatically gets waivered. Otherwise I would've been left very disappointed! I would advise the hotel to change this policy, as it is a ridiculous charge considering the hotel is not cheap, I would expect to receive these extras for free in any other 5* and can't see the point of it in place if it is so easy to get around with out paying by joining Journeys Membership for free. It just leaves a bitter taste in customers mouths who are not aware of the Journeys Membership waiver. 

Finally, the reservations team (Navlat) was extremely helpful in organising my booking and was a pleasure to deal with.

title: Location, location, location!
text: Excelente hotel.  Buenas habitaciones muy limpias.  El hotel tiene fácil acceso y todo es muy conveniente. Sin largas filas como los hoteles más grandes, el proceso de check in es rápido.  Lo mejor, la ubicación. Cerca de líneas de metro, Central Park y atracciones en midtown.

title: Quick Getaway
text:
This is a nice hotel at a great location and has nice, clean & good sized rooms. I didn’t give it a five because:

(1) The elevators are tiny & you are often squeezed in with other people. 

(2) The water ran between VERY hot & cold  while showering. Plus, tried to take a bath one evening & the water was very brown in the tub (see photo). 

(3) The service & buffet in the breakfast restaurant was very lacking. Servers were a little surly. We chose to eat breakfast elsewhere. 

The bar is nice but has very limited seating.  The service was good. 

The staff in the hotel is friendly.

title: MAJOR Disconnect in Communication
text:
I booked a room over the phone and explained that I wanted a parade view room for next year's Thanksgiving Day parade. The man who I spoke to on the phone was SUPER nice, booked a room, and said that I would need to call back the following day to ensure that the room would be on floors 3-6 which I was requesting. I called the next day and the woman at the front desk was super rude and explained that booking online didn't guarantee the room. I explained to her that I called and needed to just call back to make sure everything was straight. She was talking to me like I was dumb and didn't follow proper protocol for booking and that I needed to call to book the room... AFTER I HAD ALREADY STATED (THREE TIMES) I BOOKED OVER THE PHONE. I understand that I need to call a manager now... However, that is advertised NOWHERE online or when you call. You telling me that I didn't follow the correct protocol 5 times isn't an efficient or effective way to help your customers who are shelling out hundreds of dollars a night to stay at your hotel and ensure that you have a job. She was incredibly rude, short, and sent me to the manager to get the room worked out. 

When the manager returned my call she basically said that the person who originally booked the room with me was wrong and that I would have to book with her. Fine. Well... the price of the room doubled and there was a three night stay minimum (understandable). However, had I known that my $700/night stay was going to turn into a $1,500/night stay I would have never booked in the first place. 

You would think that they would make it right and honor the original booking or offering something... NOT AT THE WARWICK! I'm just glad that I called back to follow up on the room. Haven't even stayed here and their customer service is abysmal. The Ritz is down the road and at least they will ensure quality customer service!

title: Surprise $25/night fee
text: Had to change rooms,  first room had an awful smell.  Second room 315, had such a small bathroom that I almost couldn't sit down on the toilet. Also, they had a surprise $25 mandatory resort fee that wasn't paid for when the room was prepaid by my host? Otherwise hotel is ok.

title: My Go-To New York Hotel!
text:
This hotel always provides a great experience.  I stay here very frequently for work, and the service, comfortable rooms and "welcome back" that I get from the staff make my trips away from home a bit easier.  

The style is classic and elegant and is perfect for those who like vintage charm but with renovated rooms and modern amenities.   If you are fortunate enough to get a room with a view, the lookout over 6th avenue is pretty impressive.  The interior rooms are just as well appointed and though they lack the view, are away from the noise.

The location is convenient to all things Midtown and the ambiance at the restaurant is great for business drinks.

title: Our all time favorite hotel.....let's tell you why
text:
We regualarly spend time (mostly theatre weekends, once a year) at the Warwick Hotel, NYC.  It's our favorite hotel and we travel quite often.  

You can't beat the location which comes with a charming, friendly and professional staff.  It's not often in NYC that you are recognized as a regular customer but at the Warwick you are greeted as a friend who has returned from a long trip from the gents at the door to the wonderful woman who checks us in routinely.  It is a joy for us to recognize the staff each visit as remember, this is New York City!! Our recent three night stay included a window view of the Thanksgiving Parade.  It was a bucket list item and our entire family enjoyed the thrill of watching the parade from our window followed by a Thanksgiving feast at Murals.  From the catering director to the server to the bus boy, each gave us exceptional service while being kind to our 5 grand kids.  All in all, the Warwick never disappoints us.  A great hotel operated by a great staff.  When you travel to NYC, the Warwick is a must!

title: Elegant hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text: We often stay in the Warwick when we visit NYC.  The location is perfect for museums (MOMA is across the street), shopping and theater.  We love having a late snack in the bar and the breakfast buffet in the restaurant.

title: Thanksgiving in NYC
text:
Our trip was the perfect way to check an item off our bucket list! From Angela Calebrese, who got us into a 6th floor, parade-facing room, to the doormen, front desk clerks, bell service, dining, housekeeping and valet - everyone made our stay a great experience!

Our room was spacious - especially for NYC - clean and beautiful. The complementary thermos and blanket were a special touch, as was the chocolate turkey ... a big hit with my 8-year-old! 

Thank you to everyone who made this such a special holiday for my family! We may just have to cross this bucket-list item off twice!!

title: Magical
text: Our family spent Thanksgiving at the Warwick in NYC. We had such fun doing all the traditional holiday activities. The Warwick is convenient to everything we chose to do, the service was first rate, and the rooms were great. We had one suite where everyone could gather and regular rooms on the same floor. We have stayed at the Warwick a number of times and are always pleased.HL-M

title: We had a lovely stay at the Warwick.
text: Our stay at the Warwick was wonderful as it has been on past stays here. The front desk staff was polite and efficient, the bar restaurant staff was pleasant and the food was delicious! The doormen were friendly and welcoming and recognized us on each return to the hotel which was very nice. We had no issues during our stay. The hotel is close to places we were interested in and we booked an interior (no view) room which was quiet, so we slept great. We will stay here at the Warwick again. Thanks for everything!

title: Beautiful NYC Hotel!!
text: We elected to stay in the city as we were as we do every year, watching the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade. We chose The Warwick because it was on the parade route. Glad we did. The Warwick was a beautiful hotel, spacious rooms and great customer service. It was extremely clean with a old fashion but modern look. Right in the middle of midtown, we had everything we needed walking distance. From sight-seeing, Christmas lights to any food, it was right there. I would without a doubt go back to The Warwick my next NYC visit.

title: Thanksgiving in NYC
text: It has been years since we had been to NYC and this was a family trip for the Thanksgiving Day Parade. For us, the Warwick was the perfect choice. Easy access in and out during the parade, great location for walking to Rockefeller Center and convenient to central park. The staff was outstanding and we would likely stay there again. The only issue we ran into was the lack of power outlets in the room for the modern day family and some of the lights didn't work on the master light switch. Other than this, we had a great time.

title: No heat and indifferent service
text:
After staying at the Warwick on pretty much every trip to New York for the past 6 years or so, we are finally ready to move on. The hotel is older, but is in a terrific location (we are MOMA fans and it's on the next block), close to 5th avenue, Central Park, subway stops, etc. However, management seems to be non-existent and the hotel is badly in need of refreshing. 

Our room had street views - which we usually request - and was large by most standards, with the exception of the bathroom which was minuscule with a small shower, no hooks for towels or robes (which we had to ask for), and a crack in the sink. The shower control valve was also loose, making temperature control somewhat difficult. The real problem was that we had no heat on the day of a terrible snowstorm. Maintenance was valiant in trying to repair it, but no luck. One of them finally brought us a space heater and we asked for extra blankets. It took several calls to the desk  before any response to our requests. Throughout the fiasco, we NEVER heard from management, were not offered an apology, a bottle of wine, a bowl of fruit or a discount on the room. We were initially told there was no room available to move us to, and we would have to wait until the next day. This turned out to be not true, according to the front desk. It seems as if no one is in charge. One other annoyance - one of three small elevators to service 30+ floors was out of order for our entire 4 night stay. Overall a VERY frustrating experience.

title: Would never encourage anyone to stay here sadly
text:
We had a fabulous trip to New York but we’re sadly seriously let down by the hotel. We were advised by another guest (in the lift) to be careful as they try and charge for whatever they can... and how they were right!
To keep it short, 6 of us arrived and met in the restaurant. We had to ask for some water at the bar 3 times before they finally sent somebody over like they said they would. After we had our water and a bottle of wine (wine between 4 people) we got charged a $7.50 ‘large party’ fee.
We asked if we could have some mugs brought up to our room - we were told they were on their way... they never arrived.
We asked for plates to be brought up (we asked twice) and were then told it was $12.50.
The WiFi which is advertised as Free when you log on, is not free, despite confirming at the front desk.
Having been very wary that they were trying to charge at every opportunity, I was very disappointed to see $138.50 gone from my account when I returned home. They’ve persistently ignored my emails querying the bills... I don’t believe I met one smiley, pleasant person in that hotel. If they’re going to charge for everything, at least be friendly in the way you do it!

title: Just spent three nights at the Warwick
text: Just got back from a weekend break in New York. We stayed at the Warwick. The hotel has a nice vibe as you walk in. It’s not as anemic as some more modern ‘chain’ hotels. There are pictures up the staircase of some of the many stars who have stayed there in more glamorous times. I found the desk staff on check in and check out a bit surly but maybe that’s a New York thing. I asked for a coffee maker to be delivered to my room. My first request was ignored but it was delivered on the second. The bar area was very convivial but beware prices are high - $25 for a beer and glass of wine (again this is in line I guess with similar hotels in Manhattan. Breakfast at $30 was also expensive so we ate out. The rooms were clean and comfortable but worryingly we were visited by a cockroach on the morning of our departure. I did report this to the front desk when their surly manner lifted for a second whilst they apologised.

title: Price worth hotel i a super spot.
text: The hotel had a location very close to both Time Square and Central Park. Restaurangs, theatres and shops was just around the corner. The room was clean and of good size even though the feeling was a little bit dark and old.

title: La storia nel cuore
text:
Sono stata in questo hotel con la mia famiglia. Abbiamo scelto questa struttura poiché è un edificio storico newyorkese che ha ospitato la Hollywood del secolo scorso.
La struttura è indubbiamente di grande fascino, sembra veramente di tornare indietro nel tempo. 
Le camere spaziose ed accoglienti denotano però una ristrutturazione non molto recente.
Il personale è molto cortese e pronto ad intervenire per qualsiasi richiesta.
La colazione non è compresa ma intorno all'hotel sono presenti moltissimi locali dove è possibile effettuare colazioni di qualsiasi tipo.
Il vero punto di forza dell'hotel è la posizione, letteralmente a 200 mt da Central Park e a 50 mt dal Moma.....in una Manhattan pullulante di vitalità.

title: Remarkable Staff
text: A hotel is only as good as the staff.  The Warwick enjoys some of the finest support staff we have ever encountered.  From check in to check out the service provided was exceptional.  I strongly recommend this hotel.  This is a classy, well priced establishment.

title: Great stay! Friendly staff
text:
A good location to explore the city, nearby a metrostation.
Difficult to park your car due the renovations in the street.
Great thanks to Jesus who helped my spouse with the lugage to our room!
Also a would like to thank the whole crew, your a making this hotel famous!

title: Expensive but great location
text: Last minute trip and the only “affordable” hotel I was able to book was the Warwick. Location and customer service are great, but per night rate after taxes and resort fees (times Square) end above $500

title: Pas mal déçu....
text:
L'hôtel est beau, et bien placé mais...parce qu'il y a des mais !
