Les petits déjeuners sont très très cher, peut-être que dans tous les hôtels de New York c'est la même chose je ne sais pas... Compter à peu près 170 dollars avec les taxes et le Tip pour 3 adultes et un enfant, c'est un buffet à volonté...
Nous sommes à New York dans un hôtel dit de luxe ! alors c'est surement normal que tout soit cher...
La chambre pour une famille de quatre personnes est vraiment juste, et le placard petit.
Notre douche n'était pas synchro avec le robinet de la baignoire.
La cerise sur le gâteau, ou plutôt le cafard sur le gâteau, et oui ! nous avons eut la visite d'un gros cafard un soir dans notre chambre dans un hôtel de ce standing c'est plutôt surprenant, mais eux aussi ont droit au luxe !!!!! 
Il a fallu une certaine insistance de notre part pour obtenir un prix sur notre séjour.
Nous avons pu changer de chambre le soir même (sans l'aide de personne pour les bagages !) et sans soit dit en passant sans aucune excuse de la direction.
Apparement c'est très commun à New York la présence de cafard, super !
Le personnel de l'hôtel dans l'ensemble est très sympathique mis à part le personnel derrière le comptoir d'accueil, ils ne sourient que lorsqu'ils se brûlent, c'est impressionnant... 
Le bar qui fait aussi restaurant est très agréable et son personnel très sympa, son petit côté feutré, (même si les clients parlent fort) est très chouette.

title: Warwick in the heart of Manhattan!
text:
We had the most amazing experience in this iconic hotel in the heart of Manhattan!
Situated a mere 3 blocks from Central Park and an easy walk to Times Square, we would recommend this beautiful hotel to any vacationers!
Our room was very comfortable with a bed to die for! We had a 24 th floor room with views down the Avenue.
The staff could not be more cooperative and friendly and in terms of cost, was more than comparable...however, to stay in the same hotel as Elvis, The Beatles, James Dean and Liz Taylor to name just a few, was marvellous!!!
We will return one day!

title: Great base to explore from
text: Family of 4 with 2 teenage boys staying in a double queen room , bathroom was a little dated and breakfast was expensive so we dined out all of the time. However clean and comfy beds and an excellent base just south of Central Park and close enough to be able to explore east and west side manhattan within a few blocks .

title: The Best Hotel and More
text: The Warwick is a wonderful hotel. My absolute favorite when visiting New York. They have a first class bar, and exceptional restaurant. Sometimes a bit pricey, but worth it. The front desk and service is tops, and never a disappointment.

title: Return trip
text: Just Recently returned from our second  staying at the Warwick into 2 years. Once again this hotel met and exceeded our expectations! From the front desk staff, to the concierge, all the way up to the Guest relations manager B.K. You just can’t beat this hotel.  The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect for walking to Central Park, Grand Central, Times Square, and anything further away is an easy one block walk to the subway. Can’t say enough about this hotel! Can’t wait to return! Can’t wait to return!

title: The Best Value in New York City
text:
We stay at the Warwick whenever we are in New York City.  The rooms are well-appointed and large by New York standards.  The location, the corner of 54th St. and 6th Ave.,  is unsurpassed and convenient to everything in Midtown Manhattan.
The staff are courteous, friendly and helpful, and the best part is that the Warwick's prices, compared to other New York hotels, are an absolute bargain, especially considering the rooms and the location.  You will not be disappointed.

title: Always a pleasure to stay here
text:
I have used the Warwick for business meetings in the past and whenever I can I stay here when I visit. 
Friendly staff and helpful 
Rooms spacious and inviting 
Restaurant a pleasant respite from the busy city 
Location is perfect for whatever you want to do in the city.

title: Room facing the two walls, no day light
text: Watch out, there are quite a lot of rooms facing one or the two alleys (corner rooms). Hence you look right onto a wall. Way too expensive for the value. Staff neither very friendly nor customer oriented , slow handling of any inquiry, not properly organized. Stayed there 2x, both times same experience. Checked out early. Would never go back.

title: De locatie is prima , voor de rest vreselijk duur en weinig comfort
text:
Het hotel ligt mooi centraal in het centrum van New York.
De kamer voor vier personen was bijzonder klein.
Bij herhaling aan moeten geven dat er vier personen op de kamer verbleven en wij dan ook graag vier sets handdoeken wilden.
Dat is uiteindelijk gedurende één week twee keer goed gegaan.
Wij zwijgen maar over de shampoo en de rest , dat is ons niet gelukt.
Het ontbijt is vreselijk duur en stelt niets voor.
Als je cappuccino bestelden kon je  $ 8,00 extra aftikken of te wel , money money.,
Ik kom er niet weer.

title: ドアマンが良い！
text:
3月は忙しいのか、レセプションは忙しいのか
対応も普通より少し劣るという印象。
ただドアマンの対応が大変良かった。
空港に行くタクシーについて相談したところ、
当日はマーチがあり、道路が閉鎖になるので
早めに空港に行くべし、とのアドバイスを
もらい、タクシーを1台確保してくれていたため、
無事慌てることなく帰国。
ここに宿泊するのは2回目だが、プロフェッショナルなドアマンに感激しました。

title: Large rooms, great location, needs a LOT of work
text: We chose this hotel for its location and the suites. The location is fabulous, and the suites are large and well priced, which is great. The rooms are clean and the hotel was able to accommodate our room requests since we stayed for a week - also great. Things that are not great - firstly, we were travelling with children (not babies) and there really is no common space where we could go with them in the hotel. The lobby is tiny, the bar not really appropriate for children, the restaurant is completely unappealing and the buffet breakfast was quite simply, dreadful. I can honestly say I have never had a worse hotel buffet breakfast experience. I ordered a la carte and I was horrified as it all came directly from the buffet. Even the children were underwhelmed. Also the staff at breakfast really need a pep talk as the service was as bad as the food. Do not bother with it. One of the 3 tiny lifts was out of order for most of our stay, which meant we could wait for more than 5 minutes each time we called it up to the 18th floor. Not great. The shower went cold mid stream on a number of occasions, and the A/C units are incredibly noisy. We really wanted to love this hotel, for its wonderful heritage and the story it tells - but it simply does not live up to it. Front desk staff at check in were ordinary (it was like they were over it).  Overall this hotel needs a LOT of work but there is so much to fix - I am not sure they will ever get there.

title: Past its Prime
text: I used to stay at this hotel back in the 70s and 80s, when it was just a small step down from the Waldorf.  I decided to try it again for old times sake. A mistake. It has been updated to some extent but still has a frayed look and feel. The elevator service was a complete disaster. A 10 minute wait was normal.  Along with other guests we ended up using the service elevators.  Absolutely no view from our room - couldn't even see the sky.  The front desk staff was anything but friendly.  None of these deficiencies were reflected in the price. The only saving grace for this hotel  is its location, which is superb.  But you will be better off going to the Hilton, which is just across the street on 6th.

title: Never again!
text: I have been walking by this hotel for years and it seemed really nice, actually the staff is nice and the rooms are comfortable. However as I was grabbing my towel after taking a shower a monster roach jump at me! Beyond disgusted!  I called the operator 3 times before someone came up and of course could not find it, 20 mins had gone by!! The manager gave me a discount on my bill but that does not cut it. They need to change pest control services! This can not happen to a guest !!

title: Very central, comfortable room sizes, great staff, reasonable meal prices
text:
What I liked was the comfortable room sizes, quite big really we had 2009 which was a corner room, great wardrobe storage, good bathroom accessories, lots of room for suitcases.  We were really central and could walk everywhere.  The staff were really helpful when asked questions, and when we wanted a kettle to make tea, within 10 mins they came up. The air con worked nicely and we could adjust it easily.  We had a desk, 2 seats and all the mod cons.  The WIFI worked well too. The room and beds were comfortable and clean.
The breakfast was a bit expensive, but then everything in this area was $$.  The lunch and evening meals were reasonable compared to other restaurants in the area but basic, schnitzel, burger and salad etc.  They made a great apple waffle, nice pizza on flatbreads and a great french onion soup, and the schnitzel was great too.
The down side...the lifts can be slow, its probably at little old fashioned but it suits its style of old hollywood, its not a a mod sleek look.
There was a building site across the road but we had little to no noise issues, certainly nothing after hours at all.  Even the road traffic was fine died down after the peak hub bub.  I would not hesitate to stay here again if I wanted to stay in this location as I felt comfortable.

title: Not Great
text:
We stayed here for four nights.
Whilst the staff were very pleasant, maid service was good & the room was very clean and the location is great, we had a few issues.
There are only three small lifts for such a large hotel and for the whole time we were there one was out of order.
Our room was pretty dark as it looked onto a wall and the hotel, at least on our side, was covered in scaffolding and building work.  So there was never any point in opening the curtains.
Although the bath-room was pretty good, our shower was very temperamental and went from hot to almost cold without warning.
The bar was OK, but again, a bit too small for such a big hotel.  One night we ordered a bloody Mary and when I asked for Worcestershire sauce, they had none.  Ditto when we asked for a gin and diet tonic - no diet tonic.
We just felt the hotel was a tad tired.

title: birthday trip/nyc
text: This was my first stay at the Warwick and loved this hotel.  I would definitely stay there again.  Our rooms were nice and very roomy and the hotel staff was great.  Went there to celebrate my 60th birthday with some friends, and the hotel manager left some goodies in my room to welcome us to the Warwick and to celebrate my birthday. Also, Jose, the concierge, was a great help in recommending places to eat. I will be a return guest there.

title: Average - needs an update -- and friendlier staff
text:
Location is great.
One of the elevators is still broken (I saw other reviews about this), so at peak times, I waited over 10 mins for an elevator.  
Beautiful rooms although the a/c went out at 2am the 2nd night - however, they fixed it quickly.
Very clean - excellent housekeeping for both of my rooms the entire stay.
Breakfast in their restaurant was slow service for coffee and water - we had the buffet - not worth the money.  
And upon checkout, they tried to charge me for mini-bar (which I never touched).  Although they reversed the charge, there was no apology and there was no "I hope you enjoyed your stay or come back again." It's a shame that the front desk person was not friendly because that's the last person I interacted with during my stay.  Other staff were friendly.   I will not be back.

title: Perfect Hotel! Central Park, minutes from Times Square without the crowd!
text: What a great experience! We arrived early and were forunate to check in early. If the room were not ready, they would have gladly held our luggage. Rooms were large for NYC. NO COFFEE MAKER in room, but we asked for one and it was brought up within 10 minutes. Super clean! Good bathroom; After hours of walking, I felt comfortable taking a long hot bath. Mattresses were so comfortable we are purchasing one! Great room especially for the price!!

title: A real let down- second visit, second disappointment.
text:
Location: awesome! The good news ends there.

This was our second trip, coaxed back by a front office manager who convinced us to try them again after an unfortunate stay in June. As others have noted- simple requests (extra pillows) take an entire day and many phone calls to fulfill. Being skipped over for cleaning or turndown etc. and a breakfast room that could use a really good cleaning (walls/floors)- just not good. 

I really wanted to like this place, but fool me once- shame on you. Fool me twice shame on me.

There won’t ever be a third chance.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Staff
text: We stayed at the Warwick for a week with friends.  The lobby was small but very nice.  Rooms were large and comfortable except for the bathrooms which were very small with virtually no storage.  The rooms were well maintained and very clean.  The best feature of the Warwick is the staff.  Everyone we came in contact with was pleasant, helpful, and knowledgeable, particularly Sammy in the bar.  A problem with one of the elevators the last couple of days caused long waits but that is (hopefully) a rare occurance.  Prices in the restaurant and breakfast are were high, but this is New York.

title: Lovely hotel with charm.
text: Really great location close, to Central Park and many tourist spots.  One block from our favorite french restaurant La Bonne Soup. Nice size rooms and very comfy beds.  Pricey but planning ahead will allow for a lower price.

title: A great location & a very good luxury hotel at a reasonable price (by NY standards)
text:
This hotel is the corner of 6th Avenue & 54th street about two blocks or so from Central Park. 5th Avenue (and all the wonderfully exclusive shops) is just around the corner. The hotel is clean and very comfortable and the position cannot be faulted. 
However, there are a few things that could be improved. Firstly the wait for the lifts is unbelievable - when we were there one of the three lifts was constantly out of service. 
This meant waits of up to 15 minutes for a lift. We ended up using the service lifts which were much quicker but meant we needed to walk through past bags of trash. We decided we would rather do that than wait. The breakfast buffet is a real treat with a huge selection and the French toast the best I've ever had. The service in the restaurant is 'efficient' but could be a little more friendly. At times I felt like a naughty child when I asked for another pot of tea! We booked directly online with the hotel and got a great deal. Overall compared to the cost of other luxury hotels in NY the Warwick was a bargain. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Location,location,location
text:
The Warwick is the perfect location if visiting New York.The staff were helpful and the breakfast buffet well stocked with everything you could need!Very clean and the room cleaners were very pleasant and polite.The lifts were a problem most of the time having to wait at least 5mins to 10mins on occassion!The doormen were extremely helpful with guidance and cabs.I definitely would stay again and recommend Warwick Hotel to anyone visiting New York.
Tiretep

title: Emplacement idéal
text: A quelques blocks de Central Park et Columbus, un emplacement idéal et rapport qualité prix correct. Cet hôtel conserve un charme ancien avec des chambres spacieuses. En revanche, les ascenseurs se fond parfois attendre longuement et si vous êtres au 20e étage, bonjour pour les escaliers. Mais oublie bien vite surtout à New York et cet hôtel très ancien reste encore dans le coup.

title: Smart Hotel
text:
Classy hotel but very overpriced for what it is !
King suite with view very basic ! 
Bathroom small with shower over bath. Extraction fan very noisy !
Hotel restaurant very expensive !
Nice looking hotel !
Great position for theatres and time square !

title: Estava bom...
text:
Hotel antigo, mas bem mantido e limpo. Boa localização, tem muita coisa para se fazer a pé, porém, começamos a ter problemas com as contas...
Primeiro no café da manhã, além do atendimento descuidado e nada simpático, cobraram do meu filho que não pagava, pois tem só 4 anos. Ao reclamarmos, o garçom refez a conta, assinamos, mas mesmo assim, o valor foi lançado na cobrança do cartão! E não era nem o valor de criança, mas de adulto! Soubemos disso porque consultamos o extrato do cartão de crédito por outro motivo.
Depois, ao pedirmos o detalhamento das contas do hotel do dia, encontramos itens do Mini bar que não havíamos consumido!!!
Ao reclamarmos, tiraram imediatamente, mas vou ter que ficar checando todas as contas agora?! Inadmissível, duas cobranças indevidas no mesmo dia! E só foi o primeiro dia!!!

title: Visit to Warwick Hotel Restaurant
text: Hice food and good value for New York.  New York Cheesecake is delicious.  Unfortunately our waiter was a surly grumpy type.  He overcharged three other parties when we were there.  So overall good restaurant but could do with the manager reminding staff that this is a service industry where you need to treat the clients right.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: We recently stayed at the Warwick for 11 days.  This was our third visit to the hotel and it did not disappoint.  The staff is courteous and accommodating.  The location is ideal but it is the staff that is the primary reason why we return.

title: Would not choose to stay here again
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a group travel.  The room was fine, except that the electrical outlet and lighted mirror in the bathroom did not work.  We notified them TWICE and they still did not fix it.  Also, we had to ask for wash cloths.  They did bring some, but the next day - again no wash cloths.
ALso, they charge $10 to deliver food to the room, so 2 cups of coffee and one muffin cost us $40.
The window in our room faces a brick wall, so it was dark even in the middle of the day.
Lastly the elevator situation was terrible.  They have 3, but only 2 were working for the 3 days we were they.  They held a maximum of 6 people and with over 30 floors of rooms, the wait times could be very long.

title: Our NY hotel
text: We found this hotel many years ago through Priceline.com.  It is our favorite.  The location is the best and they have been so nice and accommodating over the years.  Again, we had a wonderful experience.

title: Spacious hotel / Great location
text:
I visited the Warwick as part of a group of five ladies celebrating our 70th birthdays. 
On arrival, room service presented us with a platter of chocolate strawberries and a bottle of Prosecco as a welcome. What a lovely gesture. 
The rooms which we had (319 and 320) were spacious and comfortable. Unlike previous guest reviews which complained of noise, we were never kept awake by traffic. 
The hotel is convenient for MOMA (on the same street), St Patrick's Cathedral in 5th Ave and Times Square. It is also within walking distance of the easy to use subway system and Broadway for Theatre shows. 
We ate breakfast in the hotel on 3 X mornings. It was delicious but quite pricey. 
The hotel Comissionnaire, Adam, was an amazing, tall, bearded, top hatted gentleman who was a fount of knowledge. He gave us some excellent restaurant recommendations. Unfortunately, we didn't manage to thank him before we left....so thank you Adam. 
If I were returning to NYC, I would happily stay at the Warwick again.

title: Perfect location!
text: Our son and daughter-in-law recommended this hotel, and we were very happy with this choice! We were celebrating my husband’s 50th birthday, and since he had never been to New York City, this hotel was in an ideal location, with short walks to Times Square, Central Park, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, etc. The staff was extremely nice, and they sent up champagne and chocolates for my husband! We had a wonderful 14th floor view overlooking iconic 6th Avenue! I highly recommend it, and we will be back.

title: Excellent location, excellent hotel !
text: We had two rooms on the 18th and 21th floor. Both rooms were excellent. The hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, an excellent location !!! The rooms were very clean, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. I am waiting my next trip to New York !

title: Great location, comfortable bed. That's it.
text: This hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. The location in Midtown is fantastic if you want to be in the middle of it all (very noisy as well, obviously - ear plugs are must for sleeping). The building is old and shabby; one can see how it was once a luxury hotel, but no longer so. My room was spacious and had a very comfortable bed, but the bathroom was tiny and old. The air conditioning/heating was extremely loud, and the standards of housekeeping were much lower than one would expect for a hotel of this category. I found trash left by the previous guests on the floor by the bed, dust in the corners and stained furniture. I also saw a cockroach in the corridor (thankfully not in my room, but still an unpleasant sight). When I pointed these issues out to the staff in reception they were not apologetic at all, rather they took it as a matter of fact and said they would make a note for housekeeping. Service was ok, particularly the porters and concierge who were very nice and efficient. I would however not stay in this hotel again, unless they renovate it completely. There are much nice places around for a similar price.

title: Present vs past
text: This hotel had for sure a better life years ago but its level, in respect to what I read, is still rather good. Rooms were renovated, or at least some, and are spacious and cheery, bathrooms are old. The lobby still breaths the ancient glory. Its staff is extremely professional, effective and kind.

title: Great location, BIG rooms, home away from home
text:
Love the Warwick, and book here whenever I can.  The big rooms, high ceilings take the edge off of the midtown bustle.  Join their frequent guest club to get suite upgrades etc.
If you drive in, they valet directly across the street for quick in/out of town.
Their breakfast is a bit ridiculously-priced, but Joe and the Juice right next door on 6th is great for smoothies, juices, etc.  Also, a great french pastry place just North on 6th on left.

title: The prison hotel, what a deception !
text:
I had a morning international  flight from New York on 11 th Sep , so what a better thing to do than travel the day before to have a few hours sightseeing in New York. We flew from Charlotte to NY and arrived at Warwick hotel early afternoon on 10 Sep 2018.
I had spent hours looking for a convenient hotel, next to attraction, a sort of high rise where I can see the city from my room. 
Well, I got the shock of my life when the room turned to be more like a prison cell, two sides Windows, both opened on brick walls!!!
The reception staff said there was no other room available, and was quick in telling me, I could check out if I wanted! 
Never have I experienced such bad service or a prison room except in a remote island in the phillippenes, even there I was upgraded and all went well. That afternoon, the rain was so heavy that we had to return to our hotel early, and closed the curtains to avoid the clustrophobia! 
Next morning the Manager on duty was no better, he said that we had had booked through Delta Airlines and not much he could do! 
This was by far one of my worst hotel experiences! Never again

title: Excelente ubicacion
text:
Definitivamente regresaré a este hotel, su ubicacion es excelente el MoMa está justo en frente y caminando llegas a casi todos los puntos de interés de Manhattan.
Las habitaciones impecables y muy amplias.
La comida y el servicio del restaurante es muy bueno.
Lo unico malo es que la habitacion que me toco no tiene vista a nada, pero en NYC es demasiado pedir.
Felicidades a este hotel y su staff.

title: Spacious rooms and great location
text:
I stayed in this hotel for seven nights with my parents. My Dad uses a mobility scooter, so we were a accommodated in an accessible premier plus room with a roll-in shower. I think the size of the rooms is really great - they are very spacious. I also loved having a coffee maker in the room.  The location of the hotel is unbeatable - you are within walking distance of museum mile, Central Park, Lincoln Centre and Broadway. You are centrally located without being in the craziness of Times Square, which is too busy and stressful!

Breakfast is expensive so we went to Pret-a-Manger around the corner most days and it is great. I really recommend it if you want to keep costs down.

In terms of the staff, the doormen, bellhops and housekeeping staff are extremely kind and were so nice to my father. I did not find the reception staff to be kind or helpful. When we had to move room due to an issue on the hotel's part (I won't go into the reason why, as we were compensated for the inconvenience eventually) they were unsympathetic and unapologetic.  

For those of you travelling with elderly or disabled friends of family, the premier plus accessible rooms are good but not all have roll-in showers and, even though there are grab rails, the toilets are not elevated (by contrast, the beds are too elevated).  For those of you where there is more than two people per room, be aware that the double beds are very small and you should look for a twin room with queen-size beds.  Otherwise, the hotel is wheelchair and mobility scooter friendly.

I had a lovely stay in the Warwick and will definitely come back. I really think the location is perfect, especially if you are with family (young, hip people who don't mind using the subway might prefer a downtown location).

title: Ottima posizione. Ma senza colazione inclusa!
text: Abbiamo scelto questo hotel per l'ottima posizione vicino a metro, central park e altri luoghi interessanti e popolari di NY. Il soggiorno è stato ottimo e la soluzione individuata comoda è confortevole. Purtroppo le porte hanno un sistema di chiusura molto rumorosa e ciò disturba molto soprattutto in tarda serata o al mattino presto. Condividiamo l'opinione che una colazione inclusa nel prezzo sarebbe un'ottima soluzione per completare il servizio. Personale gentile e disponibile. Lounge piccola e non confortevole in caso di attese e di affollamento

title: Pobyt w NY
text: Hotel bardzo dobrze położony, blisko Central Parku. Jest to stary, klimatyczny hotel. Pokój dość spory z oddzielną garderobo-szafą. Wymaga lekkiego „odświeżenia” ale może remont jest planowany bo podczas naszego pobytu była renowacja elewacji.

title: A time gone by
text: The hotel is old and worn down. The rooms are OK but nothing more.  We booked a room for three, but they only had rooms with two beds. We found a cockroach in our bathroom and mold on the AC under the window. The breakfast is overpriced. When we came down to breakfast late, about 9, most of the pastries were gone.

title: Weekend Tourist
text: Spending a weekend in New York City with so much to do, the hotel location is key.  The Warwick Hotel is perfectly located a few blocks from Central Park South, a short walk to Times Square, and also walking distance to Radio City and Rockefeller Center.  The hotel is one of the older historic properties but expertly renovated.  The rooms are a nice size for NYC, clean, crisply decorated.  The staff are friendly and accommodating.  We could not have been happier with our choice.  Definitely check out Randolph's in the hotel for a great lunch, cocktails.

title: Péssimo
text:
A única coisa que vale nesse hotel é a localização.
Infelizmente a minha opinião sobre o Warwick é outra, não conheci esse hotel que alguns afirmam ser bom.
Logo de cara sentimos a falta de educação e cordialidade dos funcionários. Posso generalizar que todos com muita má vontade de atender, isso na recepção quanto no café da manhã. Para piorar, uma cidade cheia de turistas não era possível encontrar no hotel, um funcionário que falasse espanhol.
O meu baheiro estava sujo, simplesmente a limpeza péssima, privada suja, nada de repor o sabonete.  
Agora o pior, fui deitar na cama e o meu edredom estava usado e com sujeira de nariz. Ligamos na recepção para reclamar e eles encaminharam um edredom todo rasgado. 
Palhaçada ou não isso? 
Sinceramente não recomendo, a não ser que a pessoa ache normal esse tipo de acomodação.
Existem hotéis ótimos para ficar ali perto, inventei de trocar para conhecer outro e me arrependi.

title: Excelente ubicaciòn, muy buen hotel salvo una empleada de att al cliente
text: Estuvimos hospedados una semana y merced a una excelente intervenciòn de Mònica Di Buono nos alojamos en una hermosa habitaciòn en 16 piso con vistas a la 6Av, todo cordialidad y buena honda hasta el momento del  check out que nos topamos con una señora de nombre Vilma que no nos dejò que nuestras valijas permanezcan en custodia durante una semana ya que realizabamos un crucero y volviamos a N York cuando previamente esto habia sido convenido claramente con la gente encargada. De muy mal modo no nos permitiò el dejar las valijas sino que nos quiso cobrar por el uso del refrigerador sin haber consumido nada.

title: Not so great
text: The Warwick is well located for business in mid-town. The lobby is elegant and calming, and the bar is comfortable. But our room (310) was positively dreary. Though the bedroom was a good size, the seating was inadequate; the carpet was stained; and the bathroom was so small as to be marginally functional (with just three towels for two people). Our one small window looked out onto scaffolding, making the room dark and unappealing.  Worst of all was the smell. It reeked of mildew, perhaps because the ac didn't really work all that well. (We couldn't get the temp below 73.) Breakfast was fabulously expensive but not fabulous in any other respect.  The $25 dollar facility charge -- assessed because I had booked through AMEX Platinum Concierge -- was particularly annoying.

title: Spent one night at the Warwick on a quick overnight trip to NYC
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I had originally booked a room without a street view but we were upgraded at check in. The lobby is surprisingly small but probably normal for a Historic Hotel in NYC. The hotel has a fascinating history and you can see glimpses of its age and quality in multiple places. the rooms are completely renovated but still have the lovely crown molding and the bath fittings are luxurious and modern. We had a two queen bed room and the beds were wonderfully comfortable. The view of the street was a nice plus and the room was very quiet. AC was good and adjustable within the room. Sheets and towels were excellent as well. We didn't eat at the restaurant but the maitre'd was kind enough to let us walk through to look at the beautiful murals and gave us a couple of postcards with information about the artist and the history of the hotel. I wish we could have stayed longer!
As to location, it is a quick walk to Central park, the MOMA and to the Ed sullivan theatre. We walked down to central park and across to Rockefeller Plaza as well. Taxis are plentiful and the doorman got us a ride instantly whenever we needed one. Perfect location if you like Historic buildings.

title: US Open stay
text: Love the location of the Warwick. Close to the Park, shopping, subway and restaurants. The rooms are great and you can always work a good price. The bar is worth having a drink and snack anytime. Prefer over the Hilton or large chain hotels.

title: Altmodisch gemütlich, tolle Lage
text: Wir verbrachten 3 Nächte in diesem Hotel, welches sich durch eine tolle Nähe zum Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center etc. auszeichnet.Die Lobby und auch die Zimmer sind wunderbar altmodisch, aber im positiven Sinn. Gemütliches Zimmer ( wir hatten ein Deluxezimmer), in dem für New Yorker Verhältnisse viel Platz war , ein gutes Bad, allerdings mit niedriger Badewanne, in der die Dusche war. Wir bevorzugen eine Duschkabine.Das Bad war aus Marmor, gepflegt. Über das Frühstück keine Auskunft möglich, uns erschien es zu teuer, daher haben wir direkt um die Ecke deutlich günstiger unser Müsli verspeist. Sehr freundlicher Conciergeservice. Wenn man viel zu Fuß in Manhattan unternehmen möchte, ist dieses Hotel sehr zu empfehlen.

title: Worse service and they lie to you
text:
I booked a Premier King and when I checked in, besides the staff being very miserable, the told me I had a basic room. I tried to correct them but got nowhere. 

The front desk staff is one of the worse I have ever experienced and I travel 3 to r times a month. I would not stay here again if it were the last hotel in the city. I traveled with another guest who was also lied to and had similar issues. Pretty hotel, not for business travel and not for any level of service you would expect for the price. How sad and to lie? I could not get a manager to even talk to me. Sad!

title: Lovely old hotel in great location
text:
The Warwick is a lovely old hotel in a great location. Room was spacious but bathroom a little small. Housekeeping was fabulous,any requests met and the room was spotless.
Hotel staff were friendly and helpful,from the restaurant personnel to the front desk staff and concierge- brilliant.
Stayed here with my mother and we were keen to explore all that NYC has to offer.The hotel is ideally placed for many of the highlights.
Can’t wait to return!

title: Hotel decaduto
text:
Abbiamo passato 8 notti in questo hotel. 
La posizione dell'hotel è straordinaria.
Peccato che la manutenzione lascia molto a desiderare.
La nostra stanza aveva le mattonelle del bagno rotte.
Ogni giorno addebitano sulla carta di credito l'importo della stanza per il giorno successivo: evidentemente la clientela è fatta di gente che usa scappare di notte per non pagare il conto. Se utilizzate il servizio di colazione spenderete un botto (circa 40$ a testa). Peccato inoltre che la facciata dell'hotel è in ristrutturazione per cui non siamo stati avvisati della presenza delle impalcature, che oltre a rovinare l'aspetto dell'Hotel hannorovinato anche la vista dalle camere.
Non vale il prezzo.

title: Big room but old
text: Very old hotel. Classy but not renewed. The room is big but the bathtub should be renewed, such as a part of the forniture. Honestly it does not worth the high cost even if it is really in the Center of Manhattan, very close to Central Park and other attractions. Moreover personnel is not kind, even rude in some occasions . Do not suggest it.

title: Amazing location, great service
text:
Stayed at the Warwick again for the US Open semis and finals, and couldn’t have hoped for more. There was a small snag when checking in late Friday evening, and the front of desk quickly rectified it on Saturday with a double room upgrade!

The location is perfect, close to shops, theaters, and of course - the park! Can’t wait to come back next year.

title: Excellent on all fronts!
text:
We stayed at The Warwick for 3 nights in late August and everything was fantastic! Front desk staff were friendly, helpful, efficient and even left a special treat in our room for my daughter's birthday that showed me this hotel is willing to go above and beyond to make the guest experience special - thank you!!

The location was perfect and close to everything but far enough from the madness of Times Square. A lovely classic old-school vibe and a large room made our stay at the Warwick very pleasant.

title: New policies
text:
I have been staying at the Warwick for at least 12 years, during the US Open...There are so many negatives now, I am not sure I will continue.  
First, the room wasn't ready initially, but that was understandable as we were early...however by almost 4:00 still not ready.
When we finally got into our room. no washclothes, no soap, and hot!
The air was not working properly...we called to please have it checked, as we left for a play.  We returned, and it was still hot, but a little better.  The thermostat was set on 69, and the room would not go below 77.
WE had more towels delivered.
The next morning, as we left for tennis, we just stacked the additional towels next to the tv.  When we returned, the room, was still hot, and the additional towels had been removed.  That happened on 2 straight days.  
In addition to all of this, as we waited for our room to be ready, the bar, Randolphs which was always a nice stop, was no longer opened until 5:30.  Well, what kind of a hotel, has no access to food, or a drink during the day...and much less does not open their food service until 5:30.  This new policy was ridiculous.  We had to walk down the street, and get a cola at a grocery store.  
We had to make  calls to the front desk for several reasons... the last time we requested towels, it took 5 hours, before any we delivered.
The housekeeping was terrible.  Toothbrushes were taken out of their keeping places, and laid on the counter while we were gone, and the beds were not made up properly.
For a hotel of this caliber, or what used to be its caliber, this was less than average.  We stayed 4 nights, and the manager on duty, took off one of the nights.  That was not our concern.  Our concern was that the hotel, was not accommodating its guests.  It was obvious there was some type of new management, not the same hotel as had been for 12 years.  If the hotel is trying to save money, and closing the restaurant/bar during the day...they will have no problem saving money, as they will have no customers.

title: Perfect Location
text:
My son and I flew into town for a Yankees game and the location of this hotel was perfect.  We arrived in the morning and he hotel had no issue holding our suitcases so we could explore the City without having to lug our bags with us.

The hotel is Easy walking distance to Times Square and Empire State as well as shopping.  Super close to subway stations to get you down to the 9/11 memorial,ferry to Statue of Liberty, and up to Yankee Stadium.

We didn’t spend much time in room but it served its purpose.  Our room had an interior view so there wasn’t much to see other than a brick wall.

Would definitely stay here again should we ever make it back to New York.

title: Amazing locationin a historic building, but needs improvement
text:
We stayed at the Warwick over Labor Day weekend, so as expected, it was packed.  The rooms were not ready when we arrived so we dropped off our luggage at storage.  Once you start walking around,  you'll realize just how amazing the hotel's location is as a visitor to NY.  Everything is definitely walking distance.  Even if you need a ride, taxi is easy to get and it's fairly easy for Uber as well to get to.  

The bed was comfy, actually one of the better sleeps I've had at hotels.  Our room needed some work.  When we first got there, there were no shower curtains.  Called front desk and after 30 minutes had to call again for it.  Our room's closet also had an odd, wet smell to it.  Most likely from the humidity.  The AC unit is on its own, so it gets pretty darn loud, definitely louder than some other hotel's.  Also, for some reason the AC unit had a crazy amount of condensation and actually made the ceiling wet, cause paint to actually drip off.  It got a bit onto my clothes.  

Service was hit & miss.  Check-in experience wasn't as friendly as some of the other hotels, and with the AC issue, when we reported it, one of the staff almost had a "well, what else can we do" attitude.  It wasn't until one of the staff at the front desk was free after talking to another guest that she was asking if we would like to switch to another room.  Since it was our last night, we decided it wasn't worth the trouble.  We also witnessed a few very very public arguments when going in & out the hotel. 

The gym is a bit small, but decent.  Was very packed over the weekend during the mornings.  Free wi-fi as a guest, which was great.

Overall, I would stay here as a 2nd/3rd option.  I think the location itself is a great choice, but with what had happened in our room, I'd think twice before staying at the Warwick.

title: Tips and review:  Location, staff, room great.
text:
Tip:  Check out their website for better rates, and sign up for their Journeys membership for a little daily discount. 

Cons (few):
—it’s an older building so we had issues which maintenance and management quickly addressed. 
—the restaurant (Randolph’s) is very limited and expensive but it’s there for convenience and some ambience.  Consider it a decent splurge on your being lazy to head out to the NYC culinary universe. 
—When you call for your car, Reception just plops your card on the counter without summoning the cheerful and eager bell staff. 
Tip:  If you want the car ready when you’re ready, call repeatedly to bug the reception staff (who are indeed busy) to call over the valet.  But don’t keep the car waiting outside in NYC traffic.  Or, of course, go outside and get the valet yourself, who handles it pretty quickly. 

Pros (huge):
—location:  Walk 5 to 20 minutes to Amazing. 
Near great food trucks, delis, various bus and subway lines, yellow cabs, MOMA, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, St Patrick’s Cathedral; 5th Avenue; reasonable as well as upscale shopping (Nintendo, NHL, diamond district; high end brands...) etc etc etc etc!!
—room:  nicely appointed and sized. 
Tip:  Push the light-blocking shades behind the plastic barrier so you get more flow from the air conditioning. 
—great staff. 
—great valet parking service for extra charge. Some other NYC hotels have no garages or faraway lots. 
Tip:  Park and forget; driving is a crazy idea in Manhattan. 

Tip:  While not at all visible near the hotel which is in an active and apparently safe area, there are several panhandlers you will pass during the day several blocks away or on the subway.  Have a few spare dollars in a quickly accessible place to give to the ones who will probably use the money for food.  I passed one guy close to Rockefeller Center who really needed shoes and I wished I had a spare pair to give.

Tip:  Your room is probably nice enough to bring back food and sit and have a good view.  There are many places within a block or two to take out, including several food trucks and delis that are rated very well on TripAdvisor.  I didn’t try but there’s probably a few delivery places too.

Tip:  The higher up you are, the less you will hear city noise.  That said, a white noise app can help.

title: Great iconic hotel average hospitality
text:
In a fabulous location in midtown New York we were so excited after a long flight to finally arrive. However, there was mix up with our booking and it was canceled a few hours before we arrived without notice. This even though a credit card had been supplied. This could happen at any hotel however the reception staff were indifferent and at times patronizing. 

After it was sorted out and we avoided a major panic attack our stay was in a lovely spacious room. From the surroundings in the lobby and bar to the lift I can describe the surroundings as quintessentially NY old world charm. The hotel is in a fantastic and convenient part of town to go site seeing, catch a show on Broadway or shopping on 5th ave etc.

title: A Wonderful Place To Stay
text: From the moment we arrived, we were treated with a friendly and happy staff. Every person we interacted with was a pleasure. The room was spectacular with great views and located next to the Modern Museum of Art and within walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. Almost too nice to leave.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights in July and honestly this hotel is in a great location with everything you need on your doorstop.

Our room was on the 21st floor and we didn’t hear a thing, room service was good and cleaned daily.

We ate breakfast in the hotel and I can honestly say it was one of my favourite breakfasts in the USA, so much choice of fruits, pastries, hot food and best of all smoked salmon!

In the evening we had a drink in their bar restaurant before we went out and one night we ate there and the food was great along with the service.

Central Park is 10 minutes walk, Times Square 15 mins and 5th Avenue shopping 2 minutes.

Would recommend this hotel and definitely stay here again.

Join Warwick hotels rewards scheme as you get free WiFi and a few other benefits depending on the number of rooms nights booked and membership status.

Thanks for a great stay.

title: Oh Yeah!
text:
We have stayed in NYC before. Most rooms are so small you have to climb over furniture to get to the bathroom. The Warwick is not!  We were upgraded for free to a very spacious suite. As a family of 4 with 2 teenage girls we loved it. The room was stunning, the front desk staff was patient and kind. The valet parking and head bellman were all smiling and focused on the clients. 
We were there for one night to see Hamilton. The hotel was easy walking distance from the theaters and Times Square. We walked back at 1am and felt safe and secure in the neighborhood. 
We will definitely be back to stay at the Warwick.

title: Excellent hotel in excellent location
text: This hotel is very nice inside while being reasonably priced.  Everything was in excellent condition.  Room had good size compared to other NY hotels.  In an old building which was having its outside facade redone, but it was not bothersome.  They forgot to give me towels but rectified the minor oversight quickly.  Comfortable, enjoyable stay.

title: Great old New York hotel
text: The Warwick is a really comfortable, old New York hotel. Very convenient location just south of Central Park. Rooms are a good size for city hotel. Both the lighting and the shower taps are easy to work - something that seems to be becoming increasingly complex in many hotels.  Staff are all very helpful. It was raining when we where there and they have plenty of umbrellas at the reception that you can borrow if you don't have your own.

title: Stanza grande, comoda e pulita
text: Il Warwick ha un’ottima posizione per girare New York, stanze molto grandi, pulite e dotate di tutti i comfort (tv, frigo bar, balsamo, crema corpo, asciugacapelli) e WiFi. Unico problema, comune a tutti gli hotel in US, letto col piumone invernale pure d’estate nell’idea che si stia in camera con l’aria condizionata a palla. Non so 5 stelle solo perché dato il costo, almeno la colazione la potrebbero offrire ;)

title: superb hotel
text: An excellent hotel right in the heart of NYC. Great rooms, excellent service and just two blocks south of central park. In an old building everything has been refurbished. The only downside is that during busy periods the three lifts, which are small, can't handle the number of people going up and down. We used the service lift.

title: Great hotel and great location
text: This hotel is perfectly positioned within New York - easy access to the subway and Grand Central - Radio City is 5 mins walk away too.  The rooms are clean, modern and spacious - there is a mini bar in the room and ironing board etc.   You don’t pick up the noise from the street which ensures you have a great nights sleep too.  The staff are very helpful and offer to carry luggage get taxis etc.  Check in was smooth and efficient - this is the hotel I would choose every time I came to NY.  Not to be beaten!!

title: Family bliss
text: WE came in as a family for a New York experience and were delighted with everything this hotel had to offer. The ambience of the lobby, lounge and rooms reflected the rich history. The location was perfect for walking the entire city and central park.

title: Warwick Hotel New York
text: Perfect central New York location, walking distance to Time Square , Central Park and great restaurants. Concierge very helpful, 8 of our family stayed for a week and felt very comfortable in The Warwick.

title: Très bon séjour
text:
Le style « vieillot » de l’hôtel fait qu’il a beaucoup de charme. Il dispose de toutes les prestations modernes.
Nous avons disposé d’une des suites 707/708. Une très grande chambre avec 2 king ou queen size, une pièce salon avec un canapé et 2 fauteuils, une table ronde avec 4 chaises, une télé énorme dans chaque pièce, une entrée avec placard et par contre une petite salle de bain. 2 minibars. La suite ne manque pas de rangement. A 3 c’était suffisant mais nécessaire. La literie est excellente et les produits cosmétiques dans la salle de bains de très bonnes factures.
L’hôtel est bien isolé, néanmoins, nous étions face à des travaux et il y avait du bruit résiduel. Mais cela l’hôtel n’y est pour rien. La climatisation est efficace et peu bruyante.
Le lobby de l’hôtel est charmant.
Enfin l’hôtel est situé idéalement à l’angle de la 6th avenue et de la 54th. A 4 blocs de Central Park et tout prêt d’une bouche de métro.
Les prix sont élevés, mais correspondent à ce type de catégorie. EN réservant à l’avance ou à la dernière minute, il y a des prix.

Par contre, hormis les « doormen » et les femmes de ménages, le personnel est peu souriant et l’amabilité est limite. Très en-deçà du standing de l’hôtel.

title: Buena ubicación!
text:
Estuve 5 días alojada en este hotel. La ubicación es muy cómoda. El cuarto es amplio y muy bien decorado. El edificio es antiguo pero está muy bien conservado, de allí mi calificación. 
Pero Sinceramente lo que no me gusto fue la atención del personal de recepción muy antipático y cero servicial, tanto en el check in, durante mi estancia (salvo el  Sr Carlos) y el check out también (a cargo del Sr Marc), lo cual a mi parecer le resta categoría al hotel.

title: Un po’ datato ma buono
text: Ottima la posizione centralissimo di fianco al MOMA e ad altre interessanti strutture abbiamo alloggiato al 22º piano purtroppo con una vista interna dove si vedevano solo muri a mio parere va migliorata la tecnologia ormai obsoleta poi per il resto tutto bene letti comodi servizio in camera efficiente qualche problemino sul bagno poi risolto qualità prezzo comunque discreta

title: Very accommodating
text: I haven’t stayed at the Warwick Hotel for many years ,but decided revisit there again this week. The room is lovely and the front desk accommodating . I had a few issues and they went out of their way to resolve them and compensate me for my inconvenience

title: Third stay, really great hotel
text: I have been dedicated to the large hotel chains, but as value, comfort and location in Manhattan, the Warwick never disappoints.  The rooms are spacious and well-priced,  They have a good gym.  The breakfast was good, although pricey, but welcome to Manhattan.  One block from MOMA, walking access to anywhere.  The staff is well-trained and dedicated to making your hotel stay comfortable--- they bent backwards for me.

title: Limited restaurant service for such a big hotel
text: Last time I stayed here it was over 20 years ago and I was happy to see that major renovations seem to be complete, but the front level still covered with scaffolding gave a bad impression.  The "fancy" dining room is only for breakfast and the bar/ limited menu venue does not open before 5:00PM... extremely inconvenient.We had some issues with room not cleaned properly upon check -in and after complaining we were upgraded to a better room.  The location of the hotel is good ( one block from Radio City) but I would not stay there again.

title: Beautiful hotel, great location
text:
I've stayed several times at this beautiful hotel, because it's very conveniently situated. Of course it isn't cheap, but by New York standards it still is "affordable".
I had a beautiful, spacious room, with a very comfortable bed.
Still, I think readers should be warned about what this hotel charges for certain services. 
My plane was very delayed the day I arrived, so I checked in after midnight. I had not had dinner, so I called room service and asked them to bring me a sandwich and a glass of wine. The amount on the check was 50 dollars ! (yes, $ 50 for a sandwich and a glass of wine !!). 
I had been travelling for 3 weeks in the US, and needed to have some of my clothes washed. I gave a pair of jeans and 4 T-shirts to the laundry service. They brought them back to me the following day, with a bill of a hundred dollars ! (yes, $ 100 for washing a pair of jeans and 4 T-shirts !! Buying a new pair of jeans and 4 new T-shirts would have been less expensive !).
Apart from these ludicrous prices, I had a nice stay. All the staff members were nice and friendly. I'd like to mention the very nice doorman (called Adam), who is not only amazingly handsome, but also friendly and helpful to all hotel guests. He's certainly that hotel's best asset.

title: Enjoying a good stay
text: The Warwick is a very nice hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Just a few steps from MoMA, it is very comfortable and the service is top-notch. You can also enjoy the bar/lounge on the ground floor where you can sip some nice cocktails. I would definitely recommend this place.

title: Meraviglioso
text: Grattacielo in stile tipico new yorkese degli anni '30. Hotel lussuoso con camere molto grandi per essere a New York! Personale gentile disposto a dare consigli e a fornire mappe della città e della metropolitana. Atmosfera affascinante. In pieno centro (a 10' a piedi dalľEmpire State Building) e comodo per la metropolitana.

title: Amazing hotel with amazing location !!!
text: Just finished a great 2 night stay at the Warwick Hotel. Great location in the middle of everything in Manhattan ! Nice people at the desk, large King room (unusual for NY), comfy bed, and a decent bathroom. The location and beauty of the old hotel was fantastic. There is also a great diner across the street where we got breakfast twice. I would stay here again in a heartbeat !

title: Fabulous stay
text: I'm not sure why anyone would stay anywhere else in midtown!  Great location, great service, and a magnificent room. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite and were amazed at how huge it was. The hotel exudes elegance and was perfect for our quick NY visit walkable to so many sights and shopping.  Though the hotel staff was friendly and accommodating, I can't say as much for the bar staff.

title: Peccato!!!
text:
Peccato che questa struttura che ha vissuto un periodo d’oro, ora sia condotta in modo molto approssimativo. Il problema non sono le stanze, anche se datate, conservano tutte le qualità che hanno dato prestigio a questa struttura. Il problema è il personale nella hall poco efficiente e disponibile e soprattutto la qualità dei camerieri. A colazione per avere una tazza di caffè ti devi sbracciare più volte, al contrario di tutti i posti dove sono stato, dove la prima cosa che fanno è riempirti la tazza. Per un’omelette 20 minuti!!!!
Veramente peccato

title: Buono
text:
Qualità prezzo super. Ottimo l’up grade all’arrivo. Tutto buono tranne il bagno decisamente troppo piccolo...
Però lo consiglierei assolutamente. Io ho prenotato su Booking per 3 notti ( attenzione alle tasse!!!) e sono molto soddisfatta. Carissima la colazione, consiglio di uscire perché il ristorante dell’albergo e’ folle.

title: Great hotel in Midtown
text:
Glamourous hotel in midtown. Very well located in the heart of Manhattan. It is located on the 54th st in the 6th av; that means: close to every single top spots of the city but it is not in the crowds. 
It was the best option for us.
The hotel is clean and confy, and the rooms are bigger than average in NY. Expensive breakfast and minibar, but you have thousands of other options for eating in the city that never sleeps.

We would recommend this place to everyone who visits New York.

title: Не стоит тех денег. Гостиница с трудом тянет на 3*
text: Заселись мы в гостиницу 15 августа на неделю взяли 2 номера (пара и 3 ребенка). Заранее, за месяц позвонили и попросили чтобы номера были смежные. По приезду  не оказалось свободных смежных номеров , дали на одном этаже  2 номера. В 1 номере двуспальная кровать на друг 2 раздельные кровати. На вопрос что у нас 3 ребёнка отвели что 2 детей должны спать на одной кровати . При заселении дали бумагу с предупреждение что я должен буду заплатить 25 долларов с номера за ночь не включая налоги в эту сумму входтт интернет использование фитнес комнаты и телефона по местным номерам. На вопрос если я не хочу этим пользоваться ответ был предельно прост: можно не пользоваться но платить надо все равно. Т.е. мне еще выходит 350$ не включая налогов дополнительных налогов за принудительные услуги которыми я бы не пользовался. Окна номеров выходят на стенку и непонятно ночь или день и какая погода на улице что есть окна что нет. Сегодня был дождь в номерах зонтов нет в ресепшен ответили что зонтов нет и  надо ждать когда кто нибудь вернет зонт. Во всех нормальных гостиницах зонты находятся в номере а не надо за ниме бегать и ждать пока кто нибудь их вернет. Единственный плюс это место положение оно очень хороше. Я очень разочарован гостиницей и советую подумать несколько раз прежде чем заказывать номер в этой гостинице.

title: Water is how much...?
text:
Stayed here for four nights, the room was lovely and spacious, the bed was comfy, I had a great view down 6th Avenue. The location is great (as a tourist at least). Staff all seemed pleasant and helpful. And there was free WiFi.

My issue with the Warwick was the price of water at their bar area downstairs.
I was charged $8.71 (~ £6.80) for a room temperature 500ml (17.59oz) bottle of water (featured below). 
It was at the end of my stay just as I was leaving and it really put a negative spin on the end of my holiday, I felt very ripped off.
I don’t doubt it’s “good water” however you can find it elsewhere for around $1.30 a bottle so a 570% mark up is just an outrageous price to pay for water regardless of how “prime” a location is.

title: The best service       Lovely historic hotel
text:
Second visit....outstanding
The room was on the 6th floor, would have preferred a higher floor
From the front desk, to the bartenders, to the concierge/Robert, to the housekeeping, all very good.
We were celebrating our 50th anniversary and received champagne and strawberries in our room, plus 2 free drinks. Very nice of the management to recognize our milestone.

title: Old world
text:
This hotel has a great location.    The room is big compared to those in most downtown hotels.  The price is very reasonable for a great Manhattan location.  

Well the down sides:  loud AC, my God, old world charm should have stopped right here w antiquated ac.  The quiet room in the back is great for a good night sleep.  I would forego a view for a good night sleep.  The minibar fridge is annoying.   You can’t store any personal items in there.   Get real,  who uses minibar nowadays especially when you are in NYC?  The service staff is quite Unknowledgeable.

title: Close to Everything!
text: My teenage daughter and I recently visited NYC for a mother-daughter vacation. It was her first visit to the city so we had a long list of sites we wanted to see. Our flight arrived several hours before our check-in time and hotel staff graciously held our luggage for us so we could explore the city until our room was ready. SInce we were't very familiar with how to navigate the city, location was important to us.The Warwick was conveniently located close to Central Park, Times Square, Radio City Music Hall and MoMa,NBC Studios and many other points of interest as well as shopping and great restaurants. The Love sculpture was also just steps away. I am a big fan of Starbucks and there were at least three within a very short walking distance from the hotel. We loved exploring NYC and the Warwick was a great home base for our excursions. We loved that the Warwick wasn't a cookie cutter chain hotel and had a unique look and feel, along with an interesting history. The steps leading to the second floor displayed pictures of famous guests like Cary Grant, Elvis, and the Beatles. The hotel had a retro vibe but didn't seem dated to me. The room was comfortable and larger than expected. This might seem like a silly comment but I really liked the "hello" and "goodbye" light switches.The staff were friendly and helpful. Previous reviews I read before booking the hotel mentioned being frustrated with the resort fee but since I joined the Journeys program and had it waived with no questions asked. Other reviewers also mentioned the small elevators. They are indeed small but the only time this proved to be inconvenient was during one particularly busy morning when we were in a hurry to leave. The only negative comment I really have is that there was a minibar instead of a mini-fridge. It would have been nice to been able to have had space just to store our own snacks and drinks. Before booking this hotel I read a ton of reviews before making my finally deciding on The Warwick.Since there are so many options in NYC, I was unsure if I had made the right choice but after a great visit, I can say with confidence If we ever return to NYC, we will definitely return to the Warwick!

title: Great location and friendly staff.
text: We spent 2 nights here in August for a quick weekend getaway. The location was great—2 blocks from Central Park and you can walk to Times Square and Bryant Park. Our room was awesome! Newly renovated—it was a premier room. 2107. It even had a balcony although I wish we could’ve used it (it was closed bc of construction). The staff (especially housekeeping) was so friendly. The gym is small but has everything you need.

title: Uno dei simboli di una New York che non finisce mai di affascinare
text:
Un grande albergo che ricorda i fasti di una New York che, nonostante i continui e innumerevoli cambiamenti che l’hanno attraversata, rimane piena di fascino e intrisa di uno spirito magnetico.
La struttura, che risale ai quegli anni Trenta che hanno visto la peggiore crisi e, contemporaneamente, il più vigoroso rilancio della Grande Mela e dell’intera nazione, conserva intatto quel mood storico (bellissime le cassette della US mail ancora allocate in ciascun piano, vicino agli ascensori, nelle quali, un tempo, venivano introdotte le lettere da spedire per posta e i quadri che ritraggono sontuosi ricevimenti delle famiglie dell’epoca).
A parte il suo indiscusso fascino retrò l’hotel ha caratteristiche sicuramente apprezzabili: camere moderne ma rispettose della tradizione, conciergerie sempre pronta e all’altezza delle esigenze della clientela, una posizione centralissima, a pochi passi da tutto e un rapporto qualità/prezzo straordinario.
Non abbiamo, invece, apprezzato particolarmente il breakfast il quale, sebbene ricco e vario non ci apparso competitivo (troppo caro rispetto a quanto offerto vista anche l’enorme varietà di luoghi a NYC in cui consumare un’eccellente colazione).

title: Our favorite hotel in nyc
text: English style Hotel with nice and fluffy beds. Nice for families. It’s truly superior 4star hotel, very well located, just a few block away from central park and times square. Located in a nice, calm and fancy place at uptown manhattan.

title: Molto bello
text: La posizione è fantastica, di fronte al MOMA e a due passi da Central Park e Rockfeller Center. Stanza e soprattutto letti molto confortevoli, frigo e cassaforte in camera, personale gentile. L'albergo in generale è abbastanza vecchio, ma si presenta ben tenuto e con un valido rapporto prezzo/qualità. Lunghe attese talvolta per gli ascensori

title: Birthday celebration
text: We came to NY to celebrate my granddaughter birthday. I’ve stayed at many nice hotels in NY (The Taj Pierre, Marriott Essex House).  The Warwick is one of my favorites. The location couldn’t be better. You’re walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping and the other quaint shops and restaurants in the area. Our room was spacious and the separate living area was perfect. While my granddaughter slept in the bedroom, my daughters and I were able to enjoy cocktails in the living room area. The Randolph Restaurant, attached to the hotel, was equally as good. I would stay at the Warwick again.

title: A great time
text:
Due to airport cancellation snafu's we had the unplanned luxury of staying at three different hotels in NYC last week. The Warwick was easily the best of the three. 

For one the location is perfect. A couple blocks from Central park, Rockefeller center and fifth avenue. Out of the way but still less than 15 minutes away from Times Square and Broadway area. And Subway stop options all around it. Easily my favorite area to stay in New York when I want to do all the touristy things. Also close to Halal guys the best street food in the city (and the only one you will see a long line at for a reason). 

The room was spacious. I couldn't believe how big it was and it was just a standard room with a handicap accessible shower. It was updated and modern so there were plenty of USB ports, power, labeled light buttons, etc. It was also super quiet even though we were only on the fourth floor. Closing the shades at night seemed to really help the street traffic and the inside building is very insulated so we never heard anyone outside our door. The floors are small so that helps a lot with foot traffic as each floor only has a handful of rooms. The wheelchair accessiblity from shower chairs to wider doors to easy access in and out of the hotel was great. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

The people here were also the best of the three hotels we stayed at. Out of their way friendly and helpful. The main entrance has a couple steps down, my daughter is in a wheelchair so the doorman walked us to the side entrance right around the way and showed us how to get thru. We checked out and needed to store our bags and they stored them at no charge for the day (the Hilton across the street charged $5 per bag). 

There are only two negatives about our stay here. The elevators are way too small. We couldn't fit four of us and our two bags and our daughters wheelchair. So theres frequently a wait for elevators. We discovered there are three elevators in the stairwell that are much bigger and less crowded so used those most the time (they are generally in use by staff but there was no notice that said for staff only so we assumed there were fair game and anytime we ran into staff they were very friendly). The other is the restaurant/bar attached to the hotel is extremely over priced for plain food. There are phenomenal restaurants each direction you go within a couple minute walk, dont spend the high prices to eat basic food here.

title: Lots of good at The Warwick
text: If you are looking for a midtown hotel to act as a great base camp for a NYC holiday, The Warwick is a good choice.  The hotel itself is not bad at all; relatively spacious, very clean, and an attentive staff.  If you want a room with a view, I would suggest asking before you arrive. Ours had a brick wall literally right in front of the only window. We weren’t going to spend much time in there anyway so it was no big deal at all.  The downstairs bar was nice, $45 for 2 beers and a vodka soda made it a one and done. The location is right on the money with everything close by or a short cab/subway away.  If you find a good deal, do it, The Warwick will meet your needs.

title: Comfort and location
text:
Stayed here as part of my 60th birthday celebration and it couldn't have been better. Upon arrival at the hotel we were given a free upgrade to a premier king room which was really thoughtful. A lovely room so clean and spacious and the bed was so comfortable with loads of pillows. Our room was on the corner of the building which gave great views along 54th street particularly at night. Lovely bathroom with marble sink and matching effect tiles on the walls and floor. The shower over the bath was good for anyone who has difficulty climbing in and out as the sides of the  bath are low - not sure it would be deep enough to use as a bath though. Concierge were really helpful advising us about tours and helping book our transfer back to the airport. The hotel is in a great location with easy access to a range of the main attractions including Broadway  and the  Rockefeller centre. 
On arrival in my room I had such a lovely surprise to find a tray of chocolate strawberries with a happy birthday message and a chilled bottle of prosecco with a card for my birthday. Thank you Warwick management for making my birthday so special.

title: Excellent Choice for Manhattan
text:
For the price we paid, our room was an absolute steal.  The room was huge and the king bed was extremely comfortable with the right number and size of pillows.  The toiletries in the bathroom were plentiful and first rate.  The staff were all extremely courteous, including the housekeeping ladies we encountered.  The bar is a great place for a drink and light meal.  Prompt service as well.

The lighting in the room and in the bathroom left much to be desired.  The bathroom lighting was so bad that I used the mirror inside the door of the closet to put on makeup.

title: 6 giorni  New York
text:
Buon albergo
Abbiamo usufruito di un’offerta Expedia 
Quindi abbiamo pagato relativamente poco considerando la categoria dell’hotel 
Spaziosa la camera con un bel bagno ed una cabina armadio
Buona la pulizia
Non avevamo nel prezzo la colazione, ma nessun problema , appena fuori dall’hotel ci sono tantissimi baracchini Street food
Dove con pochi dollari si fa colazione 
Ottima la posizione a 15 minuti da Time square e pochi passi dalla 5 Avenue 
Comoda anche per prendere la metro
A pochi minuti ci sono 2 linee che portano sia a sud che a nord Manhattan

title: Good reliable, 4 star business hotel but aging a tad
text: A business travel staple of mine while at conferences in the area. I like the staff, convenience and the reliability of getting a nice room. I have asked for an outside room at 1 AMand the front desk obliged.

title: A Good Find.
text:
Unless you are willing to pay the big bucks, hotels in New York can be hit or miss. The Warwick was a hit for us this weekend.  
Traveling with friends, we wanted a nice hotel in a good part of town without spending an arm and a leg. We also wanted a living room with adjoining bedrooms so we could have a nice gathering space. The Warwick did not disappoint.  Old but not dated, this hotel offers well appointed suites with the option of adding an adjoining room.  The decor is certainly more “antique”, but it did not feel worn out. The bathrooms were updated and the beds were super comfy.  All in all a great experience.

title: History, Style and Location
text: Most people do not know that the Warwick was built by William Randolph Hearst as a luxurious apartment hotel for his Hollywood friends and business partners and, most specifically, for his long-time mistress (and San Simeon roommate) Marion Davies, who held lavish parties within its walls. Other Warwick guests included Marilyn Monroe, Elizabeth Taylor, James Dean, Cary Grant and The Beatles. The building's upper exterior was being restored while we visited, but the process did not interfere one bit with our enjoyment. Have a drink in the old-style, wood-paneled New York bar on the first floor. Generous and lovely buffet breakfast. Old world NYC at its best.

title: Scarso per il costo
text: Mi aspettavo molto molto di meglio. Ma per i soldi pagati (uno sproposito) la struttura, il servizio e le camere non sono all altezza. Bagno vecchio, piccolo e con vasca. Camera con moquette, tendoni e vista inesistente (interna stabile ove al massimo si vedono uccelli morti). Qualcosa di positivo? Location!

title: Class in the City
text: This hotel has real character and is perfectly located, just 10 minutes walk from Times Square and also right by Broadway and Central Park. Very friendly and welcoming staff who are happy to give recommendations on local restaurants, lovely spacious room

title: لا بأس به
text: فندق من اقدم الفنادق في نيويورك - تم تجديده حديثا - الغرف واسعه ونظيفة - الخدمة جميلة - بعض الغرف لا يوجد لها اطلاله وهذا عيب كبير - اللوبي عادي جدا - النظافة عاليه جدا - رقي في التعامل - لا يوجد مواقف. ويقع قريبا جدا من السنترال بارك

title: Four days in NYC
text: Wikipedia has written amazing historic ( movie stars ) figures tied to this hotel.  Very old building so everything is tiny ( room, bathroom. You get the idea. However it has all the nice, quality furnishings like Four Seasons Hotel & Resorts. This hotel is cozy and cute.

title: Great location
text:
We chose the Warwick for our stay in New York.
It is located on 6th avenue facing the Hilton.
The location is great.
The hotel is almost a century old.
The first suite we were given had a bad Air convsmell. The room was changed next day.
Breakfast is basic.
The WiFi was not functioning after the rain , for 2 days.
Front desk staff could have done  with more smiling faces.
The housekeeping service could be improved too.
It was my observation that hotel staff in general lacked the motivation to charm the clients.
I hope this point is addressed by the management.

title: Great room in NYC
text: We had a marvelous stay at the Warwick Hotel!  The rooms are spacious, with lots of great amenities (reading chair, desk, safe and high tech light controls). The bath tub and toiletries are wonderful. The courtyard view was of the building, but I loved the blackout curtains. The staff is very friendly and helpful. It is very close to Central Park and a short walk to Rockefeller Center or the Theater District and Time Square. It is a great place to rejuvenate after the hustle and bustle of NYC. Highly recommend this hotel and I will be back!

title: Lovely hotel in good NYC location
text: Spacious room in great midtown location in New York. Visually nice room, very comfortable bed. Speedy lift to higher floors. Close to subway stops. Staff didn't stand out as particularly friendly or unfriendly, probably just normal for New York. Only negative would be the shower, was extremely difficult to get the temperature right, either too cold or scorching. Should probably have contacted them about it but was only a short stay so didn't bother, although it was very irritating. Would stay again.

title: Quick Christmas Trip
text: Popped up to NYC for a quick Christmas season trip in December 2017 and stayed at the Warwick for the first time.  Older, classic hotel that has a lot of character and feel of an era past.  The room, like many in NYC, was on the small side but nicely appointed and met our needs.  The location was of course great for our purpose, situated very close to all the shopping and sites we were interested for this trip.  Would consider staying here in the future.   PS.,,sorry I am late posting the review...I just found it in my "drafts"!

title: Décalage entre les avis Tripadvisor et ce que nous avons trouvé
text:
Effectivement l'hôtel est idéalement situé, et c'est l'un des rares où nous avons pu trouvé une chambre pour 5, pour le reste :
la chambre que nous avions était très petite, avec vue imprenable et très rapprochée sur ...l'immeuble d'en face,
une climatisation très bruyante,
Heureusement, nous n'étions pas à New-York pour rester dans notre chambre

title: 4 NIGHTS IN NYC FREEZING!!!!!!!!
text: We visited as a family of 4 for our daughters 21st Birthday!!!! Early January I really wanted to stay in an old classic hotel with a history and plenty of style, this really did fit the bill and highly recommend it, we arrived late as Norwegian had lost my husbands case and they were useless when we landed as it’s a late flight in and help desk unmanned!!! Our case eventually turned up and got delivered to our room. We took a suite which had two large rooms such huge rooms for NYC apparently. My husband and I took the bedroom with our daughter she had a large bed to herself and in the living room area we had sofas & chairs and a single bed made up for our son. We would never go this time of year again as it was absolutely bitingly cold, you need t9 be so suitably dressed for it. It’s a wonderful city but it’s ticked off my list, I only ever tend to visit somewhere once, shame it was so cold.

title: Fascino retrò a New York
text: Costruito negli anni 20 del secolo scorso nel cuore di Manhattan si distingue proprio per tale motivo da tutti gli altri grattacieli più moderni che ha intorno. Ciò tuttavia costituisce la principale ragione del suo fascino facendo respirare l'atmosfera della New York che fu. D'altronde qui ha soggiornato il top del jet set internazionale, dai Beatles ad Elvis Presley, da Cary Grant a Liz Taylor. La sua posizione strategica, vicina alle maggiori attrazioni di Manhattan lo rende poi un'ottima scelta ai fini turistici. Le camere sono spaziose e curate anche se ovviamente arredate in stile classico. Unica nota stonata e fastidiosa è stata l'addebito alla fine del soggiorno di numerose bevande (peraltro a prezzi allucinanti) del frigo bar che invece non erano mai state consumate. Ciò soltanto perché erano state semplicemente più volte tolte e poi rimesse per far posto ad una bottiglia d'acqua comprata al di fuori dell'hotel ed il sensore del frigo ne aveva rilevato lo spostamento. Ebbene la receptionist continuava a ripetere che era indifferente averle consumate o meno (sic!). Soltanto una nostra ferma presa di posizione ha determinato lo stralcio di tale addebito, senza tuttavia alcuna scusa da parte dell'hotel ed anzi facendoci pesare la concessione che ci stavano facendo.

title: Beautiful old fashioned hotel near Central Park
text: Really nice staff that goes out of their way to be as accommodating as possible. The doorman was very friendly and willing to answer numerous questions. The rooms were bigger than I expected considering it is an older downtown hotel. The room was clean and well kept. Would definitely return if traveling in the area.

title: Very Pleasant
text: Stayed here with a couple friends visitng another friend in the city. Stay was extremely pleasant from beginning to end. Hospitality was second to none and the hotel was very clean. Very good breakfast as well! Will definitely go back.

title: Super hotel
text:
Really beautiful hotel.
Very nice staff.
Superb location.
Our view however was described as a court yard but in fact it was a wall with zero view.

Food and drinks are typically expensive hotel prices but lots of other options nearby.

Highly recommended as so central and easy to navigate around from here.

title: Muy buena ubicación y confortable
text:
El hotel tiene su historia la que se ve reflejada en sus fotografías en las paredes y su estilo. El personal fue amable en la recepción y cada vez que entrábamos o salíamos nos sonreían y nos deseaban un buen día. La habitación era muy confortable, pudiéndose descansar sin problema en el centro de Manhattan. El servicio a la habitación quizás es su punto débil, ya que es algo caro y no siempre trajeron lo que solicitamos, teniendo que volver a pedirlo, pero si hay que destacar que la comida era buena. 
Posiblemente regresaría al Warwick

title: Girls Weekend to Solo Weekend
text: Great hotel! Was greeted at the door by friendly doorman and bellman. Check in was easy and quick. Room bigger than i thought great space for two girls, marble bathroom, great water pressure in shower, and big walk in closet. From lobby to  hallways to room place was elegant besides the outside of hotel as they were doing some construction and up keep.
