My trip started off with my best friend but due to an emergency ended up solo rest of trip but felt safe at hotel and was in center proximity of all the important stuff in NY and the doorman and bellman were always very helpful on directions, suggestion, and gave awesome service. One of them i asked where I could find a selfie stick to purchase since my friend went back home wanted to get one to get good pics with me in them and doorman ended up lending me one during my trip and also later an umbrella. Room Service not too many options for dinner food was okay loved the hot wings but the papperdelle and Teriyaki wings not so much. Ate at Mural 51 coffee shop for breakfast didnt do buffet cause i wanted eggs benedict but looked really good and reasonable for 34 pp. Overall was very pleased with hotel and if it wasnt for the employees i probably wouldn't have felt so comfortable. Will definitley be back again and stay here.

title: Amazing Place.  A MUST
text: Only had one night to stay on this trip.  The front desk staff was FANTASTIC.  They let us park prior to check in (fee, but if you visit NYC a lot, this is normal). Walking distance to Today Show, Broadway, and 5th Ave.  Rooms are out of this world and large.  We checked our luggage in early and it was in our room in no time of checking in. Very Clean, with a Older History Charm.  Bar was great!!!!  By far the best PLACE I've stayed in NYC.  Upon check out, they held our luggage and car.  We were able to run around the City until 9pm.  Once we called for the car, our luggage was brought to us.  AND.... no NYC trip goes without a story.  This is ABOVE what any hotel will do...  We accidently had someones bag with ours...... We received a call from the hotel shortly after getting through the Lincoln Tunnel... NOPE.. they didn't ask us to return to the Warwick, they started driving our way and met us at a rest area.... NOOOOOO ONE does this.... Highly recommended.

title: Great value for miney
text: Spacious rooms, minor problems fixed quickly (faulty light for example), accessible, very clean, and pleasant all round.  Breakfast is rather pricey so I found wonderful alternatives on 6th Avenue. Great bathrooms.

title: Flawless Overnight
text: At the risk of posing a review so good that I run the risk of never being able to score another room at the Warwick, in all fairness, the staff here and this hotel earned this stellar review.  From the price, the (included) valet, the early check-in, the fabulous immaculate two room suite, the excellent buffet breakfast, and excellent/friendly staff, the Warwick is top drawer. Having stayed over after the Lincoln Center matinee “My Fair Lady” and terrific service, drinks, and dinner at the Atlantic Grill, this one nite stay over was a mini vacation for my wife and me. The rear facing room was one of the most comfortable in which we have ever stayed, and it was so very quiet - very unusual for Manhattan. A steal for a fine midtown Hotel at $185. Thank you Warwick!

title: Great location and well appointed rooms
text:
The Warwick features an excellent location in the heart of NY. My room was a standard room, well appointed, clean and with a very good quality of sleep. Soundproof windows and spacious bath.
It’s an address to keep definitely in mind for the price point and the level of services offered. I would consider going back.

title: A good time
text:
I stayed at the Warwick regularly many years ago and it was lovely to be back. It is an older hotel and has character. I used to particularly like that some of the rooms were a very good size. 54 and 6 is an excellent location, within walking distance of Central Park, shops, museums and much of interest. I was staying on my own for four nights and arrived late from the UK and the receptionist gave me an upgrade to a lovely room which I much appreciated.

I ate breakfast one day and brunch another in the dining-room and both were very good. I also used the bar with friends and that has good ambience and was very relaxing.

The Warwick was not cheap but everything in New York felt expensive because of the exchange rate so its hard to say whether other hotels would have felt better value. If I can, I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to New York

title: Posizione eccellente
text:
Ottimo hotel nel pieno centro di Manhattan. A due passi dalla metropolitana e dalle maggiori attrazioni: Rockfeller,time square,central park, moma museum......la struttura benché sia  datata è pulita e curata,camere spaziose,letti comodissimi.
Consigliato.

title: hotel trop vieillot
text:
sommes de retour d'un sejour a N York et avons eté  deçu de cet hotel
avons du attendre 15h pour avoir la chambre qui se trouvait au 4e etage avec une fenetre barrée par des planches!!!
ai demandé de changer de chambre et avons eu la 1015, assez spacieuse avec 2 fenetres d'angle mais.... lavabo de dimension de lave mains!!! petite salle d'eau et ai du mettre la petite table basse du salon pour poser nos trousses.......
aucune bouteille d'eau dans chambre, pas plus que cafetiere ou bouilloire !!!

title: Toplocatie en tophotel!
text: Aanrader! We zijn 3 dagen in NYC geweest en hebben overnacht in The Warwick. Prachtig hotel met een klassieke uitstraling. De kamer was ruim, zeker voor NY begrippen. Prima kingsize bed, dagelijkse (goede) schoonmaak en een keurige badkamer. Personeel was vriendelijk. Ontbijt leek prima (wij hebben er geen gebruik van gemaakt, elke ochtend een ontbijt tentje gezocht in NYC). Hotel beschikt ook over een leuke bar. Wat bij dit hotel het meest in het oog springt is de locatie; gelegen aan 54th street en 6th Avenue, midden in het centrum. Central Park en 5th Avenue (de dure winkelstraat) op perfecte loopafstand, ook Times Square en Bryant Park is goed te doen. Nog een paar leuke tips: fietsen huren ($35 pp per dag), The Highline wandelen en in de avond borrelen op de rooftop bar van The Peninsula. Prijs kwaliteit (wij betaalden $190 per nacht) uitstekend!!

title: Great location in NYC.
text: We stayed at the Warwick Hotel in July when we were in NYC on vacation. This is an old hotel but rooms are nice. It has 31 floors so it took a bit of time to catch an elevator.It has a very small lobby. We enjoyed the breakfast at the hotel. Overall, I think this is a pretty good place to stay for the money you pay because of its proximity to popular shops on 5th avenue. Around the corner to St Thomas Church on 5th avenue and very close to Rockefeller center, just a couple of blocks away.

title: Beautiful, high-quality historic hotel near the park
text:
This is a very nice older hotel (but very modernized and refurbished) in a truly great location.  You're steps away from Central Park, and also within a 3 minute walk of so many things.   The staff was extremely helpful, the facilities were first class, and the room was first class in every way.

The room was big for Manhattan and felt friendly, not cramped.  Manhattan hotel rooms are small, even at ritzy places.  They just are.  If you've never been there before, the size may shock you.  This one was surprisingly comfortable and big.  Our last stay was at the Waldorf-Astoria (before they closed) and the rooms there were far less spacious and welcoming. We've stayed in fine hotels all over the country, and this one is a solid 4-star place.

Our family stayed there for 5 nights and got a Premium King room, and it was essentially a 2-room apartment!    Our teenager got a rollaway in the main room and was extremely happy.  The room was quiet, the bedding excellent, and at the peak of what was a nasty summer heat wave, our room was cool and comfortable.  

The wi-fi was excellent, the coffee and turn-down service perfect, and the place had all the perks that a 4-star hotel in Manhattan should have.

Not only would we stay here again, we would work our schedule around coming so that we COULD be at the Warwick.

title: Buon Hotel
text:
Posizione strategica , personale professionale e simpatico .
Pulito, molto pratico per gli spostamenti .
Prezzo moderato per le camere .
La colazione buffet molto vario,ma per chi beve solo caffè e croissant, direi assai caro .

title: Low perfirmance
text: Old, staid, needs a renovation and a facelift. Apparently they did, guess what they should revisit again. It’s greatly located, but honestly you could stay at a better, fresher hotel for the same price tag. The bell boys were rude, and would not even take my suitcases outside (I had a lot of them) so my son and I had to take them up the steps in lobby as that’s where he dropped them), while trying to hold the door open to bring them outside, as the bellboy outside watched us and didn’t even offer help... rude. Wouldn’t stay there again. Hint to management: Look at the Langham hotel in London for inspiration...because it’s from same period, still traditional but with a fresh approach.

title: European boutique feel in NYC
text:
This is a very good 4 star hotel with a European boutique feel. 
We just had our annual 4 night visit to celebrate our wedding anniversary.
The hotel location at 54th and 6th is just perfect. Shopping on 5th is a 2 minute walk. Broadway theater is a 10 minute walk. The subway is a 3 minute walk and for $3.25 it will take you to the World Trade Center in 25 minutes. Central Park is 2 minutes up 6th Avenue.
The breakfast buffet is superb and after-theater drinks at Randolph’s are a great way to relax.
The concierge is very knowledgeable and helpful with everything. The staff are pleasant, courteous, efficient and accommodating.
Billy Kang is the guest relations manager and has looked after us for many years and is one of the reasons we return annually to this Warwick among the hundreds of NYC hotels.
Let the hotel know if it is a special trip for you.
A & R
Toronto

title: Perfect luxurious location affordable rates!
text:
My daughter and I stayed 5 nights. I’m wasn’t sure what to expect with so many mixed reviews but I’m happy to inform you the staff was very pleasant and accommodating we arrived Sever hours prior to check-in and we were quickly accommodated to our room with extra perks and upgrades when I mentioned I had a bday coming up. We had a decent view the room was modern and more importantly clean. Concierge was very good too with suggesting we visit the theater to purchase broadway tickets at a better rate. The location is perfect within walking distance of Theatre district, Central Park and Times Square. Join Warwick journeys program directly on their website for better rates and they’ll even waive the $25 daily fee so many people complain about, just make sure to update your reservation with your journeys member number. Also, you’ll get a better rate when you book direct than through a 3rd Party. I recommend the New York Sightseeing pass is an easy way to get a feel of the city and get the most value of all the sites with unlimited to as many attractions as time allows you. 

My only recommendation to the hotel is housekeeping can be a bit quieter as it was rather loud with doors slamming and knocking loudly. Otherwise was a very pleasant stay and would stay again!

title: Stay at the Warwick
text:
We have just stayed 3 nights at the Warwick. What lovely staff -  All of you were really so friendly and welcoming. A great location for everything, good value and a lovely breakfast. Monica thanks for the time dealing with our reservation. This is the place to stay if in New York. A lot of fun.
Andy

title: excelente localização, acomodações  e atendimento
text:
Localização privilegiada, perto do Central Park e várias estações de Metro. 
Ótimos restaurantes e cafeterias nas imediações. 
Quarto grande, bem decorado, roupa de cama de 1a. , banheiro excelente. 
Pessoal da recepção prestativo.

title: Great location and helpful staff
text:
Just had along weekend here and it may not be one of the new shinny hotels in Manhattan our room was large, very clean and also had a lovely comfortable bed. The street noise was also quieter than other places in the city I’ve stayed.

I think the Randolph bar down stairs connected to the hotel I think could do with being a bit bigger and maybes little updating but that’s being over critical really.

I would stay here again as it’s also priced well and hey it NYC you can find 1000s of other bars to go to in easy distance.

PS - well done all friendly staff

title: Mother daughter trip
text:
Stayed at The Warwick to celebrate my daughters 15th birthday.  I am not even sure if the woman who checked us in looked at us.  She was very impersonal.  Our room wasn’t ready, so we had lunch at Connolly’s next door which was a nice enough lunch.
After lunch our room was ready.   We booked the basic room.  We first received a room on the 20th floor and it was a room with a street view (upgrade), but it smelled very bad of cigarette smoke.  We called down and they quickly moved us to the 7th floor, 2 queen beds and a view.  
We had breakfast included each morning and it was nice besides the fact that the scrambled eggs were under cooked.  My daughter loved the bacon and fruit though.
The location of the hotel is wonderful for exploring and easy to get to the subway and steps from lots of shopping!
We were very happy with how quiet our room was even though we were close to the elevator.
Overall a good stay.
I was disappointed that my daughters birthday wasn’t recognized even though it was on the reservation.  Of course it didn’t matter to her as she didn’t know the hotel did such things.

title: Central to all places.
text:
We stay for 5 nights. In center to:
Central Park
Columbus Circle
Times Square
MoMA Museum
Rockefeller Center

We found the hotel very clean, with very good attitude & reference of the reception staff.
Room was quiet big for NYC.

Only one thing to indicate: If you don't need anything, DON'T touch the mini bar.

title: Good but should be very good!
text:
We stayed there for two weeks during a business trip.
Pros:
- Staff are friendly, 
- location was ideal (close to good restaurants, work, subway, Central Park, times sq etc),
- bed was very comfortable 
- room spacious
What let it down were:
- very noisy AC
- towels left fluff, sometimes we received 3 towels , sometimes 2
- bathroom had this beautiful old-style decor, but needs some work, e.g. toilet looked dirty. Amenities provided were very basic, and sometimes not replenished. 
- the breakfast was overpriced for the spread they offer
- walls a bit thin, we had to ask the room next door to lower tv volume etc..
- furniture not regularly dusted, and pyjamas were not folded (only once)
The above are based on comparison with similarly rated hotels. I think especially for people who stay for long periods like we did, these are very important to ensure a comfortable stay.

title: Super Service and Location
text: Just spent 4 nights at Warwick on a NYC getaway. Staff were very friendly and accommodating, the location can’t be beat and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. If you’re a walker this location can’t be beat. Close to Central Park, Times Square and a hundred other attractions. Management and staff were great. We had one issue during our stay that was handled professionally and quickly. Would definitely go again anytime.

title: Enjoyed My Stay at Warwick
text: I had a lovely stay at the historic hotel. The staff was extremely helpful. The room was lovely and the location was great. I got a good price through the Warwick Journeys loyalty club. My room was decent sized for New York. I'd stay here again.

title: JB from Texas
text:
Pleasant, well maintained hotel in good location
Breakfast was on the high side and did not try. The breakfast restaurant had piano music in the mornings
Coffee pots available upon request
Comfortable seating in lobby
Cozy bar but restrooms were on second floor??
Various doormen were courteous 
Close to subway and bus - shopping and shows
Attentive personnel

title: Classic and modern mixed together
text: The hotel has a main entrance and a handicapped entrance on the side, so it was easily accessible, even under construction.  The lobby and room were nice and clean!  The staff was friendly and helpful too!  The only thing I did not like was the step-up into the bathroom in the room, which did not even have a caution sign.

title: A Comfortable Iconic Hotel
text: When making a reservation for a stay at this grande dame, wasn't sure what to expect.  Sure it is an established older hotel, but would it be updated sufficiently to meet my modern needs?  The answer was a definite "yes."  The room (and bathroom) was larger than other NYC hotels, it was nicely furnished and had all the amenities one would anticipate finding in a newer hotel.  The bedding was extremely comfortable and, importantly, outside noise was minimal. The condition of the room was excellent, Front desk staff were friendly and helpful while the small, but nicely appointed, lobby always bustling with activity.  I would stay here again, particularly given it's very convenient location

title: Avoid! Horrible hotel!
text: Small, old and dirty. Bad smell inside of the room. Tried to charge us extra $300 for deep room cleaning after smoking. After further investigation, including security personal, apologies. Apologies are not accepted! They have to talk with hotel guests before attempting to put any extra charges.

title: Dovolená v Manhattanu
text:
V rámci dovolené v NYC, jsme se ubytovali v tomto krásném historickém hotelu v centru Manhattanu. S ubytováním jsme byli velmi spokojeni, personál byl milí a vstřícný za každé situace, čisté pokoje, denně perfektně uklizený pokoj a dokonalý klid. Hotel má dokonalou polohu - Central Park, Times Square, metro, vše máte pár minut pěšky. 
V hotelu měli navíc své apartmány takové hvězdy jako je Elvis Presley, Beatles, James Dean nebo Marilyn Monroe! Služby hotelu určitě využijeme i při příští návštěvě New Yorku.

title: Location, location & location
text: All the staff I encountered in the hotel were wonderful. PJ checked me in, late at night and I was told I had been given an upgrade. I was there for 4 nights. I wasn't expecting such a treat and the room was great! The location of the hotel is wonderful. Right across from the MoMA. So close to the sights I wanted to see and not far from the theater district. Everything is in walking distance even though I'm not young. So, as other guests have commented, it is an older hotel, has small elevators, and doesn't have huge rooms, but for convenience, location, nice personnel and old world quaint charm, it's the only place to be. I will be back.

title: Summer visit
text:
My sister and I stayed here last week for 5 nights and we were really pleased with the hotel. We had one of the twin rooms and it was lovely and spacious, as was the bathroom - the only thing I would say, is that we could have used an extra shelf or two in the bathroom, but that is the only negative we have for the room. They were clean and we had a quiet one, which was lovely. 

The staff were very helpful and welcoming. We ate in Randolph's a couple of nights during our stay and we really enjoyed the food - especially the Ceasar salad. 

I will definitely try and book this again on my next visit to NYC, as for me, it was the perfect location and close enough to the areas I want to visit. 

Well worth a try.

title: So so experience
text: I stayed at this hotel during a girls weekend. The price was decent for a hotel of that caliber. While it was classy, the rooms were very small as was the lobby, elevators and breakfast area making you feel that you were always on line. The hotel is filled with pictures of famous former guests such as the Beatles.... but hotels have come a long way since then. This is a very old hotel which left a lot to be desired. In addition the rooms were not ready to check in on time and I was late, trying to check in at 530 pm. This caused havoc with my dinner plans and they credited me 50 dollars for the inconvenience. Not a horrible hotel by any means. But I can't see staying there again.

title: Great for the value
text: Good hotel off of central park. We've stayed twice for business this spring and had to request a new room both times (once because construction workers were right outside the window and the other was because of a musty smell). The front desk was nice about the switch and moved us to a different room. Clean and comfortable.

title: Nice hotel for mid-town area
text: Nice sized and clean rooms. Very convenient to many mid-town attractions and restaurants and not too far from the theater district. However, no automatic checkout, coffee in room, or responsive bell service. No free paper — and did not have turn down service. However safe area and $100 to $200 cheaper per night than comparable lodging.

title: Great value for the price
text: This is a well maintained property.  Service is excellent and the rooms are spacious for New York properties. The location is great (near Broadway and Central Park).  The only thing I wish that they supplied was in room coffee but at least you can get a good cup at the restaurant (which serves only breakfast and is a bit high priced.)

title: Could be better...
text: Walking into the Warwick' lobby is like entering into a 3rd World hotel.   There are people everywhere, wearing all kind of unsightly garments.  When it comes to the coffee shop, they have extra charges for everything, including for the  "upkeep" of their mediocre fresco.   Recently, I paid $40 dollars for a slice of apple pie and a cup of black coffee.   There are plenty of better 4*s hotel in NYC; stay someplace else.

title: Staré dobré časy
text:
V hotelu Warwick na vás dýchne trochu historie, jakoby se ocitnete v nějakém klasickém americkém filmu.
Hotel je klasický luxusní hotel. Pokoj byl prostorný a čistý.
Pozor na pokoje do vnitrobloku, kde není žádný výhled ani denní světlo.
Pokoj servíruje v přízemí kvalitní snídani s dostatečným výběrem. 
Je možné si vybrat bufet nebo a la carte.
Příjemné je i posezení v Randolps baru.
V hotelu krom posilovny není žádné wellness zázemí.
Jednoznačnou výhodou hotelu je blízkost 5 Avenue a Central Parku, kam pohodlně dojedete za několik minut a můžete si po ránu zaběhat.

title: Great ambiance!
text: Great location!  Our room was spacious and very comfortable.  The hotel was very accommodating to our early arrival. We had dinner and drinks at the restaurant downstairs called Randolph's.  The food was amazing and the atmosphere was great. We had an amazing time.  I would definitely stay there again!

title: Classic Hotel with Great Location
text: Classic art deco hotel in a 1926 building commissioned by William Randolph Hearst; easy check-in, good beds, minibar (no micro), bathroom was good.  Family visit with multiple rooms on same floor.  Concierge was helpful.  Great location, walk to Central Park, Radio City and Broadway.  The hotel will hold your bags if you have a late flight.  Slow elevators.

title: Not what you expect from a  5 stars hotel
text: Hotel with a great location directly on Ave of the Americas. However, for 5 stars (or 4.5 stars, depending on website you look at) not the level you would expect (e.g. no bathrobe or slippers, which I like to use if floor is made of carpet). Air condition was so loud, I could use it only during the day. Room was quiet as looking to the back, but because of that also very dark (but better dark than loud). Breakfast very expensive, but there are great options in the same block.

title: Best experience in New York!
text: I traveled with my family for the first time in New York. The room was very big and clean. The front desk staff were so friendly to us and made our stay so enjoyable! They helped us with direction of taking subway. They also have two restaurants in the lobby. The food was very delicious but a little bit expensive. We'll definitely visit again soon!

title: Lovely hotel
text: We stayed here for 4 nights and couldn’t fault the hotel. The staff were accommodating and the location is fantastic. A 5 minute walk from Central Park and 10 minutes to Times Square. The rooms were beautiful and cleaned daily. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the price of the bar, $17 dollars for a gin and tonic! Would recommend anyone to stay here.

title: If you want to enjoy 70s but with Modern Amineties
text:
Excellent place with every place either few steps or few blocks away. They have a pub cum resturant and in case want to something else, there are plenty of resturant nearby.
i enjoyed my stay. Room were big and spacious.

title: twice in one week
text:
Its a lovely old building, the first trip was great quick check in and bags brought to our room, huge room very comfy, what Brits will miss is no tea and coffee making facilities, we find these in the cheapest  B/B we do love our tea.

Second visit, crowded understaffed check in,  a very long wait one person on desk, we eventually came downstairs and stuggled with out own luggage after 20 min wait.

Breakfast was great a lovely waitress, so kind a pleasure to speak with her we also had drinks in the bar prior to my exhibition in New York, service a bit slow, but the waiter was on his own needed help, super drinks and we made it to my opening 
 just in time.
 We had our English guests staying and relatives from California, a great hotel  terrific staff to get cabs, the front desk needs more staff and our air-conditioning worked but was grumbling, our guests their's blew hot and cold, but eventually worked. 
Would we stay again, yes we would check out all the internet pricing as details change so quickly, mid town old charm and lovely place.

title: Terrific hotel for an anniversary
text: The Warwick was a great choice for us: centrally located, the staff couldn’t have been more pleasant or helpful.  They upgraded our 2 nights from a King room to a Premiere Plus room on an upper room (very quiet floor) and left us a bottle of nice champagne and 6 huge chocolate dipped strawberries!  I had a drink here with a colleague for a conference last January and love the location.  Easy walk to our anniversary dinner and Central Park.  Definitely will stay here again!

title: Buyer beware-go somewhere else
text: If I could give no stars I would. I booked several months ago and was given a total charge that I would have to pay upon check out.  When I checked out I was charged the amount that was said. Not a day later there is a second $354 charge pending to my account that is being explained to me as a hold on my card for the stay.  Seeing as to how my obligation to pay my financial duties has been fulfilled this bogus explanation is unacceptable. The charge started pending AFTER a checked out. Doesn't add up. Upon requesting for the charge to be reversed I have been passed around to numerous different people who don't have an answer and now am being hung up on before even saying hello by front desk staff. To be called a luxurious hotel, this is not my idea of a high standard.  I will become this hotels worst nightmare until this is handled appropriately. Aside from the HUGE financial issue, I also had zero water pressure in the room, requested additional pillows and blankets and 3 hours later had to call back and ask for them again because they still weren't brought to me. Buyer beware unless you don't care to have hundreds of extra dollars being spent by this "luxury" hotel. Book somewhere else.

title: Wonderful visit for a long weekend in the city
text: We were in the city for a bat mitzvah and a broadway show. The location of the hotel was in the heart of everything. We did not have a car with us so I cannot comment on parking. The desk staff was friendly and offered a room upgrade to a room with a view. We didn’t take it only because it had two doubles and not the king we booked. Who needs a view when your in NYC - go out and walk the city until all hours and just come back to sleep! The room (806) as spacious with a large closet and nice size bathroom. There is also WiFi for free. The architecture was old Hollywood and charming. The room was clean, had a nice size tv, a desk and an extra upholstered sitting chair. The bathroom had nice soaps, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and body wash. An iron and ironing board were in the closet. Coffee maker was available on request. There is no breakfast included so I’d recommend grabbing something at one of the many diners around. The restaurant/bar is nice but very expensive. We’d definitely stay there again.

title: Excellent venue
text: Its position is good and so is the overall venue. Rooms are recently refurbished and this goes well along with the classic and well-kept structure. Its view are not astonishing, also worsened by current works in progress. Staff is professional and fast.

title: Perfecto, great location in Midtown
text: Stayed here for 5 nights as part of a package deal through Travelocity. It was a great experience. Standard cab ride from JFK. We checked in late, just after midnight and were treated well. The room was spacious for NYC, with the bathroom being more than sufficient. I really appreciated the closet space and safe. Definitely didn’t feel cramped as with other hotels. It’s an old historic hotel, so keep that in mind. No high speed elevators, but there are 3 were constantly crowded. At times there was a minor wait going up or down,  it if you’re willing to squeeze a bit, you’ll be fine. The staff from front desk to the valets were outstanding. One night during busy rush hour traffic the valet walked out into 6th ave to hail a cab for us. The location is ideal for a holiday or even business trip. Only blocks from Central Park. Rockefeller Center, Radio City all within an ear shot. We used the Warwick as our hub for the week and traveled to all parts, including the financial district, as well Times Square to name a few. We didn’t eat at any of the hotel restaurants, however morning and night they were crowded. I would hesitate staying here again next time we’re in Manhattan.

title: fantastic hotel
text: Just returned for 4 lovely nights in this perfect hotel, got a lovely upgrade as we stayed as part of our honeymoon! All the staff were fantastic, looking forward to returning again in the future. A great location to all the main places to see when visiting NYC. Stayed on the 31st floor so had a great view and got some lovely photos

title: Nah zum Central Park, allerdings kein 4-Sterne Hotel
text:
Vor kurzem haben wir einige Nächte im Warwick Hotel in New York verbracht.

Das Hotel liegt auf der 6th Avenue unweit vom Central Park entfernt. Auch den Times Square kann man von dort aus gut zu Fuß erreichen.

Bei Buchung der günstigsten Zimmerkategorie bekommt man ein Zimmer zum Innenhof. Da das Hotel über 30 Stockwerke verfügt, kommt daher in den innen liegenden Zimmern kaum Tageslicht hinein. Sie sind dunkel und um nach dem Wetter zu sehen, muss der Wetterbericht im TV eingeschaltet werden. Auf Nachfrage nach einem vergleichbaren Zimmer derselben Preiskategorie mit mehr Tageslicht wurde uns mitgeteilt, dass alle Zimmer dieser Kategorie denselben "Ausblick" haben. Man bat uns jedoch gegen einen Aufpreis von ca. 50 $ pro Nacht ein Zimmer mit hellem Ausblick an. Dieses durften wir uns vor der Buchung anschauen. Als wir das Zimmer besuchten, befand sich darin allerdings noch eine Person - das ist ein absolutes No-Go!! Zudem sind 50 $ pro Nacht nur für Tageslicht ein wirklich stolzer Preis.

Unser Zimmer war geräumig und gut ausgestattet. Das Badezimmer war leider etwas klein und sah abgenutzt aus. Im Bettlaken haben wir einige Löcher entdeckt.

Das Hotel verfügt über 3 Aufzüge. Wir mussten jeden (!) Tag mehrere Minuten auf einen Aufzug warten. Diese müssten dringend erneuert werden!

Mein Fazit: Das Hotel ist gut ausgestattet, allerdings auch in die Jahre gekommen. Dafür verlangt es einen sehr stolzen Preis, der nicht gerechtfertigt ist.

title: Just Splendid.
text:
First, a bit of history. The Warwick was built by Randolph Hurst for his girlfriend. What a present! The hotel is perfectly situated to explore central NY. The rooms are large and spacious with extremely comfortable beds, pillows and linen.The furnishings are classic. The bathroom is a bit small but elegantly decorated.
The breakfast buffet at $32 is good value for NY and is of high quality.
The Bar is a must.
The staff are extremely helpful.

title: Our Home When in NYC
text: Cary Grant lived here, and we have stayed here every time we are in New York for forty-four years. It's a winner, offering rooms or suites in every price range, an exceptionally personable staff, and location, location, location! From its quiet corner on Sixth Ave and 54th Street you are one block west of the most famous shops on Fifth Avenue, two blocks away from the exclusive boutiques of Madison Avenue, a block and a few steps more away from Carnegie Hall, and just a few minutes by foot (10 - 15) from the heart of the theater district and Times Square. The rooms are unusually spacious for a New York hotel, all baths are marble lined, and the beds and furniture are of the highest quality and comfort. Any time we have had any sort of issue, a quick call to the desk and VOILA !!!-- the problem is fixed! We have never been disappointed at the Warwick and neither will you!

title: Great Hotel
text: Very pleased with our room on 16th floor. It was nice and quiet but no view just a brick wall. Having said that we didn't come to New York to sit and look out our hotel window.The room had a very comfortable large bed and plenty of storage .There was no coffee making facilities but a quick call to housekeeping sorted this.Bathroom was spotless with a good hot shower ,well most of the time.This hotel is in a great position for visiting the sights of New York.The staff were friendly and helpful and they serve a great "bloody mary" in the bar.

title: Great as usual
text: The Warwick is my go-to in NYC. Perfect location, very walkable to Time Square, Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, shopping,Theater district. Staff always courteous and helpful. The elevators are extremely slow, so allow yourself plenty of time if you have a scheduled event, otherwise I wound't hesitate to recommend this hotel

title: Nearly Perfect
text: Excellent situé très bien situé entre Times Square, Central Park. Prestations de qualité, propre, literie américaine... seul bémol la porte des chambres donne directement sur le couloir donc prévoir les boules quies pour éviter les réveils en sursaut de portes qui claquent !

title: Still wonderful 10 years later!
text: Stayed here 10 years ago for our 20th anniversary upon the recommendation of a friend and it didn't disappoint. Originally were planning to stay elsewhere this time to try something new but water issues forced us to change plans and without hesitation we decided to stay at the Warwick again. You cannot beat the location. Were upgraded to a suite (without asking) on the 12th floor and we had more space than we could use! Large sitting area, comfy bed, spacious closet and good size bathroom with wonderful bath products. Enjoyed the extra mini fridge to store anything we purchased and the lighting system in the rooms was clever. Only downside was being on the 12th floor, our views were brick walls and we were unable to assess the weather for the day - not a huge deal! Also the elevators remain unchanged from 10 years ago and are slow as molasses and often full, requiring long wait times. Oh, and Randolph's (hotel bar) is the only place we found who knew how to make a proper Rob Roy!

title: Usted to be better
text:
I have stayed at the Warwick four or five times over the past three years, but this time it was disappointing.
The hotel is still a very good hotel, it’s architecture is impressive and it’s very very clean.
However, for the first time in all my stays, the reception staff (not the concierges) were very unhelpful and I would even dare to say rude in every occasion.
Moreover, the elevators took forever to arrive, which then caused them to be very crowded and to stop in every floor. 
Also, the AC in the room was so noisy it even woke me up at night.
The general manager should take a look at the general aspects of the hotel, not only worry about charging huge amounts for everything.

title: Choose other place
text:
Charged for everything! 
- Be careful with the minibar in the room, they charged for every item if u even touched once! 
- The room is too dark, not enough light.
- breakfast not good but expensive 

Nice location

title: Avoid
text:
The short version: what a farce of a hotel that cannot deliver a basic standard of room. Aged, smelly, occasionally cramped, indifferent staff. Location great, however. Will never return. 

The long version: stayed at the Warwick hotel in two parts over two weeks having booked on hotels.com: the first a 7 night stay from Friday to Friday and the second a 5 night stay from Sunday to Friday. Both stays I had booked a Premier (King bed with courtyard view) room. 

On the first stay, I arrived around 10.15pm. The receptionist seemed rather surly. I was given room 923. On entry to the room, there was a distinct mould / wet smell. I called reception saying I wanted to move and was told that there were no other King rooms available and that I would have to go to a room with two single beds. This was unacceptable for a 7 night stay and so was told I could then be moved the following morning. I waited in the room and someone arrived with replacement keys for room 1623 which was in fact a king room. He asked if I had used anything in the room to which I responded “no”, probably so some other sucker could move straight in. He did, however, agree there was a mouldy smell. 

Room 1623 had the same layout as 923 overlooking the inner courtyard of the building. The room was large. It was, however, all a bit shabby and dated: many marks on the skirting boards, chipped paint, no easily accessible power sockets next to the bed and the room seemed to be sloping as the drawers on one of the bedside tables constantly opened despite me closing them a number of times (I gave up in the end). 

On the first stay, WiFi was down for one whole day and despite complaining staff were indifferent. 

The bathroom of 1623 was reasonable with Gilchrist & Soames toiletries provided. I really liked the exfoliating soap. 

On my second stay, I was initially given room 1903. The bathroom was tiny such that I could barely sit down on the toilet as my knees were wedged between the sink and the hard shower door. Also the shelf above the sink meant that the tap could not be turned on the whole way. I complained and was then given room 1223, which like my first visit and room 923, smelt mouldy. There must be something wrong with the air conditioning in that part of the building but despite mentioning this to the manager, he had not heard of any complaints (despite the member of staff agreeing on the mouldy smell last time). On going back to reception, the receptionist seemed at a loss and noted “but you booked via Expedia (the parent of hotels.com), what do you want me to do”? I retorted that I just want a room that doesn’t smell and that I can use the toilet. 

The manager then came to reception and agreed to show me two rooms. I was happy with the first he showed me, 3002. This had a large layout and a relatively small bathroom but there was a bath meaning it was different to 1903. On going to sleep, the aircon became ridiculously noisy and even after putting in earplugs I could still hear it. I complained in the morning and asked someone to fix it but as I was back late that day, I spent one more night in that room. 

In the morning I then spoke to another manager who acknowledged that my experience had been not up to scratch. He then agreed to hold a room until I got back from work that day. On arrival back at the hotel in the evening, I moved into room 1020, which was the biggest room I had had so far, didn’t smell, could sit on the loo and whilst the air conditioning certainly wasn’t quiet, it was less noisy than 3002. It had a Sixth Avenue view. 

Cleanliness could be greatly improved. Room 3002 had a thick layer of dust on the bathroom shelf. The duvet had dirty marks on it etc. 

Overall, very disappointed with my experience here. There’s a great disparity between the rooms, they seem poorly maintained, shabby, dirty and staff seem to assign poor rooms to third party bookings. I would never stay here again. My opinion: avoid completely.

title: Excellent hotel and location
text: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in May 2018 for both mine and husbands birthday (21st and 23rd) . Stayed in a premier room overlooking courtyard on floor 20 . Very clean, quiet and spacious - perfect . Room was beautifully decorated and bed and towels changed daily. Manager sent up chocolate strawberries and prosecco on both birthdays which was a lovely touch . Located on 54th street close to Central Park was in easy walking of all sights . Would recommend 3 day NewYork Pass which includes Big Red Bus - all excellent . No breakfast included but went first morning costs 80 dollars which was expensive . Would book direct and have breakfast included in future. Excellent breakfast choice . All staff have been excellent

title: Week in NYC
text: Location in midtown of Manhattan just next to Central Park and only one block from fifth avenue. Historical classic design with original details. Nice and testy breakfast. Spacious room. I got room on 22nd but no view. Service especially at reception not client oriented need to be approved - issue with deposit and solving it.  Despite to have cash deposit anyway charged CC without asking.  Another day responding when breakfast time was shorted about RS delivery - ask restaurant manager etc.

title: Great hotel, short notice
text: Perfect room, perfect price, attentive staff, great bar and amazing breakfast buffet. What could have been a disastrous work trip was saved by the Warwick.  Can't wait to come back when its not a work trip!

title: Great Location and lovely staff
text: Stayed here in November 2017. Awesome location, lovely rooms and great staff. I would definitely recommend this as a base for exploring New York. An old classic hotel. 5 minutes from Central Park, 5 minutes from Time Square, 3 minutes from 5th Avenue. Will definitely go back.

title: Hotel clasico
text:
Un hotel antiguo, con historias. Muy bien ubicado en la 6ta con la 54
Es elegante , ascensores antiguos, un bar restaurante entretenido aunque le queda un poco chico al hotel
La habitacion no fue gran cosa. Con vista a la 6ta pero algo oscura

title: Hotel impecable. Antiguo pero de calidad. excelente ubicación
text: limpio, con muebles, camas, almohadas de calidad. Buen Servicio. Estuvimos en meses de obra afuera,por lo que estimo cuando terminen se verá aún mejor. ubicación inmejorable a 1 cuadra de 5ta avenida y del MOMA, y a dos del Central Park.

title: Family fun at Warwick NYC
text: Best location, amazingly friendly and helpful staff and superb rooms!  Ask Robert the concierge for restaurant recommendations- and know the doormen (Adam) will take great care of you. The hotel is elegant, spotless and home away from home.

title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel in the heart of the city
text: Great location by Rock Center and Central Park.  Tucked away on 54th on 6th Ave.  So much nicer, I think, over the monster size tourist hotels in the area.  It's charming and old school.  Nice lobby bar. Rooms are nice size and clean.  You won't be disappointed.

title: Aprovado !
text: Os fatores mais positivos desse hotel são o custo-benefício e a sua localização. Fica praticamente ao lado do MOMA e a poucas quadras do Central Park e do Times Square, mas fora do agito. O nosso quarto tinha um bom tamanho, bom banheiro, tudo reformado, limpo e confortável. O atendimento não era um ponto forte, mas também não foi tão necessário. Nas ruas em volta tem ótimas opções de cafeterias e restaurantes, sem falar que mesmo no inverno foi possível fazer muitas coisas a pé. Recomendo em geral e para famílias.

title: Une localisation idéale.
text:
Superbe hôtel idéalement placé entre les deux plus importantes avenues de New York la 5ème et Times Square et surtout à 300 mètres de Central Park. 
Les chambres sont très grandes, très propres le service est irréprochable. 
Le petit déjeuner est complet avec un service très attentif  
On y est resté 8 jours et je n’aurai jamais voulu un autre emplacement que celui là c’est ventral et le personnel est toujours à votre disposition pour vous aider. 
Nous avons dîner deux fois au restaurant mes filles ont adoré les hamburgers et moi les Ribbs avec une sauce BBQ hors norme. 
Le premier soir on a commandé en chambre un club et une salade Caesar, le tout était frais et servis rapidement, ce fut agréable surtout après un long voyage. 
Le voiturier nous a arrangé notre départ pour JFK pour nous 4 avec 8 valises sans problèmes ni stress. Je conseillerai à tout le monde d’aller dans cet hôtel surtout grâce à son emplacement, sa propreté et le sens de l’accueil distillé par le personnel travaillant.  
Merci et bravo à tout le personnel du Warwick NY

title: Pas du tout à la hauteur d’un cinq étoiles
text:
Hormis l’emplacement idéal pour un séjour dans Manhattan, et la serviabilité et la gentillesse des voituriers et des femmes de chambre, le Warwick ne répond absolument pas aux standards de service de sa catégorie. Pas de bouteille d’eau, pas de kit pour un café ou un thé, une grande serviette de bain pour deux le premier soir...et pour couronner tout cela, pas un sourire à l’accueil!
Le personnel à l’accueil n’est pas du tout aimable, la salle de bain de taille minuscule (chambre 315) et mal agencée (toilettes inutilisables dans le sens normal car face à un mur ne laissant aucune place pour les jambes). Le buffet petit déjeuner est hors de prix. Vous vous en sortirez pour plus 105 dollars pour deux si vous prenez un double expresso!
Je ne vous parle pas du cafard énorme rencontré dans la salle de bain, parce qu’il paraît que NYC en est infestée.
Passez votre chemin!

title: Pas à la hauteur d’un 5 stars
text:
Grande chambre très bruyante avec une salle de bain minuscule moins de 2 m2 .... Pas la place de s’assoir sur les toilettes dans l’axe !!!
Des cafards ... 
une seule serviette pour deux personnes 
Un personnel pas aimable du tout 
Un petit déjeuner à plus de 50 euros par personne .... hors de prix ... allez donc déjeuner en dehors c’est mieux ..  

Bref cet hôtel ne mérite pas ses étoiles et même son emplacement proche de Central Park ne fait pas oublier sa médiocrité.

title: Hidden Charges
text:
I visited NYC for business and booked this hotel through Expedia 

They impose a fee of 27 USD for wifi which is titled as “free” during the login screen as there is chargeable option for faster speeds.

This is expensive and given that Expedia list free wifi as one of the selling points of the hotel it’s outrageous.

My room temperature thermostat was set an intolerable 27 degrees and I spent an evening in sweltering heat despite trying to adjust the temperature to something enjoyable for humans.

I assume the hotel survives on new naive tourists and needs no repeat business.

title: Old Dusty and Crusty
text: A hotel 40 years past its use by date. A hail mary required for blessing before you get in the lift, old heavy design and a rip off 27 USD per night  for internet and gym that was not stated on Expedia. A truly horrible place

title: Bon Hotel
text: Sejour de 3 nuits en famille. Chambre spacieuse au 21e étage, mais après réclamation car on nous avait initialement donné une chambre bien plus petite au 3e étage avec vue sur les échafaudages et ouvriers qui passaient devant la fenêtre!(hôtel actuellement en travaux) Bonne literie et propreté nickel. Accueil un peu froid. Très bien placé pour visiter midtown. Central park à 5 rues.  Rockfeller center à 5 minutes. Time square à 10 minutes. Metro à 3 minutes. Hôtel qui a été un palace (Les Beatles y ont séjourné en 65 !) Mais qui a été dépassé sans vouloir le reconnaître.  Gagnerai à faire plus simple et plus friendly.

title: In my opinion: HIDDEN CHARGES, OUTRAGEOUS PRACTICES
text:
Once in a while, you come across something that completely angers and riles you.  This is such an occasion.

It concerns a "mandatory" fee of $25 per night that the hotel imposes as a "Facilities Fee" that is essentially hidden. It was mentioned in my booking.com e-mail I received after I had booked, so I should explain further.

If you see the initial  listing for this hotel through booking.com it says, with an accompanying icon, "free wifi".  'Free' means you do not pay, it my opinion.  Additionally, when I checked in, I received a paper which says "local, 800 and long distances calls are complimentary"  Complimentary, in my opinion, means you do not pay for them.

But the the wifi are local calls are precisely the reasons the hotel says these services are "free" or "complementary" because they are under the "Facilities Fee".  In other words, it tells you up front that certain services are "free" and then charges for them on check-out.

Here's the real clincher: when I checked out, I noticed first this "facility fee" and then noticed charges for 5 local calls I made, at 1.40 each.  Despite there being 5 calls and each one taking two lines on a one-page bill (it appears as "Telephone Local" and "line" on two separate lines) the check-out person who had scanned the bill somehow claimed she did not notice those ten lines related to charges that were covered by the "Facility Fee". They were removed when I objected to them.

It's not the charge of $25 a day per se that bothers me.  It's the way it is imposed that does.  "Free" and "Complimentary" actually mean $25 per night.

Needless to say I think booking.com should remove the "Free wifi" icon on the site and the Warwick needs to be much more transparent in its letter it hands out to its guests.

I will never stay at any Warwick hotel again.

title: Globally disappointed !
text:
I was dreaming to have a stay in this hotel after several trips to New York but end up now with a disappointment and one experience that I would not repeat unless having the information of major changes at Hotel Warwick 
The name was giving me great expectations in term of global comfort 
Welcoming was common not really warm, corridor nicely decorated at each level but rooms being old fashion and need a whole refurbishing, old carpet floor, curtains being not very clear or clean, room cleaning average, bathroom too small to be comfortable and allow our products to stand or to stay for a temporary minute at 2 persons...no bathrobe ...
Burger tasted the day of arrival being average!!
The Warwick is may be a historical hotel but really not matching with the level of comfort expected comparing to other offers around and if classification to be applied quiet below 5 stars !! 
Will not recommend today.

title: Beautiful with lots of potential
text:
Arriving at the hotel and walking into the intimate beautiful lobby sets the stage well for this well maintained New York beauty. Our room was spacious by New York standards. I always love hotels with lots of moldings painted in high gloss.  Our bathroom door handle was broken when we arrived, but the hotel maintenance team quickly repaired. 

Two things that keep this from a five star property. There are only three elevators and waits can be up to five minutes and even then there might not be room.  Second, the exercise room is inadequate compared to other properties.  I usually check before booking, but skipped this step.  This is despite a health “activity fee” for the internet, exercise room and never used business center.  

In summary the place looks great but it is a little form over function.

title: Classic Hospitality
text:
After dealing with the construction mess at LaGuardia Airport and an extremely long shuttle ride (should have Ubered, my mistake!) I arrived at the Warwick Hotel in midtown Manhattan late in the evening.my stress quickly dissipated by the warm reception I found by the front doorman and guest service agent at the Warwick New York.  

I was in my room within minutes.  The room was clean and large, the overall design and ambiance beckons from a bygone era yet exudes modern comfort.  Though the hustle, bustle of the city was just outside the window and the hotel may have had 900+ guests the room was very quite.  The Bathroom was wall to wall marble and well appointed.

I would recommend Murals for breakfast and Randolph's for Lunch and dinner,  Cocktails are well mixed, and the food is great!  The service is attentive and delivered with warm hospitality.  The entire staff is attentive to the point where I think they can read your mind, Kudos to the doormen, they are very engaging and perform their jobs in a professional manner with warm smiles.  

The Warwick is conveniently located near many major attractions within short walks from the hotel.  Do make a point to hit up the Halal Food cart near the hotel- just go easy on the hot sauce.

This is my 5th stay at the Warwick Hotel over 6 years and it always delivers and exceeds my expectations.  The Warwick group has cornered the market on delivering classic old world hospitality that is well appreciated these days.

title: Big rooms old 5 stars hotel
text:
The hotel is old style 5 stars hotel , surely not modern and the furniture must be renewed.
I cannot complain for the price as we caught a good deal on booking. If you are with childs then you must book a suite , 50 share meters rooms make it one of the the biggest rooms in town at that price.
Quality ratio price really good
If you want a top view on New York then do not choose this place.
Higher floors rooms are recommended , the lower ones are too noisy.

title: A Classic That's Contemporary
text: I stay at the Warwick New York whenever I come into the city for work. The location is great which makes getting around easy. The staff, which is helpful, warm and friendly, remains constant with very little turnover, so after all these years of being a regular, I feel that the hotel has become a home away from home. The rooms are large and very comfortable, and the history of the hotel makes for a lovely classic backdrop.

title: '' Excelente localização ''
text: Hotel antigo e ligado a uma antiga história de amor onde, ao longo dos anos, se instalaram muitas celebridades, de Elvis Presley aos Beatles, passando por Cary Grant, James Dean, Marilyn Monroe, entre outros. Um misto de glamour e de decadência! Os quartos que ocupámos eram espaçosos, decoração clássica e sóbria, como tantos outros hóteis em NYC,  com walk-in closet, ferro de passar, cofre, mini-bar, secador de cabelo. Sendo um hotel de 5 estrelas (?), não providenciaram nem chinelos nem roupões, mas a relação preço-qualidade parece-nos bastante razoável! Staff atencioso! Café da manhã/Pequeno almoço a US$22,00.  O Randolph's Bar and Lounge é muito frequentado, com decoração clássica agradável, servindo corretamente bebidas,mas está longe de servir comida de excelente qualidade!  Partilhando a West 54th Street com o MoMA, e oferecendo uma promoção para entrada neste, este hotel tem uma situação privilegiada perto de Central Park, Rockfeller Center, Broadway, 5th Avenue e Times Square!

title: Visit my favorite city
text:
Checking into a booked up hotel at midnight got us a small room with 2 beds, but the next morning I called Joel Fabian, manager and explained our plight.
Not only did he up grade us to a nice 2 room suite, he had all of our luggage, move there, so when we got back from breakfast we were delighted.
This is what makes nice hotels: GREAT

title: Great hotel
text:
This hotel has a lot of history. Close to a lot of sites that you can visit in walking distance such as central park, rockefeller plaza, time square.
The rooms are good not really big but ok. Staff is friendly, would book here again

title: Disgusting stains on the sheets. Immediately checked out.
text: Had planned on staying in the city for one night to celebrate our anniversary and booked a room at the Warwick based on location and star rating. Upon check in, I was a surprised to see that this was a 4 star hotel due to the carpet and chair stains, as well as stains on the bathroom shower curtain. Since we had dinner and show reservations, we didn't stay in the room very long. When we returned back to the room to go to sleep, we pulled the covers off the bed and red stains all over the sheets. I don't know what they were but I can only assume it was blood based on the color. I called the front desk and was advised they could not move us to another room but would send someone up to change the sheets. I told the front desk I was not going to sleep in that bed after I saw what was on the sheets. We immediately checked out and asked for a refund. Our anniversary plans for a fun night out in the city were cut short thanks to the Warwick. Will never return to this hotel.

title: Regular
text: Hotel es básico, piezas regulares, ascensores lentos, personal con mala actitud y el servicio es ridiculamente malo, estuve una hora esperando para que me cambiaran de habitación y que trasladaran mi equipaje. Lo único bueno que tiene es la ubicación. No lo repetiría jamás. Precio calidad deficiente.

title: Super hôtel 5 étoiles
text: Très bien situé, service impeccable le Warwick est une superbe adresse si vous souhaitez découvrir New York. A deux pas de Central Park pour prendre un bol d’air frais et rencontrer les écureuils et parallèle à la 5ème Avenue pour des heures de shopping

title: CEO LearningMate
text: I took a overnight from the west coast. My room was booked from the previous day. Got here only to find that my room was not ready!! They gave me a breakfast coupon. Then I get a room after an hour of wait. I try the shower. It does not work. It’s been a horrible experience. Had to shower and leave for a meeting.

title: Inmejorable ubicación!
text: El hotel cumple con todas las espectativas para un 4 estrellas, quizas las habitaciónes para 4 sean un poco pequeñas pero no nos resultaron incómodas para nada. Muy buena limpieza y la atención del personal. El desayuno excelente, vale la pena.

title: Decidedly average
text: After reading the reviews online I booked this hotel for the first leg of our honeymoon.The location is excellent for sightseeing and there are plenty of placed to go for breakfast to avoid the extortionate prices of the hotel. However we had multiple issues with the room and the service. First off our AC was nearly impossible to regulate and as a result the room was either too hot or too cold, these rooms are not large and this exasperated the problem even more, there were also quite loud background noises in our room, they sounded like fans or something(the ac was switched off at this stage).The alarm clocks had obviously been set by someone else and went off at 7 am on 2 mornings of our stay.......very annoying!!The shower head fell off and hit me in the mouth while i was showering on the second day, it took 3 reports before the issue was addressed!! the people at the front desk were not only inconsiderate but i would rate them as being passive aggressive, I was not at all impressed with their demeanor.We had to double check the bill also as we were being charged an extra night......a slight smile from the girl at the desk "Oh sorry about that sir", I got the impression she couldn't care less whether we spotted the fault or not.The other gripe was the lifts............they take an age...........when they are working! We resulted in taking the service lifts instead as they were quicker and are right behind the main lifts.In short I would not bother with this hotel again, it was decidedly average.

title: DO NOT BOOK THROUGH A 3rd PARTY-Michael the night Manager is a disaster!
text:
Let me begin by stating I have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the years.
Sometimes booking through the hotel, others through Hotel Tonight!
Never had a problem (actually visited 9 days prior) .  Jamal at the front desk actually remembered I had the same request- quiet room, high floor!  I was put on the 11 th floor- and with 2 beds! Traveling alone I wanted 1 bed.  The hotel has 30 floors-when I asked for a different room the Night Manager was put on the phone and continued to repeat at least 3 times that when one books through a third party , one is given whatever the house chooses!  He then proceeded to have Jamal offer me a room facing the street one floor down—10 th floor REALLY?   Worthless manager. Poor customer service -making one feel inferior for using a 3rd party! Shame shame shame!

title: Toujours un bon séjour
text: Je suis allé à cet hôtel à quelques reprises au cours des dernières années et j'ai toujours eu une bonne expérience. Les chambres sont propres, le personnel est courtois et serviable et l'hôtel est bien situé. Central Park est tout près, de même que la 5e Avenue, Bryant Park, les métros, etc.

title: Fantastically well located and appointed hotel
text:
My daughter and I stayed here (for our first trip to NY) to celebrate our 21st and 50th birthdays. We loved this hotel!! Most importantly, it is located in an excellent position, close to various subway lines, bars, restaurants, shops etc - plus attractions such as Central Park, MoMA, Times Square.
The  hotel itself was fabulous. Think old school glamour. Our room was spacious (loved the walk in wardrobe & marble bathroom), clean, & the staff were charming. We felt very secure here.  We were on the 20th floor - no problem at all with elevators. We were given a lovely gift of prosecco and chocolate covered strawberries to celebrate our birthdays, which we were delighted with. I would definitely recommend the Warwick & very much look forward to staying here again.

title: my new cruise hotel!
text: I cruise a few times a year from New York City. This hotel was the best yet due to good price and lovely accommodations! The staff was friendly and helpful as well. Location is ideal....restaurants are nearby. The hotel bar/restaurant ....Randolphs... is very nice and the breakfast/lunch shop.... 'Murals on 54th' was also very nice. Lots of nearby restaurants. Short cab ride to pier 88.

title: Great Hotel Great Price!
text: I was skeptical when I booked this hotel because it was not as expensive as the other hotels in the area. The Warwick constantly got good reviews so i tried it and it was great.  Although it is an older hotel it was very well kept.  It was extremely quiet and my room was adjacent to the elevator.  I booked a premier suite and it was definitely worth the extra $ with a separate living area.  Bathroom was very small but the comfort of the room made up for it.  Nice amenities such as robe and slippers.  Front desk staff was excellent, I really appreciated being able to check in to my room even though it was a couple of hours ahead of check out time.  Location is fabulous.  I would have passed on this great hotel if it wasn't for the helpful reviews so I hope mine is helpful as well.

title: Ideal location, excellent service,value for money
text: I and my family stayed at the hotel for a night while in transit. The check in process was fast and pleasant. They had reserved the room they promised when booking, They were helpful with restaurant recommendation we requested. It was raining but they were happy to provide umbrellas. The room was spacious , well kept and had all the normal amenities. Location was convenient for us to get to Central park, Plaza hotel, several good restaurants. We requested for a late check out which was provided with a pleasing smile. Check out process was also fast and pleasant. Jamal who was checked us in and out was very pleasant

title: Amazin location, charming rooms, request a high floor!
text:
Wonderful location - close to Everything! Hotel is older but charming. Perfect size for 2 people.

The hotel is under construction on the exterior and there is scaffolding surrounding the building. We were placed on a low floor where there were men working directly outside our window. We were not made aware nor given the option to move. They start working at 6AM which is ridiculous and we could not get back to sleep. Being to women in the suite we were totally unsatisfied with our stay because we were so uncomfortable. When we spoke to the hotel manager he was very apologetic and compensated us for our uncomfortable situation. He definitely made up for it but I would have rather known and been placed on a higher floor to avoid the uncomfortable situation!

title: Très joli.
text: Hotel idéalement situé sur la 54eme entre la 5ème et la 6eme avenue. Accueil souriant et hôtel chic et très propre. Le personnel est très souriant et prêt à réagir à vos demandes. Les chambre sont de bonnes taille. Demandez les chambre en hauteur mais pas trop haute car plus vous montez plus les chambres sont petites.

title: Top
text: Hôtel bien placé a deux pas de la 5eme avenue. La réceptionniste super sympa, souriante. L'entrée de L'hôtel est un peu vieux mais relativement classe. Les chambres sont propres,spacieuses, avec un grand dressing. Ne pas hésiter à demander une chambre à étage la vue est sympa.

title: Great Location, Pretty Hotel, Couple of Hiccups
text: We really liked this hotel for its location and size of rooms. It was very quiet in our room and everything was well-appointed. The front desk staff and the concierge were excellent. We were a little disappointed that some of the elevators were broken the whole weekend which was a hassle and there was a lot of construction going on outside the property. Inside was very pretty and well-maintained. Overall, very good stay. We did leave two items behind by accident and were disappointed that no one turned them in. Usually, we have better luck with housekeeping.

title: Worst night of sleep ever, but the hotel itself was nice
text: We loved the charm of this hotel and the location, but it definitely had a few issues.  There was a long wait for the elevators (one was broken too) every time we used them, it was not possible to adjust the temperature in our room (72 degrees for everyone), and there was almost zero counter space in the bathroom -- too bad because there was a great lighted, magnified mirror for putting on makeup...it was just awkward to lay down anything, including a toothbrush.  Worst of all though was the noise from the room next door and the hotel's failure to help.  Our neighbors started screaming loudly at each other at about midnight and continued on and off for a half hour. After that they left their t.v. turned on loudly until after 1 a.m.  Then they turned it on again at 4 a.m.  By 5 a.m, we started trying to call the front desk, but no one answered for a half hour.  When security finally did contact the neighbors, they turned down the t.v. for about 3 minutes, and then it was back to full blast. Reported this to desk, they didn't seem to care. Disappointed with their response and no follow up. The rooms were spacious, that was a plus, but not sure I'd go back. I like to actually get some sleep at a hotel.

title: Convenient and friendly
text: A friendly hotel, well placed for Times Square, Broadway and Central Park.  Opposite the MoMA.  Nice rooms, good sized, comfortable bed.  Excellent bar with good food.  Clean and well-appointed throughout.

title: Still My Favorite -  but some work needs to be done
text:
We have been staying at the Warwick for many years and it is still my favorite. I love the people who work here - the housekeeping staff, the doormen, the bellmen, the front desk and the wait staff at Randolph's. They are all wonderful.  We love the food at Randolph's and the exquisite drinks.  The location is the best and central to everything I like to do when visiting New York. Our bed and luxurious sheets were heavenly!!

Room maintenance was an issue. We had walls that were worn looking and in one instance there was a small hole  that needed to be filled in and repainted, a  light switch that were not secure to the wall, The woodwork in our room was scuffed and marked.  The halls also looked tired.  One of the three small passenger elevators was broken throughout our stay.  We ended up taking the service elevator twice. Also, I like to have a grab bar in the tub.  The Warwick's bathrooms are small, lovely and marble but there is  nothing to hold as one enters or exits the tub.  We find that most hotels have a grab bar as a universal accommodation - not just in rooms designed for disabled guests. There was no mat or feature on the floor of the tub to prevent falls. 
Again, it remains my favorite hotel in New York.  I hope that these suggestions are helpful and that I can give the Warwick 5 stars next time.

title: Nice location, slow elevators
text: Recently stayed at the Warwick with my husband and daughter over Easter weekend. The check in was quick and efficient.  Our room was small with a window facing inside to skyscrapers and scaffolding. It felt a little like a prison cell. The bathroom was fairly small, but ok by NYC standards.  The good news is that the room was clean. The elevators were very slow only to find out the next day that one of the three had to be taken out of service. It was a crowded holiday weekend so waiting was very frustrating. Someone finally showed us to the service elevators which we took with the employees (who were super pleasant).  I would also suggest that the hotel get a specific car valet section.  We had to wait in the front desk line to ask to have our car brought around.  The best part of this hotel is the location right on 6th ave...Duane Reade a few doors down, Time Sq or Central Park within a 10 minute walk and Magnolia Bakery a few blocks away.

title: Centré mais vieillissant
text:
L’hôtel est très bien placé 
Tout est accessible à pied : central park, le métro, le moma, les magasins ...
Les chambres sont propres et la literie est bonne.
Quelques points négatifs:
- sur les 3 ascenseurs l’un était en panne pendant les 4 jours où nous étions la, ce qui nous faisait attendre jusqu’à 10 minutes l’ascenseur pour descendre ( 31 eme étage )
- les serviettes n’ont pas été changés même si elles étaient laissées par terre dans la salle de bain alors qu’elles étaient pleines de maquillage
- manque de rangement. Nous avions une suite junior et il n’y avait qu’un seul petit placaard pour 2 personnes ...

title: NYC Beat
text: This magical hotel is the best place to experience in Manhattan. Early 20th century fashioned with every service supplied with kind and gentle staff. This hotel is haunted by the Hollywood acting people of old times. The rooms are large and tidy in every corner. It has been a pleasure to stay and breath that amazing atmosphere. Will be there again Randolph!

title: Family stay in New York
text:
We stayed at the Warwick for 7 nights in April 2018, travelling as 2 adults and 2 teenagers. 

To the positive
- great location for the hotel, 5 mins to Central Park, 15 to Times Square, subway and taxis always close by
- all the doormen are great, with a welcome and a farewell every time you walk through the doors of the hotel
- hotel full of heritage and story

To the negative
- big building work going on right outside the hotel, with the materials lift starting into life at 6am on weekdays, so it’s an early wake up call everyday!
- the room we stayed in was a double premium, so the ones with two double beds and a separate living area. But the beds really are small doubles, so no change of any body sleeping in the same bed with somebody else without getting pretty close (clearly not something mixed sex teenager siblings want to do). So we were forced to get an extra rollaway bed for the living room. 
- price of breakfast in the hotel is very high, much cheaper and good options close by

title: Fantastic location and great sized rooms!
text: This hotel, whether you are in a standard room or a suite, is a good size, nicely decorated, very clean, and in a great location!  Very close to Central Park andcto excellent restaurants. If you don’t want the yummy hotel buffet, zip down the street (just a block) to Astro’s for a huge variety!

title: Great location
text:
This hotel is in a great location just a short walk from Central Park in 1 direction and Times Square the other way.  There is a lot of history to this place in terms of guests who have stayed here and it is very well presented.
The rooms are very generous and I really only have one niggle, which nothing can be done about.  These generous rooms have the smallest bathrooms I have seen anywhere in the world, I just do not get it. Even the shelf above the tap in my room was placed so low that you could not fully lift the tap up to get maximum pressure.  Cannot explain how odd it is but I assume the bathroom is sacrificed to give more space in the room itself.  Gripe over!
Food and drinks at Randolphs were very good and not overly expensive.  Service was always excellent throughout the hotel.
Would stay again, no question!

title: Perfect location
text: Great hotel, I often stay here when coming to NYC. It’s walking distance to everywhere I want to go. The rooms are nicely appointed and feel luxurious. It’s also very quiet. I’ll stay here again soon.

title: Another trip to New York made better by the hotel friends you keep
text: I just returned from a quick trip to New York that included yet another stay at the Hotel Warwick on 54th and 6th Avenue. It has been my hotel of choice in Manhattan for many years, since September 11, 2001 as a matter of fact, when i was trapped there for six days after the 9/11 disaster, unable to get a flight out of the area until the local airports reopened. I suspect a lot of business travelers found themselves trapped in NYC that week, and they remember their hotel home either fondly or with some degree of resentment. My experience -- despite the enormous sadness of the experience -- was very positive as the hotel and their skeleton staff did everything humanly possible to make their reluctant guests as comfortable and safe as possible. I've had a soft spot in my heart for this grand old hotel ever since. My latest trip was just another example of how well the Warwick operates. It has a wonderful location -- a nearby drugstore, Starbucks, several wonderful restaurants both formal and casual, and spacious, old-fashioned rooms that seem like great values in today's hotel world. I am almost sorry to suggest it to others as this may well put me in a position competitive with other potential guests, but I think the hotel deserves to be better known to business travelers. It's combination of location, professionalism and value make it one of my favorite stops when traveling to New York.

title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
text: My family and I stayed at the Warwick in March, and we had a wonderful time!  The hotel was beautiful and charming.  The doormen were extremely friendly and always had a kind word and a smile for our young daughter.  At check in, we were offered a room with two beds instead of the one bed that we had originally booked, and we found it very thoughtful of the hotel to do that for us.  The location could not have been more perfect for us, we were close to everywhere we wanted to go, whether we were walking or taking the subway.  Thank you to the Warwick for making our family trip so memorable!

title: Très bel hôtel un peu vieillissant
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans une "suite luxe" à l'angle de la 65ème et de la 6ème, avec une magnifique vue sur ces deux rues !
Une chambre immense, un salon magnifique, une propreté irréprochable. Seul bémol, la petitesse de la salle de bain pour ce type d'établissement...
Accueil sympathique de l'ensemble du personnel.
Un très bon séjour dans cet hôtel au coeur de Manhattan, à proximité de tous les métros.

title: Necesita modernizarse
text: Un hotel que acusa en demasía el paso del tiempo. Deberían realizar reformas con urgencia en las habitaciones, ventanas que no son herméticas (entra aire y ruido de la calle), interruptores obsoletos, enchufes muy viejos, grifos del baño que pierden agua por las juntas....., etc, pero en su favor, tamaño suficiente y camas muy cómodas, los colchones sí deben ser bastante nuevos.

title: Week in February
text:
We stayed at the Warwick for a short week in February while attending a conference. We needed a larger room to accommodate a small meeting so chose a premier plus suite, which ended up being on a high floor. The night we arrived the fire alarm went off around 1:00 a.m. and we trudged downstairs. There was no emergency and we took the elevator back up (though my calves felt it for the rest of the week). 

The suite was delightful - open, airy, clean, traditional decor. The bathroom was smallish but we had plenty of room to tuck away our things. 

We did not have much need for specific staff attention but when asked everyone was responsive.

The room rate included buffet breakfast in the "Murals" room downstairs and I would say the breakfast was somewhat better than average for a hotel. Waiters were attentive and for the occasional drink the bar was inviting. 

We had not complaints with the staff and I noticed concerns about the "facilities fee." Regarding the latter I just suggest reading the fine print and make sure you compare apples to apples with other hotels. 

Because of the competitive rates compared to other hotels in the area, the nice room/suite, and the breakfast we will probably return to this hotel next year. 

Hint: If you are thinking about staying here, join the loyalty club. In January they offered a promotion on gift cards that saved us 20% - maybe they will do that again!!!

title: Birthday overnight “Great Place “
text: We decided to give the Warwick a try, moving away from the Palace and Sofitel as our usual go to overnights.  Glad we did, beautiful hotel and the service was first class.  I booked through a quick email to the assistant reservation manager Navlet Bernard to see how service might be handled from the get go.  I was emailed back very quickly and he took care of everything for me without having to make a single call.  We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by a great front desk woman that I really wish I remembered her name, she was very nice and extremely helpful. She upgraded to a beautiful suite and had strawberries and champagne sent up upon our arrival.  The bar was great, I could of sat there all night with the the great window seat we had.  Breakfast was a nice surprise they was included with our stay.  Definitely coming back as soon as we can and highly recommend this hotel.  Thank you to the staff of the Warwick for a great birthday weekend.

title: This has become a terrible hotel.
text:
After many years of coming here -- at least 100 nights in the hotel and membership in their frequent visitor program -- and being pleased with the experience, we arrived in the middle of the night and left a 10:30 AM wake up call.  Unable to sleep, we cancelled the wakeup call during the night and put a "privacy please" sign on the door.  The cancellation was apparently never put in the computer.  After two wakeup calls came NOTWITHSTANDING  their cancellation, a very rude young man pounded on the door.  And argued with us when we told him we did not want to be awoken.  In the meantime, the maid knocked NOTWITHSTANDING the privacy sign.  "Oh I wanted to make sure you meant "privacy"!
