Frustrated beyond measure, having gotten essentially no sleep, we attempted to reach the manager to complain and the phones are so busy, the operator was unable to connect us to either a manager or the front desk.  

All of this says that this hotel suffers from a fatal absence on the ability to communicate.  Obviously there are no internal controls.  

The absence of any service and the inability to communicate correctly with staff or management is a fatal flaw.  We totally disrecommend this hotel until this situation is corrected.  We had a complete violation of our privacy -- our most basic requests were ignored effectively destroying a day for us.  We can never recommend this hotel again.

The hotel has an excellent midtown location.  Heretofore we had been willing to forgive tiny bathroom and loud, heavy old-fashioned doors.  But a total disrespect of guests needs is the kiss of death.

title: Watch out for the Customer Gouging with the hidden 'facilities fee
text:
The Warwick adds a compulsory "facilities charge" of $25.00 per day which is not included in the room rate, which is just another way of gouging customers. The extra charge is not explained at check-in. Disgraceful behaviour from a hotel previously renown for good service.
The horrible room I stayed in and many other rooms at the Warwick are built around a quad which is covered over by a mesh which blocks the light. The result is that the room is in permanent darkness as if it is constantly night time - even when the sun is shining. An unpleasant experience to come back to on a sunny day.

The location in mid-Manhattan is good; but there are a lot of better hotels in the same area. The Warwick has lost the plot in terms of customer service. The overall impression is that customers are a source of income and generally a nuisance. Obviously poorly leadership resulting in  poorly trained staff and very low motivation to be friendly or helpful. Definitely off my list for good New York hotels.

title: Zara training
text: I can’t express enough how great the staff at the Warwick allerton have been to me and my I workers wanted to give a special thank you to Raul the waiter your a kind man thank you for your services from monika

title: Quick trip to broadway play
text: Charming! Saw lots of reviews about room sizes and such- but dismiss those. The rooms are perfect and have a classic charm to them. This was my first trip to NY for fun and this was the ideal location. You can take the subway right to the hotel from LaGuardia and save the traffic and the expensive  cab fare. It’s walking distance to the dairy barn in Central Park (aka the visitors center), Times Square,5th Avenue and all the theatre venues. Restaurants around there cater to the theatre crowd, so dinner places serve quickly so you don’t miss the show and stay late if you would prefer a late night dinner instead. Food isn’t up to foodie standards- but you’ll get a solid meal at a fair price. The hotel restaurant is actually one of the better places to eat. I recommend you enjoy a cocktail at the bar and chat it up with the bartenders for some inside info on the neighborhood hot spots. Staff was awesome. I highly recommend.

title: Remains a great place to stay
text: I stayed here for two nights recently after a stay -- and probably a review -- last year. The Warwick Hotel remains a high quality hotel with a great location, spacious rooms, friendly service, and a rich history that the decor makes apparent. The hotel does not seem to feature a gym or pool, though, and the business center is a bit cramped.

title: !st Class Classic
text: I had the pleasure of staying at the Warwick in February, 2018.  The room was comfortable, clean, and roomy for New York.  The staff was excellent!  I had misplaced my umbrella and they readily supplied one for the weekend.  I was always greeted with a smile - which makes rainy days much nicer.  I have seen complaints about the slowness of elevators and noise, but did not find any issues.  This was a wonderful place to spend a weekend!

title: Old School Elegance
text: We wanted to stay in a charming, elegant hotel near Rockefeller Plaza and Radio City. We chose the Warwick and it was wonderful. The Randolph Lounge is the bar area and it is the place to go for cocktails when you are staying. we had a great room and loved the place. The location can't be beat.

title: מלון מצויין..
text:
זאת הפעם השלישית שאני מתארח במלון .. נקי, מסודר, צוות נפלא.. נאלצתי לעזוב את המלון לפני תום הזמן שהתחייבתי עליו.. חוייבתי רק על הלילות בפועל.
אז אם אתם מחפשים מלון במיקום מצויין עם צוות נהדר וחדרים נאים.. ממליץ

title: Fabulous boutique classy hotel
text: Great location at Rockefeller center on 6th ave and 54th. Excellent service and attention. Hotel staff is friendly and genuine and makes every effort to serve. Hotel lobby is classy and bar is very welcoming. Feels like a local bar. The breakfast is upscale and a real treat. Fresh selection of fruit eggs meats salmon and NY bagels. Very European feel and love it for business but many vacationers stay here. Rooms are nice size and classy furniture. Not the flimsy stuff in newer hotel brands. Gym is small but good.

title: Another Outstanding Stay at The Warwick
text: If you go to NYC and don't stay at the Warwick, you are truly missing the best hotel in the City. As usual, the staff, facilities, service, location, everything is second to none. The rooms are great and the housekeeping service is excellent. A great full breakfast is available in Murals and shouldn't be missed. Randolph's is the ideal place to end the night, have a great lunch or dinner and enjoy the best cocktails in the City.  Billy K and his staff go out of their way to make sure your stay meets or exceeds all of your expectations. You will not regret choosing the Warwick.

title: Best value in midtown
text:
I stayed 3 nights on during a business trip. The hotel is very conveniently located. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated (nothing too extravagant). It managed to keep,an intimate and cozy atmosphere. 
On the down side: I would not recommend the room service, 65 bucks for an ok burger and a beer....
Service was good (I appreciated the rapid and dilligent check in and check out).

title: Must-see for an Elvis fan
text:
I went in for dinner after visiting MoMA, nearby.
My main reason for visiting was to see where Elvis stayed and was famously photographed in 1956.
Photos duly taken at entrance etc.
Dinner was ribs and sweet potato fries, which I enjoyed in an elegant bar just off the foyer, served by an attentive and helpful waiter.
I would have loved to have stayed at this hotel, but it was out of my price range this trip.

title: Excellent hotel and staff
text: Great room service and staff, nice bar, great location. Next trip back we now know where to stay.  Nice big room, shower was wonderful and everything is right around the corner.  If you need a ride the door man was on it and entertaining. Highly recommend staying here,

title: Very nice
text: I was very pleased to see how large our room was. I expected a NYC hotel room to be very small. We were pleasantly surprised! The room was clean, comfortable, and in a great location. We will definitely stay here next time we vacation in NYC.

title: Our home away from home
text:
My wife and I live in PA, but spend many weekends in New York City.  Over several decades, we have stayed at many NYC hotels, but in recent years we will only book the Warwick Hotel.
The Warwick is in a great location, near the theater district (but not too near). It is not a large bustling hotel like the NY Hilton across the street. It is a more modest, historical hotel, with attentive staff, comfortable rooms, a great bar (Randolph's has fabulous lobster rolls and other tasty bar food to accompany their professionally mixed drinks and extensive selection of wines). We've dined at Murals, also located in the hotel lobby area, for brunch and dinners, and have not been disappointed! The personnel at the reception desk, doormen, and bell staff are professional and courteous. They all do their best to accommodate guest requests to insure a comfortable and relaxing stay. 
We have stayed in small inside rooms for short stays at a reasonable price, and have experienced their luxury multi-room suites for special occasions. The rooms are clean, well appointed, and consistantly updated to high standards. Among the hundreds of hotels available in New York, our first choice is the Warwick New York.

title: Un hôtel au coeur de NY
text: Hôtel au coeur de Manhattan à proximité de tous les incontournables : central Park, l'Empire, le Rochfeller, Broadway...Personnel attentif et souriant. Chambre spacieuse et décorée avec goût. Si nous devions revenir à NY, nous reprendrions sans hésiter cet hôtel.

title: Muy buena relación precio calidad.
text: Estuvimos hospedados una semana con mi esposa e hija de 10 años. Las habitaciones son cómodas, el staff muy amable y la ubicación de primera. Considero que la relación precio calidad es muy buena. Recomiendo tomar el paquete de desayuno ya que está muy sabroso y completo. La razón que no doy 5 de calificación es que tuve dos eventos que considero pudieron haber sido manejados mejor. Uno fue que una noche sonó la alarma contra incendio, tuvimos que evacuar el hotel, pero durante todo el proceso de evacuación y luego de regresar a las habitaciones no hubo ningún personal del hotel que tomara control de la situación y nos diera instrucciones de donde evacuar y cuando volver. Siento que nos dejaron solos a los huéspedes en esto. Les recomiendo que revisen este proceso.  El segundo problema que tuvimos fue con el desayuno. Cuando tomas el paquete de desayuno en el Check in te dan unos boletos para ser entregados cada mañana. Una de las mañanas un mesero nos reclamó que no habíamos entregado el boleto en el día anterior. La acusación fue sumamente incómoda en el momento, pero la misma fue resuelta muy rápida por la persona de recepción que nos emitió nuevos boletos por ese día. Recomiendo mejorar el proceso de pago de estos boletos y mientras no lo mejoren les recomiendo a los huéspedes que tengan mucho cuidado que el mesero anote bien su nombre y número de habitación en el boleto para evitar la incomodidad que yo pasé. A la vez alabo si a la recepción que supo resolver esto ágilmente.

title: Great location
text:
My husband loves Central Park and I found this hotel which had great accommodations for us to stay overnite in the city. We booked the hotel and selected a restaurant that was close by. The room was spacious and was perfect for an overnite stay.
In the morning he got up early and walked to Central Park to take pictures and enjoy the scenery. We then had breakfast and went to the "The Rock".

title: Girls trip
text: We stayed at the Warwick New York. It was absolutely amazing. The service was impeccable. The bellman were exceptional. There were two outside and one inside. Jose, Johnny and Carlos. They always helped with luggage, the doors and always directions. We never got lost asking these men. The room were nice and clean. The location was off the chain!! We were centrally located to Time Square, Central Park and the theater district. We could walk ANYWHERE. So many pubs just a throw away from the hotel, coffee and juice bar directly behind the hotel and cornered to Avenue of the Americas. I can not say enough positive things about our experience there.

title: Localização otima
text: Muito bem localizado, com quarto amplo, confortável e limpo. Elevadores são um pouco lentos e decoração está um pouco antiga. Houve um período de manutenção que interrompeu a água quente, mas foi comunicado com antecedência e não atrapalhou nossa estadia. Staff foi atencioso, providenciando uma geladeira adicional no quarto, sem custo, para guardarmos uma medicação.

title: Not at all as expected. Very disappointed
text:
I just checked in today, I was pleasantly surprised at the speed of the check-in process. However when I reached the room I opened the window curtain and I saw that I was facing brick walls, up close and on every possible Direction. (see photo) 
I was feeling claustrophobic and called the front desk to ask if I could change rooms, they said this was the room I had booked and that I could pay $40 extra a night to be upgraded to the next level. 
I looked at the hotel pictures and description of the room on the hotel website, it says "the rooms overlooks the interior of the hotel making it perfectly suitable for those seeking a peaceful and quiet stay". In all the pictures of the room the curtains are closed and there is no way of knowing that you're going to be overlooking the tiniest interior Court and basically just be staring at brick walls.
 I felt so disappointed as the room was not a cheap one, and just wanted to get out to tour the city, so I went to the concierge to get a city map and again I was surprised at the level of customer service. He just tore one map page out, not offering any assistance whatsoever nor even a smile. 
A few hours later I had returned to the hotel and not a single employee (doorman, front desk, concierge) has greeted me with the slightest 'good evening'.

Bottom line - hotel location is excellent, rooms are rather big for NYC, beware of the 'Premier' rooms (Im guessing the ones ending in 23 as I am in 1623) and do not expect any hospitality.
 I will deffinitely stay elsewhere when I return to the city this summer.

title: Muy buena ubicacion
text: Sin duda una ventaja es su ubicación. Hay que destacar su limpieza y habitaciones con respecto a otras alternativas más económicas. Si estás ahorrando y buscas donde dormir y como sea, está no es tu opción. Pero si además de dormir buscas un lugar bien ubicado, y donde la habitación no sea un problema, tengas un trato amable y espacios de mejor nivel, está es tu opción. (hay otras opciones que son más económicas pero pueden ser un dolor de cabeza).

title: Gracefully ageing grande dame
text:
My friend and I stayed at the Warwick last week.  Pleasantly surprised.  None of the hustle bustle of the big name hotels.  The Staff are very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast buffet is fab!
If your looking for high end perfection, this isn’t the place to be.  There were lots of little minor maintenance issues. Ie broken ice machine, worn out plugs, defective curtin pulls, spotty dishes and flatware.  
I think it just adds to the ambience.  I felt like I was staying at my rich ageing aunts house for the week.  :-)
I plan to stay again.  Highly recommended!

title: Once again the Warwick shines!
text:
My wife and I stayed at the lovely Warwick Hotel in NYC and once again it shined for us!
We were greeted by Francine who actually took my phone rezzy several months ago.  Good memory huh?  She upgraded us to a 2 room suite which was so spacious and nice.

The Warwick is superbly located just 8 blocks from the theater district, it is surrounded by lovely little restaurants and of course just 1 long block to 5th avenue.  We did not dine with them this time but they have a wonderful first floor restaurant Murals and also a comfy, warm bar Randolphs with leather lounge chairs and sofas where you can get light bites to eat.

As we were going to a play I asked the front desk mgr. Jamahl if I could have a wee bit later check out Sunday morning.  Unlike many hotels that give you a thousand reasons why they can't, Jamahl quickly and pleasantly said, "sure, what time do you want?"  I asked for 2 pm in the afternoon and he said, "you got it!"

So, in so many ways, the lovely Warwick Hotel shines like a star.  Give them a try and you too will be wowed by them too!

title: Perfect Hotel for a business trip
text: We stayed at the Warwick for 4 nights and it was very pleasant experience. The hotel is very conveniently located in Midtown area, so its close to the central park, 5av shopping and Times Square. The room was actually quiet big with lots of space. The only minus was the bathtub, very small and low.

title: Love this Classic Hotel
text: We have stayed at the Warwick twice now and cannot wait to return. The hotel is everything that a New York hotel should be.  It is a gem from the past and hopefully will be able to maintain this quality for a long time to come.  From the moment you arrive you feel welcome.  The rooms are large, extremely clean and elegant.  The location could not be better.

title: Clean, Close but clearly no amenities
text: Checkin was later in the day, held bags no question but small elevator up to a clean room only slightly dated. No flash amenities and restaurant for food packed and closed early breakfast later in dinner side. Door is push revolving by bellman but ones usually on duty. All in all a positive experience but for the price one would think at least the shampoo would be decent.... clean comfortable bed is it’s biggest plus then location

title: Au cœur de New York !
text:
Nous avons passé dix jours au Warwick avec en tête de visiter New York en entier. La localisation est incroyable, vous pouvez accéder à tout en métro et encore plus simplement en taxi naturellement. La cinquième avenue est à deux pas avec ses boutiques de luxe.
L’hôtel est très agréable et chargé d’histoire. Le personnel est courtois et le petit déjeuner continental est excellent. Je recommande les yeux fermés.
Le bar de l’hôtel est également très sympathique après une journée de marche et souvent animé aux horaires de sorties des bureaux !
A 2 min à pied de Central Park, à 10sec d’un Starbucks et à 5 min d’un Apple Store...

title: Excellent Manager
text:
I contacted the manager prior to arrival to secure a room in a lower floor. Billy was exceptionally helpful with this, as he was again after check out when we encountered an unexpected fee. He deals with things promptly and seems to genuinely care.The best hotel manager I have come across in the city. I wish I had been able to meet him to thank him in person.
Room wise, we couldn't fault the hotel either. Very big for NY and good size bathroom too. 
Nothing was too much trouble for Daniel on reception who was so friendly, calm and welcoming. He really made check in a pleasant experience (whereas usually there isn't much to it) and was a real highlight of the hotel.
Doorman Jose was another highlight. Very friendly and remembered guests - always asked how your day had been etc. We had ran out of dollars by the time we got our taxi back to the hotel but if we could've tipped Jose $100 every day we would have.
The hotel begins to feel like home very quickly and had there not been the issue at check out, I wouldn't have had anything negative to say about the hotel at all.
Please stay here, it's a fantastic base for NY - close to Times Square, Rockefeller, 5th Av etc and only steps away from Central Park. Of all the hotels I have experienced in NY, this is the only one I can truly recommend and would stay in again.

title: Wonderful hotel with beautiful details and very clean
text: We really enjoyed staying here. We were put up here by my publisher and stayed over two days of busy meetings and shows. The bed was so comfortable, room was spacious and bright, bathroom was VENTED, and the over all space was very inviting. The staff were very courteous and genuinely seemed to enjoy their jobs.   The room was VERY quiet.

title: Classic Hotel with perfect location
text: The Warwick is close to Times Square and the Theater District without all the noise and congestion. A few blocks from both Central Park and Rockefeller Center. The staff is great and the bar is one of my favorites, good food and good drinks. All of the Warwick facilities could use a little updating but it's not so bad that it's a turn off. Room was a good size, clean and with plenty of closet space. The bed was also very comfortable. The doormen are courteous and fun and don't have their hands out prior to performing their service unlike some other hotels. Overall, a very enjoyable experience in a fine establishment.

title: heart of manhattan
text: Hotel itself is not big, but location is great. you can walk to every sightseeing spot in Midtown. Lots of restaurants and delis, so you can find cheap eats to 4 star world famous restaurants nearby and most of them open late.

title: THE Place to be in New York
text:
We really enjoyed our stay in this beautiful hotel. Great service,  the staff is very friendly and service minded. We felt at home right away, even so far away from home..
Beautiful hotel, very nice and spacious room, we couldn't expect more.
We definitely come back for our next stay in New York!!

title: Excelente hotel !
text:
Hemos estado una semana, y después de chequear muchos hoteles, leyendo reviews, decidimos por este hotel, no nos defraudó , la habitación es tal cual la elegimos, y si bien tuvimos un problema con la calefacción, lo solucionaron inmediatamente, y nos dieron otra habitación perfecta.
La atención es muy cálida y esmerada, lo mismo la higiene .
Las camas son súper cómodas, amplias, eran dos dobles.
El baño no es de los súper modernos pero tiene una ducha con mucha fuerza y tiene todo lo necesario.
El desayuno es caro, y el servicio allí no es gran cosa, los mozos por momentos están superados y se olvidan de uno.
Hay muchos lugares cerca geniales para un buen desayuno.
La ubicación es perfecta , cerca de todo y de los teatros a diez minutos caminando.
Lo recomiendo sin dudar y espero volver en nuestra próxima visita a New York.

title: Perfect Location with Old World Charm
text: My husband and I visit NYC at least once a year for the magic this unique and wondrous city offers any time of the day or night. Our home away from home is The Warwick Hotel. Stepping back in time to the suites of Old Hollywood or choices of more modern times, our suite balcony offers a stunning view of the city and breakfast for two in romantic intimacy. I wrote about our stay in this magical city at the Warwick in my book My Gift of Now which is available on Amazon. The attention given to us by Joel with the intention of making each of our stays memorable is consistent in grace, warmth and detail. This indeed feels like our second home while in NYC. The suites that have been renovated are much improved. The feel of Old World charm where the actor Cary Grant once lived in the hotel is mesmerizing. Even the hall phones on each floor are part of the charm of another era. The location to Central Park, Broadway, Fifth Avenue, restaurants and more is all within walking distance. The Warwick will continue to be our home while in the one and only NYC.

title: Customer Service and having a heart
text: I was just resent recently diagnosed with brain cancer and I needed to  come to New York to meet with doctors and I have my caregiver staying with me so we decided to get a suite at the Warwick and when I asked if there was a larger room they were able to open me up a suite that had enough room for three adults with two bedrooms. This was surprising to me because they really seem to care. I have had so much bad news in the past five weeks that this was such a blessing the suite I v have is amazing I have a Jacuzzi tub and a sauna. The reason why this is important is I actually had a stroke and it’s helping with me walking and getting around. I have been asking the doctors if they could prescribe me this kind of therapy for the past couple weeks. Now I’m in New York in a suite that is actually helping me recover giving me enough room for my Caregivers. The manager was quick to actually assist me in getting something that made me very comfortable. The reason why I would give this hotel a ten star is because most hotels don’t care. How many times do you hear sorry Sir cant help you. For us with cancer. This kind of caring is crucial. All I am told is where the next needle is. Thank you for making my trip so enjoyable in the process of getting me set up so pleasant and made me really feel like I’m at home away from home. So if you’re looking to stay in a hotel that’s a home away from home I would recommend the Warwick.

title: sort of clean additional fees are ridiculous
text: Great location for the price.  Room is old and sort of clean, I was a little grossed out.  Room service is extremely expensive $10 delivery charge plus 15% gratuity.  We ended up paying $45 for 10 chicken wings and a small water.  really ??  I know, I should have looked at that before I ordered.  Also the $25 facility fee plus a tax on the facility fee what even IS that?  it's not taxes, those were in there too.  So much for the "great price" we got, I nearly fell over when I got the final bill.

title: But the Facility Fee Irritates Me!
text: I can't decide whether to rate the Warwick good or very good.  The location is great!  It's walking distance to the major sights and very close to the subway.  Our room was fairly large - very quiet.  Our room faced what the hotel called an inner courtyard - it was actually an airshaft that was quite unattractive.  The room and bed were quite comfortable.  There is virtually no lobby - and no facilities to speak of.  Yet, when we checked out, the hotel tacked on a $25 facilities fee.

title: Great Location
text: We had a great stay at the Warwick in Summer of 2017.  It's a great location.  Close to Central Park, theaters, and subway lines.  Our room was very big, by New York standards.  My biggest complaint was the resort fee.  I don't think I should have to pay a  daily resort fee for WIFI, phone use, and access to a computer. Those amenities, do not, in my opinion, constitute a "resort".  The stay was pleasant, though, and I would stay at the Warwick again.

title: True Luxurious NY Experience
text: We stayed on the 31st floor, high above NYC. The view was great; the accommodations were awesome; and the service was top-notch. I was referred to this hotel by a friend. Now I'm spoiled. If/when we're able to come back to NYC, my wife and I will make it a point to stay at this location. We got a great feel for the city and were close to almost EVERYTHING. We averaged walking 6 miles a day during our stay. And the proximity to Times Square and Central Park - perfect! They made our business/Christmas vacation one of our best.

title: Très bien situé ...
text:
Bon hôtel & très bien situé à tarifs très abordables pour  moins de  150 E / nuit  pour trois adultes  et  deux grands lits  et  le  personnel  est  très  sympathique .
Si vous ne voulez pas sortir   ==)  petits déjeuner  et  ensuite  bar /  snack / resto ...

title: Great position for midtown attraction.
text:
The Warwick is a throwback to an older time, no polished chrome or pulsating led lighting here.  The hotel is well placed for attractions like the Rockefeller Plaza, Times Square, Hells Kitchen and Central Park.  The bar has a nice atmosphere and seems to do well with walk in customers.  The breakfasts are well presented and you have a choice of buffet or a’la carte.
I’d stay here again if I were back in Manhattan.

title: Buena estadia
text:
El hotel si bien es antiguo, está bien ubicado. A 4 cuadras del Central Park, a 1 de la quinta avenida y a 10 minutos caminando de Times Square.
La verdad que le hubiera puesto un punto mas, salvo que tuvimos un inconveniente ya que apareció una cucaracha en el cuarto, pero nos cambiaron a una suite muy buena y nos regalaron el desayuno para toda nuestra estadia. La verdad fueron muy amables.

title: Super Stay
text:
We loved it here. Excellent value for money. We booked a suite, it was exactly as described. Very comfortable and well appointed. The hotel is in Mid Town so the noise from the traffic , especially the sirens does filter through at times, but we still slept well.

Randolph's bar is lively, and very friendly... great colleagues that really go out if their way to help, and a very nice snack menu. 

Top Tips. 1 
If your room is on a lower level, call the elevator both up and down and get in the first one, it can be a while otherwise to find a space in the busy elevators.

Top Tips 2. 
The concierge service is Super, Robert organised everything for us, from transport, restaurants, helicopter flights, top bar bookings etc etc. Nothing was too much trouble. ( thank you Robert, you are a star)

Top Tips 3
Do not, under any circumstance get a yellow cab. They are smelly and filthy, a massive hygiene risk, bodily fluid was an extra in every cab ... horrible... we thought we were unlucky, then realised it was standard.. get a car booked via concierge it's easy, comfortable and safe... oh and clean! And you only pay on checkout.

Enjoy your stay in this wonderful hotel.

title: Convenient and good rate for January
text: I have stayed here before and after not having visited NYC for many years, though it would be nice to try it again. It was one of the lowest rates for my visit so we booked a double room for three nights. Given the price, I thought the room would be very small but we were very pleasantly surprised with the king bed, seating area, and closet. The bath was small but suitable and very clean. We arrived early so it wasn't quite ready so we had a small lunch in Randolph's bar. That was fine for our purposes and for drinks it would be better but I seem to remember that the Warwick bar in years past was more classic NY. At any rate, the location of the hotel is great, and the door-people are fantastic about finding taxis at busy times. Housekeeping service was thorough although on one day it wasn't made up till late afternoon. Interesting note is that Cary Grant, the Beatles, Elvis Presley, Audrey Hepburn, James Dean, and other luminaries stayed here over the years and there is a photo gallery that you should check out. I didn't look at the fitness room but there is one.

title: Muy buena ubicacion
text: La relación precio prestación del hotel es súper acorde. El hotel es de estilo y muy bien mantenido. Las habitaciones son muy cómodas , con buenas camas, todo muy limpio, y el trato del personal es siempre muy servicial. La ubicación, inmejorable!

title: Nice, Classic, Quality Hotel
text:
We stayed here overnight in order to spend an evening in the city. We had stayed a number of years ago at The Warwick and remembered it as being a very nice, comfortable, classic-style hotel, low-key and warm.
It was that again.
We had a two-room suite which was large and comfortable with a great view of 6th Avenue. Both rooms had nice size televisions -- if one of us wanted to watch TV while the other person slept or wanted to watch something different. There was a very comfortable and sturdy king-size bed. (I believe that a room with 2 queen-size beds is also available). We both slept deeply and warmly.
In each of the rooms of the suite there was a thermostat that we could set to our own comfort level. There was a nice round table in the living room which we used for dining when we had a quickie breakfast brought in from outside the hotel. They also offer (which i didn't know until we had already eaten our small breakfast) a rather nice breakfast buffet down off the main lobby. But we had gone out for dinner the night before and did not want to fill up again the following morning.
Our bathroom was very clean with washcloths and ample towels (face and bath towels) and there were also some nice creams/lotions/shampoo on the counter. 
Really a very nice, good quality room.
The welcoming staff at the counter were very pleasant and eager to please. 
We chose to park our car overnight and we had 24 hours from the time of admittance to take the car out. There are no in-and-out privileges, but for $50, it was comforting to leave the car in front of the hotel, know that the staff would drive it and park it, and then would retrieve it for us the next day and bring it right to the door of the hotel.
All in all, a very nice, moderately-priced,classy hotel in a good location to be in the center of the City.

title: Great boutique hotel
text: We choose to stay in this hotel instead of the very large Hilton across the street that was the official conference hotel. It is much more quaint and personable than the monstrosity of the Hilton. The staff are very friendly. It was easy to get an elevator and it was so quick up to your room. We did pay extra for a view and were given a "corner room". While the room was ok, it did chop off some square footage and our bathroom was VERY small. Officially it was a view but it was obstructed. The breakfast was good but expensive ( $80 for two with tax). If you can, try to get a rate with this breakfast included. Still had a great experience overall and would stay here again. I would just request to not be in the corner again.

title: Great place with mostly ups, and just a few downs
text: We have always enjoyed the Warwick for a number of reasons, primarily the large, spacious rooms and hallways (going back to its days as an apartment building), its convenience to many of the things you go to the City for, and its friendly and accommodating staff.  None of that has changed.  It does suffer from a lack of in- house dining options for a hotel its size, and although the food in the bar, its only evening option,  is quite good, it is hardly the place to feed families with children.  On the long weekend we were recently there, we found it to be sadly understaffed both in wait staff and bar staff, but they did their best on a Holiday weekend but it was tough.  Such a situation makes hard working, friendly employees look bad when they are stretched too thin.   One personal plus for us - the hotel has not given in to the idea that guests would rather make espresso in their rooms than a traditional cup of coffee, so it was good to see actual coffee makers.  Room service can be slow at times, but the food was always warm and tasty.   Not writing it off for the future; just not sure we would are ready to go right back, although we concede that New York during the holidays is crazy all over!!!

title: Fine for a quick stay
text: The Warwick is a classic NYC hotel which is a nice place to stay for a night however I wouldn't recommend a longterm stay. It's a bit dated in areas and the bathroom had some wear and tear that you don't see at Five Star hotels. It's fine. A four star experience.

title: Grand dame nicely redone
text: This is a really neat hotel.. it’s old and very cool.  They redid all the rooms a few years ago. It’s  not ultra luxe but it falls squarely at 4-4.5stars. The rooms are big and comfortable with great beds.  There are two things in my mind that really make this a 4.5star instead of 4 Star.  Sleep quality is great because the walls are nice and thick and the windows are good.  In Manhattan that goes a long way. The other thing is the staff.  Friendly and super helpful. I have stayed here a couple of times and the most recent stay we had a problem with the room and the manager personally took care of it and was a real gentleman the entire time.  This is a good choice for midtown if you don’t want to stay in a shoebox room or if you need a real night of sleep.

title: 굳.
text: 위치가 매우 좋았습니다. 주요 관광지를 걸어서 다닐만한 곳에 위치해있습니다. 위치가 좋아서 그런지 늦은 시간에 걸어 다녀도 위험하지 않았습니다. 룸상태도 매우 좋았습니다. 룸의 크기도 크고 청소상태도 깨끗했습니다. 와이파이는 공공장소에서는 무료입니다. 룸에서는 무료 아닙니다. 헬스장도 있어가지고 운동하기 좋았습니다. 늦은시간에도 룸서비스를 시켜서 먹을 수 있어서 좋았습니다. 직원분들이 친절하십니다. 좋았습니다.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Ottima posizione per qualsiasi cosa in città , struttura un po’ datata ma pulita bene il bar , non proprio contento del servizio e delle richieste di modifica camera all’arrivo (per altro non accettate) nel complesso soggiorno piacevole 
Non consigliato

title: 1st time to NYC ❤️
text: Excellent service! The Bellman was very professional and courteous. The staff were kind and accommodating. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were very clean!! The Randolph lounge was the perfect place to unwind from the evening and have a nice drink and endless bowl of chips 🤗 and take in the NYC travellers & business clientele. Visit the 2nd floor to see the wall of fame of all the celebrities that both lived and frequented the Warwick Hotel 👍🏽😉 Large hotel with a boutique feel ❤️

title: Very nice Hotel
text:
The rooms are beautiful, the staff is very professional, helpful and friendly!
The food was absolutely delicious! 
We were extremely happy with our hotel experience at Warwick! 
Highly recommended! We would certainly stay again.

title: Excellent
text:
I went to New York for the NHSMUN project, and I stood in this hotel for a week; loved it. Great rooms, nice service and kind staff. I also really liked the bar, where I made new friends. The hotel is in front of a Starbucks coffee (where I had breakfast every morning) and near to Times Square: well placed to visit the city.

P.s. I have been there in March 2015

title: Loved the hotel, location and staff!
text: We had a a great stay at this hotel! The staff was great, room was clean and it was a fantastic location. The valet, doorman and bellhop made this trip. We looked forward to talking to them each day. They were very personable and beyond helpful. Our daughter even made a picture for her favorite doorman. We were there as they decorated for Christmas and the decor was pretty. The rooms are not big but are nice. We did have a cracked tile in our bathroom but it didn't effect our stay at all! We were walking distance from Radio City Music Hall (super close), Rockefeller Center, Times Square and Central Park!

title: Centrally located, Expensive , Lots of Hidden Fees
text: Best thing is its Location. Very easy to get here from LGA by bus (and the subway); easy to walk to places from here and the doorman, Josie is great! However, while checking in, I was told about a $25 per night amenities tax (whether or not said amenities were used, I'd presume);  the mini bar could not be used to store anything (to request a fridge for personal use, one would have to pay a one time fee , I forget how much);  I could see the underside of the toilet bowl rim (?) from my bath tub and it was DIRTY; the lady who cleaned my room forgot to take the trash out ( granted it was left over food in brown paper bags, left on the table,  so she might have thought it was still for I wanted) but the table didn't get wiped, she used what suspiciously looked like the same towel she had used to wipe the sink to wipe the inside of the drinking glases (yuck!) ;

title: Très bon hôtel bien situé
text:
Nous avons été très agréablement surpris par la qualité de cet hôtel.
Notre chambre était spacieuse, très propre, avec vue sur la 6ème avenue.
La situation est idéale, très proche de Central Park, proche de Times Square où vous pouvez vous rendre à pied sans soucis.

En revanche, le personnel de l'accueil est très antipathique.
Le personnel de chambre et les portiers rattrapent ce point négatif, mention spéciale à Doris qui assurait le ménage de notre chambre, très avenante.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Si bien las instalaciones del hotel no son modernas, la relación calidad y precio del mismo son completamente acordes. El personal del Hotel es amable con los huéspedes y me apoyaron con diversos requerimientos que llegué a necesitar, incluso antes y después de mi estancia. Lo mejor del hotel es la ubicación, ya que te encuentras en el Midtown por un precio inigualable.

title: excelent
text:
je suis descendu a l’hôtel Warwick il y a quelques années pour mon anniversaire une petite boite de chocolats pour mon anniversaire avait étais déposer dans ma chambre a mon arrivé.
personnel accueillant serviable professionnel 
l’hôtel propre et vraiment irréprochable

title: Generally nice and central, but
text:
The hotel is located in a central location and is kept up well. The rooms are a little aged, but nice. 

Things that might bug you:
- Small reception area, so you might have to wait for check-in/check-out/concierge. 
- Only three very slow elevators. At times I had to wait 5+ minutes to catch an elevator
- Breakfast area is relatively small, overpriced and you have to wait to get a seat. 

If you are on vacation and want to be close to 5th avenue and central park this is a good choice. I've been there for business and would not pick the hotel again.

title: Vivez le vrai New-York
text:
Situé à 2 pas de Central Park, de la 5th Avenue et de Broadway, cet hôtel offre une prestation quasiment de luxe pour un prix raisonnable, compte tenu de sa situation dans Manhattan.
Il s'agit d'un hôtel ayant gardé son cachet du vieux New York. La décoration est classique et chic. Les chambres sont assez grandes et calmes.
Le personnel est très accueillant, serviable et efficace, nous nous en sommes aperçu lors de notre arrivée en pleine nuit (retard de l'avion).
Le petit déj est excellent.

title: Nice hotel and great location
text:
Stayed at the Warwick December 28-31.  Very nice hotel, rooms were clean and nicer than expected. This hotel is in a great location for touring NYC and the staff was very nice and helpful.
We would definitely stay at the Warwick again.
Good choice for New York City!
 YP

title: Classic and Out of the Movies
text:
I booked this hotel because of the proximity to Radio City. This was a Christmas to New Year's visit. I actually left on the 29th of December so not really a New Year's trip.

This hotel looks like something out of a '30's to '50's classic Christmas movie. I am not kidding about that. The decorations, outfits, and style of the hotel looks like a grande example of old New York. Do not let this lead you astray because the hotel has all of the amenities of a modern hotel. The WiFi is complementary for guests. 

The elevators are ornate and wood paneled. The interesting thing is that they are only about 5 feet wide and 2 1/2 feet deep. This was a shocker to me. It is still cute. There are three elevators which can take some time to get up and down, but with the ornate beauty of the hotel, I was willing to accept that. 

Let's get started with the room service. It was fast, tasty, hot, and had a variety. I am not talking a full restaurant menu, but there was enough to satiate the palate. Especially about 11:30 PM when you came in from the cold while walking around sightseeing. Be warned though, they are not messing around when it comes to coffee. They serve is very strong. 

The room was a little warm when we first got there, but the individual thermostats allowed us to change that. 

The rooms come with an ironing board, iron, hair dryer, safe, plenty of hangers in a large closet, and a desk with a power strip on it. I know it seems trivial to add that last one, but there are enough outlets to handle two phones, a computer, coffee maker (you need to ask for that but it is complimentary), and a tablet.

The bed was comfortable, and the blankets were warm enough. The only problem I have with ALL hotels is the pillow choice. All of these hotels think the extra soft feather pillows are great. Nope. I had to fold them several times to keep my head off of the bed. That is a small complaint that can be adjusted. 

Let's talk about the proximity. It is about a 5 minute walk to Rockefeller Center. A definite Christmas time treat. It is a 10 minute walk to Broadway. There are three Starbucks (Not sure if you are into that) within 5 minutes. There are restaurants along 54th that are worth going to. I never thought that I would have such a time. It was a wonderful Christmas time visit. I am going to want to go there again. 

The doormen where helpful and immediate in any requests. Please remember to show your appreciation with what they do.

A problem, maybe because it was Christmas time was the traffic. Getting there in a taxi was difficult, but a $40 ride from LaGuardia is not something to get worried about.

title: Kind but disorganized and the elevators are dysfunctional
text: The front desk people are kind but in over their head.  Our reservations did not align with our rooms and when moved to a "bigger" room the bathroom was smaller as was the adjoining room.   The elevators are dysfunctional.   We carried 8 bags down 9 flights of back stairs after waiting 20 minutes- and that was the 3rd time with significant waits. The rooms are outdated and cold. Granted the temps were the coldest in 50 years but the room was 50 degrees.

title: Nice place, great location
text:
One thing you should know before booking a room here is that it is indeed an older hotel. It has some issues that is to be expected from a hotel like this, but it doesn't detract from the experience of staying here all that much.  There was one annoyance that stopped it from getting a 5 star review.

Location:  It is in a great location, couple of blocks away from central park, a block away from the subway and good eats all around. It really is in a wonderful location.

Lobby: The lobby is wonderful, it is small but it feels regal...marble and plenty of chairs and a sofa so you can just sit back and people watch. Just mind your steps if your shoes are wet. 

The elevator: Yes it is small, but that is the charm of the hotel :) However, it seems like forever and a day passes before the elevator arrives to pick you up and when the door opens there is a chance that it will already be full and you have to wait more.  Some folks actually took the stairs down because they got tired of waiting. Once in the elevator, it really is pretty fast and you will get down in a few seconds. 

The room (where my annoyance lie): So my room had a foyer that lead into the room itself. The view is of a brick wall. The bed was a king and there was a chair as well. The bathroom was great...plenty of shelf space.  I wish the bathtub had an anti-slip matt to go with it..sometimes I felt like I was taking a chance showering.  The biggest problem was that the room was so hot! it was like 80 degrees (for me that is hot) I turned down the heat and put it on cool but it took 24 hrs to cool down some what.   Also there isn't a coffee maker in the room, so you have to request one. I requested one via telephone from the room, the gentleman said that he will  have it brought up...never received it. Also, the room has some basic wear and tear..but if you go hunting for imperfections then you will find them where ever you go in hotels. 

The staff were good for the most part, doormen where really helpful with hailing a cab, the front desk made the experience enjoyable. 

I would definitely stay here again.

title: Ghost of Christmas Past
text:
This is a review of Randolph’s Bar not the Warwick Hotel. We have stayed at the Warwick on two occasions, both at Christmas time, most memorable was over the Millennium Christmas and New Year’s period. Always found the Warwick to be a fabulous experience for location, rooms, service, decor, wonderful history, the Murals Restaurant and Randolph’s Bar. 

We visit Manhattan regularly at Christmas and, whichever hotel we are staying in, always visit Randolph’s for lunch and drinks at least once, the last time before this year being 2015 when we had the corner table looking out over the 54th/6th Avenue junction. Perfect spot and a perfect lunch and I personally would say the best dry martini in the city.

I feel quite sad about writing this review but here goes . . . we called in to Randolph’s for lunch 27th December 2017 - it was busy as usual but we hovered near the bar trying to catch the eye of one of the waiting staff to ask about getting a table for four. We’ve done this before and always been told when we might expect one to be available, take a seat at the bar or call back etc. Not this time, gruffly told that it’s a ‘free for all’ - when one becomes vacant, help yourself. So we hung around, as did other hopeful diners, grimly viewing each other through narrowed eyes, trying to gauge each others likely speed when we all sprinted for the first available table. We viewed the room with growing unease - although the barman was a nice, efficient guy there was an irritable spat going on between him and one of the waiting staff: she had requested a Bloody Mary for a table but was told the bar was out of tomato juice which kicked off the confrontation. I should add here that the woman in question had the looks, manner and personality of a paving slab, I cannot imagine a more inappropriate job for her than waiting table. I could see people at tables frustrated by delays and other tables overflowing with stuff that should have been cleared away. Fortunately for us, a lady in a group near the door tipped off my wife that they were about to leave so we encircled their table as they were getting their coats on and sat down trying not to look too triumphal to the other disappointed would-be diners still standing. Obviously the table at which we were seated had considerable debris from the previous occupants so we waited for it to be cleared away . . . and waited . . . and waited. At least 15 minutes passed before a guy who collects the glasses for the room came over and started to clear it. We asked him if he could get us drinks while we were waiting so he went to the bar with our drinks order. The other waitress for the room then came over and put our drinks on the table and she did apologize for the delay before turning to walk away - I quickly said “Could we order some food please” before she got out of earshot and she replied “Oh, you want to eat? I’ll bring some menus over”!!

This is where my review improves. We had another round of drinks before the food arrived - we had all ordered a Club Sandwich as they have always been a good choice (although for some reason we were told we could no longer get a side-order of fries with these!). I know it’s not fine dining but this time the sandwiches were perfection, better than any we’d had at Randolph’s in the past. Our thanks go the chef - we did leave a tip (because of the quality of the food not the service) and I hope he gets a share of all tips. 

That’s it, overall a disappointing and unexpected experience to end our Christmas trip to NY as we were leaving for the airport directly after. Will we visit Randolph’s next time? Certainly will, reminiscing about our past experiences there, we had already been talking about staying at the hotel again next year. This just had to be an aberration, a bad day at Randolph’s, and hopefully this shambles will not be repeated.

title: Great location
text:
We have taken multiple trips to NYC over the last few years with our girls. I was skeptical at first when I booked the Warwick bc the rates for a Premier Suite King were very reasonable in comparison to most places we have stayed. We were also guaranteed a roll away bed which we needed for one of my daughters. Here are my +/-'s

Positive
Hotel staff super nice
room was spacious
location was perfect--walkable to most locations, ie Time Square, Central Park, 5th Ave, etc. 
Short cab ride everywhere else
Window cracks so you have fresh air

Negative's
Premier Suites only have interior view (you are looking @ a wall)
Roll away beds are NOT guaranteed. My husband had to sleep on floor the first night
Elevators are TINY and there are only a few. The hotel was sold out so getting an elevator was sometimes tough (there is a service elevator that you can use & we did often)
Long lines for Breakfast--however the breakfast was very good

Overall good Hotel for the Value

title: A Gem In NYC
text:
This was my second visit to NYC (the trip was actually July 2016) and my mum and I picked the Warwick on a bit of a whim due to it being a fairly last minute booking for a girls holiday and being unable to get a booking in a hotel we had previously stayed in.

We were pleasantly surprised at this lovely hotel and were so glad to have ended up going here instead!

Cost wise, this is between a mid range to luxury hotel and you'll probably find places slightly cheaper, but I honestly feel paying that little bit extra was so worth it.

First and foremost, the location is one of the best in Manhattan, with Colombus Circle and Times Sq a short walk, and a subway stop a mere few feet from the front door. We were shattered on our first day and ended up going for a wonder to Colombus Circle where we found an array of places to eat and shop.

I can't comment on the hotel good as we opted not to go for the hotel breakfast - from what we saw most days this was the right choice. It was fairly expensive for what I considered a to be a pretty basic breakfast - most days we ended up in Pret a Manger on 6th Ave and 55th street (literally a 2 minute walk), the lovely deli on 6th Ave just past the LOVE Sculpture, Sarabeths on Central Park South or even Whole Foods in Columbus Circle for a quick and wholesome breakfast. This is NYC so of course there was never a shortage of places so I'd recommend doing your own thing daily for breakfast if you want something quick and easy... and the same goes for lunch and dinner!

The hotel reception staff were friendly but somewhat curt  (some moreso than others) - we never really asked for tips and advice to get around as we usually like to explore places for ourselves, but I often felt they were a little on the formal side and could have done with being a little more smiley and approachable.

The room itself was beyond outstanding. It was huge (if you've stayed in NYC before, you'll know finding a decent sized, let alone huge, hotel room is an achievement in itself!) with a massive bed, good sized bathroom, lots of floor space and a huge amount of storage space for clothing and suitcases. The bed was so comfy with beautifully soft linen and the air con worked a treat in the sticky July heat.

We stayed for 7 days and found our stay lovely and plan on returning soon/

title: Good location
text:
This hotel is situated in the perfect place to see a lot of the sights. Its a short walk to The Rockefella building, Central Park, Tiffany's, Time Square and Madison SG.

We were slightly disappointed with the attitude of some front desk staff and the irratic level of house keeping with 2 rooms on the same floor, one room was cleaned as expected the other less so, with missing towels and other items. Not something you would expect from a luxury hotel.

title: location worth everything!
text: walking distance from the major attractions in NY, good rooms in size and decor for the price, the hotel is well maintained, but the elevators need an immediate refurbish too long to be up or down (small and slow). the rooms sufficient but the air conditioned is old and not automatic as needed. But I will return

title: First time magical New York trip
text: As an avid user of trip advisor it is important that if I grade as excellent then I mean it...... well in respect of the Warwick I really do mean this rating. The hotel was superb, rooms spacious, well appointed with good bathrooms, comfy bed, plenty of pillows. The hotel staff are really nice and helpful, many went out of their way to help and offer advice. The hotel does not have free wi-fi but there is a computer area that is free to use and offers a connection and a printer so i was able to do all I needed. The location is ideal for all New Yorks attractions and also for the subway. Central park and 5th Avenue are a stones throw away and we will definitely be revisiting this hotel in years to come.

title: Pre Cruise Stay
text: We booked this hotel 6 months before our trip. The room allocated had a connecting door to the adjoining room. We stayed two nights - both nights we were disturbed by noise from the next room. The first night a couple rowed from 3 am to 6am. We were assured by Management that there would be no problem the following night as the occupants checked out that morning. However, that evening from 10 pm the adjoining room became rowdy with business visitors congregating therein. We suffered two nights with lack of sleep. The response from Management was inadequate.

title: Best location for a Manhattan visit
text: We really enjoyed staying here for a 4 day NYC holiday -everything was either in walking distance or an easy cab or subway ride away. The staff were really friendly, especially the concierge desk. The rooms were well appointed and beds comfortable. It was a lovely part of our stay.

title: Amazing
text: After checking in and out of 2 other New York hotels because of them being awful I was so happy to find this hotel. The entrance is beautiful and the rooms are amazing. I cannot fault this hotel at all and would recommend it to anyone.

title: Nice stay at the Warwick
text: The Warwick is a historic, lovely hotel, and the room was very nice and comfortable.  The location is very good.  The only issues were that the elevator service was inadequate at times with long waits, and the front dest seemed short staffed at times, resulting in long lines for check-in, etc.

title: Perfect Hotel!
text: I've stayed at the Warwick a number of times (mother-daughter shopping trips), but this was the first time my husband stayed - and he agreed - it's just a perfect hotel. Great service, quiet rooms, lovely staff, great location - you can walk to the theaters, Central Park, 5th and Madison Avenue shops, etc. - and a wonderful on-site bar, Randolph's.

title: Nice hotel at the right price point
text: Had a very comfortable 1 night stay at the Warwick. Was a family holiday trip into the city to see all of the Christmas sights and the hotel was very comfortable, clean and perfectly located for our family of 4.  We were on the 24th floor and it was pretty quiet too. However, they could work on the service as no one answers calls to the front desk - whether you are at the hotel or before your stay. We got a good price for a great room so we were satisfied.

title: It doesn't get much better!
text: Not my first time at the Warwick, and it never fails to delight. The location couldn't be more perfect as what you can't walk to is easily accessed by cab or public transport. The staff is super friendly and helpful, the rooms large and gracious, and the property has the feel of a grand dame hotel of eras past. You'll sacrifice none of the amenities of a modern chain yet get the unique character and charm of a unique building. Bar is fabulous. Room service was spot on.

title: Where the BEATLES STAYED!
text: I was so excited to stay in the original hotel that the Beatles stayed in the 1960's!  It was very nostalgic for me. Not to mention that it has maintained it's original overall appearance. Yes, it's kind of like staying in your great grandma's house. Very small rooms. Not updated BUT if you're looking for an experience (and they keep it clean and tidy) this is the place to have an adventure!  Thank you for the wonderful welcome and amenities! A BEATLE FAN!!

title: Visiting the theatres!
text: Very nice hotel with great service. Quiet, excellent beds, and decoration. Just steps away of Radio City Music Hall, MOMA, SAINT PATRICK Cathedral, and a lot of great restaurants. We loved the restaurants in the first floor.

title: The PLACE to stay in Midtown
text: Best hotel experience in NYC ever! Service was fabulous, room was great, location can't be beat, staff was fantastic, and when we had a problem with one of our doors at 1:30am they fixed it within 15 mihutes.

title: perfect place to stay while visiting NY :)
text: I very appreciate excellent service, spacious and well epuipped room with nice view and great location. The staff in the hotel is very friendly and ready to help and arrange for you everything you need.

title: Christmastime at the Warwick 2017
text: Call the hotel directly for reservations.  The reservation staff is very helpful and friendly.  The Warwick NY is so centrally located you can walk everywhere; shopping, Central Park, museums, theater--even to Madison Square Garden.

title: Horrible, find somewhere else to go!
text:
Save time, save money.
Parking is valet and $50 (if you bring your car).
Upon arrival, I checked in and was asked 
to wait until my room was ready and I have 
been here for more than an hour while others have already gotten checked in and their rooms.
Save the frustration, the long wait line, 
and go somewhere else. Have a nice day.

title: Impostor of Luxury....Essence of Mediocrity
text:
Called two days before - just to check on what's involved for Valet Parking.  Operator finally answered and transferred to front desk... no answer for 18 minutes!  Every once in a while the operator returned to the line to inform me "they aren't answering (thanks for the info!)  They NEVER picked up - I parked elsewhere.  (Good thing - our travel companions DID valet park and waited 40 minutes for their car in the lobby.)
Our reservation was for an ADA Accessible Premier Plus King.  We were not given this room but a smaller non ADA room.  By the time we realized this and were in our room, it wasn't worth switching.
The condition of the hotel is "very worn".  Room needs paint job.  Elevator capacity for the hotel is RIDICULOUS!  Nice try with the promotion of the "elegance of the 1930's."
The Warwick in London is pure class.  This one is a cheap impostor.
There are SO MANY better choices in midtown Manhattan!

title: GREAT place to stay; great location; old world class and courtesy
text: Cannot go wrong here.  Been coming here for 30 years.  Perfect location.  in and out quickly.   one of few hotels where you can open window for fresh air.  Service courteous.   You can tell most of guests are ones who return year after year.

title: Posizione perfetta,hotel bello ma servizio non da 5 stelle
text:
Iniziamo con la posizione: perfetta. Esattamente al centro del centro di Manhattan. A pochi passi a piedi da tutto: 5th Avenue,il museo Moma,Radio City Hall, Times Square etc.
Albergo di stile molto retro,ma ben strutturato. Arredo spazi comuni classico ed elegante. Alcune camere arredate molto bene,altre un po troppo buie ed illuminazione alquanto tetra.
Ottimo il lounge bar Randolph's situato all'interno della struttura(anche se non è parte dell'albergo). Eccessivamente costosa la colazione(con quelle cifre si mangia bene a cena a Manhattan).Voto basso per le pulizie(per carità,non era una bettola ma da un 5 stelle ci si aspetta di più....pulizie fatte male ed in maniera svogliata dalle cameriere).Il bagno il primo giorno aveva un odore sgradevole.
Altro piccolo dettaglio che per un 5 stelle non va bene: in camere doppie mettere a disposizione dei clienti soltanto un paio di ciabattine non è da 5 stelle,e non è stato un caso nella nostra camera perché anche in quella di amici presenti con noi è successa la stessa cosa.
Esperienza comunque sia positiva , albergo consigliato ma che per essere un 5 stelle al 101% secondo me dovrebbe limare certe piccole mancanze.

title: Beautiful and well maintained hotel
text: Excellent location (just along the road from MOMA and 2 blocks up from Broadway and a street away from 5th Ave) and a huge room!  Didn't hear anything from the corridor or between rooms once we were in.  Polite friendly staff (and loved the doormen in their top hats!).

title: Mauvais rapport qualité prix
text: Bon l'hôtel a du charme et est bien placé . Mais les chambres à part la literie laissent franchement à désirer. La TV compliquée à faire marcher . Pas de possibilité de se faire du café ou du thé. Ma chambre au 7-Eleven très bruyante. La salle de bain date des années 70. Pas de douche mais une vieille baignoire sabot. Les plateaux de petit déjeuner traînent une demie journée dans le couloir. Pas top pour le prix!

title: Amazing - above and beyond
text:
We stayed in a premier room overlooking the Avenue of America's on the 17th floor and from start to finish our stay was perfect. Not only is this hotel in the best location for major attractions, the room and the service made the experience incredible. 

From staff answering phones and dealing with requests I felt as thought nothing was too much trouble for them. The breakfast buffet was worth every cent and the staff were quick, efficient and friendly. 

I cannot recommend this hotel more and will definitely return.

title: Great Hotel
text: Cannot beat the location… many things to do within walking distance. Front desk goes out of their way to help, much more personable than the big box places. Room size is larger than hotels at higher rates around that area.  Reasonable prices and attentive staff. Some question the size of the elevators, but across the street the elevator are bigger but you spend your time waiting for them—not so at the Warwick. Good facilities on second floor for small or large meeting. Have held shareholders meetings there several times. Best choice in Midtown.

title: Top Notch Thanksgiving Destination for a Childhood Dream Come true!
text:
We spent Thanksgiving week at the Warwick and loved every minute of it! I have dreamed of watching the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade in person and the Warwick helped make that dream come true! 
Of course, we booked the hotel almost a year in advance through a travel agent who made sure that we received a parade route view room. We got a room on the 6th floor and it was perfect! When we arrived there was a hot thermos and a blanket on our bed to use for the parade. The morning of the parade they had a stand in the lobby with coffee, hot chocolate (the best we had all week) and some pastries for purchase.
For Thanksgiving Dinner we made a reservation at their buffet. The food was great, my only disappointment was that there was not any pumpkin pie.
The rooms are a little small but it's a boutique, 1920's hotel so what do you expect? We love historical, boutique hotels so it was perfect for us! We want to come back without the kids soon and will definitely be staying at the Warwick again. Thanks Warwick for making a magical week for our family!

title: Fab hotel
text:
The Warwick is in an amazing location! Staff very friendly, rooms spacious, clean and the most wonderful Xmas decs throughout the hotel. 
Absolutely no issues what so ever during our stay.
Highly recommend!!

title: Bad stay at the Warwick
text:
Stayed at the Warwick at nearly $1200 for one night and found tired furniture in the room, a tired bathroom with an old scratched toilet seat, a tub/shower that wouldn't drain, noisy heating/system, and overpriced food that has made me quite sick.

Ate all 3 meals in the Warwick restaurants only to return with a bad stomach illness.

title: 25th
text: Perfect location for the theatre and Central Park not to mention all the Christmas festivities and decor near Rockefeller center! The rooms could use a little updating but very comfy pretty Lobby and great service. Best price for the holiday season not super cheap but for a nice hotel it sure is! Def recommend!

title: Classico
text:
Hotel di tradizione in una posizione eccezionale , di fronte al Moma . E’ stato frequentato da personaggi famosissimi Beatles , Elvis Preasley , Audrey Hepburn.........
camere spaziose . Potete raggiungere a piedi Saks , Rockfeller Center ......

title: You simply cannot beat the location
text: Quite spacious, clean, rooms, 10 minute walk to Central Park, 15 minute walk to either Rock Center or Times Square. We slept so soundly due to the quiet nature of this hotel. This is our second stay here, and we highly recommend The Warwick!

title: The Warwick impresses again. A must stay.
text: The hotel’s location allows for easy travel by foot to many of the must see attractions in Manhattan. The rooms are remarkably large for a Manhattan hotel and very comfortably furnished. Randolph’s Lounge may be the premiere hotel bar on the island, with its old school atmosphere and lively ambiance. A must stay hotel.
